reviews.review:
Very relaxing. Take the hop on hop off bus then you will get a free cruise on the harbour with the voice explaining you the history of the harbour.
Standing on the deck is very relaxing. I like sitting on the harbour to enjoy the breeze, the sun and the sight.

Beautiful view. My husband and I were very fortunate. Our room had a view of Victoria Harbour. Our hotel was along Salisbury Road so we were able to take a walk along the promenade and enjoy the view during the evening. You also get to appreciate the view from the star ferry. At night it is beautiful with all the lights lighting up on the buildings.

Bustling natural harbour.... Really interesting place to wander around and watch the hundreds of boats coming and going. The Star ferry across to Hong Kong island leaves from Pier 8. Fabulous skyline views, and don't miss the nightly light show at 8pm. Arrive early to get a front position!
Waterfront Entertainment. Beautiful views of the water, very touristy area with street performers/buskers and the place to catch Star Ferry as well as the nightly lights show.

Visited as part of a tour. The view over the city at night is beautiful. There is a tram to the top which costs 32 Hong Kong Dollars. We went up on our coach and down on the tram. There is a light display around 8pm. Good photo opportunities for skyline views.

Beautiful harbour. Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong is one of the best tourist attractions. It is most beautiful at dusk or early evening when the sun is setting and the city lights start to come on. For tourists, it is best viewed from the Peak on the Hong Kong Island side, but the locals could go to other hilltops (with some extra efforts) to have a better view eg from Braemar Hill.

Best harbour in the world!. Awe inspiring by day or night, great photo ops from every angle and locale. Take a junk cruise or the Star Ferry for a water view aspect. Great natural harbor with many fantastic floating restaurants. If you can afford one of the hotels that offer a harbour view, take it.
Beautiful by night. The buildings all light up at night with an amazing view!!! best view of hong kong is victoria harbor at night!
Shopping heaven!. If couture is your thing... put on the comfy shoes and spend a day here. My bank account will cry for months after my half a day here..... sigh.... ;)
Very Awsome Palce. One of my friend lived in that building and from the top of that building there is a wonderfull view of the sea and the lights we used to go there many time its a cool place...
Breath taking attraction. You can take the public ferry to get through the harbor or take the tourist attraction of wood sail HK$190 with one drink included. Night time is more popular.
Busy. Boats coming and going, people going about their business,. FABULOUS . It's an amazing feeling to be able to see Hong Kong life on the water.
Not to be missed.. Victoria Harbour from the Kowloon side at night is a feast for the eyes. Take a harbor cruise so that you will be able to hear and watch the 8:00 pm laser light/music show.
Beautiful harbor . I would say that if you go to HK and don't go to the harbor for a look or a boat ride you have missed a great part of the city.
Take a boat ride. Great way to take photos on a clear day is to ferry across the harbour. On both sides (Causeway Bay and Kowloon) are restaurants and shopping.

Harbor cruise. Completed the cruise around the harbor. Took about an hour but at night it was a great experience.The night time allows the lights to shine and hinds some of the imperfections.Surprises for me was seeing small fishing boats in the harbor and the number of residential towers lining the hills.A great night and a great thing to do

love the lights.. day time impressive but like most things in Asia night time is fantastic. The evening light show at 8pm is so so but just watching the neon at night is mesmerising. We were fortunate to be there for China national day (October 1) so the 25 minute firework display was superb (though crowded +++, someone said 100,000 people watching not sure if this was true or not but sure felt like it)
great light show. did a harbour cruise and watched the light show, well worth the money - the river edge can get over crowded
Great plaza at night. Played tourist walked around to see the lights and viwes of the harbour Lots of places to sit and watch the sites as well as places to eat and drink
No other like it. The skyline surrounding the Victoria Harbour is so outstanding and we have never seen so many skyscrapers surrounding the Harbour anywhere before.
Stunning urban view. For people who love big cities walk along Victoria Harbour especially at night is priceless! The lights are so beautiful you can watch that for hours! Really worth a visit!

Undeniably spectacular.. Whether viewed from the land, a skyscraper or (best of all) a junk, the views across the harbour are stunning. The skyscrapers are framed by the jungle behind and it looks incredible. The water of the harbour added in means that it is probably the best urban view in the world.

Go for the light show. Went to the harbour twice in one day as we learned that there was a light show at 8 in the evening. Get there for 7:30ish to get a could view up on the terrace. As far as free attractions go it is definitely worth a visit.

Victoria Harbour at the move. Harbour activities are allways fascinating and there's a lot to see. Just buy something to eat and drink and stroll from chair to chair and just watch.
And take the ferry from Kowloon to the other side for the most dramatic scenery. It is also a good start to take a ferry to other islands
Great views for the Kowloon promenade.. Great day views and a light show every evening at 8pm. Tai Chi during the day at the promenade. 1hr. 150yuan (22US)

Never disappoints!. Still one of the most exciting harbours in the world. Would recommend you travel to Aberdeen to take a trip around the harbour in a sampan. A small amount of money for a memorable trip where you can see the most luxurious yachts alongside local fishing boats and gaze at the mega expensive sky scrapers.

Land scape city scape photographers paradise . This is Hong Kong. Busy; active madness. Just love it. Take your tripod. DSLR find a spot and shoot to your hearts content. In fact going t gf ere again tonight.!

Views of Hong Kong Island. A walk along the harbor on the Kowloon side, gives you some amazing view of the Island. A night the city lights up and if your camera takes pictures in low light, you will get some amazing shots. On my last trip I stayed in Kowloon near the star ferry and ran every morning before the crowds started to appear, grabbed a cup of coffee from McDonald's (it was the only place that opened early) and sat and enjoyed the view.

Hope you like Chinese.. Went to the peak, just a big hill. Nothing else much to do in H.K.Used black Lane car hire to get around, a bit more expensive howver worth it. You actually get to your destination !If you don,t have to go here, rethink your travel plans, it is not the same as six and half years ago.Try Macau, it is only 60 minutes on jet ferry, and is not as crowded or slum filled as H.K.

Iconic. Victoria Harbor is considerably narrower as years go by with land reclamation on both sides of the harbor. Causing bigger waves when crossing. It's not as calm and peaceful as before but still the iconic sight of Hong Kong. You can cross the harbor taking the MTR or the underwater tunnel but you will miss the beautiful sight. Take the ferry instead.
You are going to see it. Hong Kong harbour is pretty hard to miss. So generally speaking everyone is going to see it. And it's brilliant. The city (especially at night) is very pretty.
Nice . One of the best places to see and feel Hong Kong. We did really enjoy walking arround in Victoria Harbour.
Busy, busy, busy !. Wonderful harbor - full of every kind of vessel crossing back and from Kowloon to Hong Kong . Cheap ferries take you everywhere
walking sailing could last for ever. so much activities all around with new development coming reclaiming the sea again and again...evening even more attractive..
taste of luxury. Here you can see lot of luxury brands and big stores. Very busy place. I think price level is quite high.

Busy harbour. We traveled across the harbour quite a few times to visit Hong Kong from Kowloon.The harbour is quite busy with tourist ships and public transport ferry's. A cheap and nice way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong.

Magnificent harbour. Best seen at night from any vantage point in tsim tsa tsui or Kowloon
Quite spectacular lights and high rise buildings with light shows on hk island
During the day is also interesting as lots of activity and can be viewed from any hotels or promenade

Breathtaking. Such beauty.
Take a traditional wooden boat tour through the harbour and enjoy.
Also plan to visit this place more than once, it is worth it.
Beautiful. You can see the harbour it was a beautiful view. You can take pictures with statues of Hongkong actor and actress. Hongkong has mountains and harbours and sea, those are beautiful too see.

Cool place to check out how active HK really is. It is the kind of place you won't find many other cities in the world. It us active and bustling and full if colors and sights and sounds.
I loved this place.

You have to go here when you come to Hong Kong.. This is a must see area even if you just want to catch some cool breeze. Easy to get to by Metro and lots of things to see. Unfortunately though there is a lot of construction taking place and the long walkway along the harbour is not accessible so there is less to see. But once it is finished I'm sure it'll be better than before. Try to go when they have the evening lazor light show.

Smelly and crowded. The light show is okay not that amazing however there is very bad smell in the harbour. We take the ferry and I thought the trip is long but it was very short. Sometime it get very crowded, with the humidity and smell it make the experience not that great. It could be better !!
Best light show on Earth. Very spectacular light show, it literaly lights up the night sky with fantastic neon lighting, a must see place and you should put it on your bucket list

Take the ferry tour around the harbour. There are 2 prices...one for a day time trip and the other for an evening trip. The prices are displayed at the kiosk . If you get the last day tour ferry you go out in daylight but come back just as the lights are being switched on and this is magicaal

Beautiful at night. What an awesome harbour to take a cruise and watch the night lights. Impressive sightseeing at its best. A must see while in Hong KongApprox 45 minutes to do a lap. Late afternoon the best then you get 2 types of photos

Good view on this side but better view on the other side. I work in a building over in Central with a view across the harbour. It's quite beautiful. However, the view from the other side of the harbour is much better. The buildings in Central are much taller than the Kowloon side.

Boat trip. We took a boat trip round the harbour, which set off from the Star Ferry terminal. It was great fun, and we were able to see a lot from the water. It took about an hour, allowed us to take lots of photos, and also to rest our feet!
chill with a view. a great spot to have a little hangout and tea. its best viewed at sunset then to watch the city lights come on at night which will dazzel
Fascinating. Great place to people watch. Very busy, great sights, day or night.Reminded me of a movie set as it has the scenes that you see so often in films
Incredible views. Better views than the bund in my opinion, can travel between all the islands, lots of shopping and things going on..Can't wait to go back!

"BEAUTIFUL" Just the word to describe the harbour.. Anglers can try with small tackle.... Located on thee kowloon side of HK, u can reach with star ferry... take the star ferry u can see the entire harbour... scenic, but also u ll see numerous bill boards.. alternatively u can walk along the harbour.. u can see numerous people angling with small tackle.. can try for the enthusiastic angler..

Fascinating to watch and explore. I had a harbor view from my room and really enjoyed watching the harbor in action. I also liked exploring other places to observe the harbor in action. Fine a good location and enjoy or ride a boat in the harbor to really get the feel

You can walk almost all the way along the waterfront and enjoy the views. Why not start start your harbour views by taking the walkway to the Star Ferry from near Worldwide House. At he Star Ferry go down and experience the harbour right at its very edge, with ferries coming and going and some spectacular cross harbour views.. There is even a maritime museum which is quite interesting. Keep walking along until you get to the elevated walkway that takes you back into the IFC building (you can see it ahead) and walk all the way through the IFC to the exit about 50 meters after the Four Seasons hotel entrance you will see on your right. Now you are on an elevated walkway that goes to Macau Ferry terminal. This is hub for travel to Macau and makes interesting wandering around with a few good places to eat including some restaurants offering Macanese dishes without making the trip to Macau (which you should do any way!!). You can exit this complex and if you are keen keep heading about 300m, a bit of a struggle past bus terminals and the government Harbour Building, but keep heading West to one of Hong Kong's hidden gems, the Dr. Sun Yat Sen park. Its a beautiful circular design with references to Dr. Sun's journeys establishing the Republic of China. Here there is nothing between you and the water except a fence line. Stay for half and hour and you will see all manner of sea vessels including the hydrofoils just getting up out of the water on their path to Macau. Spectacular and you will be one of the few tourists that made the trip! On your way back you could take in the Western Market across from the Macau Ferry building.

Beautiful view from the island ! . Its located in Kowloon Island - Tsim Sha Sui. U can go there by MTR or Star Ferry if u stay in Hongkong island and central. it's nice place to see the view of Hongkong and daytime and nighttime. it's magnificent view and u can see the light show of these building at 8pm every night .

Beautiful harbour with too many billboards . The harbour is absolutely stunning however there is a lot of billboard signs on the Hong Kong island side of it.I guess if you love looking at lights , then it might be ok A must see anyway for anyone visiting Hong Kong . Cannot miss it anyway ...
One of the great harbours!. Victoria Harbour is one if the great harbours in the world. Its an incredibly busy waterway and tourists should all experience the ferry.

Need not visit. Arena of star is under renovation till 2018 thus nothing much to c there. Located beside e sea n there will b symphony of light every night but when I went on a tue night,e lighting were terrible to e max!nothing special at all!

Best place at night . It's the best place to spend your time at night especially. The Hongkong skyline is soo impressive at night. It's outstanding out of the world place. A must place to visit while in Hongkong.

It's a looker. The Victoria Harbour is basically the place to start, and exploring Kowloon.A big shopping mall is also in the vicinity.From there you can go in a few directions, one of them being Nathan Road.

Wonderful seaview in Hong Kong. Victoria Harbour is wonderful seaview in Hong Kong. You can watch best architectures in both sides. Another hand, walk along waterfronts in Tsim Sha Tsui or nearby Central Ferry Pier take a sea breeze or photography day and night views of Victoria Harbour. Moreover, you can go to peak sightseeing Victoria Harbour Kowloon and Hong Kong side views.You also, take a ferry ride to cross Victoria Harbour and Harbour Cruise get best view and close with Harbour.
Hustle--Bustle!. One can easily spend a good amount of time in this area, with the museums, mall, promenade, pick your activity.

Busy and bustling. There is lots to explore when you take a stroll along the harbour and it is great for taking in views of the city.
The best way to explore the harbour is, of course, by taking the Star Ferry!
Amazing. Great place to view the skyline from, plus you can see the old junk boats with their beautiful sails

Beautiful Skylines. At the Victoria Harbour, we caught all the skylines of Hong Kong island. All buildings were constructed modern with high tall skyscrapers, which portraits the prosperity of the SAC

Everything you would expect. The harbour is busy and bustling both the Hong Kong side and of the Kowloon signs are fascinating there is an overall activity high-rise buildings just amazing everything I expected it to be the two are on the star ferry was worth every penny.
See it from the Star ferry. In my opinion, the harbor is best seen up close and personal from water level aboard one of the STAR ferries. Interesting from way up high as well.

It buzzes. The harbour is just so busy. There are ships, ferries, junks, working boats and any type of floating craft you can think of.
You can watch it for hours.

Change is what is so magic. Victoria Harbor remains unique and unlike most harbors in the world, Hong Kong's waterways are beautiful and get you to gaze for hours seeing how commerce and capitalist enterprise unfolds under your eyes. Visits of contemplation are key, and Victoria Harbor deserves the highest marks.

Not as busy as you would expect. A well laid out harbour with plenty of viewing points to take photographs.Sadly the smoke prevented that opportunity. The water in the harbour is exceptionally clean with a distinct absence of fishing boats. The ferry terminal is easy to find and prices start from $2AU to cross the harbour.There are a couple of junks still running and are operated regularly through the day and night. Food at the harbour is very limited to the odd ice-cream and paper stall, with small snack stalls near the ticket purchase machines.Be prepared to be bumped around as the workers knock off and school children enter the harbour. No one looks where they go. If you are a tourist, you will not be noticed as everyone is looking at their mobile phone.

A must for your itinerary. I had a one hour cruise around the harbour as part of a package tour. Watched the sun go down and the lights bring the city to life. A gentle breeze and a few beverages was a great start to the evening.
Most beautiful harbour. Victoria Harbour is beautiful from differnet angels on sunny or rainy days from Hong Kong or Kowloon sides at the water front or riding on a ferry.

awesome water views.. Victoria Harbour is a very good place to go to if you want to view the skyline of Hong Kong. You can walk along on Victoria Harbour on the Hong Kong island side or Kowloon. Either way, there are great places to view the city.
Quick stop a must. Do not pass an opportunity to have a quick visit to this place. It has a nice view of the Island. Plenty of opportunities for nice pictures.
One of the world's great harbours!!. This is rated as one of the world's great harbours!! Although not a harbour in the true sense of the word it is still worth having a cruise thereon!!
Land mark of HK. It has no waves but all like to spent time near to Victoria Harbor. I am in doubt whether it look beautiful on day time of at night
beautiful harbour. the lights for many buildings are so gorgeous. even if the day i went there was raining, it's still beautiful.

Nice HKG experience.... This place i have planned in my must visit place list. Very good place for the enjoy at free of cost and lots of activities and time pass options. At evening also night light decorations over buildings can additional advantages. That's great...

Stunning skyline. Hong Kong has some of the most iconic buildings in the world, and one of the most stunning skylines, especially at night when all the buildings are lit up. Don't miss the light show at 8.00 each evening, lasts for about twenty minutes and is best viewed from near to the Star Ferry terminal.
HK Summer Festival. great place to watch HK 2016 summer festival, 3d light show with night view of the harbor will be a wonderful way to end the day.
Beautiful. This is a great place to go and just have fun. The battle of the light at nite on the harbor is a spectacular event
Nice view . I spend the raining time here if you don't want to go to shopping and eating . I prefer to sit down and enjoy the view here

Nice harbour day and night. It's not the prettiest of harbours but with the surrounding buildings creates a feel of an unrealistic huge city.
For some reason the night we came down for the light show nothing happened. But there were still enough lights from building to give a nice backdrop.
Curious. Best views and many places to go. Worth spending some time getting lost and discovering interesting places that are not on maps!
Excellent views. Excellent views of the HK skyline (both on HK and Kowloon) when taking the Star Ferry across the harbour.

Best during evening. Go after 3 pm so that you can visit the museum and then see the skyline in the night too.
Lot of good place to eat
Lot of art work and kids enjoyed it
Can spend couple of hours

Vibrant and interesting . There is always something to do or see. Street buskers, shopping malls, restaurants with views. Tickets for the Big Bus can be purchased here. We recommend a 48 hour pass. There are extras with a pass - not just a bus ride. A Harbour Tour, sampan boat ride which takes you around the Jumbo Floating Restaurant. You can get off to have a meal. Enjoy ☺

Great landscape view in the middle of the city. If you want to go here, you can use MTR and stop at the East Tsim Sha Tsui station walking just 1 minutes. Or if you stay around Tsim Sha Tsui area, you can reach here just by walking distance. Best time to come here is in the night if you want to watching the light show, but if you want to enjoy the building view you can come in the morning or noon time.

The essence of Hong Kong. A visit to Victoria Harbor is a must the views of Hong Kong are spectacular. It has so many things to see but possibly the best is just to sit and view all the activity in the harbour and the bustle of everyday life. Most memorable thing about Hong Kong and it is free

Take a. Boat ride. Get to one of the many spots for a ferry or a hydro boat or a private boat. But do it the water gives a whole different look to the city. And with all the construction going on it helps to see from this point of view.

Usually beautiful. Currently under construction.. I have been to the harbour before the construction and it was fantastic. The statues and walk of fame are great to see. This visit it was extremely difficult to get around due to construction. You are not able to get down to the water front at most parts. The Bruce Lee statue and a few others have been relocated up top for the time being. I did eventually find them, but it took quite a bit of time and a lot of walking.I look forward to going back to Hong Kong and seeing what it looks like once the construction is complete.

Wonderful views both day and night. Exquisite views at night time and very active all day long. We had wonderful views from our hotel rooms all week which provided great photo opportunities and tremendous background.
Best skyline in the world! . It doesn't get better than this! You need to visit this area both during the day as at night. I never got bored of this sight while I was in Hong Kong. Sensational.

A great place to visit. The harbour is full of life and interesting activities. If you take a stroll along the harbour at night at around 8pm you will be delighted with the light and laser show displayed on the high rise buildings. Take a cruise along the harbour and enjoy the commentary as you take in the sites. Along the Kowloon side you will see many hand imprints in the pavement of famous people.

Stunning view! when it's not cloudy haha!. I am a hongkongnese but I moved to the UK since I was 11, but looking back to this lovely night view, I would absolutely rate it a 5 star due to It is so beautiful, especially in Winter, you'll see christmas decorations.Make sure you arrive there at 8pm, because that's when the show begins!But it looks prettier when you look from Tsim sha tsui to Central and not from Central to Tsim sha tsui.:)xthats based on my personal view.

A must see at night time!. Such a spectacular place at night time, all the lights on the Hong Kong skyline are lit up and there is even a light show to see! The traditional boats going up and down the harbour are beautiful. it's a must see.

Amazing Views. Viewing Victoria Harbor is great viewing Hong Kong while on Victoria Harbor is spectacular. If you can go at night during the light show you will be amazed. Again have your Octopus card ready just scan and go. The ride to Kowloon is just 10 minutes you won't be disappointed.

Lovely. Though the symphony of lights does not last long, the view from Victoria Harbor is quite amazing. There is a little promenade between the ferry piers, and there are people who come here to catch fish. There are also quite a number of performers. Very pleasant to walk by or sit in one of the benches in the evening.

Fantastic view. - if you stayed near by the harbour you will be lucky to watch many kind of ships all over the day .- easily to find out ferris to many islands through the harbour .- the only disadvantage is, not all harbour side could be reached by walk and there is no seats to relax.

Magnificent. Victoria harbour is a place to make a stroll day and night . You have views that will stay with you forever . From Avenue of the stars in the evening you can watch a light show that not many places in the world can dream to do ...
More views especially at night. Interesting to see the views from Victoria Harbour back across to Kowloon and especially at night to see the opposite perspective from our usual view from the hotel.
Nice views of the Hong Kong skyline . The harbor itself is Nice with great views at the Hong Kong skyline. Definitely the best views in town. Don't miss! Can get there by boat, subway, taxi and bus.

Beautiful view. This place gives an amazing view of the Hong Kong skyline. I had seen the skyline from a few places at night time so decided to come here in the day and it was wonderful but I am sure it would also be amazing at night time. Perfect photo oppertunity.
Walk & View. an opportunity to maintain your walking exercise with great views, recommended during the day and night

The fresh air and beautiful scenery of Victoria harbour makes it a good place to visit.. This is a nice place. And the harbor is clean. There are many beautiful flowers around and benches where you can sit and rest.
Beautiful skyline. Beautiful skyline - going during the day and night gives totally different views! A must go! Pray that the day you plan to visit won't be hazy X

Perfect photo opportunities . Most of people come here to take a lot of photos and it's totally understandable, since the view is quite spectacular. Good at daytime as well as at night. One of these things you have to do while visiting Hong Kong.

Beautiful . The harbour was amazing during the day but even more in the evening.
All the neon lights and the landscapes were so picturesque.

A true festival of lights. The stunning skyline is one of Hong Kong's most advertised features and rightly so. Victoria Harbour offers a look at both sides of the skyline, in Hong Kong and the New Territories. The International Finance Centre and the International Commerce Centre form an epic entrance gate to the harbour. This classic and historic trading port is an excellent location to view the Hong Kong skyline and a nighttime harbour cruise is simply a must. Choose Aqualuna.

High end shopping. We took the bus down to Victoria Harbour to see what the fuss was about. There's a huge mall (high end shopping only) and the view of the buildings at night is nice. Other than that it wasn't that great.

Great central place in Hong Kong. The central harbor district is in an ongoing transition that has been marked by the move of the old airport and most notably new commercial developments on both sides of the harbor. The old central district that was the hub of government activity has evolved into a high end commercial center with extensive indoor "malls" that extend up the hillside. Most notably there is new development on the hillside beyond the waterfront, which had become a quality restaurant and late night gathering spot. One needs to navigate this district, as there are open bar-fronts, but more notable quality and reasonably prices restaurants that are above the street level entrances. This is a great place to go for Sunday brunch. With new developments on the waterfront this area is rapidly evolving -- from the Central district into the Western district, which is an interesting mix of "old" Hong Kong and new commercial and office developments that are pushing out the old "chop houses" and family shops.

What a view . I can't compare this yet to what I have seen as I've just started travelling and won't be in another magnificent place for a view like this until November when I reach New York City! But what a view to see during the day and experience

Do it once.. That is enough!. We went there for a walk and window shopping. We enjoyed walking around, as we later headed to the Victoria peak. You can shop for luxurious brands over there, if you are interested.

Ships, ships and ships everywhere. If you are a fan of big ships, you must see this harbour. Giant ships full of containers from and to everywhere in the world. Dream of every right man with a soul of a boy:)

Happy Time in Harbour. It is very beautiful and lovely seeing everything in the lights of night. But day time their port for the ships is in the water because they don't have so many space on land. It can make the harbor smaller and smaller.
not so special if you go more than once. The first time experience of victoria harbour is good, but the second time is not as good. Perhaps keep it on your list for once only.

Makes me want to go back again!. One of the best places I've ever visited in Hong Kong! You can see Hong Kong skyline from here, tall buildings and green trees. Travel across the waters using Star Ferry or traditional Hong Kong boat, the one with red sails. This is the place where you can see light attractions at night, starting from 8 o'clock. Don't forget to bring camera to remember this wonderful experience. You can't do a lot of things here, rather than enjoying the view.
Beautiful . Lovely harbour especially if you have a room with a view such as we had . Lovely walkways around and at night the light show is spectacular.
What a skyline. Take the ferry after sunset and enjoy the iconic skyline which is instantly recognized. Day or night the view from the harbor is amazing.

Beautiful View without Being too Far Out of the Way. Even if you miss the evening light show, it's worth stopping by to see the beautiful skyline lit up. Located close to other things in Kowloon - definitely stop by after dinner to take in the city view
Like any Harbour.... One cant miss but nothing great..It use to be a British colony and its subsequent development as a trading centre. The panoramic view is just amazing. And also the Skyline.

Superb views especially at night !!!. Must visit place in Hongkong. This gives the best views of the place and especially the night is the best with the whole city lit up.
Can use the ferry from Star pier to the central which is only aroud 10-15 min and you can really enjoy.

Victoria Harbour. This is Hong Kong landmark. It is picturesque. Every evening between 8-8.15 p.m. there is a symphony of lights show where you can view from the Tsimshatsui side, just the Hong Kong Cultural Centre.

Victoria Harbour one of the best places to be in Hong Kong. The best views of Hong Kong can be seen from Victoria Harbour.IMHO the best, and cheapest way to see Victoria Harbour is by catching the Star Ferry between Kowloon and Central, and Kowloon and Wanchai. Tips:Catch the Star Ferry both at day and night for a completely different experience. The Star Ferry also offers a night cruise on Victoria Harbour that departs from both sides, Kowloon and Hong Kong Island (Central).
Best at night . Even though it's a good attraction to go during the day but go at night before 8pm as their is a laser light show and don't worry it's quite safe as there's lots of people around.
Amazing views!!!!. Sunny summer i love to hangout in this great place....relaxing yet eye-fulfilling views around...with a cooly drinks:sitback and relax...

Victoria Harbour. The best view of Victoria Harbour is from the Kowloon side in Tsim Sha Tsui. The view of Hong Kong Metropolis is spectacular and you can catch a Ferry cruise from Star Ferry. The nightly 8pm light show is also best viewed from Kowloon side.
Nice place to snap photos!. Nice place to snap some family photos for remembrance of your Hong Kong visit.Don't waste your time for the Symphony of Lights, extremely over hyped.

Great View. Take a trip on any of the ferries, or stroll either side of the harbour, for a great view. There are few cityscapes in the world as dramatic as Hong Kong's. Aside from the Peak, this is the top site in Hong Kong. Don't miss it and especially view it at night.

No longer what it used to be!. No Symphony of Lights! No Avenue of Stars! All we saw are new buildings all over the place (which once was a long stretch of waterfront - where we used to take a fresh, cool and nice stroll in the evenings). And each of these buildings are getting higher and higher! What a pity!!!

Beautiful Bay - Victoria Harbour. It's the largest and busiest harbour and also a major attractions for tourists in Hong Kong which bustles with all types of Watercrafts. The night views of Hong Kong is so marvellous and amazing that the tourists should not miss it whilst travelling in Hong Kong. Since 2013 I'm visiting Hong Kong for Business and Leisure purpose as I do adore this place - Hong Kong.

A great night activity but skip the dinner cruise. I am very happy I did this at night, but I did it as a dinner cruise. You go for the view and the view was great on the clear night I went. The dinner buffet was okay. I was alone and seated with some other people who were part of a larger group. My seat was taken over by others in that group. Unless you are with several other people, I would skip the buffet and just get a harbor cruise.
Magnificent skyline. Did a cruise around Victoria Harbour and took heaps of photos. Now some people would call me biased but Sydney Harbour is more beautiful and photogenic... Just sayin.

Victoria Harbor. This is a bustling area of Hong Kong. You must take the ferry across the harbor to Kowloon. The views are magnificent especially at night when the entire harbor is lite up. The price is right.

Walk along harborfront to enjoy and ride Star Ferry to experience. Easily enjoyable via Star Ferry to experience as you cross the Harbor and see a few traditional junk boats crossing or ferries crossing, and admire from the harborfront walk from either Island side and Kowloon side. Day, sunset and night views offer various perspectives
Great. The view is great. Most of the night view in Hongkong is great because there's different bright color lights everywhere and because the terrain is hills and valleys...

Feel the beauty . In February during the new Chinese year celebrations you can visit Victoria Harbour and see the 3D show there its amazing and the view through the sea also weather .. Be careful yo may forget your name with this amount of feelings

Brilliant views of Hong Kong Island skyline!. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed Victora Harbour! There are many restaurants there and not to mention the beautiful views during the day and brilliant lights of the skyline at night! Definitely a must see if travelling to Hong Kong! We also bought a Big Bus Hop on and Hop off ticket which included a boat ride around Victoria Harbour, due to the rain, we unfortunately didn't get to go on the Harbour ride!
Ships and Boats Day-Night. lots of ships and variety of boats can be seen all the time. Some stationary ships with nice lighting have restaurants on them.

Impressive skyline especially at night fall!. Lots of shops and a great mall. Be sure to bring your unlimited spending credit card, because all the best designers have a store here! Some of the best window shopping ever!

The centre of HK. A visit to Hong Kong must include a visit to Victoria harbour during both the day and at night. The green hills provide a nice contrast behind the skyscrapers on the Hong Kong Island side. At night the lights are pretty. If you are on the Kowloon side at 8 pm stay for the Symphony of Lights. But don't make a special trip to see it.
amazing. victoria harbor in hong kong is beautiful.it is incredible to see in the day..in the night ..from the sea..from above..from hong kong island..from kowloon..it is always beautiful.

Modern with Fantastic Views. Very cool place to walk around. Unique modern benches for people to lay on ( sorry no photo ) and amazing views. Modern version of a Chinese junk went by all lit up in red.
Amazing. Morning or evening, its so amazing to watch or relax in front of the Victoria Harbour, either just walking in the morning or watching the lights dance in the evening.
One of the best. Must visit if you're in HK. One of the best places to see the city's skyline. It is definitely a view to die for.

Majestic and Memorable View. Seeing Victoria Harbour at night is a view that will remain in your mind forever. The combination of skyscrapers with neon signs advertising various wares is so much a part of Hong Kong's charm. There is a pulse, a tangible heartbeat to this city that is palpable. Hong Kong is an exciting, "can do" and totally unforgettable place.

exciting view. We had cocktails on the top floor of the Mandrin hotel. Amazing views...
yummy cocktails and nibbles.

Enjoy the view. Its really amazing and quite cool.
Not much but the amazing view of the place.
For photo ops and back ground.

Good view at night. Victoria Harbour has a very nice view at night--it's the perfect time to visit the place so that you can see Hong Kong's skyline in brilliant lights. Although there is "A Symphony of Lights" every 7:45 pm, it's not that much of a show but you can still enjoy it.

Amazing panaroma view. I have visited hk many many times, and every time I am always make my time to come here.
It's a very eye-opening experience, you can feel the modern city pace and enjoy so much the broad view.
i like it. we reach here around 4pm, we waited few hours just to see the night view!! relaxing and we really want to come back again
Brilliant view. . Visited here and was taken by the skyline view. It is beautiful at night and the warm breeze off the sea makes it a perfect evening stroll or even a nice area just to sit and relax

Nice but a lot of construction work!. Unfortunately a big part of the harbor is under construction..so it was not optimal! But for sure mist see is the simphony of lights (starts at 20:00 every night), the Clock tower and the cultural center!

Victoria Harbour on a lovely day . It is a very lovely day in Hong Kong and I take a Star Ferry ride from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui to enjoy the beauty of the Victoria Harbour! It only costs less than USD 50 cents and truly an amazing experience! You can also choose to enjoy the magnificent Victoria Harbour view while dining at restaurants facing the Harbour! The day and night view is so different and charming in its own ways! Enjoy!

World Class Harbour View. Victoria Harbour is the best harbour views in the world. No matter what you must come see this attraction. There have laser show at 2000 hours with great music along the two side shore i.e. wanchai and tsimshatsui. My humble is that it is much more beautiful seeing Victoria Harbour from Kowloon side than Hong Kong island side. The last advice is that spend very small money to onboard star ferry from tsim sha tsui to wanchai back and forth. That will be a must go attraction when you visit hong Kong.
Mini New York. It's a very interesting and busy harbour. The traditional sampans, gleaming cruise liners, fishing boats all add to the charm and magic.
Night, beautiful view. Have to see this place at night... full colours of light from the towers.. love being here, unfortunately my wife didnt want to ride the star ferry.. but its ok for me haha

Beautiful and busy harbor. Lots of activities occurring on the waters from commuter ferries to ship yards to local cruises. The skyline from any angle is beautiful and picturesque. The walk along the harbor is nice. Walkway accessible from a number of hotels or just the Main Street. Must visit and see.

Amazing views and its FREE. What breathtaking views of the harbour, depending on the hotel you stay at you may be lucky to have a view. We watched, looked, and viewed for hours, always something different going on. Another tip the higher the floor we found better the view ( we were on a 19th floor ) however just walking by and looking, stopping at various points was amazing, day and night gave a different onset. A must while you are in Hong Kong.

Go there in the night. HKG seems to be a little boring during daytime, like Las Vegas. If you go there at night you can thos phantastic light scenary. If you go there at 8pm, you can see a nice lightshow-every night
Shops are shops - same everywhere. We are not lovers of shopping and this was a typical mall with high end shops and a few eateries. Nothing special.
Great view . A good walk and view but with too much tourist and gets too crowded. Always prefer at night but if you want to stay away from the crowd, go earlier.
Best skyline I've ever seen.. View from Kowloon is as beautiful as from Victoria Peak, but without the crowds. Promenade is great.
Great area to stroll around in. A lot to see and do, just stroll around, some street artists at night, goos food ans close to all forms of public transport.

Take a cruise in the harbour.. Thr is onr of the best natural harbours in the world, wrapped around the worlds most exciting city...and quite dear. Many boats are available to a cruise even an authentic Chinese junk, maybe have an awesome meal in one of the floating restaurants..."Jumbo" is appropriately the oldest and biggest choice.

Good to View. The whole harbour is a constant source of boats & ships zooming around in all directions. We watched this for hours and never noticed the time. We then went on a Night cruise on the Star Ferry - Brilliant

Expectations Not Met, But Beautiful View. I was really excited to watch the light show, it happens every night at 8pm, but unfortunately, it wasn't as awesome as I thought it would be. The view from the harbor is amazing though, I'll give it that, but other than that, there was nothing else to see there. It didn't help that it was rainy and cloudy when we visited so perhaps visit during spring or wintertime so it's not cloudy and you can take in more of the view.

Boring. Only the night view is worth seeing, maybe?. Not so nice as I heard. I was so expecting the light and music, but it has no music. Only little small light started, for about 15 min. So boring even at the night on a sunny day.
Awsome. Definitely worth a trip during the day and one at night to see the city lights over the bay. Some great restaurants, shops and lively at night. Definitely worth a trip!

Has to be part of your visit to Hong Kong. Full of history and worth seeing from both sides (HK island and Kowloon aka Avenue of the Stars).When you get tired of being a landlubber; the only way to see it is the Star Ferry. You will soon understand how busy this shipping lane is.

China Visit. Victoria harbour in Hong Kong is famous with their structure buildings along the Hong Kong island where the opposite is the China mainland. The splendid scenery capturing everyone attention with the lighting and buildings along the coastline.
Semi Important. Beside "Ferry Star Station" in HKG Island side ...... You can catch many attractive photoes ...... But, the problem is: it is often clowdy
Amazing view. A breath-taking view which needs to be experienced in person! There is plenty of facilities to enable you to sit, relax and enjoy the view!

This is Hong Kong!. Ever seen any Hong Kong movies? Victoria Harbour is definitely having high visibility to be appeared in the movie. It just represent Hong Kong in certain way, to connect the island with Kowloon by ferry service. A must visit in Hong Kong!

Both Island side and Kowloon are nice. But the harbour area is particularly nice. one night there was a concert when we were there. very peaceful and romantic. HK is one of those cities you would love instantly and Victoria Harbour is a great place to spend time

Great views lots of places to see. This area is great on both sides of the harbour. during the night you get great views of the lit up skyline. During the day and night there are many restaurants to choose from and almost unlimited shopping. As well, depending on when you go, there can be special attractions and shows.

Bright lights, fast lives. The lights from all the buildings on both sides of the harbour light up the night sky, and the reflection from the water, watching the ferries passing by, you will feel the energy of this city.
Always Something Happening. from either side, the Island or Mainland the harbor is something special with always something happening. Take a ferry to get the full feel.

A Wonderful Night View. Consider as a great walk to Victoria Harbour by feeling the wind and hearing someone playing the saxophone (if you're lucky enough). Enjoying the night view there, that's beautiful and awesome. A must go place when you're visiting HongKong.

Beautiful area day or night. A great area to walk and enjoy the scenery with the harbor and the skyline, especially beautiful at night. Don't miss the Symphony of Lights on the harbor each night at 8 pm.

All conveniently co-located. Take the Big Bus Tour and pick where to get off and on and you can see loads all in one day. The HSBC building and ground floor were worth checking out if only to rub the paw of the lions for guaranteed wealth.

Wonderful view of the Skyline and Harbour. On a clear day this is just the perfect spot for a stroll or a drink in one of the small parks at the harbour. The big roads are close but the noise is not too bad and you can still hear the ocean from a bench, enjoying the mesmerizing view of ferries crossing the blue harbour, with skyscrabers and mountains in the background. An absolute must when visiting Hong Kong!
So beutiful. This harbour is one of the most famous in the world. When is it lite up it was wonderful, something everyone should experience.

Good view of the city . Across the street from the Peninsula Hotel. There are many constructions going on in June 2016, but one can get access to the harbor from HK Culture Museum. Good view of all the major buildings and halls. On a clear day, one can also see the Peak. Recommend 10-20 minutes for pictures.

Symphony of Lights!. We watched the Symphony of Lights. It was an experience and atmospheric but in all honesty, I have seen better outdoor entertainment light shows. I would recommend going though, as the skyline alone at night is breathtaking. Suggest booking to ride on a 'Junk' too, too fully appreciate it.
Very nice area. It's very quiet and nice in the night. I recommend it for a night walk. It's nice in the daytime too, the skyline is charming.

Symphony of light and music at 8pm.. To take a ride of the star ferry, to be there for the symphony of lights, or to walk along the promenade, just head to victoria harbour. Level road, easy on the feet. Taxi, buses and mtr are all within reach. Peninsula hotel which is a heritage hotel of hongkong is just nearby.
Enchanting!. Perfect place to see the City Skyline! Best time to go there at night. The nearby attraction, which is the Avenue of the Stars is closed til 2018.

See it in the day and at night. Should see it during the day and night. The light show is at 8pm. If your strapped for time in Hong Kong:Spend half the day shopping (because that's Hong Kong lol). Get some pictures of the harbor throughout the day and at 6pm catch the star ferry across the harbour. Then take the tram up to Victoria Peak just in time for sunset don't pay for the return ticket and just walk down avoiding massive 2 hour tram queue to go back down. Easy 45 min walk and quite lovely. Then catch the star ferry back for some night viewing of Victoria harbor.
Views, shopping and dining. Great place to experience what Hong Kong is all about. The skyline at night is unmatched, shopping is convenient, and great dining is everywhere.
Harbor. The view is beautiful. We could have sat and looked for longer than we did. The colors on the water at night are gorgeous. Worth a stop.

Nice harbour with a ferris wheel!. There's some quite nice views along this harbour which is in walking distance of both Central and Hong Kong MTR subway stations. There's a large ferris wheel similar to the London Eye and quite a few food stalls and restaurants in the area. The view of the Hong Kong skyline is also very nice from here.

Great skyline!. Victoria Harbour is a great skyline during the day but even more impressive at night, lights are amazing. Doesn't matter which side of the harbour you are on, so great from Hong Kong Island or Kowloon. Easy to get across too on the Star Ferry, very quick and convenient.
Beautiful Night Lights. The buildings lit up at night are spectacular. The laser light show was good, but a little underwhelming. Still recommend it for your night time photo op.

High end shopping to local tourist treasures. Our hotel (Marco Polo) was located across the street, so we had easy access to the very high end shopping to local tourist "treasures". Starbucks, McDonalds, local Asian quick eats to newspaper stands are all available here. This is also the area where you can purchase your Ferry tickets. There are many large cruise ships coming in and out of this area. Almost anything you can want to purchase is available. When the fog/smog clears photos ops are awesome.
Awesome place. Went there at night and the view is amazing, great place to see the skyline and to have a great time.

Wonderful. Victoria harbour is best seen either from The Peak, Kowloon or from the Star Ferry. The light towards dusk is amazing for photos and the colourful lights from the buildings are superb in the dark. The laser display at 8pm is ok rather than amazing and it seems to vary night by night.

Amazing Views!!. World famous for its dramatic panoramic night views, best seen from Victoria Peak or the TST promenade on the Kowloon side. Also the rides on star ferry or other cruises between central and TST, among the popular places to see the harbour at night. I would suggest to capture both day and night views from Victoria peak.

Good view Good strolling. Reach this place through aferry and you have a good view of the opposite bank. Good views and Good areas for stroll especially in the evenings. Combine with the laser show at 8 PM.

Great View of Hong Kong Cityscape. There is beauty at different time of the day and different months. The best part is that is that is is absolutely free! Just take the MTR to Tsim Sha Tsui and walk for 10 minutes. There are signboards to direct you or you can just ask any passerby and they will point you in the right direction.
Sensational night and day. A beautiful harbour that is lovely day or night. Love the ferries crossing the harbour. Definitely try to see it day and night. Impressive on both accounts.

Busy Waterway. Living in Australia I have always thought Sydney harbor was the best. Now I put Victoria Harbor as number one. The variety of watercraft is amazing. Day or night is active and interesting. Add to that the surroundings and is really worth seeing.

My favourite spot in earth. Victoria Harbour is for sure my favourite spot in the earth. The views, either fom the Hong Kong island, or from the the Kowloon side, always touches my heart. There is no place in the world, I love more. Take the Star Ferry, and enjoy the view.

Hong Kong. Beautiful views of two classic skylines. In the last three days it has been clear and sunny once but even so the view is great. Especially evenings looking towards the island at night during the light show.

Worth seeing the light show. When in Hong Kong we take a harbour view room so watch from there but the better place is on the promenade at Tsim Sha Tsui. It is a sound and light show which is better than average. Well worth seeing.

Views , Views and Views...... Me and my wife walked and reached the harbour in the night after the light and sound show at 08 pm at Avenue of Stars. And we sat there along the famous skyline. There is an observatory deck on the Harbour which is free for public.You can sit , relax and enjoy the magnificent views of the sky scrapers and boats (big & small) sailingfrom the harbour.Overall a nice experience.

Night Cruise on Victoria Harbour. Victoria Harbour is one of the finest harbours I have ever seen. The ferries move from Centro to most of the Islands.Cruise ships also dock in this Port . It is beautiful by day and spectacularly beautiful by night
Beautiful in the evening. Harbours are always beautiful in the evening and so is the Victoria harbour. With a beautiful weather in the evening and few bands around, it feels great.

Hong Kong Highlight. Hong Kong harbour is one of the most dramatic harbours in the world. Buildings of various shape, colour, height crowd out the tall landforms that once stood out more prominently viewed from the harbour. Night views are spectacular since all the buildings are lit up. When there are special occasions such as Chinese New Year, there are spectacular fireworks display. You can take the historic Star Ferry that connects Hong Kong island to Kowloon. The Star Ferry offers great views of the city skyline. Unfortunately the harbour is slowly being filled in to reclaim more land for development. Some Hong Kong residents feel that the once fragrant harbour is now a river. The harbour can also be viewed, on a clear day, from the Peak.

Stunning. Thus hustle and bussle location is stunning during the day. During dusk period it's breath takenly beautiful. During the evening we would get a bout across to the Chinese side and go to the market which is overwhelming large, with all the bright lights, shops and markets.. Beware, only take a formal taxi, and ask for a price before you get into the taxi. That can be ruthless if not.

beautiful harbour. I HAD take a iventure card which included a lot of attractions, and one of them for a ferry across the victoria harbour..IT WAS a wonderful 60 mins journey around the harbour as it showed tall and beautiful buildings on both side of hong kong island..looked as if these were posters on the walls..

stunning view! Heart of Hongkong !. well it's victoria harbor! A heart of hongkong with an amazing view and ofcourse a traveling option between china, macau, hongkong Iceland. A night view will just take your breathe away! feel like you are in another world! most amazing must see place at HK

Relaxing. if you want to relax your tired eyes and body , Victoria Harbour is the place to go .
Just sit and relax while sight seeing the waters and the skyline of Hong Kong beyond the other side.
Its a must see for all , enjoy the Hong Kong views.

Just beautiful! . What a beautiful harbour both at night and during the day. The scene constantly changing before you so keep your camera ready. We went on a day trip around the harbour one of my many highlights of Hong Kong. Watching all the ferries go by and the cruise ships looking amazing. At night the harbour comes alive the light show on the buildings and boats just lovely. Enjoy.

Most amazing . I love hong Kong specially the beautiful Victoria harbour... It best skyscraper view in the world. Best and the only musical light show in the world... Perfect pictures... You can easily travel to the place through mtr without any hassle..
Night show of light can be view is awesome. we went and the sky line is visible very nicely from here . try to go around 8 pm when all he building put a light show
Amazing . The view is incredible, very good atmosphere. The music is a great value add to the view. It's better to go around 7h pm. Do not miss it
Great Hangout place!. Good view of harbor and very close to majority of hotels. Great place to view Light show and casual stroll. Lots of malls nearby for great shopping.

Wonderful place to be on a Sunday . The park is a hive of activity with young families, couples and healthy minded joggers. Very relaxing strolling around the large park in the heart of Causeway Bay, worth a visit to enjoy a lazy Sunday morning

Right In the Middle of Everything. Basically anything and everything you need is right in this location. If not, its a quite MTR or cab ride in any direction and you will find what you need. The views walking around the harbor are amazing and will give you a deep feel for what Hong Kong has to offer. A very simple taste of what the city has in store before you venture out in the city life.

Not to miss at night. Probably the best attraction of Hongkong, beautiful in the day because of the architectures of both sides of the bay and the funny and intense traffic of all kinds of boats in the sea, this attraction becomes outstanding over night, especially if at 20:00 you attend the light and music show, where all art of making the skyscrapers play with you through lights touched the peak of joy.
Very Busy Harbour. We did a "Bum Boat" ride on the Harbour which was lots of fun. One of the best things we did in Hong Kong.

Soak in the view of hongkong from the harbour. It is good place to spend time in the evening & walk. The reflection of the lighted buildings around on the sea is nice & lits the environment. Its also the place to see the symphony of lights show. The highest building of hk can also be seen from here. Gets pretty crowded in the evenings.
Poor lighting. I was having a high expectation for the symphony of light but it turns out that only few lights was shown :(
Victoria harbour from Kowloon. try and visit at night - the light show is amazing - although it was a bit misty when we were there - it was still spectacular
Great view of Hong Kong . Probably one of the best water views in the world. I regret not visiting Hong Kong sooner. Bring a camera, really awesome shots of the buildings especially at night.

I didnt see that much because its raining and cloudy :((. I didnt see that much because its raining and cloudy :((((((
But it must be good because this place is one of HK highlights tho
Lovely Place. Its a lovely place to spend the evening. There is a beautiful mall near it where you can shop also. Otherwise just stroll around. Its lovely in the evening.

Walk and take in the view. My Hong Kong relatives took us here for a short walk. Harbour view was nice, just like any other harbour. The weather was very humid and cloudy, maybe that's why I did not really enjoy my experience. Snap some photos and we were off again.
Beautiful harbour. It was nice experience strolling at Victoria Harbour and watching all walks of life there. The star ferry has made it even more interesting place to be day, day or night.
Excellent view of Hong Kong. Excellent view of downtown Hong Kong. Great to walk around and take photos. Make sure to take the Star ferry to get a river cruise of the harbour. Its cheap and fun ride

Lost the orignal beauty due to land reclamation. I was back in Hong Kong last Oct. Victoria Harbour has changed the most. I guess it is due to the land reclamation over the years. The harbour seems narrower to me. Along the two coast lines are all the new tall buildings and they are packed. Not really recalled the old beauty of Victoria Harbour anymore

A Harbour of Romance and Life, Victoria Hong Kong. IF you care to dream a little one fine sundown atop Prince's Building next to Mandarin Oriental Hotel Hong Kong to have a certain cuppa @ Sevva balcony overlooking HKmagnificent Victoria Harbour in late April and early May, you could relive your last chilly foggy X'mas in total romance.Victoria is like your lover in romance shrouded in thin silky fancy veil of mist and chill, and masterly coloured by the neon light fantasy turned on by HSBC, BOC, AIA and all the top banks in this former UK colony, the Pearl of the Orient !Yet, she is full of life and resilience with her never sleeping powerful waves to chorus the beautiful tales of Hong Kong year after year till eternity !I came to know you since 1973 and eversince I have been around almost every year :God Willing !

A nightly spectacle!. It's a must watch whoever comes to Hong Kong. It has been awarded as the world's largest permanent light and sound show by Guinness Worlds Record. A nice photo opportunity in the backdrop of brilliant and view of the buildings. You can take photos from professional photographers with cost of HK$60 - 80. It's get crowded around 8 pm onwards.

Very modern, extensive and full of shops and amenities. I wouldn't class it as the shopping destination in HK, that's probably Causeway Bay but nonetheless it has a great many shops as well as cafes and restaurants. A great many buildings are interconnected with covered walkways, useful in torrential rain and to the ferries on the waterfront. If you aim for the Hang Seng Bank building you can also connect to the Mid Levels escalator to save your legs! There's a light show at 9 pm every night and can look spectacular from a rooftop bar. Won't be cheap but worth it.

Love this place.. Enjoy the HK view for nearly free. This place is the heart of HK! Use Star Ferry to cross from HK side to Kowloon side and vice versa. The view at night is fabulous. HK skyline is alive and vibrant. I have been falling in love for many years.
Gorgeous waterfront. This is a beautiful place to just sit or walk aroun and people watch... They have ice team carts to with great ice cream to grab a treat

hong kong april 2016. The StarFerry is a landing stage from Kowloon side, here you can see all types of boats from cruise liners to small fishing boats on the water,take a ride on the ferriswheel and get a better view,

Great!. One of the best view / skyscrapers's skyline in the worldThe best view is at night on a clear dayWatch it from Kowloon side in Tsim Sha Tsui.I suggest to first watch it from the promenade avenue starting from the star ferry terminal, then go to the top bar of the Peninsula Hotel behind. Name of the bar:FelixThis bar has been designed by Philip Starck.Have a drink in a top palace hotel watching the best view of the world....what else?

Hub of Activity. Victoria Harbour is a must: it is a delightful area to walk, ride the Observation Wheel to get a good look at the Harbour, take the Star Ferry to Kowloon, DINE, City Hall Concert Hall musical events.

One extreme to the other..... Junks, yachts, houseboats, fishing boats....they are all there - in various states of repair and disrepair. A great experience. Should take the water tour. Your captain just drives the boat - doesn't narrate, but the tour is a real eye opener
Very nice terminal and shops. Very few harbour terminal buildings are anything close to as modern and pleasant as this one.It;s more like an airport terminal.
Great for evening / late night strolls. Walk around Victoria Harbor is a must for anyone visiting HK. It was almost therapeutic for us as we did after a long day.
Great Harbour View!. This is a must visit spot when you are in Hong Kong where you are able to have a 180 view of the Hong Kong skyline which is exceptionally beautiful at night! Don't miss it!
Nice at night and day. A very nice view from all over the Harbour and especially above from a roof top. Hope it is a clear day to take some good photographs.
Breathtaking view!. Breathtaking view of Hong Kong harbour area, skyline, and skyscrapers. This is definitely not to be missed!

Evening place. If you like to see Skysrcrapers at night, this is your place. View is very nice and also ferries are there. At eight o´clock there light show (not very good), bit in that time there is lot of peoples.

Rating?. Not sure if this is about the Harbour itself or the landing in the Kowloon side, but I can speak for both. We crossed the harbour on the Star Ferry and I quickly noticed how dirty the water was, there is a lot of trash near the docks. You can see jellyfish swimming at the top of the water which was cool. Once you get over to the other side (Kowloon) you are accosted by people wanting to sell you suits, watches, and other things. There is the biggest mall in Hong Kong, but we did not go in there.

"Breathtaking". Wether it day or night, the view of Victoria harbour from Tsim sha tsui clock tower is just incredible, so go in the day and at night (especially for the symphony of lights{every night at 8pm}) and you won't be disappointed.
Clean and with lots of activities. It is like the heart of Hong Kong. Beautiful at night. Try and get a hotel room overlooking it, well worth the price.
Beautiful Harbour view in the evening. Beautiful Harbour view in the evening. Worth a visit. Also have the light shows, but not fantastic. A bit over rated.

Beautiful. This must be one of the worlds best harbours...and so accessible. Take a cheap Star Ferry ride across the harbour and a million photo opportunities appear. At night it is spectacular. The water side walk on Kowloon side is easy and there is often some entertainment. Be there at 8 PM for the laser light show. So no need to splash out on a helicopter tour to enjoy it up close and personal.

Good evening views at night when there is no pollution. Best to admire the beauty of all the neon lights from a distance. Jump on the ferry from TST and enjoy the ride. A great pity that HK is suffering from serious pollution problems..... Enjoy HK for what it is as it is going down quick in all directions.
Stake a sampan ride. Get to the jumbo restaurant dock and get a sampan for cheap you'll love it !!! It's a great sightseeing trip and cheap to get to the dock by taxi
Well, slightly overrated. That place is so overrated. Its quite pretty but I really dont get why everybody is so amazed by it. Rather take a stroll through the city at night. Way more beautiful

wonderful views and photo opportunities. wonderful to walk along the streets bordering the water with a view across the harbour to hong kong. great photo opporunities with famous landmarks in the background. lots of shops and dining nearby

In my opinion one of the best city-scape vistas in the world.. I am well traveled and in my opinion Victoria Harbour offers one of the best city-scape vista's in the World, especially at night viewed from Kowloon.At 8pm each night there is a light / laser show which is worth a watch and also take the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Wan Chai or Central Ferry Piers (just a couple of HK$) to get other great views of this fabulous harbour.
nice by any time of the day. be it in the evening. or in the early morning, it is always have a seat next to the Victoria harbour and enjoy the view to the other side

Best place to spend an evening. Victoria harbour is less famous for boats, cruises and ferries (of course you will take star ferry, spot few star cruises at any point of time). But for night when people throng to it to watch famous light and sound show. You can try some street food and indulge is some shopping or photography. Visit to Hongkong is incomplete without an evening at Victoria Harbour.

Harbour light show. The Hong Kong Harbour is just magnificient at night. Best to see the shimmering lights of Hong Kong harbour is from Kowloon side near the Ocean Terminal next to the Star ferry. Everynight at 8 pm, they also have a laser light show which last for about 10 minutes. Crossing the harbour with the star Ferry is cheap and highly recommended .
Just Magnificent. The tour books did not lie! The view was and is unbelievable. My one regret is that I did not book a hotel with the view of the harbor that was suggested.
Average. Nice skyline of course, but view it during the day. The night light show is a bit disappointing. It's free and nice for a stroll, so that's all in your favor!

Must visit at night and take Panoramic view shot from camera. You can see all iconic buildings of Hong Kong Island. Lighting at building are fantastic. Sea will have number of tourists boats, You will find number of professional photographers to click photo for you. Local as well as tourist are there. Easy to reach by Star Ferry, MTR or by Bus. Take a walk on harbour front and wind will blow you away
Views. Love the views at night the constant movement on the water and the lights of the central skyline the promenade is very nice

City lights look great!. Nice place to view the city day or night and to enjoy the boat traffic. A short walk from Chung King Mansions (40 Nathan Rd):From Chung King Mansions (40 Nathan Rd) go left on Nathan Rd. and walk to the harbor
Lights On!. Best to visit this place at night and to enjoy the cold breeze but usually crowded. Witness the short symphony of light ( and i didn't even notice that..lol)

Horrible when air quality poor. Nice views, beautiful walkway on the Kowkoon side. Ferry ran in time. But the air quality was so poor it was hard to enjoy because the smog was dense. I bought face masks at the local pharmacy.

Light show. Went there at night for the light show Great view ! Then went back in the afternoon to look around and shop Had lunch on the street , berry interesting . Great bake shops down there too !!

Fun time . After a long trip were looking for a place to have dinner and to shop. So we decided to visit this place. We are amaze on the big ship. So most of us take selfie. After that we take our dinner at lower ground floor of the adjacent mall. We visited also the Marco Polo hotel and the mall. We bought bags, clothes and watch

Victoria Harbour. Go there during 8PM when the light show is on. It is very cool and when I first laid eyes on the view, We had always wanted to see Hong Kong & Victoria Harbour. all lights go off at around midnight to save on electricity pollution
Amazing . Spectacular view ..Lively people in the heart of city .. Best part of Hong kong is this place ..Do not miss the Observation Wheel simple outstanding ..

Harbour View. We had always wanted to see Hong Kong & Victoria Harbour.
We took an evening dinner cruise on the Bauhinia of about 2 hours duration. The food wasn't very exciting & the Light Symphony disappointing. We had been warned that it the light show was hard to see.

Breathtaking View. Hong Kong is a city in its own class. 10X better than Toronto or New York in terms of scenic views, sight seeing, infrastructure, shopping, food, diverse culture, everything! Go there during 8PM when the light show is on. It is very cool and when I first laid eyes on the view, was at Avenue of the Stars, I almost cried. The view was so beautiful and so much to take in. I was in complete awe. Go travel the world and see Hong Kong.

better at night. it is a cool harbour, a lot of history so kinda cool to be there for that, lights are v cool, loved the skyline at night, especially from the mainland side. a surprise: all lights go off at around midnight to save on electricity pollution

OK but once is enough. The Victoria Harbour is not what it was. There was a time I could watch from my residence in Hong Kong the buses in Kowloon. Now high rise buildings block the view. With reclaimation, the harbour is getting smaller all the time. My earnest advice is to go on a ferry or hire a boat and take in the scenery before it all disappears.
Amazing. its was raining when i was there and its very busy area during all day also there is park you can set there and nice mall as well you love that place
Good for a night sight.. I had a good memory here because Victoria Harbour has a good sightseeing. They have a lighting show that you should see at least once in a life time.

Like a movie screen . We seen this during the day and night both are Beautiful. It looked like a movie screen so surreal. We went back down for the light show. We thought this was a little underwhelming.

Here you can feel the international flavor if life. Nice area, a lot of people and a lot of culture you will find there, i.e. art museum, garden of stars (with one hidden geocache), Starbucks, souvenir Shops, "Big Bus" station. And if you check the pier, maybe you found some old historical things. And if you have luck, you see some hugh Cruise Boats, I.e. we saw the "Queen Elisabeth". Also to get Taxi there. Do not forget, there is an 08:00PM light show every day (I think).

In and around harbour. Good harbour but stinks a little which is normal with all water places. A famous evening activity spot among tourists. Lots of shopping, restaurants and activities around the corner.
Great views. Fantastic views from our hotel across Victoria Harbour toward Kowloon and also the Island. Never tired of the light show . Brilliant to cross on the Star Ferry.

One of the great harbours of the world. Clearly a must see attraction from the land or water...the Star ferry is the way to go for the latter.
The nightly Symphony of Lights is somewhat of a let down....not really that impressive, more a matter of whether you are game to return home and tell your friends that you did not bother to check it out.

Awesome n very romantic. Views in the late evening are awesome with full sky being lit up from the neon n multicoloured lights from across.Breeze is so soothing n sends a wave of calmness n relaxation.Very photogenic place. Just go in the evening n relax yourself. No smell as many harbours have, rather it's very clean. TST promenade is under maintenance right now but you can enjoy at the harbour. Very similar to Singapore.An excellent lights show is also there around 8 pm.
Where it happens. Loads of hotels , shopping, restaurants and sightseeing. I would say there is something for everyone around this district

One of the Best Harbours around. While in Hong Kong you will definitely visit the Victoria Harbour.Wether it is only from the ferry terminal, ferry or on a harbour cruise.Its clean and does not smell like some harbours I been to.Try it in the evening and see the worlds largest light show, as recorded by the Guiness Book of Records

Rebuilding in progress. You will pass it if you take the ferry to Kowloon (Star Ferry). One of the great colonial building downtown but at present much of a construction site. A pitty as I saw ot in better shape and explain my poor review

Fantastic view of the skyline at night. I was there during day time and at night. Both of the cases also give me good impression At day it was breezy and at night, the lights from the opposite side of the harbour sparkles into your eye.

Breathtaking . The Hong Kong Skyline is spellbinding. The buildings on either side of the Harbour have a certain mystique. The images of your visit here will live forever in your mind. You will find yourself looking back in glee from your visit.
Spectacular. Spectacular when the sun is shinning, great from a Star Ferry.Night views are colourful, a relaxing time can be had after a hard day shopping.
a must see...night or day!. from either side...hk or Kowloon...day or night you see the awesomeness of the city you are in...definitely a must...definitely ride the star ferry!

Unavailablr. Construction work on Kowloon meant this harbour walkway is off limits and will be off limits for some time. You can still see the laser light show at 8pm every night from the harbour near to the star ferry terminus.

Nice place to stroll . I have been traveling to Hong Kong for close to 25 years. I have seen how much HK has changed.One such place is Victoria Harbor.On the Kowloon side, from Tsimshatsui East, the harbor walkway is fantastic! It is a lovely stroll especially in the evening. You can stroll all the way to Star Ferry if you so choose.And now days you can also catch the laser light show and visit the walk of Stars along the way.And the views of the Hong Kong Island side are spectacular especially at night.A nice way to end your day.
worth while. Unfortunately the weather was not good but even so the trip was well worthwhile. The ticket was part of the hop on hop off bus ticket.

Stunning Views From Above. I can only write about the view at night, and it was breathtaking. Someone we were chatting with on the street suggested we go to the lounge on the 17th floor of the Sheraton Hong Kong to get an elevated view and it was a great tip. It was a wonderful viewpoint to see the Harbour in all of it's splendour. At 8:00 they have a laser show that is cool but is only the icing on the cake. The illuminated ships and skyscrapers, combined with the natural beauty of the harbour made it an unforgettable evening. Only negative was the high menu prices at the lounge.
Nice. Victoria Harbor is coolAll the boats and ferries is interestingTake the Starr ferry very funGo across the harbor and catch the light show at 8pm

A couple of piers are open to tourist. The original area of Hong Kong. Lots of oldish buildings and first world war memorial. But the bay side is nice for a stroll. Go to the maritime museum - it's not free though. Also watch the fishing from the piers. Slightly inland are some formal gardens that are free. Also the equivalent on the London eye ,- also not free.You can also catch the ferry to various places for a pretty nominal fee.
Visit at night . Great views of the city. Grab a beer or some wine from 7-11 and watch the people and the boats go by. They have a light show for 10 min at night. It's ok.
Great view. I came here twice, once in the morning, once at night. I think you should come here at night. It's really beautiful.

Must see when in Hong kong. We went with a small boat to see the fishing boats and yachts in the area. Very interesting and great possibilities for exciting pictures. Not very busy with regard to people (it was Sunday)Nice boat for trip, but a bit costly.
View the harbour lights. Stunning even in the rain. Would love to see when there are fireworks and a clear sky. Also loved catching the star ferry here.

Gorgeous views of the harbor - definitely hop on the ferry!. We went to Victoria Harbor in the evening. We were in HK in February 2015, during Chinese New Year, so we stopped to check out the parade (it was awesome) then headed over to Victoria Harbor. The view is spectacular and we got to check out the fireworks which made this trip even more awesome. After walking around the HUGE shopping mall near the harbor and soaking in the awesome view, we hopped on the ferry to get to our hotel, which was on the opposite side of the harbor. I would highly recommend taking the ferry, it was a fun experience.

Not the Best on Cloudy Day. We took a cruise on a Chinese junk boat around the Victoria Harbour. The one hour cruise was interesting however with less than best weather did do justice to the beautiful skyline.
