The experience was good in circling the harbor and seeing the different boats within it. We imagined that the exercise will be great on a sunny day. The HK$130 per person is not cheap but worth it.
Awesome Harbor. The views of the harbor were breath taking and the local shops were awesome! It is definitely worth it to do when you visit Hong Kong!
Great board walk to run on. Beautiful Harbour front, with wide paths and so much to take in and enjoy when on a morning run! cannot miss this!

Good view. I was probably taken in by all the superb reviews given about this online, and was expecting too much from it so was a bit let down by what I saw. No doubt the light show was good, but either I was missing something or were the lights and sound out of sync like a poor Britney Spears Live show? Anyway overall it was a good experience, just not great!

Beautiful view . Really recommend during sunset and night time,u will get a beautiful n great view at this time..Verry near with mtr and garden of stars..place that should/must visit if u come hk..the view it's just magic when it start turning to sunset time!
Most attractive spot in HK. A must see in Hong Kong, suggest having a walk along the promenade of both sides of the Harbour as each side is very different then another.

Consumerism made public . The harbour is an exciting place to be. But I have to say that the sound, light and laser show was a let down. We last saw it two years ago, and my memory is of a much more impressive show.
Walk and enjoy the view . We went here and walk before we saw Symphony of the Lights. It was good to walk and enjoyed the view. The lights made the view looked more beautiful.
A trip round the harbour. Included in Big Bus package was a tour of the harbour. See cruise ships, junks, unique buildings, and more well worth putting a little time a side for this trip.

Makes Hong Kong the stunning city it is!. The jewel in the crown of Hong Kong is it's harbour. Right up there with Sydney Harbour, the place is stunningly beautiful. Boats & ferries come & go, with the skylines of Hong Kong harbour & Kowloon on either side. Fantastic.

Victoria Harbor -- two of the World's Best Skylines. The Victoria Harbor between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon offers two of the World's Best Skylines -- one view of Hong Kong Island Skyline from the Hong Kong Cultural Centre in Tsim Sha Tsui and one view of the Kowloon Skyline from the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre in Wanchai

Lots of things to see and do around here.. There is so much going on here, day and night, that you can't miss spending a day of two wandering around checking everything out.
We were there just before Christmas 2015 and saw some crazy sights, be prepared to be entertained by both the locals and tourists alike!
Nice evening stroll. A good place to walk and relax after dinner. View the night scene of Victoria Harbour and skylight, great place for photography.

Walk and enjoy. They are opening up more and more of the Harbour with a footpath and accessibility. It can get hot during summer but there are enough places to stop and grab a cool drink or sit down and rest.

Picturesque views of Hong Kong. Victoria Harbour is what adds to the allure of Hong Kong and it's unique and iconic skyline. The harbour is loaded with boats of all sizes and just adds to the charm of this incredible city. On my visits to Hong Kong, I have stayed at the Conrad and have enjoyed the views of the harbour from my room for countless moments during the day and at night. It's a great backdrop to the booming metropolis that is Hong Kong and is extra special when viewed at night. Find a hotel that offers rooms with a view of the harbour, pay the extra money for it and enjoy the view!
beautiful natural harbor. it is a wonderful and natural harbor and don't take it for granted.Keep it clean and it will serve Hong Kong people and business long years to come.

Beautiful buildings around the beautiful harbour. Looks like a new developed area in the city. Buildings around here seems to be new with a sense of art. The harbour itself looks used for leisure purpose so you can see may yachts in the harbour.

Great view of the Hong Kong Skyline. Victoria Harbour offers some great views of Hong Kong's Skyline, especially at night. I made the mistake of asking one of the local photographers to take my photo with my memory card and then she want a couple hundred Hong Kong dollars to get it back. I was literally about to punch her, and then she erased ALL of my photos as I refused to pay her outrageous price. Lesson learned by me - don't put yourself in a position to be scammed.

Nice views of the skyline, but nothing worth a special trip. If you are staying in walking distance, it's very nice to see at night, but I certainly wouldn't pay extra cab fare to come here. Just okay.

Fun to watch. The harbor is entertainment in itself. There are all types of watercraft going up and down. It is not extremely busy and I didn't see any big ships. Again, the view of the night lights is stunning.

Amazing view in the evening. As I understand it this is one of the worlds deepest natural harbours. What I liked a lot was the view in the evening. The skyscrapers are beautifully lit and quite regularly you can see big cruise ships go past. The Kowloon side of the harbour is a nice place to visit as well, a but busy though and a lot of people trying to get you into their store. All in all this is a must see when you're in HK.

It is where you feel the history of this city. When being on a boat or on either side of the bay, you really understand why this was a place "chosen" by European, Middle Eastern and Chinese traders. It is an amazing natural harbour and one can almost feel some of all the events and encounters that have found place here throughout history. To dwell a bit in this area is an essential part of a Hong Kong visit. Lots of photo opportunities as well.

Amazing scenery!. If you enjoy scenery, this is a place you should come. Not my first time visit, but it is a place that brings me come again and again. I like Victoria Harbour, it is so charming. It is a must visit place if you are coming to Hong Kong.
Every evening at 20:00, there is a show of light. Great view on the best skyline in the world, each evening there is a simple light show (nothing amazing)

Enjoy the views.. Best seen from "the Peak" , fantastic views , choose your day as if there is low cloud there will be limited vistas. See the harbour from the Star Ferry the cheapest and best views in the world. See the harbour from the Kowloon side , day or night you will not be disappointed.

Skyline surrounded by sky scrappers along . As a local Hongkonger, i would recommend this magnificent skyline surrounded with sky scrappers between the harbour from the Hong Kong Island and Kowloon Peninsula. Laser show performance nightly at 8pm for 15 minutes is the highlight, and is always fun to cruise around by Star ferry for 5 minutes within the harbour.I am lucky to have the view of whole harbour view from my apartment , is interesting to see all the building construction happening every day as well.There are firework shows happening few times a year as well, during 2nd day of Chinese Lunar Year, 1st of October as national day celebration and the New Years eve, don't miss the chance to check out while visiting Hong Kong around these schedule.

What an amazing place for the lantern festival. I went there last night for the lantern festival. It was an amazing evening with none stop entertainment from 7.30pm till 10pm. Victoria harbour is beautiful at any time in the evening but it was extra special as there were many huge lanterns in the square (which will be there for at least another week). There was also dragon dancing, art and crafts especially for kids and best of all beautiful performances by various artists. It was just beautiful. Every 40 minutes or so there was a 3D light show which is awesome and I believe there is a show every night at 8pm from here called a symphony of lights. The latter must be seen. Don't miss this place especially in the evening. Lot's to do including taking the star ferry and the cultural centre.

Eyecatching. This is a beautiful skyline, unprecedented anywhere in the world. Seeing pictures on the TV don't do it justice. It goes on for ages. The different sizes and designs of the buildings are amazing instead of the usual asphalt jungle we see with the odd Georgian building. To see it lit up at night with lasers and displays is magnificent. It's heartwarming actually to think that all the businesses have come together to deliver such a display as the Symphony of Lights each night. I can just imagine what they would say in the West about the cost and how they would get something out of it. A real wonder.
Wonderful view. Amazing harbour view, many buildings along two harbour side. I think this kind of view only can see in HK.

Great View. Night or day are both great time to go around the Victoria Harbour. So relaxing in the morning gazing at the bay and having a good night out listening to different band performing at night along the bay.

One of the best night scene in the world!!. The skyscrapers at night are simply stunning. It's breathtaking to just enjoy the view with your other half or friends. Worth a visit. There was a laser show every evening so it's another nice add-on beyond just wandering on the promenade.

Great place to take a ferry ride and see the skyline.. See it from shore line or get into the cheap Star Ferry. You will find yourself going back and forth over and again. I feel like this is a place for those romantic love story to film (Like the empire state building where you promise that you'll wait for that one particular) It's exciting, busy and non-stop. This is the view you have seen so many times in the movies, and it is alive right before your eyes. One day we took the ferry across and that was quick and easy, but a lot of fun to be a part of the viewMemorable!
Nothing much to see . Went there for a few minutes. Confusing once you get out of the station where to go. Went around in circles. Not much to see. It was too cold a day to stroll. Nothing else there
harbour. Victoria Harbour is full of people! There are shops around. We took several photos. It is the usual harbour view. I might appreciate it more if I went on a cruise or ferry.

Harbour to many places. We were at the harbor a few times, including a trip to Macau and it was also close to our place of stay. Found it to be nicely organized and the people very respectful of each other, despite the amount of people there.

Iconic. This is impossible to miss as the star ferry goes here direct. It is naturally forming and very large. Has a fair ground there and a huge ferris wheel or observation wheel. It's an iconic must see of any trip to hong kong. At night its even more magical as it lights up.

spectacular. make sure you have time to do some sailing on the harbour - can be the ferries, commercial tours or on a cruiser. had the pleasure to spend new year on the water and it was spectacular with the buildings lit, lasers and fireworks.

World Class Harbour. What a picturesque harbour! The skyline on either side of the harbour is wonderful both in the day and at night. We visited both sides as well as taking a harbour cruise on the Star Ferry. It is a vibrant city with lots to do and see. It is great to see that Victoria Harbour is clean and alive.
Amazing at night. We walked round late afternoon into th evening. Lots of good restaurants and good food thats not to expensive.

victoia harbour HK. the harbour area is basically just that a deep sea harbour consisting of the star ferry port and the big ocean liner port. The are large shopping malls in the area and loads of people wanting to sell you suits and copy watches.

Impossible to miss. The harbor is the focal point of Hong Kong with the main squares along it. I think the Ferris Wheel and amusement park is a distraction but a walk along the harbor and the sort trip across the harbor on the ferry to Kowloon are essential parts of any visit to the city.
Lit up!. A nice harbor during the day but at night is when it shines. It becomes a light show with most of the skyscrapers lit up for the season or occasion. All different colors and designs.

Kowloon side has better Harbour Skyline. Was great to watch the harbor from the hotel room, we stayed on both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon side and the skyline was better from Kowloon side but we had a higher room on HKI side.

Light everywhere. Quite nice
Many people gathered in here... and have clock tower too :)
There is have ship cruise go to hongkong island.

Harbour delights. With so much land reclamation over the years Victoria Harbour between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island is somewhat narrower than it once was. Spectacular views of the Harbour can be obtained from the Peak Lookout and from the top floors of many hotels on the waterfront. Crossing the harbour on the Star Ferry offers magnificent views of the Hong Kong waterfront right up to the top of Victoria Peak. The Ferry also offers a haven of tranquility in marked contrast to the hustle and bustle ashore. On the water there is always the possibility of sighting a sampan, a junk or perhaps the arrival or departure of a cruise ship. While there are no longer warships based in Hong Kong the level of activity in Victoria Harbour confirms Hong Kong as one of great harbours of the world.

Don't bother going to the later show. What a waste of time few green Lazers shone across the bay, nothing to write home about.It was recommended to us as a fabulous show to see but there were 8 of us and we all had same opinion
When Ferry crossed the Mercy. Wonderful place to unwind, to relax and to breath that fresh air from the harbour, you should try walking on the promenade.

Great Views. This is a nice enough harbour with bus and ferry terminals for ease of access. There is an elevated platform which offers wonderful views of Hong Kong Island in day or night.At 8pm for 15 mins every evening there is a lights show which is a spectacle to behold! Make sure to get there early and grab a good spot.
I need fresh air I need fresh air . Please Stop Smoking while walking.. People Smoking at every street corner, at HONGKONG They do not care about others  hey hongkong I need fresh air  from Thai

Harbor crossing . Couldn't help but try the famous star ferry crossing Victoria harbor and viewing the skyline of both sides. Visitors should definitely try and experience life as it used to be in HK.
Stunning view. We spent only a few days in Hong Kong, but Victoria Harbour is a beautiful place to see. At night time the lights all around the harbour are beautiful

When in Hong Kong!!. A very busy harbour where the cruise ships stop. loads of shopping in the harbour area night & day, high street high end shopping malls for the cruise ships, worth visiting the Peninsula hotel lobby, stroll to the day & night markets, in fact it is one big shopping and eating area of Kowloon. If you are over in central you can view from a distance, take the MTR or boat over to Kowloon. Hong Kong is a crazy city, noisy, colourful but very expensive, been there, bought the Tshirt and enjoyed the experience.

Very impressive city skyline. Along the walkway in Tsim Sha Tsui, you will see countless of vessels, junks, even cruises sailing busily across this harbour. But nothing beats this classical looking Aqua Luna. This red-sail junk offers different time slot for sailing such as evening sailing, sunset sailing, or for the Symphony of Lights slot while you are relaxing on the lounge beds. The price differs for the third option. Back to this Victoria Harbour, it is one of the few reasons people throng to Hong Kong. I am fortunate that it did not rain as I was here since 6pm to wait for the blue hour and for the light show at 8pm, however it was foggy and hence those giant structures were not sharp in the picture as I wish them to be. Nevertheless, it is still a wonderful experience to see the lights dance in the dark while enjoying the cool breeze

Wonderful Skyline. It's just a couple of blocks away from where we stayed along Nathan road. We walked going there to see the skyline. Wonderful skyline, you can see the tall buildings across. I think the other side is Central. We took a ferry ride that cost only hkd 3 to the other side.

Great shopping area and harbour front. Day or night it is a great place to visit. Loads of shops to suit all pockets and Gucci handbags and places to eat and only a few minutes away from the Kowloon park where you can sit and unwind. Colourful and vibrant in places and a must if you have the time to explore.

Day or night. This is not the Victoria Harbor I remember from my visit in 1970. Yes the Junks are still there but in a smaller number and yes families still live on many of them. The harbor is smaller due to the back fill from the new airport and the need to build new high rises. Today the harbor is home to many very high dollar yacht. A tour of the water front by boat still is exciting but there is something missing, and that is the hundreds of people who lived on the many small boats and docks now gone.

City of blinding lights. My flight got delayed and going around to the city is the option. I went to victoria harbour with fast train from airport.It was raining so I didn't have a chance to walk further out.Nice ambience and very safe city. Surrounded with Modern buildings.Good public transportation.
Best skyline in the world. This is the harbour between the HK island and the mainland, surrounded on both sides by gigantic skyscrapers

Loved from the very first sight. Believe me I saw a lot of cities - Paris, New York and Cape Town are my favourites. But Hong Kong is great. The Harbour and the Island and Kowloon on its both shores - it is something out of this world! I was lucky to get a junk to see the Harbour - thanks to my business partners!
Life and Color. If you were a night person and you want to roam around HongKong this is the best place to spend your time, really cool sight, colorful establishments at night!
One of the most stunning harbors in the world . Victoria Harbour is stunning to walk around by day or by night. Make sure to check out the light show at 8pm and take the Star Ferry.
Quintessential.. The harbour was of great significance in the city's development, and contines to thrive today. It is also a good place to watch Hong Kong come to life in the morning.
The Ferry Point of Hongkong. The harbor serves as the ferry point in Hongkong. The view of the harbor is awesome. Take the night rides in ferries to view the city.

Breathtaking . What do you think is a good time to visit this place? To enjoy the breaking dawn and awaits the sun rise and also the golden hours of the sleeping sun.Regardless, the two different timing of the day will be vastly different yet beautiful.For an early riser, enjoying the dawn is the best time to visit Victoria harbor. This is simply due to the the illumination of the city high rise located near the harbor.

The heart of HK. Victoria Harbour is the beating heart of HK, although smaller than it used to be because of commercial pressures leading to reclamation and developments into the Harbour, it is still a marvel and beautiful to see, even to reminiscent on how things used to be...

"Excellent". When you want to go there? In the day or night? Both the time you feel different.But to me night is the best time to visit Victoria harbor.Because the illumination of the skylines beside the harbor is in one word "awesome".

Very good place to be. Victoria Harbour is very interesting as it is busy with shops and shopping malls and attractions and all the things in Hong Kong that make you feel in a special place but very good place.
One giant construction zone. If you fancy a walk along the waterfront of the famous Victoria Harbor, bringearplugs! Endless demolition, land reclamation, unbelievably noisy.

One of the greatest harbors in the world!. This harbor is ever-changing. New buildings, filled in land with new buildings, boats from jet propelled to sampans roam the harbor. Be sure to see the laser light and music each night at 8:00pm. It's fantastic!

See the HK skyline form the best vantage point.. We ambled down to the ferry jetty and at the last moment decided on a harbour tour. We weren't disappointed!The HK skyline as a back drop to our selfies sure enhanced our memories of a great stay.Don't miss!
Very Nice. Victoria Harbour is really very good place. Just stand and enjoy the Skyline of Hong Kong. one of the best experiences you would have.

Nice view at night. The Victoria Harbor is one of the attraction place to visit in Hong Kong.Nice view along the harbor at night. The light show is start at 8pm.You can also see the Stars Walk with Chinese celebrity name with signature and hand marks. You can take Star Ferry harbor crossing the other site ( Hong Kong island ) to have Kowloon view.

One of the best night scene. The night light scenes of Victoria Harbour from both Kowloon side and Hong Kong side are fantastic, and it is even more beautiful during Christmas season. One suggestion is to take the Star Ferry to commute between the two shores and enjoy the views from the Ferry. The cost of the ferry is dirty cheap, but experience is very nice. I love this part about Hong Kong.

Walk and cross. The Victoria harbor splits the city of HK on two parts, the HK island and Kowloon.Walk both sides to admire magnificent views. The Kowloon side has better views on HK island and its skyline. Also, a Star Ferry harbor crossing is a must for catching the entire picture.

Nice View. I love the view of the sea and the harbour, its clean and nice, we see the light show at 8pm, not as good as Singapore one, but still nice. You can also see the stars walk with Chinese celebrity name, signature and hand mark
average place to visit. its an average place to visit, was just there to take the Star Ferry. Will recommend if you are taking the Star ferry - then only visit this place
We had a lovely boat trip around the harbour. Great views and worth the trip and was unbelievable all the boats that are moving around Victoria harbour and also a lot of building work

A Walk by the habour. The habour is undergo its construction forever. I miss the walk by the Exhibition Hall where many people took their pet for a walk. Now it is dusty and not a good place ,mtemporary, I hope.

Victoria Harbour - Ultimate place to celebrate the New Year Eve. This is definitely you cannot afford to miss in hongkong and most importantly, if it is in new year. This is the place where you can enjoy the new year celebration with lot many Fireworks, also you can take a ride with Ferry and enjoy the Fireworks. Those are really awesome. But it is too rush, you may be need to find a best viewing place where you can view all those attractions properly.

Iconic, just ignore the pollution. The harbour is obviously one of the most famous. As a working harbour there is always something to view, whether it is cargo ships, cruise ships, luxury yachts, ferries, junks or various other watercraft. Unfortunately the downside to its functionality is its quite obviously polluted nature. However, you aren't going to be swimming in it so it is a minor factor but don't expect to see the 'jewel like beauty of its water' as one travel brochure put it. It is the best place to view the skylines of both sides of the harbour. It is a functional part of Hong Kong daily life as people travel to and from Hong Kong itself. There is however never a shortage of something to look at.
New Year Eve 2016. The best place in New Year Eve Celebrate in Asia. Many attraction of firework beside skyscrapers in town.

Harbour cruise not a highlight . Unless you just want to have a boat ride to escape some heat and crowds I would skip this tour. Sound is weak...and on my trip the explanation of what was being described was a good minute or so behind the actual site. This was confusing until I clued in and turned to sit backwards - which was somewhat helpful. So I did not learn much. And I did not see the container yards which was one of my objectives. But I did get a boat ride. Enjoy.

Went to the harbour at night - best time!. Had an amazing meal at a Steakhouse overlooking the Harbour on our last night in Hong Kong - the best place to be on our last night - very memorable! Watching all the lights on the skyline was incredible and a memory I have for life!
Samazing nightly views. The views of the harbour from the Star Ferry terminal are amazing at night. The nightly light show at 8pm is quite spectacular and it is worthwhile bringing a camera!
Tourist attraction. Extremely busy harbour with several ferries serving the various islands. Broad promenade which is very popular with joggers.

Pearl of South China Sea. Two places best to look at Victoria Harbour; from the peak and on route to Hong Kong island taking the ferry from Kowloon. Victoria harbour is spectacular at nights and the lights never fail to impress.

Come and see the sights!. Victoria Harbour is a great place to visit and spend a few hours just watching what's going on and seeing the scenery. Come in the day to see everything then come again at night to see everything lit up.You will be hard pressed to find a better view anywhere that overlooking the harbour. Seeing the city all lit up and the little Aqua Luna boat sailing by,Make sure you are here at 8pm to see the light show from the city across the harbour.

Spectacular. Went on a sunset cruise from Pier 9 lasted about an hour. It commenced at dusk so as it got darker the lights from the tower blocks became even more impressive. Honk Kong looks so much better at night than daytime. A must do when on Hong Kong island. Very misty though as it was most days while we there so photos not brilliant.

A must see at night. Go there via the Star Ferry and this is a spectacular place to see at night. Neon signs light up every building with all the famous Corporate names from the Western world and Asia
A WoW !!!. I could say this is a good place to see Hong Kong.And it is quite easy to access, try to be there during sunset. Enjoy the moment and the view..Take your time.

A very busy harbour...... Victoria Harbour is a natural & very busy working harbour between Hong Kong Island & Kowloon.
Lovely to watch the sea traffic everything from working commercial boats, tugs, ferries, cruise ships, sampans and junks.

Everyone who goes to HK owes it to themselves to visit Victoria Harbour. I am sure if you've been to HK you've been here. If you haven't I am sure it's on your list to visit. Just be sure you do. Tons of stuff to do and see around here and lots of shopping.
greta view. The view from above, you can see almost the entire city of Hongkong in different angles. There are restaurant and coffee shops as well with a coach outlet inside.

New years Eve . We watched the fireworks display here on new years Eve it was fabulous. Great atmosphere and crowds were unreal. We also came to visit here during the day beautiful views of kowloon skyline. Sky100 building is very cool to see and at night it is lit up v.well. Victoria harbour is superclean. The big bus hop on hop off goes from here and so does the star ferry.

One of the most beautiful harbours - on a clear day. Definitely one of the best in the world when it is not shrouded in haze or fog. The skyline is absolutely stunning and the hive of activity along its waterways is exhilarating.

Beautiful to see. The harbour is a beautiful sight, especially at night. Either side of the harbour affords good views with the building lights and ships in the water. Don't bother sticking around for the Symphony of Lights at 8 pm--it is a big disappointment.

Efficient. Travelled with family to Macau from Victoria Harbour Hong Kong. Pretty good place, neat and clean and some shopping area too. We spent about an hour and half before we boarded the ferry to Macau. Helpful staff.
Beautiful at night. At night the harbor is lite up. Very beautiful to see during the day, you see a very busy port. Many ships of all designs and all sizes.

Most Beautiful Part of Hong Kong. The Hong Kong skyline is one of the most beautiful in the world. Do not hesitate to take a ferry out during the night to see the beautiful light show on the buildings.This is truly a magical experience.

Lovely walk. Here for New Years eve....absolutely packed but well worth the atmosphere and nice fire works...we went back the next day and had a nice walk around....lovey skyline...reasonably flat area to walk..quite a lot of building works going on around here
New year. All year will be good to visit ,but new year best season ,whatever you want to buy will bf there ,great atmosphere for shopping and Fun.

Sinteresting but over rated and crowded. We went to look at the lights at night. Get an octopus card and travel across on the star ferry. The lights were a little under whelming and there were crowds waiting for the light show to begin.
Beautiful. Its just one of those places you have to see and experience. There is something magical about a night time walk along the harbour.

You can't be in Hong Kong without going here. We saw it from the Star Ferry and also when we left to go to Macau.
You get a different perspective of the skyline and how awesome it actually is.

Majestic . This is a breathtaking sight both during day and more during night time with the glittering neon lit skyline of HK.The place is buzzing with tourists and revellers and is a must see on new-years eve for the amazing fireworks display. Easily accessible through the central MTR station and about a 15 min walk on the skywalk to the promenade. Be sure to add this in your travel itinerary I
Sublime!!. The Victoria Harbour is I think offers the best scenery in the world. At night time you can see all the buildings illuminations. It is really nice.
Interesting... if it's what you are into.. Came here years ago and now it's not as good as what it used to be or perhaps my expectations has changed. In any case it's a lovely place to hang-out.

One of the Best - Anywhere. Travelled to HK for Christmas and Victoria Harbour immediately holds our attention. We were staying at 4 Seasons with harbour view rooms and were captivated 24/7 with the ever changing action. Night and day this place is busy with shipping movements of all types. Helicopters back and forward and large hawks always in view. The night lights of the city are brilliant and it is lovely to see little boats going to and from making sure any garbage is removed (by hand). Other Asian nations need to look and learn - HK has it right!
Amazing Christmas lights . This is a very impressive harbour but the Christmas lights make it even more so. Take the star ferry across and enjoy the view.

Not worth at all. First of all, the staffs were rude.Not as expected, you can also see the same lights of the buildings from the harbour, this makes you pay more dollars to get the not so nice experience. Waste a time.

A lot to see!. Whether you arrive by MTR or Star Ferry, there is a lot to see in Central. It is the heart of the business district of Hong Kong Island. There are trams running East/West and you can go to the Peak Tram station, Lan Kwai Fong or Soho (where there is plenty of night life and restaurants), Tin Hau Temple and also head to the Western District which has an interesting market.

Probably the nicest at night . See the Hong Kong island from the harbour to get the postcard view of the city. They are currently renovating parts of the harbour so you might feel squeezed by the other onlookers coming en masse. Other than that, enjoy the views!

See both at day and night - see note about 8 pm daily laser show. Be sure to view the Harbour both by day and night to enjoy the views both times. We saw the 8 am laser light show and it was OK but not over the top amazing. See the Harbour via ground and boat.

Best viewed from Kowloon or the Peak. The Harbor was right across from my hotel and should not be missed. The boats floating by and the buildings (gaudy light up) surrounding it are impressive. For a breathtaking view go to the top of Victoria peak.

Beautiful Skyline!. Hong Kong's skyline is definitely one of the most beautiful skylines in the world, especially in the night, there was light shows. One could watch from Victoria Peak. Also Star Ferry provides a special view of the habour.

A feast for the eyes. I am staying at Island Shangri-La which affords an excellent view .Sensational actually. Sipping a drink and viewing is a special experienceColourful lights and then the peace educing charm of the harbour

A fascinating mix of old and new. We thoroughly enjoyed walking along the waterfront from the Macau Ferry Terminal to the Star Ferry Terminal. Although the view was foggy, it was still fascinating to see the mix of old and new vessels on the water, the amazing Hong Kong Skyline and the buskers near the Star Ferry Terminal. The fare for a trip on the Star Ferry from the Hong Kong side to the Kowloon side is cheap and it's beautiful to see the buildings and watch the numerous boats on the harbor.
good view. from there i saw the most of what i need to see, so i like it and will go there once again, like it.
Must visit and see and feel. Weather will depend the greatness of the view and surrounding environment. Could be nasty on rainy days..

Great views. A scenic place where one can catch a great view of Hong Kong Island or Kowloon (depending on which side you are at). I was there in the afternoon and evening and the views are stunning. Be there early if you want to catch the night view of Hong Kong skyline as it may get crowded there. Great laser display at night as well.

Lively. There was quite a lot going on around this area although we had limited time and did not explore much of it. We did take a ride on the Ferris wheel (150 HK dollars) and then took the ferry to Kowloon.

One of the world's great harbors, and accessible to visitors. Whether you walk along the walkway in Tsim Sah Tsui, see it from Hong Kong Island (especially from the Peak) or from the Star Ferry, you'll enjoy the views.
The nightly sound and light show is great, but in the Christmas season, it's even better as the buildings are brightly decorated.

This is THE view. Spent a few days in Hong Kong looking at the view of Kowloon at the few points you can see it best BUT the best view is from Kowloon looking back at HK across Victoria Harbour. Spectacular as the sunset and the lights started to come on. We went across by underground which is quick but will go again by ferry.
a must see when in hongkong....... a place were you can relax watching the view the people while seating and having chat or having snacks or coffee...just be relax..

Great Place for Pictorials. It's a nice place to have pictures especially at night. The lights shine in the darkness. However, I was just a little disappointed with the Light Show. It was not what I expected. Don't just expect anything spectacular. A lot of renovation is on going. Avenue of the stars is under construction. You'll not be able to see it. Just enjoy the scenery and take many pictures.
Confused. Reach victoria harbour at 8pm. After standing there for 30mins, everyone was still wondering if the symphony of light has started or not.
Nice view at night. This place very nice for night activity you can see the variety of colorful and nice view of building. Im so enjoy with view hope can see this again when im going there.

Major hub with great views!. You have to visit this area while venturing out and about Hong Kong. Beautiful views and pretty much anything you'd need while you're in that area should you require shopping, food, etc.

View of Victoria Harbour From The Inter-Continental Hotel Bar ~ FANTASTIC!. The view of Victoria Harbour is a must when in Hong Kong. They have put together a laser show in the evening. Don't get too excited. The harbour is beautiful at night with the neon signage and lights as it is. Catch the Chinese Junk party boat lit up in red lights. When we were there in November, 2015, the Avenue of the Stars was closed for renovations, and apparently until late into 2016. I remembered going to the Intercontinental lounge bar about 26 years ago. Still has the great same view as seen. They do have a minimum of about $25 USD. That is basically the cost of a drink there anyway. Great way to see the harbour, and relax before dinner. Highly recommended. View is best in the city, relaxed atmosphere, and they serve a decent cocktail
Stunning views and atmosphere along the harbour.. If you are clever you can get the most amazing photos. The harbour never sleeps. It is always interesting. Sit and watch.

out of the crowd. not central but out of the crowd, stayed a few times in hotels there. lots of nice eating places, lower priced than central, all possibilities of public transport, which is ever so good in hong kong - brisk walk to the ferry, but doable

The hub of Hong Kong!. Everything goes through Victoria Harbour, it is the real transit hub of the region.
It costs a whacking 20p to cross over on the ferry, free if you are over 65!
Lots going on!. This is a nice harbour, where you can get the ferry and there is also a shopping mall here. The skyline is amazing during the day and during the night!

great city : hongkong. faszinating busy city , new and old part of the city and english influence ... Ozon Bar a must when you stay at the Ritz Carlton ... nice view to skyline , peninnsula hotel also great for a stay !
Huge Mall. Lots of Chinese tourists there and in the malls shopping, the mall is huge and it is the same as the other DFS malls in Mongkok.
Lights, lights, lights!. One of the most colorful sights you'll see, especially near the holiday season. The city lights dance starting at 8PM, so make sure you pick a good location for dinner.
Just another mall. It looks great, it is clean, it is busy, it is tidy. It isn't for me. Malls are for those shopping and those who love it. It seems to have everything, yet nothing.

Great Views. A visit to Hong Kong would be incomplete without a visit to Victoria Harbour. The views are amazing, make sure you take your camera, i prefer the views at night but they are just as nice in the day.

Un-missable. A visit to Hong Kong would be incomplete without at least one visit to the shores of Victoria Harbour.Whether you see it during the day or by night or take my advice and do both, you can see it any way you like. There are many harbour side walks including the Avenue of Stars, or you can take the Star Ferry from TST or Central.Of course, the real highlight of the harbour is the skyline surrounding it, which can be seen from many vantage points.To me, the Victoria Harbour skyline is the image of Hong Kong I take away the most.It is truly wonderful.
Worth a visit by the day and night.. Worth a visit by the day and night. Also go to the harbour area of Avenue os Stars. Beautiful place to see the HK skyline.
Great view on a clear day. It's well worth a trip on the ferry to get a view from both sides. It's probably the best deal in HK.
Interesting. We took a tour of Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry Harbour Cruise. Sadly it was overcast so guess we did not see it at its best. Good value for money for spending an hour or so.
d (^o^) b. A must visit place while in Hong Kong . Enjoy the night view especially. Even day time is nice too . In month of November , windy and not very cold . Nice...
Busy harbour. Victoria harbour seems to be busy harbour. But the sight s beautiful. Loads is ship can be seen there. But it seems to be clean, neat n efficient.

An Amazing and Beautiful Harbour. Like most harbours throughout the world the Victoria Harbour is an amazingly beautiful place. We were lucky to catch it on a good weather day so our experience was enhanced.

Hongkong Visit 2015. Always a pleasure going back to HongKong, foods are excellent and the shopping are always fantastic. I love wondering around all over HongKong, lots to do foot massage after a long day walked.

amazing view!. the place was really amazing and its also neer to a lot of tourist spots in hongkong, its only pretty during the evening and looks very ordinary during the day:) but hey! you didnt visit hongkong if were not able to see victoria harbour

Great to see on Star Ferry. You can easily travel around Hong Kong especially from one HK Island to Kowloon side using the Star Ferry and at the same time you get to take short 10minute ride across star ferry and you'll get to see a perspective of Hong Kong that you wouldn't otherwise

a beautiful harbour. The harbour is one of the reasons people throng to Hong Kong. It is beautiful and I am fortunate to look out upon it when staying there. You can take the star ferry, a junk but make sure you experience travelling on the harbour. This time I sailed up the harbour on the Silver Shadow, a wish list and it was superb
Light show. Get on boat to experience spectacular Light Show in the evening around 8 p.m. Plenty of restaurants and shops.
Harbour. Well looked after nice and clean had cleaners out cleaning the hand rails.lots of signs to say of uneven pathways

Some of the most magical views I have ever seen. I have experienced Victoria Harbor from both the Hong Kong and kowloon side. Its spectacular, especially when you take the boat around the bay. Right now it's almost like buildings want to out do each other to decorate for the holidays. A must see.....

HK. if you have transit in hongkong more than 4 hours, get out & visit this place. you can view hongkong skyline with lots of building & if youre there at night there's laser show for about 15mnt, definitely must visit place in HK

The best in the world. Star Ferry at night (in particular) takes in one of the most spectacular (and cheapest) views in the world. The activity , awesomeness of looking at a jewel of the world can never be forgotten !

The mark of achievement for Hong Kong. The harbour is a place where you marvel at the development of Hong Kong. From a slum to a metropolis filled with skyscrapers. Every visitor will surely stop to soak in the atmosphere. Best viewed both at night and during the day. The symphony of lights will be at 8pm.

A MUST SEE. This is a must see for everyone that visits Hong Kong, it's a place where old meets new a place where the old time merchant plies his wares with the ultra modern hi-tech merchant, you will see the old ways of 100 years ago still being used today and if you care to linger with some of these people you will learn that they are doing as their forefathers have done in the same place for those hundred years or so

Still amazing.. As a local Hongkongnese and an avid traveler, I'd still rate the harbor as the top 3 cityscape scenery worldwide. However you view it, day or night, from the peak or from the ferry, it would stick with you forever. Vibrant and lively. I just wished they hadn't have built that one particular eye-sore of a building on the HK island side. (you'd know which - trust me)
The harborwalk is very beautiful. We walked quite a distance along the harborwalk and had great views of both Kowloon and hong Kong. Well worth coming down the the water.
Lovely Place. Amazing place to be, stunning views...its a very lively place with modern infrastructure & modern amenities...little crowded area..
Amazing. One of the places to go to in Hong Kong! If you can get a private tour guide, you should. This way you can see and experience it the way a local would.
Lovely !. Fantastic views, very lively and modern, one of the best sights in Hong Kong. Really enjoyed it ! But don't be out till too late !

Stunning view of HK. Go over to the Tsim Sha Tsui and enjoy the stunning view and the light show to at the Victoria Harbour as one of the must in your itinerary in HK.
Take the cruise if you want to experience the oriental.
Lovely and Romantic! . This is a truly lovely harbour. My husband brought me to Hong Kong for the first time, and since we both love being on the water, this was a must-see!

Spectacular when viewed from either Kowloon or Central............... The vast expanse of water separating Central Hong Kong from Kowloon and the mainland.Once home to the Royal Navy now a thoroughfare for all types of boats,private yachts,cruise ships pass through daily.Occasionally small junks with red sails also ply these waters.The star ferry painted in its green livery crosses daily from side to side offering a spectacular vista on a sunny day and a romantic passage at night.

Stunning reflections at night. Viewed the city lights from the Tsim Sha Tsui side. Took MTR Tsuen Wan Line (red line) from Hong Kong Central. There is a lot of construction that has limited the standing room, but was worth it. Actually went after 8 pm laser light show so it was less crowded.

What a view! . We stayed in an apartment looking over this wonderful harbour, teaming with all sorts of vessels plying their trade. Ferries, junks, sampans and barges constantly in motion. Plus soaring falcons, window cleaners, the ever changing sky and go course the Hong Kong lights. Excellent.

Stunning night and day - everchanging scenery. Beautiful, eclectic, ever changing, busy and incredible. Just some words to describe Victoria Harbour - this amazing waterway is busy day and night. Several near misses while on the many ferry crossings made for interesting journeys back and forth over the harbour. Whether you are walking along the promenades, or sailing across the water - there is always something interesting to talk about, photograph or just plain wonder "what on earth?" while looking out over this amazing harbour.

Good taste of the orient.. A mix of chaos, hectic activity, people, sights and smells. Old world charm where ferries and buses meet to take you away. Great little tourist bureau under the ferry terminal, very helpful.

One of the best sceneries in the world . The is one of the most famous places in the world. It's a must to go here if you are a tourist. You can come in the morning or midday or afternoon or evening. It's always something to see. Unfortunately a part of the promenade will be closed for some year. Still it's plenty of space.
Crowded but true "Asian tiger" flavor. It is crowded with people, nice shops, bars, restaurants and generally buildings. One can feel this "Asian tiger" flavor and the "oriental" port reminiscence.

Beautiful illumination. Very exciting night attraction. I would like to recommend to all who visit Hong Kong to take public boat to cross between Hong Kong island and Kowloon island. the boat was so classic and view from the boat also so nice.
Interesting Historically. Easily accessed with public transport, buses depart here to all sides of the city. The tourist info at the bus station is extremely helpful.

Very very crowded. The shops are what you would expect. The view of the harbour is nice. But it's very crowded. I went on a weekend, and there was a band competition, which was nice. It's easy to walk around on foot, and fairly safe.

Under major renovations. Amazing view across to Hong Kong Island but unfortunately there is major construction going on there for the next couple of years, also the Space Museum was closed due renovations!

Spectacular View. The view was amazing and with all the high rise building simply showing how progressive is the city of Hong Kong. Just walking along the bay with a great weather makes our trip more memorable! We'd love to go back and see this place again. Recommended for all traveler!

Busy location. A hive of activity with lots of sights to see during the day and ferry access to different islands in the area, Lantau and Macau. Some good shopping and hotels in this very central area of HK

Classic. There isnot too much things to say for harbor. Good to see if you visit hong kong. But there is victoria park next to harbor you should visit there. Its really beautiful place to go. Many facilities inside. Great place to refresh yourself.
holiday. hmmmm.. it was a breezy evening walk we had along the pathment of the harbour. we even sat outside starbucks to enjoy the sunset and the breeze.
...nice place to hang out doing nothing... A great place to walk around and chill out taking in the sights and sounds.Very scenic views here for pics of the harbour and Hong kong island.
Great. Get ferries from here and experience the skyline. Clean safe and fun. Must see like all the boats and ferries!

Hongkong harbour. It is situated on the main hongkong island and is the commercial hub of the city. All major offices are here and the entire area has sky rise buildings and most busy area. One should avoid cars and go by public transport only

Shopping galore. Beautiful area with tons of shopping of HIGH end stuff. Pretty much anything you want of BRAND names is available here. Very clean and safe. By the water is a art building that displays different type's of art and very interesting. A short walk to the ferry boat area, there are a lot of small shops and food vendor's. I really like that spot.
Nice view. Except for the nice view, Victoria harbour it's boring place full of ferries.Taking the ferry it's cheaper the other options. Anyway it's nice to see once and the sender something we else.

Harbour is very place to see the skyline. One of the most enchanting place to be around during the evening is the Harbour Ara apart from the Peak. The skyline of HK is visible from almost all the places of this area nd gets very beautiful. The Symphony of the night show is good to see from here as from the peak

Loved the skyline!. The reasons I went to the harbour were to see the skyline and to use the star ferry.I expected a simple harbour, but when I arrived here I was quite surprised; what an amazing and relaxing place! In the weekend many families and tourists are hanging out here.I really enjoyed watching the Skyline (sounds a little bit odd, but when you visit this place you will understand).
Very Cool. I enjoyed it from my room but also went on a cruise. Great views and a ton of activity in the water.
Beautiful in the evening. The view of the HK Island Skyline are a must watch from Victoria Harbour. So the preferred time is evening when the Symphony of Lights happens.

Free and worth visit. The harbor is very nice. You can have a walk and see it from both islands. You can take a ferry to the other island or just a ferry that make a round over there. There is a movie stars area, where you can see the local celebrities hand prints. Every evening there is a show of light and music. It is free, so you should be early, because many people will be there as well, and you want to have a good place to see the show. It takes about 15 minuets but very impressive (and romantic)
Lovely in the Evening. we visited Victoria harbour in the evening. i looked amazing with the lights on. a good place to take some nice night photography.

world-famous CNN backdrop. Because of the haze, much of the beauty of this harbor is obscured. I think this is almost a constant; spent 5 days in HK and although it was sunny, the haze was always there. Pictures would not come out nice.

Great scenery!. The scenery at night was amazing!
Good place to visit for photo shooting in Hong Kong at night.
It is very pack with people here so be prepare to walk slow.
A must visit landmark in Hong Kong.

Use a ferry tour to see the full harbour - very busy!. The harbour & waterways are used by something like 10,000 ships/boats a day! There is always something going on, & its well worth doing a harbour tour. Star Ferries & others offer them every day for about $90 (£7ish)

Unforgettable views. One of the most scenic views in the world, gorgeous at day and also at night. it is truly a postcard view and absolutely spectacular. One of the most beautiful skylines with Victoria Harbor in between.

It is a lot of construction now. Please be aware it is a lot of construction now and some attractions like avenue of stars is not available. All this district is nice but it depends on what you like. You can for sure find there many interesting and expensive shops. And in most time of the day it is of course full of people, many tourists.

Pretty views. This is one of the most visited and endearing sights of HK and offers scenic views of the HK skyline. There is a laser show every evening called Symphony of Lights. Worth visiting during one's visit to HK.

One of the most scenic harbour of the world. One of the scenic harbours of the world, with world class light and sound show Symphony Of Lights and clear blue waters. It's definitely a must visit and there are lots of attractions around the harbour. An entire day should be allotted to enjoy to its worth.
skyscrapers all around. the area is known for many skyscrapers and more have been built recently, making the place unique in the world for great views

Nice view. came to see the legendary bruce lee statue but was told that it was going to be renovated, need at least 3 years (another 2++ years to go). then the symphony of light, nice but we end up leaving after 10 minutes. but it's a nice view of hk at night
A good view of Hong kong skyline. A good view of Hong kong skyline, however the cruise was about okay!! The light show could be better.

Hong Kong @ Night. Manage to get to this side of the harbour by boarding the Star Ferry. Terrific view at night. A lot of people just chilling enjoying the view and wind. There is a few photographers to take your photos and edit it with the night view at the back.
Try for a clear day. Such a pretty area but so much nicer on a clear day. Plenty of areas to sit and enjoy watching the world go by.

Will building never end. There is nowhere nicer than Victoria harbour on a nice sunny day on the Star ferry. The only problem is the building works seem to go on for ever. If my memory serves me well the Empire state building was completed in just over one year. Hong Kong seems to take years to complete any project. I would have helped pay for it, but died before completion.

stay here for the best view. If you want an unbelievable view of the harbour try the 6th floor at the Marco Polo Hotel which is open to the public it is amazing the laser display is now a bit dated but still enjoyable

BEST VIEW EVER!!!. Go to the Victoria Harbour and grab a drink at a place that has a view of the Victoria Harbour in their lounge and sit there and be mesmerized for hours...........It is worth it. The Intercontinental Hotel has a lounge in their lobby to die for........Sit there all day......It's worth it!!!
Nice chill area! . Been sat here the past couple of nights and its so relaxing. Looking across at the amazing skyscrapers all lit up! There's usually plenty people around also. Better at night here!
Victoria Harbour. Could view the harbour at night and also during the drive to the peak in the morning. The tram ride to the peak was a different experience.

In the Heart of Hong Kong. a Nice place to visit in Hong Kong and well connected by Trains, Ferries, Buses & Taxis.Lot of Shopping centres in and around.well known attractions of Museums, Avenue of Stars, Clock Tower, Symphony of lights, Canton Road, 1881 heritage, star ferries etc., are all nearby.
Beautiful and easy to go. The victoria harbour it is a nice place to go in hong kong, it has a nice view and it is in the hear of hong kong.
Heart of Hong Kong. It's a must to visit this part of the city. See it by both day and night, from the land and the sea!

main harbor between hong kong & kowloon. this places is really 1 of the best places that represent main icon to recognize hong kong ,it connect 2 islands hong kong & kowloon city & whenever you look @ it,you will like its cool view whether @ daylight or @ night ,its very cool place .you must visit it .
big harbour and comfort. Again... what i like from hk is good service. They make the passangers feeel comfort. There's free drinking water and the provide place to recharge ur phone too
Fantastic views from Star Ferry side. We watched the light show over the harbour at 8pm tonight, was pretty cool the buildings light up with lasers across the habour.

Must-see Night Scene. We took a bus along Nathan Road to the Star Ferry terminal. This is a faster way to get to Victoria Harbour from city centre. Just take any bus that indicates "Star Ferry" as the final destination. The bus stops at the terminal where everyone must alight. After alighting from the bus, turn left and a few metres away, you will see the Clock Tower. Walk along the river bank and admire the beautiful night scene. On a cool, clear night, it was a nice place to spend the evening. Walk on for another 15 - 20 minutes and you will reach the the bronze statute to mark the beginning of Avenue of Stars, which was closed during our visit. From here, we walked towards Tsim Sha Tsui MTR, which was about 5-minute walk away.
Hong Kong Trip. Nice! Beautiful place for a run! If you are a runner who wants to squeeze in a few miles..do it here. Do it early though...it gets busy especially near the Bruce Lee statue
Loved the sights... It is a lovely sight especially at night. I enjoy the walk along the front, although quite a few areas were under construction.

Nice views.. Victoria Harbor encompassing Hong Kong island and Kowloon is something to behold. There are huge buildings on both sides of the harbor. The nightly laser show on Hong Kong island is fun to watch from the Kowloon side of the harbor.

wow so huge. when you get that harbor to catch the ferry to reach Tsim Sha Tsui an expected view comes in front of your eyes, Skyscraper full of lights and the big panoramic wheel similar to the one in london. On the other side you see Koowloon island

Definitely do a ferry trip! Stunning! . Victoria Harbour is beautiful. Again we went on a tour both in the day and evening and it was certainly worth while. I was amazed mostly because of all of the tall tall buildings surrounding the Harbour. If you lucky you will get a glimpse of the Chinese sail boat Aqua Luna which you can take a ride on but we settled for photos

Nicest skyline I've ever seen. Victoria Harbor is the nicest skyline I've ever seen. I've been to Hong Kong several times and always check it out while I'm there. There are a couple of ways to see it:1.) The Star Ferry - the ferry that shuttles people between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Cheap and great, you can take a couple routes here and only spend a couple bucks. Highly recommend this. 2.) The Peak - If you are in Hong Kong, you will probably be heading to The Peak. This is more expensive than taking a Star Ferry, but in my opinion, the view from the top is still worth the trip, particularly since you will likely be taking the Peak Tram up as it is, which is cool in itself. 3.) Boat tours - the last time I toured the harbor was on the Duk Ling, which was $5 for anyone with a foreign passport! I've been informed that this tour has since been deprecated, however, there are still other options available (although I doubt they will be as cheap as the Duk was).You may be advised to pick one route by day, and the other at night.

Great at night or from a ferry.. Watching the light shows in the evening or taking one of the harbour tours run by Star Ferries or Aqua Luna is a must. Hong Kong grew around the harbour and seeing HK from the water is fantastic.

It's not the harbour.... It's not the harbour you should be reviewing. It's the views of Kowloon from the harbour itself.
The harbour is really the pier terminal.
Big. Big. Busy.. Couple of 100 story buildings, easiest boat ride (rediculously cheap!) Across on the Star ferry, stunning. Stunning. Stunning harbour.

Beautiful day and night!. Victoria Harbor is just beautiful! Hong Kong Island on one side, Kowloon on the other. LOTS of activity in the harbor including ferries, large cruise ships, old style junks, modern cargo transports, personal pleasure craft, harbor cruise ships of every size and style, etc etc. The skyline is awesome and though there is constant construction going on to reclaim more and more land, it does not seem to overwhelm the beauty. Take a walk around the waterfront in the day and enjoy the constantly changing traffic. At night Victoria Harbor plays center stage for the nightly 8PM Symphony of Lights show. Just enjoy!
Construction valley. Lots of developments and construction taking place. Still easy to get around and some great views from the harbour. Great place for a walk at night.

Best seen at night, but always something to see. The harbour is always bustling with ferry and ships and all sorts, which makes it an interesting place to come and watch. It is at night when it becomes really special, when it becomes a reflecting pool for the stunning skyline.
Light show was a must. Another experience in HK you have to do. Excellent chirography with the lighting, dont miss it if your in the area. The place is bustling with people, and entertainment.

An icon. First thing you see when in hk. Sooooo nice and lively. Too bad they closed the avenue of the stars.I wanted to see it!There is a nice square where you can Seat - a walk to see the view and the old clock

Victoria Habor Walk. This is a hot spot during the day and evening, especially fun on the weekends when there is live entertainment. Stroll along the waterfront in the day or evening to get great landscape views. Take time to visit the cultural center or museums too. In the evening you see the neon city lights surrounding the harbor. Great place for pictures.
A lot happening. There is a lot of activity of all kinds in the Harbour. You get to see it as you care travelling around from various angles.

Awesome. This is one of those sites on the Things to do list in HGK. Visit both in the day & at night as they are both interesting to see. At night of course is the light show, that we enjoyed but were under whelmed. The Harbor takes on a totally different aspect atnight.

Always something moving!. There is a lot of shipping coming and going from Victoria Harbour, of all shapes and sizes. Plenty to see as cruise ships, cargo ships, pleasure craft and ferries all use the harbour area.
You cannot miss it while in Hong Kong. Considering that the Victoria Harbour separate two main parts of Hong Kong - it impossible to miss. Take a Star Ferry and enjoy the view

Stunning Night View. It's wonderful to take the ferry and view the city across the famous harbour. And there is a big shopping mall and many nice restaurants just located near the pier in Tsim Sha Tsui.
Great attraction. Amazing city view. If you have a few nights to spend in Hong Kong, make sure you spend one somewhere near Victoria Harboyr.

Nice views at night with lighting. For a person visiting first time & never visited Shanghai or Singapore, it would appear good. But I have visited Pudong & The Bund regions in Shanghai & Merlion at Singapore which also has similar attraction but much much adorable than Hong Kong. However every thing has its own beauty. Victoria Harbour witnesses various sky scrapers most of which are occupied by large business groups like HSBC, CITI, AIA, Samsung, hotels & others. The view is good by the ocean. There is a musical & light show in the evening at 8 PM which one can visit & is free.

Wonderful to see at night. We stayed in a harbour view room at the Mandarin Oriental hotel and had superb views of the harbour by day and night. We also enjoyed views of the harbour whilst travelling on the Star Ferry to and from Kowloon. We were disappointed that the 8pm nightly light and laser show with music has been substantially downgraded compared to what we have enjoyed during previous visits to Hong Kong. Also the Avenue of the Stars promenade on the Kowloon side of the harbour is currently closed for refurbishment. A lot of land reclaimed in Central is still under development but they have constructed a big wheel ride that also gives nice harbour views.
Victoria Harbour HK. impressive view of the city. it's a great walk in between "water and land" still leaving you day dream aside the busy city behind

Best of Hong Kong. The views of Victoria harbour are superb and breath taking. Especially if you see during the night time. The lighting of the surrounding buildings offer a fantastic view. The symphony of lights show should not be missed.

Wonderfully busy, exciting waterway.. We viewed most of the harbour from our hotel room and the biz of this street of water is amazing.Casino cruise ships coming and going tower over the small fishing boats and the multitude of barges transporting all sorts of materials.A mass of small sail dingys (on weekend days I think) make for a wonderful scene.All in all this harbour merits it's iconic stature.
Adorable night view!. This would be the best place to see Hong Kong at night. the Symphony of Lights was amazing. Take your camera!

See it at night!!!!. If you go on the anniversary of the RPC in early October, get a room that overlooks the harbor so you can see the fireworks. This is a big deal in HK and many roads closed for this holiday. It's worth seeing.
see it. You should see the harbour, the atmoshere and all the vieatnamese on the sunday, talking to each other on there weekly free day.

Amazing Skyline. The night view of the Victoria Harbour is awesome. The skyline is a must see!
You wont want to miss this spot when you are in Hong Kong

nice fam holiday. we enjoy beautiful city night view. just to chill out, hang out around the area is just so nice. with so many things surrounding, never get bored just to be there. everytime visiting HK, this is a must point of visit our fam does.
One way to travel. Gorgeous place with huge variety of boats including Chinese junk. It is unique and just love it. The ferry is very cheap, not luxurious but functional.

Spectacular Light Show. Went on an evening cruise around the Victoria Harbour on a ferry type boat which had a free bar on board. The light show from the skyscrapers around the harbour are better seen from a boat and is not to be missed !

Bright and busy. The harbour bustles with a wide variety of activities and vessels. The sampans are picturesque against the backdrop of frenetic ferries and cargo ships. At night the harbour reflects amazing colours as Hong Kong lights up to dazzle visitors. Night and dinner cruises are available but the quality of the food is poor although there is s lot on offer. However, a boat is an ideal spot to see the harbour at night. Try going to the bar at the top of the Peninsula hotel for a spectacular view of the harbour day or night.
Amaizing. Woow, it was nice to be there, malls and sight seen all over around you. I will defenetly go there and take more and more pictures
Beautiful night view. Better go at night with buildings lighted up. Beautiful night view. However, the light show was nothing too amazing.

Stunning views. First thing we did was walk to the harbour on our first morning. View amazing. We quickly walked along the Avenue of Stars as it was very hot and 9 yr old was uncomfortable. Should definitely erect shade at this popular attraction and also disappointed not to see icecream/drink vendors - hugely missed opportunity. That said, we visited again in the evening to see the light show and experience the vibrancy of the harbour which is spectacular. The laser light show was a little disappointing and probably not needed as the lights on the buildings are colourful. A lovely evening walk.
Stunning. This world icon was a great place to spend time, both on the ferry and on the foreshore. The Hong Kong skyline from the Kowloon side is amazing.
Nice Place to visit. If you like site-seeing then you should visit here :) This is the largest harbour in China and here you can see different kinds of sea vessels; from small boat to Cruise ships :)

What a view. We went up the Peak by the tram. View of the harbour and the city from there is spectacular. However, the trams are very crowded which makes waits very long. In retrospect, maybe we should have gone there by bus.

A visual feast. Whether travelling across it on the Star Ferry or viewing it from Kowloon, the Island or the Peak, its an ever changing seaborne scenario and one that you can spend a lot of time just enjoying it.

Its nice to walk along. You can't avoid Victoria harbour in Hong Kong. It's pretty at night time and great to look down on from the peak. The ferries are every ten minutes and lots of night cruises available. Go down to the promenade and walk along it then ferry it... Such a big part of the city

amazing lights. walking around Victoria harbour is a lovely way to spend some time. At night the laser light show comes on at 8pm and is worth watching, very beautiful. The buildings light up and its awesome.

Victoria harbour & Jumbo. Part of a paid tour was a trip on Victoria harbour late afternoon/evening and saw the spectacular light show of all the buildings surrounding the harbour and later had a meal at Jumbo, (the worlds largest floating restaurant). would recommend this trip
The famous harbor. Not much to see, but with so much history behind this harbor - it's well worth a visit. You may view it from Tsim Sha Tsui or view it over the ferry.
Victoria Harbour. One of those places you have to see just to say you have seen it or been there - good idea to spend some time here

Fantastic Skyline - by day or better by night. Even if you're not an architect or a Skyscraper lover you'll be amazed by the view of the city from Victoria Harbour. Do it the cheap way by using the many ferries that criss-cross the harbour or do as we did and have a dinner cruise. We were there during Chinese New Year so had a spectacular Fireworks Display but every night there is a brilliant laser show using the background of the buildings around the harbour. Certainly something not to be missed.

Walk along the harbour area for atmosphere. There is always something happening when you're walking along Victoria Harbour...various junks, sampans and cruise liners all can be viewed very closely. Great atmosphere particularly when it' spark.

Time Running Fast. One of cool places in Hong Kong busy in morning and quite in the night and you will have nice time with good weather
The place organized nicely
Nice Touristic place. This is a place buzzing with activity. Very touristy. Had the opportunity to take a private boat ride. Nice place
Good scenic spot. Beautiful view of the Harbour. Quiet at night with occasional people walking around. You can enjoy the daily "laser show" at the harbour as well. Good scenic spots.
A Must in Hong Kong. Natural harbor between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Famous for its spectacular views, Victoria Harvour is a major tourist attraction.

Night Lights of Hong Kong. This is a must. Go by tram to the summit just before dusk and watch Hong Kong come alive with lights (commercial and residential) being switched on. It gives one a completely different view of the city.

well organized travel to the island around HK. It is really a great and organized harbour where you can obtain a ferry ride to any of the neighboring islands next to HK.
I went to LAMA island -- really small and pretty.
Lots of great seafood and local small store shopping.

As good a view as you will see anyplace in the world!. We spent five days in Kowloon and our hotel room faced Victoria Harbor. It is a spectacular view whether you are in a hotel room; walking along the harbor; or on a nearby mountain. One reason to visit Hong Kong or Kowloon would be for the wonderful views of the harbor and other attractions.

One of the Busiest Harbors in the World.. Best viewed from Kowloon? across from Hong Kong. I first thought I would like the Hong Kong skyline better then that of Shanghai. But Shanghai was more awe inspiring by far. "you can take the ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon across the harbor to get the best view of HK SAR (Special Autonomous Region). Another interesting thing is the HK Police are armed whereas the Shanghai police are largely unarmed.

Super beautiful view. I love HK so much tt I am intending to stay and work here for good next time! Came to HK twice on my own and the locals were generally quite friendly probably also cos I can speak cantonese so they tend to treat u better! But I must say first tt they have a reputation of being very rude to u if u only speak chinese to them! I had no problem finding my way around HK during the 2 times I was here by myself! With this lovely view to look at everyday, I am looking forward for tt day when I can stay here for good to come!
great harbour view. A must see attraction during the night time, you will enjoy the city view especially the symphony of lights.

Not a fan of shopping. I am not a fan of shopping but if you like it than you will love this place. If you go with someone make sure you don't lose sight of them or prearrange a meeting place because it could take you 2 years to find each other.
Always nice to see!. The harbor is such a bustling place, I always smile when there. I don't know why, but I just like being in the harbor on a start ferry, makes me happy!

Interesting to visit!!!. The easiest and most reasonable way to visit the Victoria Harbour is to take the #70 Bus from Exchange Square on Hong Kong island and get off at the Aberdeen Promenade stop. (10 stops). This is where there are several small Sampans who take tourists for a 30 minute ride all over the harbor. Cost is usually about HK$50 per person. Very interesting.
Light Spectacular. Beautiful and the night light laser show is fabulous - but you must get a good viewing spot. I visited here in 2009, but I'm sure it's even better now!

Super place... What a view.. Harbour is all & all a great place to visit..You can have an entire HK view from here..Ferry service also available from here to access other city points..You can hang around,have a boat ride,visit garden,Shopping in a mall..Also a parking point of Star cruise.

Views. The laser show was a big disappointment....we expected more. However great to get a ice cream cone from the truck that parks next to the road. Great views and wind down after a long day on your feet

Spectacular Vista!. Victoria Harbour is a sight to behold. Walk along the harbour or have a drink in one of the hotels lining the harbour, but linger and take a long drink of this spectacular view. Words can simply not describe. Highly recommended.
Very good veiw.. You walk or go feel it with a ferry ride, it is just great. Very good feel and one visiting Hong Kong for the first time must go .

Busy but worth the view. Could spend all day here if you wanted as there is shops etc. views are beautiful. Busy is an understatement. Waited an hour before we could even get in the tram up to the top.
Nice place. Loved this place we went there while on the Big Red bus trip very nice houses in the area Take your camera for some great shots
Beautiful. beautifull views of hong kong, a must visit if the weather is good and its a clear day. Good for families with children as well

Gorgeous!. This is an absolute "must-do" while in Hong Kong. Although there isn't a bad time of the day to go, evening shows the lights of Hong Kong light no other spot. Here you can see the world and all the beauty Hong Kong has to offer.
stunning. Great by day, better by night. No visit to HK is complete without a visit to Victoria Harbour especially during the evening light show!

Walking tour at night. One of the best night view in the world. Victoria Harbour is absolutely one of my best night view I have even seen. Millions of light bulbs shining the harbour making it a city that never sleeps. Walking in winter time is nice, weather is fantastic for walking around Tsim Sha Tsui and take a ferry to Central. But some points to make it slightly unattractive:1. Environmental: Didn't Hong Kong people think it a waste of energy for building such an illuminated city?2. Chinese: Don't want to say discrimination against Chinese, but there are really lots of impolite Chinese in Hong Kong. Great different from ten years ago. This city is being not that clear from before.
Light show is under expactation . Walking along the port is beautiful in the night but the light show is not so worthy. Especially too many tourists are there during summer vacation :(

too much land reclamation, it was better in old times. Has been much better 10 years ago. The massive land reclamation was a very big mistake and has made the harbour more narrow. But its still unique and best seen from the TST promenade and the Star Ferry
Family with young children. Very relaxing n cooling! Almost similiar like Marina Bay Promenede except for the lights from buildings around..
Pearl of the Orient. Take the ferry and cross the harbour; take tons of pictures. Victoria Harbour is one of the must see when you are in Hong Kong.

Hong Kon is a one off destination.... There are so many thing to see & do in Hong Kong. Firstly the mainland area of Kowloon & Nathan Rd Shopping & night bazaars. Then the Island itself Hong Kong, with Stanley Market, Tiger balm Gardens, Aberdeen etc. Obviously shopping is a big thing here. Travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong on the famous HK Ferries. Floating restaurants just an Education in all..

Incredible both on land and on boat!!. Victoria Harbour is the largest harbour in China and the third largest in the world, after San Francisco in the United States and Rio de Janeiro in Brazil. It's an incredible mix of urban development and natural mountainous terrain. Get on one of the Star Ferry 1 hour harbour cruises and soak up the views!
beautiful. beautiful view of Hong kong with great mall at the harbor. Very easy walking and we always felt safe
Historic and kinda quirky. A great way to explore the city without getting too tired. Try to get a good seat so you can really enjoy the view.

Views, views, Views! Get a high floor in the hotel to see the views.. This is a great area to stay in. As a westerner, you are very welcome, and the people and shopkeepers will let you know it! There are a lot of great hotels nearby, and still close enough to walk to many restaurants.

Best sight in Hong Kong. It is a must visit destination in the evening. It is just a walking distance from city center Tsim Tsa Tsui. Beatiful place to take photographs and capture your Hong Kong Memory.
evening destination. the evening view is amazing. you can while away time just by looking at the lights and enjoy the sea breeze.

Stellar Skyline. Victoria Harbor is gorgeous. It is surrounded by all the iconic buildings on the Kowloon side as well as the Hong Kong island side that make the skyline, especially at night, famous throughout the world. All the buildings light up at night. Look for I.M. Pei's Bank of China Tower that was inspired by bamboo. You'll be able to identify it with the large Xs.
Incredible views! . Definitely one to do in the early evening - it's cooler, and also the view is much more impressive! Definitely worth a wander along the avenue of the stars.
Day or Night, this place is impressive!. Don't miss the nightly 30-minute laser light show - grab a seat early right on the water. This world famous harbor is a scenic delight to the senses.

The best night view in the world. I would say the night view of the Victoria Harbour is the best, especially from the Kowloon side. You will be amazed by the lights of the office towers and commercial buildings, the laser show at 8pm, the boats and ferries in the Harbour.
