Stroll, find a seat in the Promenade when you are tired, stay away from your electronic devices on hand, this is real beauty in front of you.

Beautiful and Memorable Victoria Harbour. There was a laser show at night .The view in harbor was very beautiful at night with buildings surrounded by skyscrapers and lights the lamp. There was a free music performances and by paying a little money many stalls photographer can take pictures with a good angle.

Great walk and lovely view of the skyline at nights. It's a perfect place for relaxing and having a walk. I did not know that there was a symphony of lights at the time I visited; however, it was a pleasant surprise.
It's also a beautiful view both in the day and at nights.
Awesome!. Loving this place when I return to HK yearly. Best to go in the night and enjoy the breeze, taking in the sights & lights from the skyline.

Nice iceland. It is a nice island. if you are in Hong Kong you must visit. The view of the tall skyscrapers is awesome. but it's THE place from which to admire the HK skyline. It's most enjoyable at sunset

This is a buzzing area!. I love the ferry trips from this Harbour and then you get to see some great views of Hong Kong.
If you walk around there are some very interesting places like the Maritime Museum and a wonderful place for eats called Cafe 8.

Nigth. The harbour is at its best a night when lit up. It is a busy place in the day.
With the ongoing reclaiming of land for development, it does appear to be shrinking!

Spectacular. I believe the view is better from the Kowloon side looking across to the Island. You need to be on the promenade for 8.00pm to view the light show- really special. Better yet, view it from a junk boat. Really special

"It is free, just show up". The last night we spent in Hong Kong we went to the light show in Victoria Harbour. It lasted about 15 minutes. High rise buildings had laser lights beaming across the sky, some boats, junks, cruise ships were beautiful lit up with their lights glowing. Many people had come to see the show. It was thrilling. As I recall, this happened around 9 PM. Our group walked to the area from our hotel (Shangri-La) because it was close to the event. Go a little early so that you can get a place near the water's edge. There is a metal railing that you can lean on if there is space. Take your camera! Wear comfortable shoes.
Harbour Night time Spectacle!. Best seen at night this modern, spectacular harbour is a credit to Hong Kong - romantic and well worth the viewing!

Crowd watching has never been so much fun. Great place to hang out and watch the boats and people go pass. Grab an icecream from the icecream truck outside the Star Ferry terminal...enjoy the performers, music and lights from the light show, enjoy a walk along the waterfront...amazing views back over towards Hong Kong city. Not to be missed.
must visit!. the tram experience is a must. You feel as if the whole of HK is in front of you. Lot of things to munch and places to ship as well.

A Very Nice "Free" Attraction. The harbor area is a great place to enjoy the views and people watch. It is all open and free so it is a nice place to stroll and enjoy the views of the harbour. A must see while in Hong Kong.

Never enough. Lack of the soul nowadays! Pity :(
But enjoy it, it is still one of the best around the world.
nice music and light show. Make sure you see the symphony of lights in the evening. Its great and just love it. THe music together with the lights and all the people. Nice.
Victoria harbour.. Victoria harbour blends old and new style in Hkg. Wonderful for kids too. Loads to see. Clean and busy too.

Never Grow Weary Of HK Harbor. Mainly, stay in Kowloon, not HK Island. It's HK Island that's so bright and gorgeous, not Kowloon, but you can't see it from the island. I always stay in the same hotel near the harbor, about a 10 minute walk northeast, close to so many things. Heading away from the harbor are busy working people neighborhoods, lively and fun. I'll go to HK on a bet, anytime I can--can't go wrong.

A great panaromic view of Hong Kong. Alight at the Tsim Sha Tsui metro station and take exit J which will take you to this place. It's a must watch when you go to Hong Kong. The view of the tall skyscrapers is awesome. Reach there by 5.30 which will give you a view of the landscape during day time and also the night view. Don't forget to carry your tripod
Ride the ferry. It was fun riding a ferry in Victoria Harbor. Great skyline, glittering buildings, awesome light shows and easy ride.

It's possibly what drew you to HK. Take a ferry or just a stroll around either HK island or Kowloon, day or night to see what all the travel picture are luring you here for in the first place. Either skyline can disappear with haze or clouds so good luck and if you can't get a good photo, buy a postcard.

Xiang Gang - fragrant harbour. In Chinese, Hong Kong means 'fragrant harbour'. Ok, a 'fragrant harbour Victoria Harbour is not or no longer, but it's THE place from which to admire the HK skyline. It's most enjoyable at sunset, when taking the Star Ferry from TST to Central or vice versa. I always like to take my daughter across at that time... Also enjoyable is the Symphony of Lights laser lights show every evening at 8 p.m..... which is best to view from the TST harbourside promenade....
too good place for shopping. great deals all year long for shopping for you and your loved once discount sales all year long......

Enjoy the sunset at Victoria Harbour . As per our friends the best time to visit Victoria Harbour is in the evening. When I asked why, they said go and try. We did in the following weekend and not to mention it was one of the best experience in HK. A ferry trip from Kowloon to Central in the evening helped us to get the full view of the harbour and the sunset. Further the evening light show was another fantastic experience.

A great place to stroll and take your time. The walk by the bay was great, its very long and well kept, its clean and is not too busy, lots of little stops for snacks and coffee with great view of the harbour all the way along the waterfront.
A joy at sunset!. Well worth seeing, especially at sunset! This is a beautiful natural harbour - but see it while you can! It is being steadily reclaimed!
well worth a visit. Spectacular views and a great cable car ride up there. It's definitely worth taking the trip. We did an island tour so cable car only on the way up and tour bus on the way down.
Visitor. Great area to be in, very easily blend in the local crowds, though very packed with Filipinos which is a big minus like they have taken over the city of HK!

The Best view of Harbour. The Best Place to see Sunset in Hong Kong and the music and light show that follows it.Located in Kowloon Island you also can take a ferry to reach the other end of Harbour and explore the Hong Kong Island.

A must when you visit Hong Kong. I travelled backwards and forwards across Victoria Harbour on The Star Ferry several times while I was in Hong Kong and also took a harbour cruise (part of the Big Bus tour package) and I love it - the views of the city and Kowloon are fabulous from the water. This time I only did day time trips but I have done a night time cruise to watch the Symphony of Lights on previous visits to Hong Kong and that is spectacular.
Iconic Skyline. This is the place to see the famous Hong Kong skyline for Free. I recommend the view from the Avenue of the Stars.

Major Tourist attraction. Famous for its stunning panoramic views, the Victoria Harbour is a major tourist attraction of Hong Kong. It is situated between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.You can admire such iconic buildings as the Bank of China, HSBC Building, the Convention Center or the IFC Two Tower. There are many options to let you enjoy Victoria Harbour.A place to see absolutely
Avenue of the star + Symphony of the light. A very good skylibe of Hong Kong, we can enjoy from this harbour, but the symphony of the light is so so compare to the one in Singapore
Great!. My wife and i enjoyed our stay in Hong Kong. The people were very friendly and accomodating. We will be back.

Very interesting place to see and the Park is just next door. Interesting to see all leisure boats and boats where people actually live. It's surrounded by a lovely park where lots of activities take place

Great view to the city skyline!. Hong Kong is just amazing; the combination of the local with foreign culture make you feel in a real modern city. From Victoria Harbour you can find all the options for dining, transportation including the ferries and ground options and shopping, you always want to come back to Hong Kong!
Great place to spend some time. This district of the city is good shopping and as a sightseeing location. Lots of bartering going on.

View changes every minute. My room at my friends apartment looks over the harbour. The view changes every minute the harbour never rests. The most exciting thing iis to go from Hong Kong island over to Kowloon on the Star Ferry. Amazing
A beauty Itself !. The Victoria harbor is an amazing view from any observatory deck. The lights and the feel is just something you can miss when you are in Hong kong.

Bright lights and sunny days. Victoria Harbour is very modern with large skyscraper like buildings, but a must to do in HK. The harbour has a great view of the city and is very bustling during the peak hours of the day.
Amazing view. If you take the Star Ferry at night across from Kowloon to HK Island it presents a fantastic neon cityscape.
Still Best in The World. A must to see the fire work at night at 8:pm and taking the Star Ferry crossing the Harbor.Then MTR to Yau Ma Tei Temple Street. Be careful do not try the food there.
Just another tourist attraction. Nothing to shout about. Sweltering hot summer August sun wouldn't be good for the faint hearted. Spent 10mins for the mundane photo ops, then I got bored.

A lively experience indeed. The place is very energetic and vibrant. It is best to avoid the area during peak hours as it would not be that easy to soak in the atmosphere. Looks the most beautiful at nights. The whole of the city can be viewed from the harbour.
An icon in the island. Cuts back the travelling time and liked it more at night with all the lights on. The city of Hong Kong can be viewed easily from the harbour
Can be your self. The best place I love so much. Here you can be happy to see the harbor and energic city, mix culture.
back to past. love the walk at the "star walk" however, expect a lot of tourist there. avoid to visit at peak hour to have a better experience.
Buzzing. Very exciting and full of life. Plenty of shops, restaurants and bars, but it's fun just to walk around.

Impressive. The cosmopolitan international city of Hong Kong is a busy and crowded city but it is also a city where I could drift away in thought from enjoying the impressive view; skyline of Victoria Harbour. It is definitely a place that you should visit when you are in Hong Kong.

Takes me back to Bruce Lee and Jackie Chan movies. The harbour was always the shot the film makers showed to represent Hong Kong. Omits own righT the skyline views are impressive, the symphony of light show is pathetic but as it is free what to expect Dubai has a better offering in their water fountain show. The harbour also has live music playing the background in the evening. The views at night are amazing and a testimony to the architectural accomplishments of man and a predecessor the the construction work going on in the Middle East. Respect!
Great place and perfect stopover. Love Hong Kong. Fantastic mix of Eastern and Western cultures. Great place for all sorts of restaurants for any budget. Good variety of entertainment and shopping.

Hong Kong!!. Las Vegas is a city of twenty four hour activity. Hong Kong and Victoria Harbour can certainly compete with that. Whether it is all night bars or sights seen only, here one is never bored. I enjoy gobbling up noodles at street vendors or trying what is termed as an " American Breakfast". Don't look for chicken fried steak and eggs with country gravy. I did find a place to enjoy fried rice with poached eggs though!

Shouldn't be missed. Well, if you didn't visit Victoria Harbor, then you have never been too Hong Kong. Take a walk at the seashore next to Hong Kong Art Museum or start from Hung Hom station / Tsim Sha Tsui East, then walk along to water front till star ferry pier to take the ferry.

This is a nice area to relax in with great views of the bay and the island. Victoria Harbour is easy to reach from anywhere near Nathan Road and has a great arrangement of walkways above the ground as well as along the harbour front. Unfortunately it rained off and on during my short stay in Hong Kong and I couldn't get the brightest photos but I hope I managed to at least give people the an idea of the feel of the area. The Star Ferry - a Hong Kong tradition leaves from this harbour to the island regularly through the day.

Beautiful View from the City!!!. i went to victoria harbour with my boyfriend after came back from a whole day apple tour ( well unfortunately My bf's mac was broken and we spent almost 5 hour at the apple store retail to find the issue)so we are going there to see the view and the ferry, the view is really look beautiful it is the good place if you want to enjoying the city view, sitting, relaxing while watching the ferry with pretty colourful light from the skyscraper building

A Must...... A nice experience, visiting the harbor at night its something that you should do for sure. There is a very popular light show (that's nothing special) but the views of the city glowing its something unique. If you can afford it, taking a boat dinner might be a good experience as well but if you are in a budget you can easily take one of the many ferries to go around the bay taking unique pictures. For me, it was such a great place that I visited both during the day and night. A true must...!

Great from all angles. I experienced the Harbour from both sides and it is equally impressive. At night, viewing from the TST side, the buildings on the Central side of the Harbour are spectacuarly lit up.The 8pm light show was a little disappointing, but during the day a walk along the harbour is to be recommended.

Stunning views from every angle.. I stayed in Hong Kong for 7 weeks and didn't get bored of the harbour. Great views from either side, and from the water!I sat and stared for hours - it's beautiful. Try a cruise around the harbour - you won't regret it.
Stunning. Really worthwhile making the effort to go down to the harbor at night. Not for the light show, as that is a bit disappointing, but for the sheer beauty of Hong Kong at night on the water.
love the walk arround !1. Great shopping and touristic , get a few trips on the ferry , different ferries different directions the best way to discover HongKong !!

A must-go when around. One important thing is to define what Victoria Harbour means. It is the small narrow harbour between Kowloon Peninsula and Hong Kong Island but not the coastal strips along it. To have a good view of it, the best ways are (i) to go up Victoria Peak on Hong Kong Island on a sunny day or at night when it is neither raining nor misty and watch the harbour below among lights on both sides of the harbour or (ii) to have a ride on a ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central after some meal or shopping on a sunny day. The night scenary of this harbour is world-class in every respect and far exceeds what you can see in Paris or Hokkaido at night. Taking some other cross-harbour route by ferry or a ride on a private launch will be 2 other options, but you will be either missing quite a lot or some key focal points. Amateur photographers will find the night scenary really good subject for a few shots, too.
Victoria, a place worth of seeing. A symbol of HK ... charming and romantic. Either visit during the day or in the evening, it brings you a most attractive impression on HK.

A MUST SEE while in Hong Kong. I recommend seeing Victoria Harbour after dark to get the full benefit. Check out the Bruce Lee statue. People watch. There are several nice restaurants in the vicinity.

Amazing place to see the Hong Kong Skyline and more. The area around the harbour is a great place to shop and dine and just a few minutes walk will bring you to Kowloon Park where you can enjoy a moments respite from all the activity. There is in fact everything for a full days visit, you can shop, dine and watch the Ferries and boats come and go and of course the Skyline of Hong Kong Island. Nice safe place to visit and loads to do and see.
Pretty view of the city. I have to tell that Victoria Harbour was one of the best places in Hong Kong! I loved it!!! During the night you can enjoy the lights show, beautiful!!!

Wander along the harbour. Very busy waterfront walk, always busy with constant movement of boats. Ferry across to experience all of Hong Kong ! Stay at the Kowloon Shangri La for most spectacular harbour views!
Nice Night View. Good place for night walking and enjoy the night scene in Hong Kong island. It was beautiful place when all the lights on during night time. City that never sleeps!
Busy. One of the busiest ports I have seen, and I have seen many. It is vibrant, interesting and is now clean.

Wonderful laser lighting show 3D. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hn04O3QjpSgcopy and paste the above link to know more how wonderful it is of the show.I think they will have this laser show from time to time in hk or other part in the world. It was great experience to watch this with the music in the sence.You know the history of hk from this laser show as well. Dont miss if they show it next time in your city.

Bustling and Scenic Views. The harbour is bustling, always amazes me just how much traffic passes along through the day and into the evening, with so much business and tourism on the go!The most beautiful sight though has to be the nightly light show, which is spectacular from any viewpoint, but even if you miss it, any view across the harbour towards the lit-up buildings is an impressive sight, and makes for fantastic photographs too!
Lovely sight, pleasant vibe but a bit crowded. Nice temporary stop for the shopping weary. but a bit disconcerting if you're trying to avoid the crowd.
Lovely Victoria. A walk around the victoria harbour, is fabulous, with the view of Hong Kong island and the skyscrapers.
Best at night. Do whatever you can to see the harbour area at night when the city lights and night light show is on. Take the tram up the big hill or go to a restaurant on a high floor of a hotel.

Doesn't get more iconic than this. This is Hong Kong. It would be impossible to visit Hong Kong and not experience the harbor. Even when the weather is bad the skyline on both sides is impressive. Especially at night!

HARBOUR VIEWS. This is truelly a beatiful city with its tall building and then the Harbour and the Cruises and Floating Restaurants. To see it at night is beautiful you must...Hop On Hop Off Bus also includes this in a night tour so worth it.

Beautiful lights. Go at night and enjoy the night lights of Hong Kong. I still remember the first time seeing this beautiful harbour. WOW! THIS IS VICTORIA HARBOUR! I can remember the number of times I've seen it on TVB shows when I was little. Always come here and check out the lights whenever I'm in Hong kong. It's just nice to walk around. Avoid the Chinese mainlanders.
Harbour. Its a harbour view and one will find boats and ferries all over. These are small shops also. The view surrounds ocean and mountains whish give a very pleasant feeling.

MUST VISIT PLACE WHILE IN HONG KONG. If you have not visited Victoria Harbour, you have certainly not visited Hong Kong!Worth visiting, especially after its dark in the evening.Light & Sound Show is never to be missed. It starts at 8 PM every evening, and its duration is around 12-13 minutes.Several boat rides are available which offer around 1 hour trip around the harbour area. One can opt for food & drink aboard.Several photographers and portrait sketchers are available around the area, and they are worth trying.

One Special Body of Water. Whether viewed from Victoria Peak or some other high in the sky location, you will appreciate its beauty in addition to its practical utility. Cruise ships, sailboats, junks, and ferries sail by frequently. If you possibly can, get a room with a view.

Very well positioned haven in Hong Kong !. In those first two days, on our 12 days long visit to far east countries, our guide had led us to this remarkable port in Hong Kong. It is located in the very southern tip of the Hong Kong's inland, with view across, toward the Hong Kong Island. Otherwise, it is clinched between the Kowloon, in the main land of Hong Kong and the waters of the sea passage, that separates the Hong Kong Island from the rest. And of course the nearness of South China Sea ,even more makes this geographical position, strategic one. Such condition was profited in the full measure by British government in its new colony. Beside the last mentioned, with the passing of time, Hong Kong was becoming more and more, one very important trading center, in this part of the world.We had been showed, the second night of our sojourn in Hong Kong, the magnificent light show of the blinkering and wavering blurbs, that moved from the top to the bottom and in the opposite way, along the skyscrapers, that were across the dark masses of waters, on the Hong Kong island. That's what is called the Hong Kong Skyline. No one, during his visit, miss such feast of lights and sounds, followed by excited wows of numerous tourists and natives as well. Here, in this harbor, we, the people from all over the world, are the witnesses of everlasting struggle for the land in such narrow straight, that also affects the natural surroundings and habitats, and water quality as well.Unforgettable evening, it was, there in Hong Kong Port !

Amazing !!. Victoria Harbour is spectacular. The beautiful lights reflecting of the cruise liners and also other ships. We were lucky enough to be able to view this beautiful harbour from our room on the 61st floor of our hotel. This harbour is beautiful.

Must place visit with good view of the harbour. Must visit place in HK. Good view of the harbour, and some of the more iconic HK buildings. Has a light show and any fireworks display can be clearly seen here.

Who has this Skyline. The skyline of HK is a monument to mans ability to build. During the night with all the lights flashing, the view from any part of HK is spectacular. HK may be a concrete jungle, but it will be the most breath-taking one you ever saw.
Must do. A walk around the Victoria Harbour is a must. The views of boats and the skyline at night is simply amazing. Make sure to go there after the sunset.

Not much too see.... I expected better, there was not much to see at Victoria Harbour. We saw a couple of ships but nothing spectacular. There are far better places to see this beautiful cities great skyline.

Pleasing walk. I went out to walk this route early before the sun was high and hot. There are boats to watch and you see the ferry boats moving travelers to other Islands. There is an "Avenue of Stars" devoted to Hong Kong cinema throughout the years. This is similar to the walk of fame in Hollywood. There are life size bronze statues of Bruce Lee and camera crews and a director. It was a nice morning walk.

Stunning view!. Victoria Harbour is bordered by skyscrapers either side which are covered in huge neon advertisements that light up like Vegas at night, making a stunning view. Must be viewed at night - see the laser show at 8pm or take a cruise. Or do as we did and go up to the 118th floor of the Ritz Carlton Hotel on the Kowloon side and go to the Ozone bar to enjoy this iconic view. You will not be disappointed!

One of the harbours in the world. Every year there appears to be more land and less harbour, but still spectacular, ride it on the Star Ferry, go to the Kowllon side and watch the cruise liners , enjoy the skyline

To Truly Understand Hong Kong. Hong Kong consists of three regions: Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and the New Territories. To understand Hong Kong's economic, financial, and geopolitical importance, you must first start with Victoria Harbour.
Relaxing, Nice View, Must See. I like to take ferry across harbour, nice view, very relaxing, it would be a nice walk around the Tsim Sha Tsui and Hong Kong Island near the harbour ferry.

Just Amazing!. Victoria Harbour is situated between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon Peninsula and is the largest bay in Hong Kong and certainly one of the largest in the world. It’s a very busy harbour with ferries of all types and other vessel traversing its length and breadth on a daily basis. Sailing on the harbour in itself is an amazing experience, especially when done on the Star Ferry. Looking at the Hong Kong Island coastline from the Bay is also incredible. One simply cannot visit Hong Kong without having visited Victoria Harbour.
Cleanliness. Beautiful place to be at night, for the laser display. Very clean area and not like some harbours I have seen

Beautiful. Well.. what's not to like. Having spent so much time in HK I still don't get sick of the Victoria Harbour! It's more pretty looking back from the Kowloon side, but being on the HK Island side is also nice.. definitely worth it to find a roof top bar somewhere and just enjoy the view with a drink!
Unbreakable part of HK. Harbor is part of famous HK View therefore worth to visit this place. Always busy and always different.
A view to see. Also a very famous place of the city. Provides a full view of the Geat China Sea. A very quiet place with clear waters and no noisy sea.
Great harbour. Never a dull moment to look at this great harbour, love every single thing about it and it doesn't matter when you look at it, it's always lovely to look at!
Light show same on land and sea. The light show we saw from a cruise/dinner and also from land on another day. It was the same whichever you choose. Neon at night is very magical.
a place for evening time pass. a place one can leisurely seat & see the sunset or high rise buildings or boats in the water. avenue of stars is also situated here.

Brilliant day or night. Perhaps the best and cheapest thing to do in Hong Kong - catch the Star Ferry in either direction to Kowloon or the Island. Fantastic views either day or night with a spray of sea-water on your face to enhance the trip! The ferry rocks a little, but you would have to be very delicate to become sea-sick as it only a short, but wonderful, ride.
what a view. This is a busy harbour but have a drink sit on the walkway at TST and watch the activity. Its one of the busiest harbours in the world

signature for HK. it's a must visit place for everyone to HK. and it deserves the compliments all over the world. usually, we will enjoy the view from Kowloon side i/o central. but another time, I overlooked from Wanchai, the view is also amazing.
First Official Visit in HK. There are so many beautiful scenery in Victoria Harbour especially in the night. lots of people enjoying here in this place.
Must See. There is only one word to describe Hong Kong: WOW! Come and see the Victoria Harbour just by walking and enjoying the view. Truly a magnificent city.
Beautiful in the night. Visit while in the night as u can see the lighted buildings at the victoria harbour. One of the places must visit at least once if you have not been before.

Remains beautiful.. The harbour in Hong Kong remains beautiful throughout the years.
While taking a cruise in the harbour during the day is lovely, see if you could manage to get an evening cruise, as the atmosphere on both banks is absolutely magical.

Best in Hongkong. Victoria harbour and the walk back through Canton road to Our hotel on Austin road was our highlight of the visit.The harbour in the evening is amazing . With the skyline so impressive, Hongkong Island on the opposite side just stands out for its wonder! The light and sound show in the evening is a little over rated...though.But overall ...wow!
Interesting busy harbour.. Busy and efficient harbour, easy to get round and very user friendly. A must when visiting Hong Kong. Beautiful sights from cruise ship
Very Scenic. I don't know what there to really say about the harbour other than it is very scenic.It doesn't seem to matter where you are, anytime you can see the harbour it will always look nice.
Pre Cruise stay. Our hotel overlooked the harbour so we didn't even have to walk anywhere to see these sights. The light show on the skyscrapers in the evening is fabulous!

Wonderful. Spent every night of my Hong Kong holiday here. Got 5 professional photos for $200 HK $. Found a nice bar for a couple of beers. Awesome light show at 8pm each night. Also an avenue of stars with the likes of Jackie Chan, Jet Li & Bruce Lee. Joined in the dancing with locals. Whiling the hours away drinking with people I met from all parts of world while being entertained by many buskers. Loved the atmosphere & area.
Interesting place for shopping. It is great place to visit. Take the tube from airport and can reach directly there. Summer time can be very humid but still advise a visit..
Stunning. Is there another harbour in the world like this ? The best way to see it, unless you take a tour, is from the Star Ferry.
Brand Shopping. Best place for Brand shopping. You will be amazed to see all the world best brand here at 1 place. But there may be que to get into these store.

Nice Photo Spot. I think this is a great spot to have some scenic photos of the tall buildings across at the Hong Kong Island.
At 8pm there is Symphony of Lights show.

What is there not to like.. My family and I came here several years ago(actually Dec 2013) around the Christmas holiday during the day time(did not come at night) I wanted to revisit this place after departed HK years ago. Across the bay, a lot things have changed, more taller buildings than before and the place is a bit smoggy. We strolled along the pier and visited the Avenue of Star then hopped on the memorable ferry for a small fee and cross the bay from Kowloon to HK side(ride is about 10min) to ride the famous cable car. I enjoyed the ferry and cable car ride. It brings back a lot of memory. Anyway, go to the harbor and catch a ferry, its a good experience.Note: The Star cruise ship docked at one of the pier closed to the harbor.

Victoria Harbour. Good place to go to for the shops and the boats. Also pick up the ferries here. A lot of walking though, hence the very good rather than excellent. The choice of shops etc. very good, worth a visit during your Hong Kong trip
Gorgeous!. What a beautiful spot to just relax and watch the boats go by while watching the blinking lights of the towers on the opposite side of the harbor!Dont miss it.

Spectacular light show. We took the ferry across to Kowloon to view the evening light show on the Hong Kong buildings that is set to music. It was awesome. Our hotel was right by the Harbour and the views were great.
Magic evening lights. Beautiful lights every night. take a stroll along the foreshore at Tsim Sha Tsui and have dinner locally.

This really is Hong Kong. . So much to see and do. The harbour is the gate way to the surrounding islands and is a much nicer way to get around. Ferris are quick and cheap. Kowloon side has many great museums along the harbour or very close by. My two young boys loved the harbour. Take your time to explore and check out the sits or find somewhere to sit and eat and people watch.
Ferry trip. Nice to take a ferry to across the harbour. In 5 minutes commute, you can view both sides in one trip. If it is not enough, go on board one more time. The fare is cheap.

Cool area!. A great tourist attraction in Hong Kong. We took a boat over and back. Just a really cool way to see the area and a different way to get around. It's very cheap too, so if you're there I would check the area out and take a ferry across and back.
Pleasant Harbour!. A memorable experience to be at Victoria Harbour especially at night with a clear view of lighted Hong Kong skyline!

Great View. Take the Star Ferry from either Hong Kong Island across to Kowloon and get a good view of Victoria Harbour. Walk along Avenue of Stars in the evening and enjoy the lights around the harbour.

Worth a visit during a the lighting show. This is one of Hong kongs main attraction. I highly recommend it to anyone who is visiting Hong Kong the lighting show starts at 8pm most evenings and last for about 15mins. I suggest you get there a little early due to the crowds of tourists coming I from main land China to see this attraction. The harbour is also a great visit during the day where you can jump on the star ferry to visit Hong Kong Island and is a must when visiting Hong Kong.

Hong Kong a must pace to visit. I lived in HK for 5 years + spent many more years travelling too and from the UK on business HK -- incredible place -- from shopping to country side -- to food -- to beaches Plan to return one day -- it is probably my number one destination
Wonderful view. The best view if you want to see buildings, ferries, boats and etc. It's best if you go at night where you can see building lit up with colorful display.
Lots to see. We only had a couple of days to take the most sights in so we were not able to see everything along the harbour but what we did see was all very clean and tidy.

A great waterway. We did a harbour cruise which took about 1 hour. The harbour was very interesting although it was disappointing to see so much rubbish in the water. It's definitely worth doing a harbour cruise.
Victoria Harbour. super dowtown palce...take a walk here n u also get many eat out joints here...absolute pleasure of HK

One of the best skyline in the world is there!. Here you can enjoy one of the best skylines in the world, i suggest to go at 20:00 when a laser and music show make the skyline a real attraction in Hong Kong
Could not get over how clean the water is. Please note that the water quality looks amazing and clean and the views from the ferry over water make for many photo oppurtunities

Inevitable to pass by while in HK. Pretty cool as a whole. Nice views of the city from both sides of the harbour. Water looks pretty clean too - nice to know that its the deepest natural harbour in the world, allows you to look at it with different eyes while there.Scenery on it is great. Boats going past and all that. Remember that the Symphony of Lights plays here, make sure not to miss it like I did!

A STUNNING VIEW. The bay is still enchanting, buildings, ships and all the landscape will conquer you. I'm not a fan of modern cities, but HK is really something! The skyline is astonishing and the harbour worth a visit.
Beautiful View of the skyline. Must go place for anyone who visits HK. Go to Avenue of Stars and get up close with the statue of Bruce Lee and explore TST.

You have to see it.... It is fun to see the contrast between the old Chinese junks and yachts, and get a view of the harbor. You can hop on a boat for a couple of dollars, and see the moored boats up close. Great views!

Beautiful view from the mall. Blue waters, tall buildings, boats on the sun lit water. What a view. Loved it and took a few pics of the scenic beauty around the harbour... The harbour shore was so busy with so much to do and nice eateries.
Fast Way to Cross. Incredibly busy water crossing with lots of great city views from the ferry. Takes about 10 minutes to cross. A good experience and easy way to cross over.
Unique Scenery. This is chaos - but beautiful. Not like anything we see in the US. People living on boats with a backdrop of very tall buildings.
Fast ride from the island to the mainland.. A bustling harbour with a very frequent ferry service from the island to the mainland, so much shopping on both side and only 10 mins for the trip across.
Stunning for Symphony of Lights. I've been here for two months now and the Victoria Harbour still amazes me. It's wonderful to watch the Symphony of Lights from, which run at 8pm every night!
One of the Great City's of the world. One of the great cities of the world. Never stop. Great during the day even better at night. At 8pm they have a laser night show a must see.

beautiful harbour. Such a beautiful harbor. A view you will never forget. Best to see from Kowloon side. Pretty in the day but spectacular at night. This should be on everyones bucket list as a must see in your lifetime!
Firework in Victoria Harbour. Firework show in.Victoria Harbour is stunning and impressive. Only twice in H K, chinese new year and Oct 1. Find a best location to secure colourful firework show.

Any time it's beautiful, but evening is better.... Walk around here and you will find many people are here for a common purpose. Viewing the scene.
It is always beautiful, any time of the day, but in the evening, it is much better. View the skyline and the glittering lights on the buildings. Fascinating
Superb. Victoria harbor is superb, we enjoyed looking at the skyline and surrounding areas of the harbor. Also the water looks clean.
Must go in Hong Kong. Very nice slight seeing. The view from either side of harbour is excellent. Better to arrive before 8pm to see the combined music and laser show that last for around 15 minutes.

Niche Harbour.. Very scenic and natural.This place is memorable because of the history and the people who went by.When photographed from above this place is astounding.When in Hong Kong a must see place.

Excellent place for seightseeing, shopping etc. Victoria harbour is a famous place for shopping, seightseeing, walking around and get in touch with the HK spirit. In the evening you also can enjoy the symphony of lights... great laser show... Excellent place to be to get a real impression of HK.
Iconic Place in Hong Kong but not excited. This place is just a place nothing exciting. View from here was fantastic, just visit this place when ever possible.
Wonderful view. This is Hong Kong. Such as great view and the harbor is just lovely. Loads of people around but that's not a problem when there. Take the Star Ferry across to the island.
Beautiful. It's a beautiful place, one of the best harbours in the world, great skyline and the highlight is watching the symphony of lights show across it.

if you like crowds, go there. first you queue to buy a ticket, then you queue to get on the Peak Train, then you queue to get a drink, then more queueing at the look outs to snap a photo and finally you queue to get your ticket checked before you queue to get on a tram back down the hill. It is a great way to loose weight on a hot day without doing any exercise. Best time for optimum queueing is around lunch time.

Beautiful sight - from all over the city. I was amazed at how beautiful Victoria Harbor was and how you can literally see it from all over the city. Enjoyed taking the Star Ferry across the harbor from Central to Kowloon and back. Loved viewing the harbor from the Peak. It's just so unexpected to have this amazing harbor next to these crazy skyscrapers!

Great at Night!. Many reviewers have already commented on the spectacular light show - words cannot describe the brilliance of seeing such a spectacle. Victoria harbour is one of those places you must visit in your lifetime, we all see it on the TV but to actually go there certainly is a highlight.Some may not be too impressed but I am and have been there many times!
Amazing. So much to see and do especially at night. You can't miss this spot as you travel to and from the different sides of Hong Kong
I thought it would be better. I thought it would be better. I did not like it that much. I enjoyed more having a drink at a hotel and watching the harbor from top.
Awesome. The view from both harbours are spectacular! Especially at night where they have symphony of lights show from 8 pm to 8:15 pm.

Worth that extra. The good thing is, that the harbour can be enjoyed in so many different ways. Stroll along on both sides. Take a ferry across. Enjoy the light and sound show in the evening. Sit with coffee or a drink and watch the dragon boats drifting slowly on the water. Or just watch it from your hotel room - it's worth spending that extra amount for harbour view.

Only on a clear day...... Yes there is a lovely view of the city from the walk leaving the mini-city at the top of the funicular. Watch for dogs and their business.... Try to pick a clear day - when it is cloudy there is not much to see.

Dazzling Harbour.. No end of praise can be heaped on this expansive location. Whether viewed from Kowloon or the Island, it is a delight and when night approaches, the lights coming on the atmosphere builds to the eventual Symphony of Lights at 8.00. HK has provided excellent promenades along which there are often beneficial pastimes such as the Avenue of Stars. Best way of taking in the Harbour is a boat cruise and the Star Ferry provides a very affordable option. The Harbour is always alive with traffic and many visitors are content to simply watch and once in a while may strike an Ocean Liner.

Its beautiful to see. Reach at late afternoon and wait till it gets dark.. to see the amazing skyline.. Avernues of stars etc.is all very nice and you can spend atleast a good couple of evenings on teh shores of teh harbour
Good. Was there on Christmas eve. Crowed as expected . The laser show was just fine (could have been nicer).. visit for the ambience and the view across the harbor just as the sun downs

Touring Victoria Harbour. Had a short tour of the harbor and it was quite interesting to see how some lived and fished on the small boats. Also got to see some quite large and expensive cabin cruisers (worth millions $$) that were docked in the harbor.

Great View!. We walked around the harbour after we got off from the Star ferry. The walk was long with no shades and it was during a hot summer day. The displays along the harbour was worth it until we saw Bruce Lee's statue!

Great view. I love this place, it offers such a great view of the city. Unfortunately for me it just happened to be a cold day ( bad day for shorts ). Another drawback is that everyone knows about it, so be prepared for large crowds. It is worth fighting through the crowds though. Don't forget your camera.
Symphony of lights not a must see!. Sailing around the habour was great for the sky line and a night view of the city, just beautiful. The lights show was not very impressive.

Life on water..!. Views of the hustle bustle across the water,steamers,ferries,cruise ships,a whole lot of water traffic.Evening lit by the lights around,gives a twinkling feel and you wish to keep it in your eyes till you can.

Views of the light show and Hong Kong Island. Very crowded especially at night for the light show but plenty of places to eat and drink. Plenty of places to stand and watch the light show. Good views across to Hong Kong island and interesting to see there is still shipping using the harbour.

Victoria Harbour Vancouver Island Canada. Very impressive to visit and it will be worth your while This is a Great Island and Province to visit.
Norman Wallace

Avenue of the stars. Its a happening place and at night it is common to see student bands playing different english numbers.The harbour has a lot of restaurents and one can enjoy a nice dinner with the views of the Skyline in front
Simply fascinating !!. Just loved it the harbour and bayside. Good for spending quality time with someone special and intresting discussion.
See it from the Star Ferry. Everything you imagine - all the hustle and bustle of an exotic port. Never a dull moment with ships of all sizes. Get a good view from the Star Ferry crossing.

Enjoy the Night view with a bottle of bear . Vitoria hourbor is well known in the world. Don't tell others you've been to Hong Kong if you didn't come to have a look. It's worth to have a bottle of bear and take a seat and enjoy the night view.

Beautiful Day, Breathtaking Night. When visiting HK, try to visit Victoria Harbour twice, during the day and night. Morning harbour coastal line scenery with clear sky is beautiful with sunshines on glass panels of many buildings, morning sea breeze is absolutely refreshing. For the night views, light show is breathtaking. Great for photography during day and night.

Nice View. we visited this place with the kids from IFC side we rode the Star Ferry through the Victoria Harbour and see the city booming economy. we also took pictures from the Kowloon side during the symphony of lights.

Exciting by day Awesome by night. We have been to Hong Kong a few times but Victoria Harbour is always a high light for me.By day, watching the crowds of happy busy people ,Catching the star ferry ,the highrise buildings,Awesome. By Night the Laser show amazing with all the multiple colors on numerous buildings. This is Hong Kong

World Class Harbour and evening light show. Hong Kong Harbour is ranked in the top 5 of the worlds harbours. It is alive with commercial activity during the day bordered by high rise office blocks on either side. However when evening arises there is a a fantastic panorama of lights the highlight of which is a laser and light show at 8pm every evening and if you are in one of the restaurants that look over the harbour you will hear the music that accompanies the lights

Skyline. This is the place to go and people watch. Good views from both sides and take the Star Ferry for cheap entertainment. The Avenue of Stars is fairly new and worth a walk to see more of the area.

Great view at night. Definitely worth the visit, try to get there at 8 pm to see the light symphony. Very clean and so much to see. Iconic view over HK with ever changing views. Dont forget your camera!
Awesome. Awesome experience you have just got to take the ferry pretty built up with hotels but the light show is amazing and a must see

lasershow amazing. one of my best experience in hongkong .the laser show is amazing with the music and u have 2 of the highest buildings in the world around you. for me hongkong is the new york of the asia :) grap some food and watch the lasershow here
Very Nice View. The harbor is so nice and clean.The view was also nice and the ice cream was so tasty and soft which you can buy along the way.

nice View at night. The view very nice and even better during night time. Pls bring camera n dont miss it. There have a remote shop sell nice bbq squid n smell nice. Can see some star name on the floor too such like bruce lee, andy lau and etc. The place are very near MTR also
One of the top harbors in the world. HK harbor is vast and eye catching, especially at night when it is all lite in multiple colors on numerous buildings. A must see!

Ever changing view. I once spent two days at the Intercontinental next to the pool just looking out at the harbour. In two days there must have been hundreds of boats going by. Now if you want to go out in one of the boats and are prone to sea sickness first make sure it is a very calm day with light winds. With all the boat traffic and with high winds you may get queasy.

A good place to see the Hong Kong skyline and watch the Symphony of Lights. It's a good place to see the Hong Kong skyline and watch the various kinds of sea vessels pass by. If you are someone who loves the sea, oceans and anything with water in it, and boats, ferries, cruise liners and 'working ships', this is a place that should not be missed.The best part is that it is not expensive at all to be on one of those vessels viz the Star Ferry which costs only HKD 2 to 2.50 depending on whether you take the lower or upper deck, to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.However, looking at the harbour is sterile, and if you only want to see a harbour, then any other harbour anywhere in the world would be just as good. A harbour is a harbour is a harbour and that's it. Hahaha!You get the sense and true story, indeed, about the harbour when you realise that Hong Kong is built around its harbour. The long line of buildings on Hong Kong Island tells the story of how its success is achieved, especially as a major world financial centre. Looking at the other side of the harbour, Tsim Sha Tsui tells how Hong Kong makes its money through tourism, with its plethora of shopping malls, shops, loud advertisements and blinding neon lights.However, I did for a moment get philosophical and contemplative because I noticed two distinct groups of people. The first group was the Hong Kongers who were working hard in the hotels, shops and even on the sea vesels, and various other places catering to the second group, the tourists.As a very small city with 1,100 sq km of land, and only about half of which is "human-friendly" and hence useable for residential and commercial purposes, the sad fact of Hong Kong life is that most people live in very tiny flats.The long row of super high rise office buildings and hotels lining the praya of the harbour may make a fantastic tourist backdrop for taking photos, telling the story of the Hong Kong miracle, but I can imagine that life in Hong Kong for the locals is not all about neon lights.

Not to be missed!. One of the busiest waterways in the world, there is always something happening in Victoria Harbour. The ferries ply their way between HK Island and Kowloon, and also all the outlying islands. There are fishing boats making their way to and from the typhoon shelters, and lighters with their loads from the ships. And of course there are the cruise ships.At night there is a spectacular laser show at 8pm, all done to music, and people line the shores of both sides of the harbour to watch this spectacle. Hong Kong buzzes with life 24 hours a day and this is a fabulous place to see it all.
too pack!!. dont go at CHINA school holiday, if not, you will not have place to stand there. too crowned.wasting my time. you need to take a long walk to reach here.
Memorable!. There is nothing like Hong Kong, but if you're seeking peace, you'll have to work hard! Victoria Harbour is one of the world's iconic places! Definitely a box to be ticked!

A trip to HK is not complete without seeing Victoria Harbour. Absolutely stunning. Easily up there with other top city views in the world. Do yourself a favour and head there for the night time lights show from Tsim Sha Tsui. It is truly something unique and special.

Unriveled night view. I took a ferry from the Central Ferry Pier to the Star Ferry Pier at night, then looked back toward Hong Kong Island to marvel at the light mosaic created by all those buildings. You can also take ferries that circle the harbor end to end at the Star Ferry Pier, the ticket booth is sort of outside the pier, on the right-hand side when you walk out the pier.

Dont go for the laser show of its cloudy. We went to the harbour for the laser show which started at 8:00pm, although the beautiful skyline was a plus point, the laser show was a complete disaster as we could see nothing at all.All said and done if you like a romantic stroll near the sealine you should probably go there if it isnt very humid or raining or you could just sit back at the Starbucks over there and enoy a nice cup of cofee or a beer which is right next to it.

Harbour Cruise. A very pleasant weather & nice breezy climate was the perfect way to unwind in the City Island of Hong Kong. Symphony of lights show & Huge skyscrapers in the Hong Kong Harbour are also a good sight to watch.

Dirty, Filthy Overrated. This used to be the most prized possession of Hong Kong. Now its the worst thing to look at. The sea is dirty, filthy and the Government does nothing about cleaning it up. People from China make it even worse throwing things into the sea is a habit. Not worth it and overrated. Darling harbor of Sydney is any day far better harbour and far more superior then victoria harbour.
Victoria Harbour ...very romantic. The skyskraper was just Amazing , with perfect scenery. Very romantic to walk around at night time . Really great location
Nice Hong Kong View . If you want to see the Hong Kong this is the place to go. You will see Hong Kong from the highest peak and also the tram ride is fun.
Nice Views. Lots of crowd for the music and lights show. Nice place on a cool summer night to walk. Huge Malls in the area for shopping and dining.
Breathtaking harbour view. Board walk along the shores for both Kowloon and HK island, great pictures taking opportunities. Best is at night to watch light of the buildings

Lots to see - both sides. Stunning high rise buildings line either side of the harbour with a nightly light show from the Hong Kong Island side along with animations on the ICC building in Kowloon.Star Ferries are an inexpensive way to cross and a must do. Ferries can also be caught to the surrounding islands and Macau.At Aberdern you can take a sampan ride and see the boat dwelling Tonka people.Boat trips around the harbour are available. Lots of interesting stuff going on.
Definitely take the ferry to Kowloon. In case you didn't get enough shopping on Hong Kong island, wait! THERE'S MORE! Never seen so many upscale brand stores in one place in my life--not even in NYC
Excellent night view. It's been known as the Pearl of the Orient.....Must see the night view of the harbour.....With all the lights... They surely look like pearls and jewels of crowns
beautiful. went on a night cruise ,saw the light show ,rally nice experiance,it shows the city off in a specialway

Over or Under Harbour. Light display every night for 30 mins from laser lights mounted on the buildings facing the harbour. Catch the tourist boat for better views from the water. Can cross to mainland Kowloon either by ferry or go under through the tunnel.

Hong Kong trip. Pre arranged harbour tour on Sampan
Seeing the world from a different prospective, brilliant
Viewing the world from the water was different

Great place to take a walk or a boat ride in the evening. Don't miss the lazer show in the evening, plenty of India restaurants in the vicinity. Most hotels have free bus service from the harbor on the Kowloon side.

Package tour stop. Could have been not raining, must have enjoyed the short trip at least.The boat should be replaced with a new one, knowing it is one of the itineraries of a package tour during our trip

A place to be, highly recommended!. Such a romantic place for couples, good for single as well:) as there are thousands of people walking on the avenue, you wont feel lonely.
Nice view, fresh air. If you come to Hong Kong, make sure you don't miss it.
Famous night scenery. If you google the Hong Kong Scenery, you would definitely find the view from this harbor. Very famous of the light from the building and make sure you got your camera ready.
wonderful. brilliant view and feel so energetic and positive while just watching it from your room. Best enjoyed from Intercontinental Hotel Hong Kong. Must see.
Highlight of hongkong. It is fun to go up in a tram and have a brilliant view from top.a good spot to click pictures and have a great view of the city.

Windy night with some music. It was windy night and some street performers were singing on the pedestrian. We enjoyed the night view by sitting at the bay and playing around with Camera to capture nice night view.

Victoria Harbour. By night, Victoria Harbour offers more spectacular views by its dazzling lights. Annual fireworks displays are being shown here on the second night of the Lunar New Year. And although it is not new year, A Symphony of Lights show is being showcased every night at 8:00 PM sharp for all tourists. But this is incomparable to the very fantastic Light and Fountain Show of Marina which is also shown to the public twice of each night.

Boat Ride. A bit of an eye opener travelling by boat. It was interesting to say the least, the floating seafood restaurant a point in case, the front and the back of the restaurant are very very different.

Victoria would be awestruck!. This has to one of the most iconic views in all the world. Looking from The Avenue of Stars across to Hong kong Island is awesome. Not to be missed is the crazy laser show known as the symphony of light which takes place at 8pm every evening, when the skyscrapers take on a new life. A stroll down past the Intercontinental Hotel past the handprints of a host of Hong Kong movie stars and lifelike states including Bruce Lee the the return journey along the quayside to the old railway clock tower and the Star Ferry terminal completes a very spectacular evening stroll.

Beautiful skyline, more beautiful to take a boat ride and visit by night. We visited Victoria Harbour by day and by night. At 8pm there must be fireworks over the Harbour, we did not see this unfortunately. Taking a boat trip during the day was spectacular. We took the boat with the fake red sails, a wooden boat with relaxing chairs on the upper deck and nice relaxing sitting on the down deck. Well worth the money.

Beautiful View, But Skip the Lightshow. We had heard much about the view of the Harbor and all reports are true; it is beautiful during the day and even more spectacular at night. We waited to see/hear the evening lightshow (lucky for us is was English night) for about an hour. Large crowds formed, but it was a "total bust". We saw a few lasers shooting from the tops of a few buildings, but the advertisements on the buildings are so bright that nothing else really had an impact. See the harbor, but skip the lightshow.

Gorgeous during the day... breathtaking at night.. Just wonderful. An impressive sight during the day but even more spectacular when lit up at night... I am not a 'city' kinda girl, but Hong Kong won me over right here.

night view. victoria harbour is simply the most amazing place to spend time in hk the sound and light show at night is just wow with laser lights and music from buildings, its a very nice tourist place

Always delightful. The best way to observe the beauty of Victoria Harbour is using the Star ferry. It is very cheap, and if you’re over 65, it is free of charge.The ride is very delightful either day, or night.We crossed the Harbour a few times, because we weren't able to have enough of this colourful sight.
Great Place. Ideal place to spend the evening and for morning jog. In the evening both the banks are enliven with beautiful lights.

Beautiful - night or day!. I first came to this place to see the light show at night which was nice but nothing too exciting. A good one for a first timer. But again when I was here in the daytime, it was a different kind of beauty - all the buildings on both sides of the harbour shimmered and the water was turquoise. Quite lovely!

Victoria Harbour Hong Kong. Very Cool to cruise around. Crab a ferry and do a trip up and down the harbor as it will blow your mind how busy it really is. If you can swing it make sure you get to return after dark to bring the night skyline to life.

You've got to do this. Best way to appreciate Victoria Harbour is from the Star Ferry going from Kowloon to Hong Kong,good during the day but fantastic at night especially during the laser show. The ferry is so cheap its practically a free attraction and the ferry is a must do in HK anyway.

spectacular view, day and night. Hong Kong is a spectacular city. The Victoria Harbour view is one of the point where you can enjoy this spectacular skyline. At night, the lights in Kowloon are so beautiful!
A great way to see the city. Take the harbour tour from Kowloon side on the star ferry, a cheap and convenient way to see the harbour, the city skyline and enjoy the fun.
unforgettable at night. this is really one of the most beautiful landscape in a city center. At night the light show is unbelievable !! This a must go.

Speactacular view. I was really lucky to be told by a taxi driver that there's a secret spot to view the Victoria Harbour. My friend and I struggle to find the rooftop car park of the Harbour City but it really worth our effort.

Amazing shoreline!. Reach this place, stand there on the observation deck and soak in the awesomeness of the place, where the sky scrapers and the mountains in the distance seem to co exist together in harmony, while the backwaters from the sea wash their feet together.

Life must visit spot yet. The star ferry is across Victoria Harbor and water transport, not only can feel to Hong Kong's unique urban landscape, night also can enjoy 8 and half o'clock every night Hong Kong Fireworks Lights Festival, in that short time of sailing can enjoy a moment of leisure.
Great For Photography. I enjoy just about any type photography except shooting flowers. The harbor offers numerous photo opportunities.

What a view!!. This place is beautiful, the view from Victoria Harbour is incredible.
Take your camera and your best pose, you will want to take some pictures here.
Make sure to go at 8pm so you can watch the light show. Its one of a kind.
Victoria Harbour. Great views at night. The symphony of lights was ok, I was waiting more of a show comparable with the one in Disneyland.

Unforgettable. Probably the best place in the world to be at! You get to view the sea, the ships, the Avenue of Stars, the splendid HK skyline....and so much more. So vibrant, so colourful, so pleasant. Had been here with my wife and I have to say I feel like coming here again one day because this is one of the best spots i've visited. The best time to be here is during the evening close to sunset upto dark, when you actually see the skyline illuminating slowly in all it's grace.

Probably the most scenic view in the world. Looking out over Victoria Harbour at night is surreal and very magic.There is always something going on...from large military vessels sailing past to ancient Chinese junks.

Lovely view of the skyline from the Boats. Victoria Harbour is one of the busiest harbour in the world. It is surrounded by tall sky rise buildings and cruise ships flock the area. Every evening there is a symphony of lights show where we are taken in boats around the harbour and at a certain time a half hour show of lights starts. Lasers lights and sounds are displayed on the skyrise buildings and it is a treat to watch it from the boats. All the sky rises will be lighted up and there is even a running letter displayed sky rise. If u r a couple you are guaranteed to have a romantic evening in the boats. Its just a treat for the eyes.tip - Do take a instant picture of you with the skyrise as your background.
Romantic Setting. This busy port city always has something going on to look at while strolling along promenade, Kowloon side. Skyline from Hong Kong Island is fantastic.
What a view. Now this is a very busy harbour,with lots to see of boats and cruise ships coming and going.and at night to see all the lights reflect across the water is good to see.

Constant boat traffic. Their is boat traffic of every kind on the water 24 hours per day. We took a ferry boat from the harbor to Macao. About a one hour ride and returned by Hydrofoil. The best way to experience the harbor is from a boat.

Awesome View. Awesome view of the Hong Kong skyline! Symphony of lights show is on daily in the evening. Nice place to take a walk along. Can walk along harbour from avenue of stars and to harbour city. Awesome night view
A must when in HK. This is a must see when in HK, take one of the cheap boottrips and be amazed by the view especially at night !!
Great views, stunning landsacpe. Every night there's a laser show from the tall buildings on both sides of the harbor, worth seeing. There'll be lots of people so be prepared.
Always impressive. The views both from ground and above are amazing. Sad that it's being filled in to build more massive buildings. Hong Kong is changing and so is the harbor.

Dont go on the Symphony of lights tour. We booked to go on the Symphony of lights tour...and didnt feel it was value for money...yes there was a free bar but the light show left me cold and wondering what all the fuss was about. You can see most of the show from the Avenue of Stars for free....

Good to visit. We visited Victoria Harbour a few times during our short stay in HK. Great photo opportunity, good place to watch the light show, great shopping mall right next to it and you can walk along to the avenue of the stars.

The Centre and Splendid. It is the center and hub of all the high rise buildings in Hong Kong of various brands. It has a good view and is a very peaceful place to relax even at late night. You can hang out with your friends or with your patner.

Excellent place to walk and get the view of the skyline. A must see place. You can walk along the harbour especially when lights are on and you can view the skyline. Lots of people around and it is full of action.

A world class, serene view. One of the best views in the world, whether from the Peak or from Kowloon. Be sure to find a spot to watch the 8 PM laser show. Great viewing from a number of rooftop bars in Kowloon.

A busy waterway. It is lovely walking along the promenade - the flowers were lovely and it was great to sit and watch the people. It is a nicely paved and well cared for area. The harbour is very busy - lots of ships, boats, and ferries. There is also a sampan that you can pay to go on. We used the Star ferry to cross the harbour - the price is very cheap, HK$2.50. The cityscape is great during the day and the buildings look lovely when lit up at night.

Beautiful night view. We came before sunset and walked along the avenue of stars and snagged a good spot to watch the night view from the waterfront. It gets really crowded so I would recommend to come early before the light show!

What an experience. Having heard of Victoria Harbour prior to arrival I was expecting a busy port but not as busy as it transpired. Even from our cruise ship we could experience the atmosphere of a very busy port.

Victoria Harbour - still a busy working harbour.. Not only could we observe the Harbour activities from various viewpoints, we also took a boat trip around the Harbour. Absolutely fascinating to be in amongst the Ships, tugs, smaller boats, Star Ferries, working vessels and even Junks. The pace of water life is fast and it is amazing that there are no accidents afloat (that we have heard of).The Star Ferry trip, from HK Island to Kowloon across the Harbour, is still the cheapest form of public transport in the World.

The hub of Hong Kong!. Equally as stunning a view of the Hong Kong skyline as from Victoria Peak.There is a laser show where the buildings are illuminated and music plays, so well worth a visit to see the city lit up at night.There are restaurants, hotels, shopping centres nearby and with planes overhead and boats and cruise ships sailing by, the harbour really is the hub of Hong Kong!
always a good feeling. Never bored however many times I use the ferry.reminds me of Istanbul.Use oyster card and good no traffic access on island side,either dock.

Skyline view. Sailing on Victoria Harbour is one of the must does in life. Sail from central across to Kowloon on Star ferry for a small amount and drink in the spectacular views of the impressive Hong Kong skyline. Take a junk ride round the harbour, enjoy a drink and take in the views and relax.

Breathtaking view. It is something you can't miss when you come to Hong Kong. The night view is spectacular but day time is also interesting to go there. You can feel the momentum of the city in here.

Loved the Christmas decorations. We visited in Nov (behind with reviews!) as part of a tour of China. The harbour was decorated for Christmas with a Christmas train and lots of Christmas trees, etc. It was really magical. The harbour was very busy when we arrived, but we didn't have a problem getting the ferry to Hong Kong Island or back. We watched the light show at 8 pm, although I don't think we had a very good vantage point. It is a busy place, with plenty of places to eat. We really liked Hong Kong and would like to return, having only had 2 nights here.

Interesting. Took a San pan ride to see all the people living on the boats as well as seeing how the rich spend their millions on some wonderful ships. The lady who took us charged 60HK$ per couple for 30 mins.
Amazing. Beautiful sight, the harbor at Hong Kong has a unique charm. A must see, even better on a Ferry or a boat
A beautiful place to take a walk. every saturday night you can watch fireworks from the harbor , the weather is beautiful so a walk with a loved one would be amazing. Full of people and tourists .

ITS THE MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACE IN HONGKONG. This is the highlight of this country and not to be missed location specially at night. there is a laser show at 8pm local time everyday where around 40 buildings participate and it can be viewed both from the peak as well as in water cruise. there are special cruises designed for it. even during the day, it shows the hongkong skyline and definitely worth a ride. I saw it both during the day and also at night and it looks amazingly beautiful. try to take a cruise on the river, its worth your time and money, around 500 hk dollars will get you a ride along with dinner and drink cruise for 2 hours.

Symphony of Lights. We went down to Victoria Harbour to watch the symphony of lights with lighting choreographed to music and lasers cutting the night sky from way across the harbour. Something to remember as unique to Hong Kong.
Gorgeous!. Gorgeous place. We took a cruise at night time, with drinks and nibbles. Beautiful scenery.. amazing views! well worth the visit.

Enjoy the excellent waterfront of both side (Central and Tsim Sha Tsiu). You can have a walk on both side of the waterfront and travel in between by the star ferry (which only cost your less than a half USD...) The day view and night view are worth to have a look. Have a drink there and bring your lunchbox there would be a cool idea.
Lovely views.. We saw the harbour from a Harbour cruise which was good and then from the Sky 100 deck in the ICC. Well organised, busy harbour, interesting to watch what goes on all day.

Great experience but not always beautiful. From the Kowloon side of the Victoria harbour u can reach the view of the whole Hong Kong Island. Every night at 8pm, u can watch the Symphony of lights and the lights will be shoot on the sky from a few towers and it's fabulous! But if u go to the Habour on a moody day u can't see anything and not quite well views.
Amazing views. I'm from Barcelona so I don't see everyday big skyscrapers. Thats why I always enjoy the views of Hong Kong

Skyline Views. Victoria Harbour is a bustling patch of water which runs between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon just to briefly explain it. Plenty of ferries and cruises. While in Hong Kong make sure you have a look at the city from Victoria Harbour.

Harbour crossing. We crossed the Victoria Harbour on a Start Ferry from TST to Central and also on a ferry from Mui Wo to Central. The view was brilliant, majestic green mountains with a wall of buildings at their feet. In the evening there were millions of lights dazzling along the shore.The harbour is quite busy with all sort of vessels but is very clean. The only thing is on these public ferries they don't allow passengers on open decks. If it is allowed the we could have experienced a much better view.Harbour crossing is a must do in Hong Kong and recommended to do it in the evening.
Stunning View!. Victoria Harbour is between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui, and you can see the beautiful lights, restaurants and shopping malls there.

must do whilst in HK.......... A harbour cruise was recommended and well worth it. You can only get a full appreciation of the size and awe of the harbour from the water.Watched the light show which was okay but t be honest the views at night are amazing without the show.A must do when in HK....

best night view in HK. This place is worth coming 2 times - first during daytime to see how thickly nested are HK buildings and second time during evening - to see lot's of lights and make amazing shot of 2 HK: one real enlighted with night life and other - ghost HK mirrored in the water.Food there is more expensive than if u dive 300 m further into tiny streets with local food.But overall the view is stunning. Couldn't say i enjoyed Laser show but if as a mark in your travel book that's ok.But to be frank i was happy to make photo with Bruce Lee on the Avenue of Stars!

A hundred ways to view the light show. No matter where you are at 8 OClock, look up and you see the light show displayed across the buildings of the Harbour. viewed from Kowloon or the Island, always has to be taken in once a year when we visit. We try to find a different spot to see this light show every time we return.

Large busy harbour with great views. This large harbour between Central and Kowloon Peninsula, has one of the world's busiest ports. As a result at any part of the day or night there is action on the water. And yet it remains serene and beautiful for most parts of the day. A Star Ferry cruise on it is a great way to catch the Hong Kong skyline and its stunning skyscrapers.At certain parts of the year, usually the Chinese New Year, the harbour plays host to a dazzling fireworks display.

One of the sights in my world. The harbour in this amazing city has become one of my favourite sights anywhere, ever. We walked beside it and got up nice and close which was great for viewing the many different boats, we gazed at it from afar (up at the peak and from our hotel) and finally we got on it via the Star a Ferry and a sampan trip. Superb. Love it.

Star Ferry still a great trip. The harbour is likely the most photo'd body of water , up their with Sydneys harbour. But traveling cross Victoria harbour via Star Ferry is a timeless classic and it is cheap (.50 cents).The view is also excellent from Wolloomooloo in K-1 shopping mall in Kowloon. The harbour has so much activity it is also entertaining.I have even seen swimmers in it over in Hunghom Bay area, so surely it is cleaner than years passed (still not a recommended pool!).It gives HK it's identity and with constant construction the view is always altered.
Avenue of Stars. this place is a collection palm marks for the famous Chinese stars, especially Bruce lee.View from the sea shore are awesome
Walk of fame. Easy to walk around the beautiful harbour. The walk of fame was very good. We were there at Easter so it was quite busy and pretty hot weather.

Loved it!. There is absolutely nothing that we did not love about Victoria Harbour. All the hustle and bustle and the people and places to eat and have a drink were just fantastic. We even saw a couple of cruise ships dock while we were there. Very nice indeed.
so entertaining. it is like Playmobile on water. I couldn't stop watching the passing of so many boats with the breath taking backdrop

Spectacular views. Walking along the waterfront in Kowloon is an amazing experience. We saw a wide variety of boats, from sampans to ocean liners, and the Hong Kong skyline across the water is magnificent.
Magnificent!. One of the world's truly great waterways. The immensity of the surrounding is hard to take in at first and requires slow and deliberate digestion. A wonderful place

"Must do" on visit to HK. This is one of the most scenic city waterfronts in the world. Certainly worth a stroll along the waterfront and quite beautiful at night. Laser light show is interesting, but the view is the reason to come.

reunion with old friends for an canto pop experience. Good authentic Cantonese food in a Hong Kong style environment. Close to newly opened HK universitiy MTR. Advance booking possible. Good selection in its menu.

Amazing. I even was as bold as to prefer it to Sydney.. Skyline well designed and indicitive of great planning and progress.
Easy access and cheapest harbour cruise ever - the public ferry!
Iconic view of Hong Kong. A lovely harbour, fantastic layout and wonderful light show each night. Victoria Harbour is the iconic and stunning picture of Hong Kong and always a wonderful thing to see.

Perfect on a clear night! View from the sky or up close.. Ever shrinking due to more and more landfill projects, Victoria Harbour is still beautiful on a clear evening. You actually won't be able to see it unless you are at the pier, on the rooftop public area of IFC, or one of the bars / restaurants atop the tall buildings facing the harbour or on the kowloon (ECC or tst) side.

What you come to Hong Kong for. The harbour gives you the views you came to Hong Kong for (when you are not eating, shopping or sleeping in great places). See it from shore line or get into the cheap Star Ferry. You will find yourself going back and forth over and again.
Amazing light show - 8pm every night. If you are into city light shows - travel to Kowloon and watch HK and Kowloon light up at night! A lot of fun - lasts about 15-20 mins. With music.

Good place for a walk. lots of tourists. I feel like this is a place for those romantic love story to film (Like the empire state building where you promise that you'll wait for that one particular) Good view, fresh air

Excellent Views. We had a very nice cruise of the Victoria Harbour which was included as part of our Big bus tour. But I think it can be bought separately as well. The views were extremely breathtaking.

Life Experience!. We stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel for a few nights, and thus had a spectacular view of the Harbor and skyline. It's exciting, busy and non-stop. This is the view you have seen so many times in the movies, and it is alive right before your eyes. One day we took the ferry across and that was quick and easy, but a lot of fun to be a part of the view. Let's face it friends, how many times in your life do you get to see this? They symphony of lights was a great experience as well, and, in my opinion, best seen from the Kowloon side.

beautiful views. We had a very busy full on day so it was nice to just sit for a couple of hours, watch the sun set and the lights of all the buildings start to come on.
We brought snacks and took loads of pictures, lots of places for you to sit an enjoy the view!
Nice and Sweet time. It is very nice to be there early morning and evening to see the light. My visit time the weather is little hot then better try to select the good season to be there.

Dramatic, active harbor. Great to sail into. All the activity of everyday life takes place as people cross it to go about their business. Ships of all sizes make their way through it. The laser light show every night draws crowds of tourists.
Beautiful laser and light show every evening. At 8 pm each night there is a free light and laser show.See Hong Kongs lovely skyline in the background

Great views at night, but the light show is not important. The harbour is beautiful, at night there are people everywhere, buildings lighting up the sky and just a relaxed vibe. Friends meeting and tourists out to have a look. The light show is not worth a special trip but the harbour is worth seeing. So, if you're there and see the show that's ok, but the harbour is the attraction not the light show.
Amazing views.. Driving on abus to the peak is a little daunting , but the views are great. Plus there is shopping and restaurants there too. And, of course, a Starbucks!
tranquil, pleasant. Visit at night to see the light show, which was lovely, but somehow I'd expected more from it.Beautiful views of skyline at night and a pleasant ambience.
