Very crowded. Very nice view at the harbour there. It was very crowded on Sunday. There was a light and sound effect show at night time but nothing special.

Nothing special as such but great views. Its a busy harbour, with lots of things happening all around. Great place to take a ferry ride and see the skyline. I would recommend going in the evening. I saw a few street performers around this area and it was interesting.

Stunnig view of hk skyline. i will recommend everyone to visit this place. the day i went it was a bit gloomy and it looks like some old chinese paintings. But i was really busy between different things. If i had time, i will visit it again from sunset to evening until i see through the entire light show.

Busy Harbor. The harbor is a very busy place with lots of building going on. You can see the harbor with one of the Star Ferry tours but we didn't find it to be especially fun. Walking along the promenade was pretty and a good way to spend a couple of hours.
Ok if you can see it. Fireworks and light display can be fantastic, but only when the weather behaves. We had low cloud and fog.
Awesome. The view is quite awesome. Must go place in Hong kong. Good to get the pictures clicked here. on the clear day get to see sunset

Awesome view!. Brilliant view, can be enjoyed from Avenue of Stars or all along TST promenade stretching from Star Ferry and Harbour CIty till Hung Hom. Symphony of Lights can be enjoyed on a clear day and even on a cloudy day when the lights fall on the clouds above. The pirate themed junk boats in the Victoria Harbour add to the overall view. All in all the one thing in Hong Kong that should not be missed
Brilliant night skyline. Take a boat trip on the harbour at night. If you can get one of the trips that include the 8 pm laser show, you will have the best seat in the house!

Night view is a perfect moment. Nice view in Hong Kong, you must come to visit Victoria harbourAlso night time is a perfect momentI know HK gov, they have a make clear harbour policynowa day, that harbour not much smelly
Must see. Sunset and night view is bestEnjoy it most from Kowloon side towards Hk Island, even better with a cocktailOne of the best city skyline view without a doubt

Nice view of Hong Kong from the water.. It is easy to get to the promenade in TST for views of Victoria Harbour, either by MTR or Star Ferry. I'd recommend coming once during the day and once in the evening because the views are very different. My comments on the light show: (1) you don't need to wait an hour for a spot up against the railing, the light show is in the sky so you can see it from anywhere on the promenade; and (2) maybe it is just me but I found the light show to be somewhat underwhelming.
Water View. Very busy and vibrant harbour. So much to see and do. Access to ferries and other attractions. Harbour cruises the best way to see the magnificence of the area.

Timeless.. No matter what the weather is doing, Victoria harbour is always worth a visit. The hustle and bustle of the tradespeople and vendors, as well as the many tourists, create a continuous kaleidoscope of colour and movement. The Star Ferries are such an integral part of the history of Hong Kong, whilst the cruise ships bear testimony to the city's ongoing attraction.The laser show attracts many to the harbour at night, when the whole waterfront takes on a different, almost theatrical character, especially along Tsim Sha Tsui.

An interesting place to visit. We visited Victoria Harbour as part of a tour around the island and ended up on a short junk ride that provided a good opportunity to see the harbour from the water. We passed via the huge Jumbo floating restaurant that apparently caters for up to to 2,000 diners, around a number of fishing vessels and then the massive and very expensive privately owned sailing boats. In summary a god way to appreciate the harbour.
Great views. definitely a worth visit when in Hong Kong for the famous skyline view and at night the laser show is a must watch.

Always Love it here. I was there when I was about 10 years old, I was really chubby back then. Now, I am back to this particular spot again when I'm about 18. This Year I'm going there again also which I will turn 22 now.

Once is enough. I have been to HK many times since 2009 but never been to VH...so many people have told me need to take the boat for the night view, but I have to say it's not my thing nothing attracted me.

Nicer when the building work is finished. Near the Hong Kong convention centre is a pleasant promenade with superb views across to Kowloon. The building work takes the edge off it at the moment but when the work is complete I am sure another delight awaits.
Worth the cheap fare. Quick trip across the harbor. Boats are old, a bit smelly and uncomfortable seats. Hard to get a good view from down low. Wish you could be on the top deck to get a full view.

Enjoyable night out . Enjoyed the light show so much that came and watched it twice. Love the skyline, tall buildings and atmosphere. The hollywood stars wasn't all that but had some performances going on. Weather was pleasant and touts tolerable.

Nice and Convenent. Many small shops nearby, there is a laser performance in the evening. Do not need to wait long for ferry. Many places to take nice photos.Night view and lights on the tall buildings look very beautiful.
Observation wheel. We went on the Observation Wheel but unfortunately it was a day of thick sea fog so could not see the wonderful architectural marvel that is HongKong clearly.

take a Ferry to any destination.. Just a nice journey to be on the water,and see all of the islands,and enjoy the perspective of a water's eye view of this city on the grow. It makes you feel so insignificant in the scale of things. It is just fun to me to experience the difference one feels going from land to water. Also, it is a way to put things into perspective about Hong Kong. It is like New York,or Las Vegas, being a 24/7 city,but it's clean and safe. A ride on the Harbour helps to reinforce this fact.
Great Skyline. No words needed, a must if you are in Hong Kong. If possible go at night, at 8pm they have the harbour light show which is nice however very crowded.
Natures Gift to a maritime Hub. A vibrant and busy Harbour. Always something happening or passing night and day. Actually it best viewed from dry land of which the Peak is the best vantage point

See HK from the water.. It is efficient and informative. The commentary is recorded and played over the PA system, so of limited value. But in the hour of the cruise you are on the water with the opportunity to see sights otherwise unseen from a regular Star Ferry ride. What more could you ask for? Food, cocktails, dinner, then that is not this cruise tour. Great as it is.

Nice view at night. Went there around evening time, before light up, not very impressive. But after light up, quite beautiful. Sitting there and enjoy the breeze, looking at the cruises and ferry that pass by. Is a nice little break from all the walking
Fantastic walk.. The walk is good, leading down to some fanastic shops/shopping. Always something happening down there, even if you want to catch a ferry.

Very accessible. We popped back and forward across the harbour a couple of times on the Star Ferry. We were not around the front of the harbour to see the light show, but what we could see from our apartment looked fabulous. The view from Kowloon is just breathtaking.
The Foggy View. I came at the wrong time. It was April-May season. I could see everything covered in fog. The air was cold and people were not that many.
Glorious. The view from the water is breathtaking. The harbour is busy and interesting, It is so very accessible and highly popular

Sampan ride. We walked around the harbour and then took a traditional sampan ride. It was a lovely experience and gave you a feel of what it is like for the boat people who still live this way, there are not many left now. This was a lovely way to see the Jumbo Restaurant in the bay too

Just amazing. It is one of most beautiful harbours seen in my life. From both sides, from Kowloon and H-K island view is amazing. Harbour coast from Kowloon is great with long side walk and other attractions. Everyone who visiting H-K for sure must be there.

Bahunia cruise. Cruise with Symphony of lights and Dinner was nice. Quite luxurious cruise. Buffet dinner has good varieties. Live dance and song show is also there on cruise. Nothing to dislike. We enjoyed the cruise for 2 hours. Bit expensive

a free view worth billions!. i come here almost on every visit...i've been to many cities and many of them have got nice skyline view with water, be it a lake, river or sea, nothing can beat hong kong's, with all the buildings and offices from international big names, this has to be a billions worth view!
The coldest of all!. The highest peak in HK, also the most expensive one :) Dont buy souvenirs here. Go to Mongkok night market if you must.
harbour. nice place to visit. cool breeze and nice place to hangout....... nice shopping around this place with most of the brnaded shops located nearby..............
You can pass on this one. Lots of building work going on at the moment. This is a shame as you see cranes, and trucks everywhere. Not really a must do, you can pass on this

Night visit. As with most skylines their best viewed at night and that would be the case with Hong Kong, especially during the lunar new year there was festive lights adorning the towers which made for a more special occasion then if it were normal lights.
Spectacular at Night. A nice place to see, specially at Night to understand what Hong Kong is truly about. Kowloon side, they have put a few loungers as well.

Panoramic view. I think any tourist who has been to Hong Kong must have taken pictures in this area. The area is very popular with lots of people specially during Chinese New Year. It is a good location for taking beautiful pictures with the Harbour as the backdrop. Specially great if the weather is clear. Daytime pictures are great but the night photos are awesome. Take the ferry or one of the tours to appreciate the view more.
Best place to see HK skyline. Victoria harbour is the best place to see Hong Kong's Skyline. Best time to visit Victoria Harbour is night time. You can enjoy the laser show also in night time.
Not as spectacular. Not as good as years gone by, but still worth a visit if you have not been before. Great to jump on one of the little boats for a water tour.

A very special place!. Our location while In Hong Kong was on the harbour- the energy, diverse sights and the culture of Hong Kong are alive and well at Victoria Harbour. We love to walk early in the morning and we found the Promenade along the Harbour was a highlight for us. We felt particularly privileged to observe traditions, rituals and the local customs of the people of Hong Kong. A truly special place!
Great view!. Really nice view especially during night! There were some odor smell which was really bad! The traffic was very convenient for both subway and ferry.

Best view of Hong Kong is from here. I happen to visit hong kong in a transit trip. The best view of hong kong I got from this place. Just take the ferry from pier 7 and come to this place. The view of the city is most beautiful from here. The are place around the area like avenue of stars and shopping stalls to spend good amount of time. I assume everyone visiting Hong Kong would visit this place.

Give the night light show a miss.. Considering the scale and brilliance of the existing views, we found the addition of the laser show hardly worth the effort. We watched from TST at Kowloon, and were distinctly underwhelmed. For such a fabulously over the top city, this was like a damp squib.

Just come at night only. There is nothing special to me in my opinion other than the night view of the skyline. But it's one of those things that a tourist has to do and take pictures to show your family and friends!
Good trip. Done as part of the big bus package , real bargain good value great views good audio descripitions. Enjoyable trips
Timeless. The 5 minute ferry ride from Hong Kong to Kowloon or vice-a-versa had gorgeous views of both Hong Kong Island and Victoria Peak.

Busy abd beautiful Harbour. There are so many ships and boats inthis harbour it is truly amazing. We grabbed a couple of Tsing Tao beers at night and sat on a bench and talked and watched all the ships go by. A beautiful place to relax and enjor Hong Kong.
Loved the view. Even on a cloudy, foggy cold day, the views are still brilliant. Will visit again when the weather is kind to us
A tourist must!. One of the tourist must things to do, especially at night with everything in lights! Hopefully you have a clear night for excellent photo's.
Victoria harbour. Great views and easy to get across to Hong Kong Island. . 2 day Bigbus tours is best value. Must go to Stanley!

Better than Victoria Peak!. I know you go to Victoria Peak to see the view of Hong Kong, but I personally think Victoria Harbour gives you a much better one.I went to Victoria Harbour at night via the MTR, which I think was the perfect time because the lights are up and it isn't too hot anymore. I suggest you time your visit so you could be there at exactly 8 in the evening, when they start the Symphony of Lights.The Symphony of Lights isn't the best light show, but it does incorporate the help of different buildings on Hong Kong Island which I thought was very impressive.Victoria Harbour was pretty good. I get why it is a tourist destination.

Such a HUGE harbour!. I knew it was big from photos, but never really imagined how big it was to see in person! Plus, I always envisioned it to be full of ships, but it is actually quite empty! Take the ferry across and see the skyline at night. The light show is from 8 to 8:15!

Harbour with a great view. I went to the Victoria Harbour when I last visit Hong Kong. You can see Hong Kong from the harbour. It was a great view to see, many ships were passing by. I went there on February and I might say it was very crowded. Full of Mainlanders. A little advice is to visit the place at non-peak season to avoid the crowd to enjoy the view more.
Great Views. A brilliant back drop to photographsThe light show was a little disappointing in the eveningGreat views
Take the Ferry!. One of the most beautiful harbors in the world. The best way to see it is take the ferry from Kowloon across the harbor they go every 15 minutes and cost less than $10.
Very impressive harbour. We were very impressed by how clean and blue the water was and the stunning back drop that the skyline provides....definitely take a ferry ride across to appreciate properly.
Unbelievable light show. Best laser light show ever. Goes on every night at 8:00 p.m. around the Chinese New Year period. Best part is that it is free!

Do a dinner cruise. We seen the harbour by day and by night and it really is magnificent. Do yourself a favour and pick one of the many dinner cruises available and get out on the harbour and enjoy the light show by night - just incredible and enjoyed by all!!

unique views. Stayed in kowloon area and could see part of the harbour from our hotel window. Great views at Amy time of day. We took the star ferry across to Hong Kong island, we also watched thwarting light show from the harbour and saw it one night from the peak. Iconic views.

Iconic views. A MUST for all travellers to or through Hong Kong. The harbour views are spectacular, especially at night, and the Start Ferries are so cheap you should hop between Central, Kowloon and Wan Chai to see as much as possible.

Enjoy the Promenade. Jog along it in the morning. Early enough and you'll see the party crowd headed home, a little later and you'll see the gentlemen of a certain age swimming in the harbor, later it's a mixed crowd of workers and joggers and tourists. In the evening see the free laser and LED light show dazzle to music on both shores.

Good sightseeing. I saw Victoria Harbour at night, many lights of the Hongkong land are very nice. they(HK government) usual make the celebration here. for it's enough to see once and let's walk around HK market.
Brilliant View. Really nice to pick up a cup of coffee and just sit and view the sights. Really Beautiful by night. Visited in december and was quite cold at night.

Iconic View. I'm a Hong Kong expat having lived here for over 20 years. I thoroughly recomend taking the 'Star Ferry' cruise in the evenings for the best vistas of the iconic Hong Kong skyline. The experience and views obtainable from the open sided ferry are excellent. A Star Ferry ride is iconic in itself,and beckons a bygone era. A must whilst in Hong Kong so why not pair the two experiences? I would recomend the night tour for the best views but the day vistas are nothing to be scoffed at either. I hope you enjoy your stay.

Great to walk around. The promenade along the harbor gives a chance to walk around and observe life as it goes by in HK. there are eateries and shops on both the sides. in the day time, you can view the buildings and at night, the lights will dazzle you. we were there just before Christmas which meant there were more lights than usual. the ferry piers are also located here. switching from HK side to Kowloon side is easy. good idea to sail on the junk boat.
Victoria Harbour. Lovely to walk around. We liked the relaxed feel and buzz. Easy to catch the ferry from here.There is a large shopping centre by the ferry pier but we did not go in.

Hotels , victoria peak, sampan rides. All the hotels on the Kowloon side or Hong Kong side of Victiria Harbour have an amaxing view of modern high rise buildings and the old way of living on the Harbour. Victoria Peak offers amazing views of hong Kong and a sampan ride gives you a great feel of the Harbour!
Do the star ferry harbour tour. Doing the ferry to/from Kowloon is great however the harbour tour is relaxing and gives you a great perspective on the city.

A Hive of Activity. The first thing you must be aware of is that Hong Kong is one of the most densely populated places in the world. Add to this number, the many visitors to the city and you understand that there are CROWDS everywhere and so the harbour is no exception. The walk on the Kowloon/ Tsim Sha Tsui side is quite enjoyable with its numerous cafes, statues of famous people, street performers and the ever present street hawkers. We were told that the best place to view the daily 8 pm light and laser show is on the walkway. It is an experience to simply sit on one of the benches, enjoying the sun, and the light breezes from the harbour and watching the variety of people passing by.

Disappointing harbour tour. Harbour trip was disappointing - unless, of course, you are a mega-luxury motor yacht spotter. Hundreds of very expensive vessels moored in what is becoming a rich man's marina. Had to look hard to see some traditional boats and houseboats. Times change

Just enjoy the view. I walked along the waters edge on both the Hong Kong Island side and the TST side. No matter which side you're on you can enjoy a gorgeous skyline. And I enjoyed it more at night when all the colored lights go on... It's peaceful and a great time to just be mindful. Only downside are the gypsies... so be watchful and avoid. They can get pushy. Just pretend you don't understand and move on quickly.

Quintessential. Seen it from many angles and never disappoints. Morning, day and night, on a clear day (rare) it is spectacular. Preferable from a ferry or Aqua Luna or any junk boat trip. But also stunning from The Peak or any high rise building with a view of it. Brunch at Intercontinental in TST provides great view

Lots of Activity. The walk on Kowloon/Tsim Sha Tsui side of the harbour is wonderful both day and night. At night the buildings are lit up on both the Island and the Kowloon sides. The evening light show is beautiful, though our expectations were much too high to make the first time we saw it seem spectacular. There are street performers at times as well.

Sometimes its not good to go back.. Just disappointed, I remember how interesting and full of local colour this area was when I last visited. Now big expensive power boats, and terrible developments surround the area, and mess and tat everywhere.We went as part of a toi=ur, and the boat trip was an .extra charge. Wouldn't have bothered if I had known.

Beautiful Views. Loved Victoria Harbour, we stayed in Kowloon over looking the harbour & travelled across every day to HK Island on the star ferry, loved the views walking along the promenade! Loved waking up to those views every morning!

Unique View. having the chance to sit down relax and enjoy this beautiful view is an amazing opportunity.Every time I get back Hong Kong I can't miss to walk trough Kowloon and enjoy Victoria Harbur skyline.

A great place to potter about.. Victoria is a beautiful place to potter about. The harbour is lovely, lots of water traffic, and lots of different experiences. We took some beautiful photos as worked our way thru the attractions and shops, and watched the people, including other visitors and locals, as they went about their business. It was a relaxed interesting day, finished off with some delicious food and a really good coffee.

Unique Vista. Having lived in Hong Kong for 3 years, the view of Victoria Harbour still manages to amaze me. For a city skyine, its unique and unmatched anywhere in the world. Its a must see for any visitor to Hong Kong.

Wonderful Harbour Cruise. One of the 'must do's' for me was a Victoria Harbour cruise. The Star Ferry was the obvious choice, having a number of timetable options to choose from each day. The cruise included afternoon tea and in the comfort of the Star Ferry line, I was able to enjoy the most stunning views to be seen from Victoria Harbour including spectacular architectural delights.Don't go to Hong Kong and miss a cruise of Victoria Harbour.
Go to Ave of Stars in Tsimshatsui to have the best view. Day and night are both good but when the visibility is high, do go at night as the night light is a bonus. Every night at 8pm has laser show.
VH. A place that everyone want to take photograph, having a beautiful scenery, see Hong Kong from the upperside

Amazing Harbour. What a fun place to watch or be on. The Harbour is the heart of this amazing city with constant bustle of ships, junks, sampans, barges and other weird vessels. find a shore front or harbour view cafe or restaurant and enjoy a drink or for whilst watching the boats bustle by

Best time to cruise before sunset.. This is my experience and recoomendation for those who want to view the Victoria Harbour face to face. Take the late afternoon harbour cruise that you can enjoy the best view of the harbour front buildings, coast line plus the bonus of enjoying sunset moment. January May be a bit windy and cold to some visitors. The best month should be November after the China National Block holidays that you could avoid the crowd.
A relaxing harbour tour. We had a relaxing, informative and enjoyable tour of the harbour. Points of interest were identified and some local history of Hong Kong and the harbour was provided.

Spectacular Views, Day and Night. This harbour has the view of arguably the best skyline in the world. I'd advise going to the harbour both day and night, in the day you can get a wide panorama of the whole of Hong Kong island, whilst at night you can see the magical light display everyday at 8pm.

Ferry rides for cheap. It's very inexpensive to ride the ferries to see the harbour. It's a pleasant way to relax while sightseeing. The ride to Lantau or just over to Kowloon is worthwhile. The seats are reasonably comfortable.

Star Ferry. The best bit of the harbour was crossing on the ferry, which is only about 2 HK dollars. We crossed it twice - day and night - and both are very interesting.I wouldn't say the harbour is as impressive as Marina Bay in Singapore but it is well worth an hour or two.

Don't miss the firework show every 8.00pm. Victoria Harbour is the peal of Southern China, the harbour is busy round the clock and the lighting at night is excellent. The high rise buildings in Central area displaying the lighting after 6.00pm and the Lighting and short Firework show beginning at 8.00 pm. Taking the Star Ferry is the best way to watch the show.

A ride of the Star Ferry is a must do. I have been to Hong Kong many times, but a ride on the Star ferry is still one of the highlights. In sunny weather, the views are amazing. Even in some heavy fog the ride was fun. DO it!

Again a must do in Hong Kong, but at night!. If you aren't going to do this at night then I feel it looses much of its allure. So I give it a 5 for evening only. I would give it a 2 during the day, and I have done both several times.
Nothing much. The much acclaimed laser show falls short of expectations. They should consider to revamp after so many years.

Relaxing walk with lots of city views. Very good area to walk, easily accessible by Hong Kong public transport. Best connection is via MTR, you get out just right next to the beginning of the harbour, near Clockwork Tower. There are plenty of souvenir shops in the area, places with snacks (for example - squid) and many views to enjoy. You can also hop on a bus and walk through the streets of Hong Kong to get there from the opposite side.

Beautiful view. I visited Victoria Harbour during the evening. The view was tremendous; you can take some incredible pictures from ground level or on the platforms. However, there wasn't an awful lot to do there, unless you boarded one of the tour boats.

Average quality. If you have traveled and experienced dinner in cruise in other countries then better skip this one. View of skyscrapers from the curies is good but the food and overall experience is average. First timers must go ahead. M sure they will like it.
excellent night life. fantastic views, amazing street cafes, dodgy street musicians but funny, marvelous river crossing it was more than i expected, Well done Hong Kong

nice walk and great view. if you can, take your time and a refreshing beverage to go visit the harbour.it's always spectacular and minutes pass by easily, watch the ferries go by and maybe hop on a star ferry yourselfyou will get a nice impression of business Hongkong and leizure Hongkong at the same time.

Harbour beauty. We really enjoyed our visit to the Victoria Harbour in the evening. The night was clear and calm and the buildings looked amazing lit up across the sky. We live on a farm in a rural area in NZ so it was a complete contrast to that. People were friendly and made space so we could take photos and we were lucky enough to have a friend fromHong Kong point out some of the buildings and places of interest. Later in the week we travelled on the Star Ferry and saw a different view of the Victoria Harbour but from dry land we had better views as we walked around the pathway at the harbour.

Best way to see both sides. This is an awesome harbour, very cheap ferry crossings make viewing Hong Kong and Kowloon sides day or night a great experience. Nightly light show needs to be seen once, then its a bit over rated.

Nothing great, a bit smelly. The trip in the boat is about average. Besides the swanky yachts anchored in the harbour, there's nothing much to see. The typical sea and ichthyoid (fish like) smell tends to magnify in the confines of the dock area. Nothing great, can avoid.

Plenty to see and people watch.. Views are amazing and plenty to do in the area, lots of lovely places to eat. Harbour is very busy with ferries, cruise ships etc. quite a lot of building work still ongoing and traffic can be quite congested at busy times.
See the light show. Beautiful light show. The fery is very inexpensive and comes by very often. Great way to cross the harbor without the hassle of the taxis.

go to the peak to really appreciate it.. This is a very busy harbour and a very integral part of the city of Hong Kong. Its nice to see fro Victoria peak and great to experience it from the star ferry.

Hong Kong's famous tourist attraction. If you come to Hong Kong, at least once you need to take the ferry to Kowloon and back. Even if it is just to have a drink at the Peninsula hotel (another favorite of mine). Its dirt cheap and a great way to get some good city line pix

A Harbour. Within this harbour you can see multiple activities from the industrial workings of a container yard that is constantly active 24 hours a day to the typical Chinese boats for the tourist to experience. There is constant activity all day long into the night. Strolling along the well kept harbour gives you a chance to unwind from the hectic of down town.
Great View. You can get really good views of the city from here. I would highly recommend that you go for a dinner cruise.
Victoria Harbour. Cruise in the evening to watch the laser show! I'd like to take a cruise during the day next trip! Lots to see
Nice place and view to be at. We went there in morning, the wind was amazing. View is really nice, at same place is Avenue of Stars that has statue of Bruce Lee plus handprints of various actors

Victoria Harbour. From the harbour, you will be able to see stunning and beautiful lit-up buildings on Hong Kong Island. An awesome background and beautiful place to hang around take pictures at. At 8pm at night (time varies on each day so check out the timings online before going there), they have a light show a.k.a Symphony of Lights which can be viewed from there as well. Anti-climax one though so do not have high expectation from it. But overall a good place to visit if you have never been there!
Stunning. Victoria Harbor is just beautiful by day or by night, as long as it is a clear day. It can get very smoggy sometimes.

Stunning views. We were lucky enough to have a stunning view of this beautiful harbour from our hotel room. We could sit for hours and watch the boats go back and forth with the stunning Hong Kong in the back drop. Well worth a visit if your in Hong Kong.

Hong Kong's tourist destination. Victoria Harbour is to Hong Kong, what Buckingham Palace is to London - you just have to visit.I was on board a cruise ship in the harbour for New Year's Eve. I know it should have been amazing- but I've seen better fireworks elsewhere. Choose your time carefully to visit the harbour area, because like most of Hong Kong it can be too busy to be enjoyable.
Amazing views. Amazing views of the hong kong island and kowloon. best view point would be from avenue of stars. very interesting place.
Nice boat ride. This is a fun thing to do in Hong Kong that gives you a view of the city lights. It's inexpensive and a must on the visitor's list.

beautiful. Beautiful views of the city and all the activity on the water. The tramway was broken that took us to the peak so we took a bus. Very clean but crowded on top. Our guide told us not to buy anything in the shops and we all regreted it as they had the best prices and selection.

Great spot. If you are walking around Kowloon mainland side of HK you should not overlook the beauties of Victoria Harbour. Skylines, restaurant and shops make this place attracting locals and turists every day.

Buzzing and alive. The whole Vitoria harbour area is a love and buzzing with activity. Lovely wallks, restaurants and cultural activities and such a great great view both at daytime but at night, breathtaking, at 8 pm for 13 minutes there is a laser light show which is stunning.

It's always great to see it.... I took a walk along the "Avenue of Stars", didn't like it much but the Victoria Harbour scenery is always nice. The Avenue is not so easy to access by MTR, and maybe because it was Sunday was full of mainland tourists. It needs more guards and more care in general, there are only 2 stalls selling dried squid. Visitors don't know most of the names on the stars, and there could be a short explanation of them. Mainlanders just go there to take photos, so the groups stand on the stars. This is when they're not vomiting around, like I saw a young woman do...
awesome. a great place in hong kong, especially the evenings. The Avenue of stars, the boat ride and the symphony of lights are just superb, lots of restaurants and shopping nearby

This is the place!. What an amazing history here, now modern but one can't be here without a strong sense of its history, even as the towers on each side project this town's wealth, power, influence, and hum. However, don't break your neck for the light show. The Christmas displays set to music are better.

Smoggy hard to enjoy. China air quality is an international travesty. Every time I've been there the air was so bad you could t see the views during the day. My eyes, throat and chest felt like I had a cold. Ugh.
Something to see. The view is something to see, I've been to many famous harbors around the world and this is 2nd to none, make sure you see it at night.

awesome. Its neat... you should come and see it for your self!
might be hot in the summer though, but i travel during winter so its ok for me :)
Good spot in HK. A must visit when you are in HK! But as the location is too hectic, be careful with your belongings.

Great views of Hongkong skyline. Great views specially at night when the Laser show is on and boats with lights are moving. Great place to walk and time flies by. Laser show has been the same for last 5 years, need to add some variety and presentation.

One of the best harbours in the world. Taking a ferry ride around Hong Kong harbour is one thing every one must do this is not the first time I have taken a trip the harbour and it won't be my last the views are priceless as are the memories
sit and watch. it is such a busy place.one of the most busy harbours ive seen.you could sit for hours just watching the boats toing and froing all day long
nighttime. go here at night. You will appreciate Hong kong's skyline. Is is known for its spectacular views so do pay a visit :)

Just breathtaking. Go at night for the show!. The harbour has to be one of the most beautiful stretches of water that I have ever seen. It is completely surrounded by the urban metropolis that is Hong Kong, but the views are outstanding! I went both day and night, if you go during the day get the Star Ferry across the water its extremely cheap and takes you from one side of the river to the other, however on your way across the views of the skyline are just wow. However what is even more WOW is the light show at night. We got there 20 minutes early and got a spot on the rail so we could see, I would advise this as it got really busy, and just sit and watch the lights on all the skyscrapers unfold. It is unbelievable, I have attached a picture to this review so you can see. If your in Hong Kong you MUST go and see this!
Pleasant walk. The pier view and the HK skyline from the ground level looks amazing from here. The breeze makes the walk even more memorable.
Lots to catch on camera and video. A great place to be, whether by day or by night. We took the bustling Star Ferry trips to explore during the day; and we just strolled in the evenings.

Fantastic Skyline. Took a walk along the Avenue of Stars around Victoria Harbour. There is a fantastic Hong Kong skyline at night with brilliant illuminations. Many local Photographers offer to take photographs with the Hong Kong skyline in the background. We caught the Metro to Tshim Sha Tsui station, look closely for the exits to Star Ferry and you will find Victoria Harbour. Victoria Harbour itself is not particularly well signposted but when you find it you won't be disappointed!
Unparalleled beauty. Cross the harbor by ferry-- see it at night and during the dayView the harbor from Victoria PeakBring windbreakers

Take a ferry, strolling along Avenue of Stars or stay in a hotel has the sea view. No matter which way you take, how many times you have seen this scenery, this can always touch your heart and take your breath away. Suggested to stay at Kowloon side, so that you can look over to the Central, where has most iconic buildings of HK. After shopping in HK island, take a ferry from Wanchai Ferry Pier and back to Tsim Sha Tsui Kowloon, you will find this is the best $2HKD you spend in HK..
Put it on your bucket list. The number of skyscrapers is truly amazing and the view; particularly from the Kowloon side is just fascinating.

One of the most romantic things to do. Taking a junkboat ride around Victoria harbour with complimentary alcohol and nibbles, this was a perfect way to unwind after a day of exploring this magnificent city topped off by watching the sunset over the harbour, absolutely perfect!
Make sure you go at 20.00. Every night of the year at 8pm the night sky is lit up by lasers from the tallest skyscrapers around the harbour.
amazing view. looks its worth going up on the tram but after you have seen the view there is nothing else to do unless you want to shop !

Good at night. Brilliantly lit buildings on the shore around the bay a lovely sight .The laser show in the night adds to the beauty a proof that every one in Hongkong wants to make the city a better place.

My Hotel was almost part of the harbor area.. To stand and watch the antique boat on the water and on the other side a Lage Cruise ship that is about 10 stories high is breathtaking! I did the sunset cruise arount the harbour and the scenery is awsome. The harbour is part of the shopping centre and opposite is the Hong Kong Island.

Many things to see. Took a walk along the Harbour with my cousin earlier last year during one of our trips to Hong Kong. Theres always something to see and try out. with many shopping malls, and places to eat, this is really a place you should visit when travelling Hong Kong
Beautiful!!. Very nice view and walk throughout. Always loaded with lots of people. Some cafes around. Starbucks along the path also.
beautiful panorama. Both sides of the Harbour are very nice. You can walk at the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade and see the skylines on the Island. Very nice at night.

The best event in HK. We had a great trip around the harbour in the traditional Star ferries. With a complimentary drink and refreshments and a delightful commentary it was for us the highlight of our visit to HK. The service was excellent and I would thoroughly recommend it as a way of seeing the city.

Must see. While there is nothing particularly special about this place, it does offer you a glimpse into the Hong Kong life as it attracts all manner of people. In the night, the light show can really light this place up.
Beautiful impressive skyline!. Great for long walks along the Avenue of Stars and people watching and beautiful skyline views at night!
Evening cruise and Dinner. Well worth the time and effort, the views of the buildings both on the Island and mainland were stunning. Buffet/Dinner huge choice.

Day or night.. This is what visitors to Hong Kong probably do first. It's iconic views are great day or night. Busy at times, especially for the light shows. The light show is not as spectacular as the views themselves.

Night Lights Cruise on Hong Kong. Great cruise to see the Light & Laser show on the harbour. Unfortunately for us it rained and was windy, but we still enjoyed it. The open bar was a nice touch.
Would be much, much better in fine weather.
Have to visit!. if u visit Hong Kong, either u r alone, couples or a group, you should have a walk there and enjoy the view. there is some restaurants there and also there is some cruises.

A must do... but. Its a must do.... but I would not bother putting much time into it.... May be plan on a cup of coffee somewhere along here or a beer.... But I was not as amazed as I expected to be by the hype. Still do it but.... just dampen down the expectations
Great!!!. Good place to hang out and enjoy the architecture..gets really busy in the evening as everybody seems to get there after spending the day doing different things
Victoria Harbour Cruise. An excellent scenic cruise! The views of the skyline were perfect. The buffet included with the cruise was outstanding.
nice view. if you are a tourist or a business man or whatever you are, it;s a must to go here. the view is gorgeous, the lights in the night are fabulous. it's a DREAM.

Amazing view. In this harbour, you can have an amazing view of harbour and skycrapper of Hongkong. It's better that you go by night and take tons of beautifull pictures.
Don't forget to take a ferry across the harbour, it's really nice experience.
Breathtaking everytime. One of the must see things ever on planet Earth. I lived in NYC and HK skyline beats NYC's in terms of beauty. It takes my breath away every time, world's #1 skyline.
Beautiful!. The view of the city from here is breathtaking! Even with overcast weather, it was still gorgeous! Get a coffee or a light bite to eat and just sit and watch the different boats go by...

Distinctive Colours and Skyline. Distinctive colours and skyline view of Hong Kong skyscrapers from Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront in Kowloon. The reflections of the water and blending with boats, ferries and cruise ships presents nice photos.
Beautiful. Take the ferry across the harbour. It only costs $3 and take about 15 minutes. Better still, take a harbour cruise. You will truly appreciate this as one of the busiest ports in the world.

Busy Victoria Harbour. Whilst it is fascinating to ride on a ferry or a junk or go on a Harbour tour , the harbour is dirty and grey in colour. Early morning rides are the best across the harbour . The harbour tours take you in and out of the boats where people hang out the octopi they have caught . You see everything in a different perspective when low in the water riding in and out of junks.
Busy little harbour. Star ferry crosses from Kowloon to Hong Kong frequently. You need to have change to buy tokens to ride the ferry.

Junk ride and crossed Kowloon to Hong Kong.. The harbour in Hong Kong is spectacular with the tall buildings showing light displays every night. Well worth a ride on the old junks.....and don't be afraid to rug up is offered rugs as they are warm and cosy and make the trip much more comfortable.

Well lit, interesting architecture. The harbor has an interesting assortment of buildings, plus the Ferris Wheel and amusement park. It is the hub of the city with the Star Ferry, Big Bus tours, and other transportation intersecting. At night you can enjoy the light show from a cruise or from the Promenade on the Kowloon side.
Fireworks. Great place to watch the New Years eve fireworks from, about a million people, with no hassles, very little street drinking, totally safe kid friendly place to go.

Sorry we went. We were told this was the place to go for the best city view. After taking the tram to the top we were very disappointed. It was basically a shopping mall at the top and very few areas to look at the city. The view from our Hotel lounge was just as nice.
Run the Harbour when you have a chance..... Beautiful view! I love HK! Stop by Starbucks for a morning coffee and incredible views;). Lots of things to see from one end to the other..

Amazing Views. The Victoria Harbour offers great views of the HK skyline both during the day time as well as in the night. At night the skyline comes alive with different buildings lit up in different colours and designs. Makes for a great postcard picture.
Excellent in every way. So much to see here, the Avenue of the Stars, pleasant stroll to the ferry piers, views across to the Waterfront and plenty of shops and restaurants.

Best Cityscape I have seen. Victoria Harbour is a must see place to visit to view the cityscape of HK - both during the day and at night. Catch the ferry from one side to another or simply walk along the waterfront and watch the boats coming in and out. In a city as hectic as HK, this is a good place to just relax and watch the world go by.
Amazing. Great location and views,Victoria Harbour is home to most of the port facilities of Hong Kong, plenty of places to eat and stay for a while.

Spectacular View of the Harbour in Hong Kong. This is my second time to Victoria Harbour. Went for both day and night. I personally find the day visit nicer. The night view can be seen from The Peak, which was better. So, if you are visiting, be sure to visit in the day. Lots of people around the area though, but able to see the central area from Victoria Harbour. I would recommend this place if this is your first time to Hong Kong. Or if you want to take a ferry across the harbour. Do visit here for at least once to enjoy the spectacular view.

Victoria Harbour. The place is really nice. You could overlook the other side from the sea. This is one of the best Hong Kong attraction and there are always so many tourist here. It is better to come on a clear day so you could see the nice view, when it is cloudy and rainy you cannot really see much from this side.

Bright lights at the Harbour at Night!. We were hoping to see the 3D show but not shown during the time we were there. Symphony of lights only. The harbour was packed with people. The teens were not amazed with the light show.
Must do. We spent a lot of time along the harbour front. It is a must see at night, especially the light show.

Pretty average. OK the view from the victoria harbour looking across to HK island side was great but that's about it. The harbour precinct when we visited in Jan 2015 had scaffold and platforms scattered around the area making the precinct very unattractive and untidy. In fact, the area needs to be cleaned up thoroughly.

view and cruising in Victoria Harbour. we took ferry from Hong Kong island to Kaulong, the 10 minutes ferry is excellent when we arrived in KauLong we walked on the movie stars bluvd to see HK Skycrapers
Tourist attraction. A very nice place to get a good city scape photos. Better come in the afternoon to get the blue hour time before the evening and all the building lights is on
Totally awesome!. A must go place at night! The view is absolutely stunning! I took the Star Ferry ride from Central over. Very beautiful.
spectacular view. cross the harbour by star ferry and you'll get the most exciting view of Hong Kong skyline from both side to Kowloon and Hong Kong island.

My Favourite View. A view you don't ever forget. Every time I come to Hong Kong I make an effort to go down to Victoria Harbour and either cross on the Star Ferry or stroll along the waterfront. Some of the best views you will get from along the Avenue of Stars and the walkway past that along the waterfront. We also had high tea at the InterCon this time which offers a great view of the harbour - highly recommended. Let's be honest, you can't go to Hong Kong without seeing the iconic harbour at least once.

Wow!! What an experience.... Had a great cocktail cruise in the victoria harbour with the symhony of lights. one just cant miss. The views are spectacular one can enjoy the skyline on either sides. Highly recommended.

Especially Good at weekends. The weekends especially from the Kowloon side is good, entertainment, boats of all sizes coming in nand out....the views of HK Island are especially good and then a journey on the Star ferry or On HK ferry to the other islands. Still one of the best City views in the world.
Great view. The harbour provide great view to the opposite island. Great place to relax and stroll along and watch bands performing when available.

What a view!. What's there to say other than this may be one of the most impressive views of any city in the world. You are surrounded by tall buildings! I prefer the view from the Kowloon side, but you should check out both while you are in town.
Lovely Relaxing Harbour. Well worth a trip out on a boat or at least a walk around either side of the Harbour. Enjoy the clear days and away from the hustle and bustle...

New Year Fireworks. Seeing the NY in from a boat in the middle of Victoria Harbour was a lot of fun.There were about 25 of us on board and a local Thai restaurant had prepared the food....lots to drink and eat and of course great views of the fireworks.The more people on board kept the cost down (HK$1000 per head)We departed from Pier 10 -Wrapped up warmly and enjoyed the mayhem of boats in the harbour.....docking after the fireworks was slightly chaotic as our captain tried to moor at Causeway Bay but -no space. Eventually, we motored back to Central (which was more convenient) All in all- great fun for all ages (not sure about toddlers!)

Very Charming. You can take the ferry (which is quite cheap by the way. But all transport in hK tends to be cheap) and go on a quick 5 min ride across the harbour and take alot of gorgeous pics. The harbour is well maintained and the views are amazing.
Take the Ferry. The ferry is affordable and economical to use cross harbor. Can be a little choppy depending on the weather so if you're prone to motion sickness you may want to use the MTR.
a must in hk. i wonder why i need to write about the harbour because all would encounter splendid view of the harbour regardless of day and night.

Attended the Laser Show and 3D Pulse Show. This a must visit. Be prepared for the crowd. You should be early to take a good spot otherwise you will have trouble viewing the show. The lights are best viewed from Kowloon.

great view of the city. the view of the harbor from Tsim Sha Tsui is nice, walking in the boardwalk along the Avenue of the stars (which are Chinese- of course). do not forget to look at the harbor at exactly 8PM everyday for the light dancer on the other bank of the harbor.

Fun place to go watch the Symphony of Lights!. From Victoria Harbour you can take a cruise around the bay to see the Symphony of Lights or just shop around Ocean Center / Gallery right across the street!

romantic at night, nice in day. good view of the night lights. very romantic and very nice in the day. it has a very good view as well in the day. buy an ice-cream, buy a drink. and enjoy the surroundings.
experience Victoria Harbour by STAR ferry. best to experience Victoria Harbour is via the STAR ferry, nostalgic ferries, cost only 3.40 HK $ per person

Love the view. We have been to Hong Kong many times and just sitting on the Harbour front in Kowloon viewing Hong Kong Island is a must. Best time is just before sun-set and stay long enough for near darkness. For first time visitors the harbour lights show is always good.

Best view of HK skyline. HK skyline is considered to be one of the best skylines with hundreds of sky scrapers located close to each other. Victoria harbor is the best place to get a beautiful view of this skyline. Be it day or night, this place will give you an amazing experience. If you prefer night lights, go there just before sunset.If you are in the Kowloon area, you can take a bus or an MTR to Tsim Sha Tsui station and follow the directions outside the station to walk to the Victoria Harbor. For the best view, you can book yourself on the Star Ferry that cruises in the sea every hour. There is a light and sound show (Laser lights from almost all the buildings on either side of the harbor) at 8 pm. For 210 HKD per person on the Star Ferry, this show might not be spectacular....but not bad either. We went to HK in December last week and for the three days we were there, it was cloudy. Infact the day we were at Victoria Harbor, it was drizzling. Ofcourse, the view was disrupted by the clouds, but was still very pretty with all the neon lights reflections dancing in the sea.

Stroll along the harbour. Take a walk along the harbour during sunset or at night to enjoy the best view. Great spot to take photos of the skyline. Best place I recommend is along the Avenue of Stars or the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade
great Experience..... Just loved the ferry ride and views all around this wonderful harbour.... did this several times and saw different things every time....
Best view in the world. I am very biased, but watching the harbour is one my favourite things ever. We went down to see the light show from Kowloon side this time which is much better.

A nice way to conclude your day with.. It was the penultimate spot in my itinerary for the day. And it was pleasant. All people gather over there and you could behold the entire HK island boasting off its tall sky kissing buildings. Neon lights all around. And as soon as the hour hand makes 120 degrees angle with the minute then begins the light and sound show. The clouds in the sky acts as the screen for those projectors throwing different shades of lights and forming a lot of caricatures. A bit relaxing. Not much but then you can't ignore it.

Really amazing experience. On a stop over I was told I must do Victoria Harbour and the Star Ferry and how right they were! An experience I will not forget going to and from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back again.
nice view. well, Victoria harbour is one of the HKG landmarks. so spend a couple of minutes when you are in the vicinity. It gives a good view of the building across the other side.
For a feel of the bustle of Hong kong.. How can a visit to Hong kong be complete without a visit to Victoria harbour. The busy waterways and boats and catemarans cross crossing are a sight to behold.

lights at night was amazing. always awesome every time at the edge of victoria harbor and watch the sparkling lights at night.
You can watch the symphony of lights on the avenue of stars at 8 pm.

Victoria Harbour. We travelled across the harbour a number of times on the Star Ferries and there was always something new to see during the day but it was even better at night on the harbour cruise - especially during the laser show.
great views. the harbor offers great views! Can get crowded but is worth a visit just to see the buildings and boats
Love it. Love the Christmas lighting fr the building opposite the harbour. It's windy , and managed to see the sunset. A place where a lot of tourists too.

Light Show at the Harbour. The Harbour itself was very fun, the show in the evening a little disappointing. Good Idea, but not so well executed. If you want to see a good Lightshow, go to Disneyland Hongkong!
Especially for the vieuw on HK island. You have the best vieuw on the skyline of HK island, additionally the atmosphere is good. Just have a walk over the promenade among all the other tourists.
One of the Worlds Best. Very busy, beautiful, and productive harbors in the world. Beautiful to see, and especially to cross, or cruise...

Not spectacular, but still beautiful.. When booking our trip to Hong Kong earlier this year, my friends and I were constantly being told to visit Victoria Harbour to see the light shows that occur at night. I think this may have led to fairly high hopes, which left us a little disappointed once we saw it first hand. The lights are colourful and pretty but nowhere near as spectacular as I had imagined. Despite this, the harbour itself is still a lovely place to visit - especially if you are dining in one of the nearby restaurants. Many of the restaurants in the higher levels of buildings boast spectacular views of the harbour, which makes for a nice backdrop at dinner.

The laser light show. This place is nicer and more romantic in the evening when all the buildings are lighted up. The laser show should not be missed, but it doesn't seem as spectacular as it once was many years back.

Just a bunch of skycrapers. The HK Skyline has been said to be among the best and it is not different. The atmosphere is electric - the buildings are all dressed up in lights - at the same time, they are just a bunch of skyscrapers across the Harbour. It can be worth a visit - but is not a real tourist attraction as such.

Romantised place. Perhaps we have been sold on the idea of the beautiful Victoria Harbour night scenery so it was a let-down when we visited. No doubt that all the skyscrapers and buildings are dressed up in neon lights but it's no different from other Asian cities like Tokyo or Singapore.

Must visit during Christmas!. All the lights are on during Christmas which will offered the best view from HK island. However walking along the road on Kowloon side is another experience that you will be very close to all those great lightening works.
One of the best night view. A good location for a night view and worth a short visit. There is also a short light show from the building around the area.
Amazing. Most of my family come from Hong Kong and this still maybe the best view ever. Could sit for hours watching the world go by with a lovely warm breeze. Absolutely amazing.
Very good & value for money.. The harbour offers an amazing view of Hong Kong city. Coffee shop was decent except for the rest rooms.Light show post sunset was awesome!
Beautiful. I come from Sydney a harbour city of world renown. I am very proud of my city but Victoria harbour is right up there with it. Great place

Symphony of light. Every day of the year, starting at 8:00pm, there is a light and sound show that incorporates many of the buildings visible from the waterfront on either side of Victoria Harbour. We viewed it from the esplanade on the Kowloon side, looking across to HK city. It was spectacular! It is, of course, free! Do yourself a favour and make the time to see this spectacular show.

Spend time to explore. Do spend time around and in the harbour. We took 2 different boat trips to learn about the history. One tip get the star ferry over to Kowloon and watch the light show from the ferry amazing..

Amazing View. the view is amazing which is a must go when you go to hongkong. Be it in the day or at dusk plus the night view is stunning if you want to relax after the long day travel. If you plan to cross the water not by road, take the star ferry which is very cheap and efficient. It will cost you hkd2.50 only !! Plus if you have the octopus card, it will be very easy to just swipe the card rather than looking for change in you wallet.

Always Breathtaking. It is my fourth time to Hong Kong and Victoria Harbour never fail to awe me with its breathtaking view. We took the Star Ferry from Central and went across to Tsim Sha Tsui. Once we arrived, everyone were busy snapping pictures or asking people to snap their photo to record the beautiful skyline and neon lights filled buildings. The harbour remind us of the Hong Kong dramas as they like to showcase the harbour. Then we waited till 8pm for the Symphony of Lights as laser lights are being displayed from the other side.

One of the Most attractive harbors in the world. The promenade walk at Tsim Sha Tsui affords an unparalleled view of the Victoria harbor. Taking a leisurely after dinner stroll is sure to feel very satisfying.

Magical Victoria Harbour. The ferry was so cheap and they run all the time. It is the most scenic way to see everything on Kowloon and Hong Kong Island Harbour. In the evenings make sure you go to Victoria Harbour for a really lovely lazer and colourful light show. All the buildings change colour and there were a lot of Christmas themed decoration lights on the buildings in November when we were there. Lots of the hotels are on the Harbour.

Spectacular harbour.. We crossed the harbour several times as it was only 3.5 HK Dollars, about 50c AUD. Great value and a scenic way to cross the harbour. You'd pay $10AUD or more to do the same trip on Sydney Harbour, so for 50c found it very affordable with great photo opportunities. We took the Star Ferry from both Wan Chai and Central and they both dock Tsim Sha Tsui on the other side, so take care on your return trip to get on the right ferry.

Star Ferry. Take the Star Ferry. It is cool. The view from the Victoria Harbor is great. It is really cheap. The views from the water add to your experience of why you came all the way to Hong Kong for.

It's all about and around the Harbour. Victoria Harbour is the pivotal point of all of Hong Kong. Albeit Kowloon or Hong Kong Island. You can take the Star Ferry to cross from one side to the other, Or you can take the subway which is the cleanest subway I have ever experienced.Also, sail around on a JUNK (Red Dragon boats) at Sunset for a very fun way to experience Victoria Harbour

Stunning during the day, Breathtaking at Night. Being one of the busiest harbors in the world it truly is amazing to just sit back and watch the maritime traffic take place. And then at the night when everything lights up, it will take your breathe away!
Please keep the harbour for its beautiful scenery. Treasury of Hong Kongers, night view is amazing!! Feel relax with sea breeze.dislike: sometimes it's too crowded...and very noisy
Stunning!. The light show is amazing and the skyscrapers are so huge and take your breath away. Go at 8pm for the lightshow.

The best night scenery in the world. I am sure the Victoria Harbour is the best in the world.
Full of skyscrapers and colourful lighting.
You can even see a light show at 20:00 every night.
Beautiful !. Nice to walk along this harbor .. we went there at 6 am in the morning to go to Avenue of Stars .. very beautiful scenery/view
Super night view!. Best way to view victoria harbour is to spend the night at one of the hotels opposite it. You get to see Hongkong night lighting in its true sense.

Hongkong landmark!!. Victoria habour is the raisin d'etre..The deep waters between Hongkong island and the Kowloon Peninsula....this area one of famous location for Hongkong films with famous star like Jacky Chan, Bruce Lee, Jet lee etc...beautiful view
Take a stroll along the Avenue of the Stars. Nice views both day and night. Along the boardwalk, there are handprints of famous Chinese actors. It reminds me a little of Hollywood.

Foggy night view. The night when we visited was foggy, thus, the laser lights were not very sharp and clear.
The music played during the show did not excite the crowd and not captivating.

Must-if no crowd. This is the 3rd time I visited this place and the only time I truly appreciate the night view and beauty of this place. There were scarcely any tourists to block the view and sound pollution. The last two times when I went a few years back, were packed with people, you have to navigate among the crowd to walk. If that is the situation, I advise you to turn back. When the place is more peaceful (no crowd), then must go.

Great place to relax and enjoy the view. What a nice place to cool down on a warm night in Hong Kong.Just take the camera and get ready for a selfie or two.The skyline of Hong Kong is second to none. Look at the boats and ships that cross in front of you and enjoy the fresh air.Don't forget to come back during day time.

It's Christmas time so check out the lights . Many of the buildings now have covered themselves with lights so go down and check out the light show. It's a concrete jungle yes but it's something worth looking at both day and night.
Nice View. Nice view of the harbor.Must see at night when all the lights are going.Kinda romantic if you have your sweety with you.Nothing special but just ok!
nice night view. The night and day view from Tsim sha Tsui (Avenue of Star) is great. You can try to take star ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui, the view is nice and the ferry fare is very cheap.
City sky line. It;s all about the view. And what a view, the buildings, the harbor and boats. The old Ferries. Just loved it.

Stunning. Going across on the Star Ferry gives you a flavour but if you have time take the ferry to Cheung Chow which gives you a much bigger picture. Cheung Chow is how Hong Kong used to be and the food in the fish restaurants is well worth going for.
Beautiful Harbour in a magnificent City!. Victoria Harbour in the City is a must see - high end shopping and lots of places to eat and people watch.

What a ride!. The best view of Hong Kong is from Victoria Harbour. My preferred way is to take the Star Ferrywhich goes from two places on Hong Kong Island (Wan Chai and Central) to Kowloon across the Harbour. The cost is $2.50HK or $3.40HK on weekends which is about 30 - 50 cent US. At this price you can ride it several times. They also offer harbour tours which are very reasonable as well. The views are great with so many tall buildings, ships and boats of all sizes. Catch the light show every evening from the Kowloon side. I'm not really in to light shows, but this is worth it and it's free.
Stunning Light of HK. The Hong Kong skyline comes alive at night. Boat trip was part of a tour but the timing was great as it wasn't too long or too short. Very enjoyable with Tour East.
breath taking. I wish I did the tour of the Harbor but I just didn't have enough time on this trip. but the views of Lantau and Hong Kong Island are amazing.

A Great Way to See Victoria Harbor. I enjoy taking the Star Ferry from Central to TST or Wanchai to TST to have a great view and appreciation of the Victoria Harbor. If you take the ferry in the evening, especially around Christmas and New Year's time, one would get the spectacular view of the harbor lights and beautiful decorations. A great and inexpensive way to view Victoria Harbor.
Great Please in Hong Kong. This harbor showes the city from one its best sides. Must see place. There are lot of things to see and were you can take great pictures as a free takeaway.

Best way is seeing by ferry. Remember when I was a child, I was brought by dad crooning hype harbour by Star Ferry. When start working in Central, I had to cross the harbour by Star Ferry too. This time when I travelled again, I still preferred the lower deck, not just paying a little less, but really gives you direct view or touch to Victoria Harbour, which most people will think stand higher will look more. This is not the case. For upper deck is all surrounded and window is high to block you away from the scene. Lower deck, though hotter with sense of machine oil, it gives you nearer distance no blocking to Victoria Harbour. No matter day or night, the view is fantastic!

Most romantic harbour in the world. If there is one single thing you must do in Hong Kong, this is the one! I have no doubt to recommend you to take a ride on Star Ferry to see the beautiful harbour scene. It is cheap, and in particular at night, the view of the two sides of the harbour is by far the most beautiful one in the world. Take your love one there. Extremely romantic!

Pictorial waterway. The harbor is beautiful and generally very crowded with vessels moving every which way. There has been a substantial reclamation of the harbor but has been limited in recent years. Star ferry is a must to cross the harbor from HK island to TST. On weekend, private charter boats take guest out to the coves for swimming and BBQ's.

Enjoy a night view of 1 million Hong Kong dollars. I remember an old movie when I climb here.Though the noon is good, after all the night night view is indispensable.Love Is a Many-Splendored Thing.It's the April rose that only grows in the early springLove is nature's way of giving a reason to be livingThe golden crown that makes a man a kingOnce on a high and windy hillIn the morning mist two lovers kissedAnd the world stood stillThen your fingers touched my silent heartAnd taught it how to singYes true love's a many splendored thing.from 1955

The Significant Image of Hong Kong. No comment, just go! Go to STS.The best schedule is go there at around 5 and take the picture of sunset, go to harbor city to have a meal and back to see the night view of harbor. Enjoy the night of silence, depend on how many tourists...
Hong Kong Old Harbour. Many cruises and ferry commence from this point, if your are lucky you can see a big cruise boarding with Hongkong Island as a background

A place i used to visit everyday. A great place to see the Hong Kong front line so whatever the weather go there and try to see even once the light show usually after 8 pm :)http://www.discoverhongkong.com/
Crowded. Loved the clock tower and the shopping experience there. However, area is full of rich chinese (China) tourists and their behavior is rather unruly at times.
Incredible. An amazing harbour to see. Best way is to catch the Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central and walk along either shoreline. Always beautiful at day or night.

Magnificent. Still a lot of work going on here, many new buildings going up and beautification in progress but this takes nothing away from the beauty of the harbour, a must do is a night harbour cruse.

Take the Star Ferry. Enjoyable ferry ride across and back, but don't forget to also take the Sky Tram. The harbor is constantly busy and beautiful at night. We were not to impressed with the laser light show each night.

As long a walk as you want. You can walk all the way from Hong Hom to West Kowloon Promenade. The central part includes the Star Ferry and Ocean terminals. There is currently quite a lot of building work going on around the new West Kowloon terminus which has temporarily blocked some of the walkways / promenades. These are so useful and used by so many - apparently all day - for running, jogging , walking and Tai Chi. Great views at night across to the Island. The Star Ferry is an inexpensive and worthwhile trip.

Harbour Of Endless Pictures. Go to the Kowloon side, take a selfie at the waterfront of Tsim Sha Tsui from early morning and on to the night, stroll along Avenue of the Stars and wait for the 8pm symphony of lights show ... photo ops is varied and endless. Take the short but very enjoyable Star Ferry ride across the harbor towards the central island and witness the beauty of the harbor, from either sides and onto the waterways, the sail boats, motorized ships, and cruise liner that ply along its length ... take a snap as you past sail every wave. Picture perfect with HK skyline at the backdrop. Now at Central HK, find your spot, enjoy every pose as you focus the lens .... pictures at the harbor is definitely endless.
Great place to visit day or night. Love the area vibrant and colourful. Litteraly. Nice stall that sells cooked squid either end in the evenings. Good light show and plenty to do afterwards.
Good worth the walk. we visted the Harbour twice, both times on food and saw the amazing laser lights as well at 8 pm, great shopping mall, and lots to see and watch.

Lots to see. We went several times across the harbour on the Star Ferry, very enjoyable. Also great views of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Lots of working boats, ferries and cruise ships to see as well as all the tourist boat tours.
Amazing views at night. The Sky Ferry gives you a beautiful view of the skyline for about $3HK. It takes about 12 minutes, and they seem to run often. A must do activity in HK

Fab deepwater view. We stayed at Conrad and Intercontinental Hong Kong. Two nights each. We Love Hong Kong and had a fabulous time.we had the hurricane blow through which inhibited us from going to our plan"Ocean Park" but we still had very acceptable weather and thoroughly enjoyed the visit. Some rain, but expected in Hong Kong. Really a first pick. Enjoy
Awesome night view, but the laser is just so so for me. I come from HK and this is one of the most famous tourist spot. Worth to visit. The laser show starts at 8 if anyone interested
amazing views. I could have spent hours here taking photographs, day and night. Loved taking the ferry across the harbour and watching the lights come on at sunset was amazing

Amazing Harbour... It is one of the best and amazing harbour. The harbour is always busy. It is good place to relax or walk besides the waterfront. There is also ferry service running from harbour. The laser show is also very good.

Spectacular view. You can see spectacular view from the harbor. It's more fun to take the ferry ride to Kowloon and view Hong Kong from the other side. The ferry ride itself is rather romantic and best done at night time.

Brilliant. One of the world's most amazing harbours. Always busy, with such and variety of vessles, from cruise ships, Star Ferry, junks, sampans and lighters carrying the latest piece of soil to fill in some landfill somewhere. Best seen from either side or the Peak Lookout, but especially at night, at 8pm for the sound and light show.
WOW. Do not miss the harbour and laser light show. The harbour front was a wonderful place to walk and look at the people and the buildings.

Great place. This was one of my favorite places during this visit to Hong Kong. In all previous visits I have never done touristy things, but having my family with me this time, I sort of had to. We did the Victoria Harbour on the second day in HK and we had an absolute blast. Lots of things to see and do while at the harbor, so definitely a great place to visit and highly recommended.
Harbor cruise, a must. just take a one hour cruise around Victoria harbor to see both sides of the shoreline and experience what most city dwellers here take for granted...
must do. we crossed the harbor at night on the Star Ferry. Great views of Hong Kong and HK Island. If we had been in HK longer, I would have liked to take the Aqua Luna during the day.
Catch a ferry and get out there.. Get on the ferry and enjoy your ten minute ride to and from the island from Tsim Sha Tsui. Great views day and night.

A must see when in Hong Kong. This is a great place to go on your first day in hong kong. You'll have an exceptional view of the hong kong island skyline. You can watch the lights and sound show from here at night. they have a nice viewing deck for an elevated view of hong kong island.
Harbour view. A must see in Hong Kong, make sure you do it both day time and night time. I like the Star Ferry ride at night, the view was spectacular.

Fabulous night views. Light show and night views of lighted buildings across the harbour is a sight to behold. Seen it many times and dont get tired of it. Best of all its free if you walk along the promenade from Avenue of Stars all the way to the Ferry terminal to North Point HK.

Like a port!. Great to view from the peak and exciting to look at from a boat. Harbor tours are well organized and a treat!
Looking at the amount of ships passing and being docked....great!

lovely view and a fun light show. the light show wasn't quite as cool as I was expecting, but we still enjoyed it. A good time just to be with a crowd and see the many buildings city lights put to good use.
Panoramic view. Could find a few spots that offered panoramic view of the Hong Kong Island. Took the Star Ferry across to view the Kowloon side. Cloudy day covered some of the tall buildings.
Great affordable tour. Super tour! Hour long tour of the harbor. A recording explains the history and landmarks surrounding the harbor. A must see.
Awesome Night Light Show.. Viewed light show from middle of harbor, it was well worth the effort. It's a must see, there is nothing else like. The view of the harbor in the day light is impressive

Gorgeous!. It looks the best when you are on the Kowloon side. Try to go at night when the sky is clear. There are things to do here as well, museums, etc. The walk of fame is also located here. There is a light show that takes place at night as well, we were not super impressed by the light show though. If you want to see it, they do 2 shows per night.

Victoria harbour . Such a beautiful place , lots to see , the Hollywood walk is really nice , lots of statues the famous Bruce lee statue is there right on the water , I love it ... U can see the whole harbour
The most beautiful night view in the world!. The most fantistic night view that I ever seen in the world. Difficult to find a place better than this!

Watching the ships go by is a great way to spend he day. The best way to see the harbor is from a suite at the Inercontinetal where one can lie in comfort, watch tv in an air conditioned room and watch the ships pass outside the large expanse of windows

Amazing Views - don't miss this.. There is nothing more breath taking than a visit to Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong.The skylines, the busy activities on the water with boats moving people and cargo between Hong Kong island and Kowloon - this is an atmosphere that you must experience.There are many trips that you cna take from the harbour on the ferry's that go between the islands - even Macau is only 40 minutes away on a ferry is a great island that often gets forgotten in the bustling lifestyle of Hong Kong.Use the harbour well - it opens up so many possibilities while you are in the Far East.

Great view of the skyline. Crossing Victoria Harbour is a very pleasant experience on the ferry. It is quite cheap and runs so regularly that you hardly notice any wait time. The journey across is quite quick too. A great way of getting around Hong Kong.
Spectacular architecture. The cityscape of Hong Kong from both sides of Victoria Harbour is breathtaking, especially at night!

Best of Skylines. The harbour gives the best view of the Hong Kong skylines. Great statues on the harbour way, with the hand prints of the Stars. Have a look at the Symphony of Lights show in the dark, for the best experience ever.
Busy but for a reason. Any time of day seems to be busy but great views of Hong Kong island, wander down the avenue of stars, see the light show at night or take in the scenery for photos

Spectacular. Victoria Harbour. - they are at it again; there's some more reclamation going on near the Wan Chai area. But on a lovely day who cares - the views across this harbour are spectacular; whichever side it is seen from - the Island side or Kowloon side. There are tour boats but my view is that the Star Ferry boats are the best way to see the harbour and there are options on the routes from Central or Wan Chai or Hung Hom. And, of course, the Star Ferry has a special place in HK history - it's an icon of HK development and transportation so a trip is a must.And however good the daytime crossing is that do a crossing at night when all the 'neons' are lit up; spectacular. The views across the harbour are especially good at night even if you don't make a ferry crossing. And it's all FOC -plus there's a laser light show each evening at 8.00pm. Another touch of the spectacular. One can spend as little time or as long a time as one wants - all depends on how the mood takes you.

Container Ships to Junks. Fascinating to watch the harbour and the variety of traffic. From small fishing vessels, to junks to the largest container ships -- there is always something interesting to watch.

Busy and Amazing. The views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon are amazing. Travel by boat or the Ferry or bus it or use the MTR - How amazing going under the harbour in the MTR - think about it whilst your doing it - astounding ENJOY

Gorgeous night or day. Take the Star ferry (great value!) for an enjoyable crossing of this beautiful harbor during the day, or find a high spot to get a panoramic view of the lights at night. Walk along the Avenue of the Stars and you may be treated to the sight of a junk plying the waters of this most gorgeous harbor. This attractive harbor is what makes Hong Kong the world class attraction that it is.

The Views are Spectacular!. This review is quite late. I did a a cruise at the Victoria Harbour on an old Chinese junk boat for less than one hour. From the junk boat you can watch the light show at 8pm, otherwise, you can do a short walk to the Avenue of Stars.

Getting smaller and smaller.... Over the years it has been reclaimed tremendously, and the current phase around Wanchai continues to the trend. However it remains scenic as ever, especially from TST side for the 8pm light show.
