Love the Star Ferry!. What an amazing and cheap way to see a bit of Hong Kong from the water! Victoria Harbour is amazing, very picturesque, and easy to hop to Kowloon for shopping. I was staying near the business district and loved the short ferry ride to shop and explore the other districts.
Stunning views. See Victoria harbour from the Star Ferry, an unforgettable 7 minute journey. Stunning at night but lovely in the daytime too.

Stunning views !!. Great atmosphere at the cornice with the view of this busy harbour...Many tourists from all corners of the planet
Luis Fernandez-Maldonado

Majestic. Extremely clean and highly recommend spending some quality time here.At 8pm, the best light show is shown and the best vantage spot is near the Avenue of stars, with Bruce Lee & Jackie Chan shown amongst others.

Ever changing picture. Just love this harbour! Have been on it coming back from one of the islands when it was just crammed with large and small vessels and also had a beautiful cruise at night in a fairyland.

connecting you all of Hong Kong & all the islands too!. organized, cheap and cheerful the victoria harbor is a great view point from TST looking out onto Hong Kong Island and also a great connecting point to lamma, lantau and macau islands. while I was there the infamous larger than life yellow rubber duck was floating about in the harbor definately worth a visit!

Wonderful experience. Take the boat for pennies and view both sides of the city. Very easy to walk around and safe at night. Lots of shopping and unsual markets and stores to visit. Don't miss the night markets and the flea markets. Hollywood Blvd has wonderful antique shops.

Enjoyable when Guandung's contribution (pollution from upwind sources) is not too great.. This is one of those places that is so heavily written about and photographed/videoed/painted that one is not surprised when viewing it. Like other such places (the Eifel Tower, the Grand Canyon. Niagara Falls), this perhaps detracts from the actual experience.If I had only viewed the Grand Canyon from its South Rim, I might have been bored. But the Grand Canyon is actually spectacular, and somewhat unexpected, if one visits the North Rim – which is not so media-hyped. Similarly for the Eifel Tower – which can be dramatic from some visual angles, such as when standing behind and around the Fountain of Warsaw, such as when standing on the Esplanade du Trocadero (where IMHO the combination of sight, sound, and sense of the water spray cannot be recreated by the media). One needs to maneuver quite a bit, IMHO, in order to find an unexpectedly impressive view of Niagara Falls, as that place has been so over-hyped. However, any view of Iguazu Falls is stupendous IMHO, because (1) it's stunning and (2) un-hyped and thus mostly unexpected.There is no shortage of impressive views of Hong Kong Harbour. And, fortunately, sounds and other senses factor into the enjoyment of that skyline. For me, unquestionably the best way to enjoy the harbour is to walk around the landward and island sides, and to ply between the two using the Star Ferry.But, unfortunately, the bad air caused by failures to control air pollution upwind (allegedly mostly over the border) gets in the way of this enjoyment all too often. That problem is not merely visual. It's also a health issue.Note to those responsible for monitoring and regulating air quality - apparently in Shenzen and elsewhere in Guandung Province: do your jobs, or stand aside for those who will do it in your place!

Victoria Harbour. While it's easier to take the subway back and forth between Kowloon and Hong Kong, if you've got time, do take the Star Ferry to catch a glimpse of how life used to be like. The harbor is not as busy as it used to be since much of the port areas are being built up outside the harbor area but it's still pretty impressive. At night, lit dragon boats filled with tourists fill the harbor in order to take in the light show--I got some pretty good photos of the boats on display.
The Oriental Pearl. It was so beautiful that it worth to visit at different level, you can go to the seafront, mid-level and even up to the peak to visit.

Beautiful. I almost cried because it was so beautiful. I cry easily, but even so...
You could spend hours here watching the many boats in the harbour and marvelling at Hong Kong's magnificent skyline. Words can't explain how much I loved this place. Do not miss it.

Stunning harbour...from the water, peak and restaurants. The harbor is one of the top attractions of Hong Kong for a reason. Although it would be nearly impossible to miss, seeing it in so many ways is stunning and lets you truly see Hong Kong. From the star ferry to checking it out from The Peak and restaurants to taking ferries to other surrounding islands, the harbor is key to Hong Kong and something that sets the city apart from other big cities in Asia and the world.

A Must See!. It doesn't really need explaining really. One does not simply go to Hong Kong without seeing the skyline across from Victoria Harbour.The best view is clearly looking on from Kowloon to HK Island. It's then you start to get the true scale of how large this city is.

Must visit!. Highly recommend visiting here. The view across the harbor to the otherside of Hong Kong is nice, though is a little foggy. I sat here for ages just looking across the water, it was such a peaceful place. The surroundings of the Harbor are also very pretty, so make sure you're not in a rush. Make sure you take the ferry ride from here too, for a cheap price. The views are amazing at night with all the lights

amazing colours at night. at night Hong Kong comes alive especially Victoria Harbour which, at 8pm, has a sound & light show with the skyscrapers on Hong Kong Island flashing on & off their colourful lights together with lasers. The star ferry comes backwards & forwards across Victoria Harbour between Hond Kong & Kowloon with its two floors it's great fun & very cheap.

A place listed at travel guide. This is one of the attraction listed in travel guide, so by default we will not miss it.Nothing to hightlight. Just a very normal Harbour with Hong Kong typical view which is full of skyscrapers. If you have time, you could consider to come. If you are having tight schedule, no harm to give it a miss.
Dream. View from the harbour in the evening is just amazing . One can sit for hours and gaze around . Evenings breeze is very refreshing .
Excellent. The harbor views are gorgeous especially at night. If you can take a dinner cruise or the ferry across the harbor.Walking along the waterfront is enjoyable in the evenings.

Amazing place. Victoria Harbour is brilliant. The ferries crisscross the harbour regularly and there are always working ships on the move. The light show every night is great to see utilising, as it does, some of the taller buildings surrounding the water.

Super Experience!. Victoria Harbour is amazing both during the day and evening. The skyline from the Kowloon side is spectacular. The walkway on the Kowloon side provides the beautiful water views and eating establishments to continue to take in the sights of the harbour. A great experience is to hop on the small vessels that give you some insight into life on the Harbour. You can see, first hand, the fishing community and how they make their home on the water. Can't miss the experience at night. Breathtaking!!

A picturesque skyline!. Although we had travelled on the Star Ferry on a previous trip- it is simply one of the most uplifting settings to be enjoyed while here! So we did this once again! The Homg Kong Harbor is an "Experience" in itself! Regardless of time, and city growth and changes, there is a magic to this area that exudes beauty, sophistication, and adrenalin charging feelings! And to see it at night! My husband and I have been in many cities however none can yet compare to this setting! Our final night in Hong Kong was spent in a restaurant/bar on Central, once gain overlooking this starry lit harbor, and knew it was the most beautiful way to end our SE Asia trip!

Take the Star Ferry to see it.. I think the Victoria Harbour has one of the most beautiful skylines in the world. Going up to the Peak on HK side, you'll get a great view of the whole harbour or get really close and soak it up on the Star Ferry (it costs very little and is also very relaxing).

Beautiful HK. Victoria Harbour is so unique. The sky line is impressive & beautiful, so it's great to go there just before dusk & linger awhile.It's also nice to experience it at 8 pm, when the "laser light show" begins for a quick 15 min.

Victoria Harbour, I would not recommended. It's getting smaller, it used to be a very pleasant crossing using the Star ferry from Central towards Tsim Sai Tsui, at least 20 min journey but now it's getting much closer. I think one day it will be disappeared all together because of the land reclamation that the HK Government decided to build more road on the water fronts instead of leave it as it is! What a shame really :(
Victoria harbour. Absolutely fabulous. Must see both in day time and night time. Time will just pass by without you realising it. Ships and boats sailing through itself is exciting.

People Mover. Victoria Harbour is the hub of Kowloon and many people live in Hong Kong but work in Kowloon so the Star Ferry transports them daily. There is much to see in Victoria Harbour including the museum and of course the light show at 8PM on both sides of Victoria Harbour.
All day going back and forward. The star ferry crossing at sunset has to be one of the best journeys in the world..just wanted to keep going back and forth.

Feel on the AIR...Wow..lovely ..excited moments. it is a nice experience lovely atmosphere though the crowd disturbs.. to feel the calm wind with exciting arrangements of buildings look.. more enjoying..spot LIGHTS music .. breeze .. cruise .. boats .. feel on the air must enjoy the spot both day and night

Pretty Impressive!. We went there one night as we heard so many good things about this place. It was a Friday night so the place was jammed pack with people. The very cool thing about it, is the view you have from the city with all the lights on, very spectacular in my opinion. We tried to get on the cruise that takes you around the harbour in an hour, but we got there too late. Overall, definitely worth your time even just to go down there and take a few pics.

Don't expect much. It's very crowded.
Be there before 8pm to watch the Symphony of Lights. We went there twice. Don't expect too much. The first time was boring. The 2nd time was a lot better, we enjoyed it.

One of the best Harbors in the world. Hong Kong harbor is frenetic during the day with many types of vessels going up and down and across the waterway. These vessels carry everything from shipping containers destined for all parts of the world to passengers on cruise ships and gambling ships.At night the lights from HK island create a wonderful site as does the laser light show from Kowloon to HK island bouncing from building to building. Quite a sight to see, especially if you are in a restaurant or on the "Walk of Fame" on the mainland side between the ferry terminal and the Kowloon Shangri-La hotel.
Good way for Star Ferry rides. In Hong Kong, a must try for their cross-channel transport system, it's really cheap crossing Victoria Harbour at approximately 8 minutes.

Quintessential Hong Kong. You visit New York City to see the Statue of Liberty, London to see Big Ben...Hong Kong to see Victoria Harbour. I've seen it a thousand times in photos/video, but in person it is truly magical. The best time to visit is around dusk as the buildings start to turn on their lights. Views from both Hong Kong Island or Kowloon are excellent along with views from aboard a ferry.
Most beautiful city around!. Victoria Harbour has beautiful views of the city which was awarded the worlds most scenic harbour! If you visit Hong Kong you can't miss it!!

amazing. we took a boat ride at lunch time around the harbour and it was amazing , we took some amazing pictures and it was one of the best boat rides i have ever done , 5pm would also be a good time to do this

Beautiful lights. Hong Kong harbour can be seen beautifully from the Star Ferry for a minimal cost (on the direct to and fro route to Kowloon, using your Octopus card) and at around 8.30pm the light show on the Kowloon foreshore adds to the attraction. To top it off try a drink at the Intercontinental Hotel bar - though beware their drinks are expensive and they have a flag fall for non resident guests!

Great views. Great views of the Hong Kong skyline from the Harbour.On a clear day you can see right across to Hong Kong Island and see the vast skyline. In the evening, all the building are lit up illuminating the vast skyline.Recommend getting the Star Ferry across to the island. A nice cheap way to see the skyline although there can be a lot of boat traffic.

Victoria Harbour. The harbour looked specular every evening with all the buildings all lit up at nite. The ferries all come in here to take people to Kowloon. Go here to view the daily laser and lights show to get amazing views of the light show at 8pm.

Beautiful Harbour Views from the Top Level of Ocean Terminal. I was there last Saturday late afternoon and had the fortune of capturing the Star Ferry Pier and the skyscrapers on the island being flooded with golden light, using my iPhone6 lens. Standing there on the top of the Ocean Terminal commands an excellent position to appreciate the beautiful views and to take pictures - undisturbed by the flow of pedestrians below. There are many cafes and restaurants inside the Ocean Terminal/Harbour City complex when one is tired and thirsty.Definitely worth visiting.
Lovely. The harbour is lovely to see at night whilst the light show is on, even the protestors that are there cant spoil it.

The Chinese know how to light up their cities!. Hong Kong Harbour is nothing short of magnificent! Whether from the top of Victoria Peak or watching the Symphony of Light every evening, you will be impressed.

Star ferry Victoria harbor cruise. Took this star ferry harbor cruise, you can buy tickets in the star ferry terminal in Kowloon or Hong Kong side and it is about an hour and included in your ticket drink and cookies or pastry or chips. If you are senior, it is discounted. Really a nice way to see Hong Kong and Kowloon buildings and some landmarks.

It was a harbor.... It was worth seeing, but how could you miss it if you did anything else there? Views were worth seeing from both sides but unless you catch a clear/sunny day, better at night. Tons of boat traffic, but as a separate tourist stop item?
Amazing... Nice place to visit... Its amazing to visit victoria harbour, everyone visiting to Hongkong, is definitely going to Victoria Harbour....
Nice views. Took the Star Ferry, nice views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Star Ferry is fast, cheap and easy.
Excellent city view. Better to be on top at 5PM to make day and night photos. Bubba Gump is the good place for dinner, good food and Margarita coctails.
Star ferry. It's the best ( and cheapest ) trip in HK with stunning views at a really cheap price, liked the short trip across the harbour

Victoria Peak Walk a Must. On a clear day, this one-hour walk is worth the tram fee. As others have stated, the views of an urban skyline and harbor are stunning on a clear day yet you feel above it all in a quiet tranquil setting. However, pick a week day as I hear that weekends can be crowded with locals and the walking path is not that wide. I highly recommend this walk. It is a good change from the crowded but stimulating streets of Kowloon and Hong Kong.
Happening Place. Happening place on weekend... Was good to see so many people and so many activities happening..Was very livelyt place...

Gorgeous view- never gets old!. Amazing view- always gets me every time! Have to take pictures even though I already have on each previous trip. Go to dinner somewhere you can take it all in- the light show is fun!

My 2nd favourite harbour. Always loved the Victoria Harbour ever since flying into Hong Kong the 1st time many years ago and seeing the junk boat in the harbour in sunset from the air. The harbour had a unique charm and I can't get enough of the Star Ferry. The skyline (looking from Kowloon side to the Hong Kong island) was stunning. The night laser show was a bit disappointing though. Could be that the night we went there it was a bit smoggy so the laser light could not cut through very well.

Fascinating harbour!. It's all a very impressive sight with the light shows, ferry cruises along the river, the reflective coloured skyscrapers and the Avenue of Stars.Should defintely be visited in both daylight and in the evening. A bit too crowded with tourists in the evening.

A full waste. a stinky dirty harbour is waiting for your arrival, nothing to watch, no sea animals, no fun except a tiring boresome experience, avoid it, i am sure you can find better options for your recreation

Catch the Friday night light show if you can.... Friday nights (sure time depends on time of year) the buildings light up and start to 'talk' to one another. If you can see it from your hotel room--all the better!
must go. The amazing harbour is the place to visit. And do not forget to see the light show at 8pm on all buildings of both side of the harbour.
ideal for evening walks. Victoria harbor is at its best after sunset. The colourful reflections of sky scrappers, Ferry cruises, Symphony of lights show adds charm to harbor's beauty.

the sea fairy. I will always remember the first sight of the great harbour from our Hotel room after we checked in. The Victoria Harbour should be seen both at night and the day as it unfurls its layers of beauty at different times of the day. With the magnificent HK skyline bowing from both sides, the queen among the harbours is an epitome of beauty. There are different ferry rides available but we chose the Star ferry to cross it at night. for more enthusiastic visitors, there are harbour cruises available.

The lights, the boats, the camera.... The evening was warm for us in October and so when we walked along the shore, we couldn't help thinking that it was one of the most wonderful nights of our life. The moving large boats make such a great background for photographs. You must take the time and take this walk.
Great views. Has great views of all the boats arriving from all over Asia, including Hong Kong Island, but is also very close to tall the designer shops

Star Ferry around the Harbour. We booked tickets for the 1 hour boat trip around the harbour - cost approximately £7:00 each ( including a drink and biscuits) for a 'concession' fare. The tour includes a commentary to highlight the history, buildings and piers on both sides of the harbour. Overall, this was a value for money trip and an excellent way to spend an hour on the famous Srar Ferries.

Busy harbour. It is incredible the amount of boats that cross the river day and night. From Hong Kong island to Kowloon it takes only 10min, but the ride can be a little rough, due to the waves caused by the boats. Anyway, an unforgettable experience.
Beautiful setting. Even with the foggy days, the Harbour is ver special and with so much history. A great place to visit in the fall of the year.

Amazing. An absolute must see - come to Hong Kong and skip on that is unforgivable!Totally magnificent view, especially at night and if looked at from one of the local bars in Kowloon =). Just take a quick and cheap Star Ferry from Wan Chai or Central to Tsim Sha Tsui, walk up the Alley of Stars and just look the other side of the bay really - great memories are guaranteed.

Beautiful night time scenery. A place you really need to visit when in Hong Kong. Stunning by night, exciting by day. Try the ferry, it's cheap easy to use and fun. Some great photos can be snapped at night.
nice view. nice harbor view. the light show wasn't as spectacular as it had been advertised though.
Ever changing Skyline. The Harbour changes every time we travel there with new buildings popping up and the night time light show is well worth a look.

You cant leave HK without seeing this view. Ideal to go on couple or alone, there is many sits around where you can just relax with the amazing view. I personally prefer it at night, where all the building lights ignite like fireworks. It is really amazing.
Different views at Day and Night. Best viewed from Kowloon side but the new park on reclaimed land will give Central and equally grand view.

Nice view. Victoria Harbour offers every tourist a nice view of HK's skyline. Here, you can also visit other landmarks such as The Avenue of the Stars and the museum. It's nicer to visit in the morning because there are less people. At night, it gets too crowded because almost everyone's there for the Light Show. Don't bother with the light show. Far from spectacular, it's actually mediocre.There are nice spots to view the harbour and make sure to walk the whole promenade. The breeze is refreshing and the view is nice.

Action on the water every day.. This harbour is an active place with ferries, ships, sailing boats, tugs and dredges all using the same water area. A great sight from elevated vantage points like hotel higher floors but also great from The Avenue of Stars promiade.

Heaven for 2 bucks. Evening light show from over star ferry is a delight.. Cross the Harbor for awesome street food..
The memorable 15 min ride will stay with you forever.

What a magical place. Many attractions are part / sit in Victoria Harbour, the promenade, the star (and other) ferries, the skyline ... it all makes for a wonderous place, especially when you are blessed with an amazing sunset on your very first evening (as we were). Splurge for a nice harbour cruise, or simply hop on the star ferry to get a great HK experience.
Star Ferry. It's really just a simple, old ferry but it provides amazing views of downtown and Kowloon. And it's so cheap! We did a few trips at various times - be sure to do one at night.

Best at Night. Took the Star ferry across to hong kong island about 10 to 15 minute trip, some great sights to be seen wish we had done it at night as everything is lite up. We were going to ride the ding ding tram over there but due to the protesters we were advised to stay away.

Beautiful View. Beautiful skyline view of the harbour. One of the deepest natural harbours in the world. At night there is a laser light and sound show over the harbour. Pretty to walk the promenade and watch.

Great Place to watch the light show. Make sure you get here early to watch the evening light show. We saw it on a foggy evening but it still was neat to see. The other place to do it is jump on a ferry

A must do in HK. This was worth the effort, very enjoyable and easy to get to. From the ferry ride across the harbour to the condola train ride to the top, the views at the top are spectacular with some very interesting history of the landmarks around HK.

Definitely a highlight of Hong Kong. To take a Star ferry ride across Victoria Harbour after dark is truly amazing. The serenity of the ferry is in stark contrast to the light show afforded by a myriad of high rise buildings. This trip deserves it's place in the world top 50 bucket list
Loved the light and sound show. Every night at 8pm. Coordinated light show from the skyscrapers on both sides of the harbour. But, it is best to view from the Kowloon side, near the avenue of stars.
Historic ride.... The Star Ferry is a trip back in time but regularly crosses the bay from Kowloon to Central. The ferries themselves have changed little since their first inception

Spectacular. Spectacular and ever changing views of the Harbour and light show at night time. Simply stunning ! Loved everything about it!
Nothing to dislike!!
What a view. The view, the lights, the buildings, the boats, the ferries, the water - fantastic. Has to be one of the best harbours in the world - rivals Sydney.
amazing view from the Harbour. amazing view from the Harbour you can see all skylines and nice place for a walk during night and after noon

Great way to visit Kowloon. Whilst in Kong Hong we caught the Ferry to Kowloon from Victoria Harbour. The ferry runs every 10mins and gives you a wonderful view of the waterway between Kong Hong and Kowloon.

Splendid at night!. Although 'symphony of light' is disappointing, Victoria harbor itself impressed me enough. It was so beautiful at night as you can see the colorful light of skyscrapers located on the other side of the harbor. Night breeze helps cooling down the temperature and makes it pleasant to walk along the harbor or sitting still and feel the atmosphere. Romantic place indeed. Good to go with friends or couple.

Has to be seen..... When you arrive you gravitate to the water or catch boats and Ferries across it... We went on a junk ride and several ferries including the jet foil to Macao. Really gives you a sense of why Hong Kong was so important....

Rented a boat and toured the harbor at night. Was great took a 50ft yacht around the harbor out to sai kung and then back at night for incredible harbour views....of hong kong. If i was here with the family for a weekend only this is a top priority....swimming , great food, and a night you will never forget

Fantastic!. The skyline on the HongKong island, to be viewed from the Kowloon side, is absolutely excellent! Especially at night. During the day time the view may be marred from a cloudy/misty day. Strongly suggested - Spend your entire evening and late evening on the Kowloon side just experiencing the views of the amazing skyline, eating in the roadside food-stalls, watching the Laser Show at 8:00PM and strolling on the Tsim sha Tsui promenade. You can also opt for a Night Cruise on the Star Ferry - good views of the neon-lit skyline & the Victoria harbour, from the ferry.
Take the night junket tour. You get a glass of wine with the tour - great way to see the nightly laser show! You get a glass of wine with the tour - great way to see the nightly laser show!

beautiful scene. The best evening scene of the world, no city can compare to the beautiful harbour of Hong Kong. The harbour is narrow close to each other. Hong Kong side and Kowloon side is about a 6 minutes drive of 80 mph.

Absolutely stunning.. Absolutely stunning. We hoofed it over here after our plane actually managed to arrive EARLY and after basically running from the airport to the train to a taxi and to the river, we were absolutely blown away by the size and beauty of the skyline in front of us. We never got to see it during the daylight, but at night it only adds to the impressiveness that Hong Kong is as a city. The Symphony of Lights is a laser light 'show' along the skyline of Hong Kong Island seen from Victoria Harbour. I use the word show a bit loosely because I'll be honest in that the show is not all that incredibly impressive... however, the skyline itself IS impressive. We ended up taking the Star Ferry over to the other side, and it was such a neat experience seeing the city at night. Our next stop was the tram station up to Victoria Peak, which I also highly recommend.So, make seeing the Hong Kong Island skyline at night a priority! A must-see!! Tons of food and nice shopping in the immediate surrounding area too.We took the Airport Express Train from Hong Kong International Airport to the Kowloon Station (if you have a group of 4+ you can buy group tickets for MUCH cheaper at the customer service counter .. the group tickets were not in the ticket machines).. then it isn't a far walk to the Harbour, but we did take a very cheap taxi since we were rushing to see The Symphony of Lights... plus we only had 12 hours in HK :)
Night scenery. Have been there some 10 years ago and recently been there again. Took the ferry across the harbour and back. Didnt get to see the light show. But its just like any other city scape.

If you haven't seen it, you haven't been to Hong Kong. Sorry New York, London and Singapore, but the Hong Kong skyline is unparalleled - nowhere else in the world is there a city so densely populated and glamorous. The sight is intensive any time of the day: the harbour greets you with a jungle of concrete and glass during the day, bustling with life with all the road and sea traffic, and lights assault you from all directions at night. There's a light show at 8pm every day, which to be honest feels very contrived. If you happen to be around during Chinese New Year (or 1 July Handover Day, or 1 October National Day), there are awesome fireworks too. Best time to visit would be around sunset so you see both daytime and nighttime versions of the city. People disagree on which side of the harbour looks better (my vote goes to the island side, ie the view from the promenade in Tsim Sha Tsui), but the best way of seeing the harbour is - get on the water, duh! My favourite way is definitely the Star Ferry (dirt cheap).

Harbour cruise. Hong Kong's harbour is an exciting place to visit. The easiest way to explore is to hop on a ferry and enjoy the skyline from the boat. I can also recommend a sunset cruise. Amazing colour show when the sun goes down and the city lights are turned on!
Nice place. The place it's nice especially at night u can walk front of the sea and there is many shops near and u can also go many places walking like kollon park we spend all the day we like it
Caught a ferry for less then $2. We caught a ferry across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Was a pleasant ride a got some great photos by day and night.

a beautiful sight. victoria harbour at night is one of the most special sights I've ever seen.best seen if you take the star ferry at 8 as you can see the full view of all the lightsan amazing sight for children and adults of all ages
Night Lights. I loved walking along the Harbor. I took beautiful pictures from the Ferry at night, while the full moon was out,and everything was lit up.
Great Views. Loved the harbour, so interesting and a great way to see much of the city on and off Hong Kong Island.
Very Nice. For such a large busy harbour, it was very tranquil and quiet. The rides on the Star ferry made our day.
Love this harbour. 2nd best harbour in the world (after Sydney). Clean, efficient ferries. Great skyline. Lots of activities around the harbour.

Great place to visit Hong Kong and beyond from the water. In HK you walk. And walk, and walk. And it is the same in Victoria Harbour. 8 piers with ferries going to various islands and other ports. It takes time to get from one to another.
Ferry is a great way to travel there, you can see a lot from the boats and get to some great places.

Star Ferry Ride. The Star Ferry is a great ride across to Kowloon. It is quick and cheap. It was fun to cross the Harbour and see the sites including the Peninsula Hotel, the musem. The Musem was well worth seeing the exhibit.

Awesome skyline. There is good and bad to this. On a clear night you get a wonderful view from any of the ferries of the Hong Kong skyline. If you are there long enough you will see the pollution and haze that sometimes mares the skyline.

so attractive!!!. The symphony of light show is so beautiful and attractive, especially in Saturday night. Try to take ferry to go across the bay (star ferry at pier 7, only take 5-6 min from Hong Kong MRT station, at Man Yiu street). It's take around 10-15 min, but it will be a great time to enjoy the light show on the Hongkong skyscrapers. Do not miss this place, and remember to take photographs.

One of the World's Great Urban Views. One of the world's great urban views, the ferry rides are a must.Walk along the quay on Kowloon in the evenings or early morning jog. Great people watching, snacks and gift shopping along the way.
Nice view. It's very good to jog or walk along the Victoria Harbour. The views are amazing. The views of those tall buildings are very nice to see.

Great Harbour. Traveling out on the Victoria Harbour is must do in Hong Kong. Whether you take a Star Ferry, a ferry to one of the island or go out on the Aqualuna the Harbour is spectacular both in the day and night. If the like to take photographs the Harbour will not disappoint you

Star walk.. Great for fresh air and for a walk with shops surrounding it. The views are one of the best I've ever seen in the night with very beautiful lights. However it did smell fairly unpleasant when we were walking, which was probably the water. A great photo taking destination too.

Harbour Tour. Did the Star ferry's harbour tour (it may be just me but this was not easy to work out how to catch the tour). Search for Star Ferry's and they will have some details. In the end we took the 13.15 from pier 7 at Central (the ticket office is downstairs from the regular ferry ticket office)
Great. Take the last cheap day harbour tour on the star ferry and watch the sun go down and the lights go onJust fantastic 85Hk dollars £7 and lasts an hour. Even a little bar on board for a beer.
Star Ferry. Cheap and easy transport across the bay to Central and back. I know there are also night time cityscape tours -
Great place. Fantastic place, where old boats and cargo ships meet the skyscraper buildings. The photos are mind blowing.
Pleasant Night Scene. Staying in Kowloon and looking across the harbour to Hong Kong to see the light show at night with the buildings was neat.
Beautiful. Love looking at the harbor, during day or evening. So many boats, ferries. On a sunny, clear day, it's lovely.

Beautiful. Beautiful place to visit. We skipped the dinner/harbor cruises and took the Star Ferry over to Kowloon from the Central Pier area (pier #7). Lots of signs will lead you to the pier if you're on the pedestrian walkway from the mall/Hong Kong station area. It's about a 10 minute ride and it cost less than $3 (USD) total for my family of 4 roundtrip. Sit on the top (covered) deck. Walk along the waterfront in Kowloon and go in the malls (one on each side) to cool off. It's a cheap day and we didn't feel like we missed out by not taking the standard harbor cruise. This could easily be a 3-4 hour outing from the airport by taking the Airport Express train to Hong Kong Station - the ticket machines are easy to use and there are lots of signs to help you on the journey. English announcements on the train. It's a little less than 30 minutes from the airport to Hong Kong Station. The piers are about a 10 minute walk from the train. Okay even if there is rain - the whole walk is covered.

A wonderful place to visit for all occasions and all ages. When visiting Hong Kong, many times now, either myself, with friends or family, I made sure that we visit the wonderful place.It is at the end of the Nathan Road (the Golden Mile) of Kowloon area in Hong Kong.When there, make sure that you walk through the Starlight Avenue along the Harbour. Many artists, movie stars, famous singers, Cantonese Opera stars, have been immortalised on this Avenue. Pose for a few photos along the Avenue or the Harbour backdrop, it will bring many happy memories for years to come.Looking across the Harbour, you have a wonderful view of the Exhibition Centre, the Hong Island, and the Victoria Peak.Ensure that you go there early in the morning to beat the flock of tourists that will be in your pictures every step away.Great spot for solo, family, romantic and business traveller.

Beautiful most of the time. Weather can make it a bit challenging to visit. Too hot, too cold, etc... This is Hong Kong and all. But if you are there and the weather is descent,. a walk around any section of Victoria Harbor can really make a great day.
Nice night view. the night view is good. You may spend 1 hour in this place. Before visiting this place, you may visit the museums surrounding which is a good experience. Better visit during night

Night lights glistening on the water.. Victoria harbour at night was lovely, as was the ferry ride across the bay from Wan Chai. The reflection of the lights on the water on this bustling harbor was a delight. The view of the different buildings with their changing lights added another dimension.

beautiful and colourful lights at night. The symphony of lights show at the harbour was amazing! The chinese junks that were lit up, sailing along the water added to the picturesque scene that can never be forgotten.

Take the Star Ferry. The Harbour is bustling! The best way to see it at its best is to go to the waterfront and take the star ferry from The island to Kowloon or back. Its extremely cheap, the trip is short and you can great some great pictures. Around 8pm, it takes a little stop so you can see the symphony of lights. Amazing!

Victoria Harbour. if you don't visit Victoria Harbour, you did not explore HongKong. Must visit.Go on the night time, the view is superb. But do except crowd. Do hop on Star ferry as well from kowloon to central. wonderful ride
Scenic view. Go to Victora Harbor to see the Hong Kong skyline. It's worth seeing it at day and night. And if it's a safe area even after dark (at least in the early evening when I went there).

about the laser show. The walk of fame is a good attraction also for foreign people who don't exactly know all the star present there. The laser show which starts in the evening is not such amazing as the people of the hotel said and you can enjooy the promenade instead.

deepest harbor in the world. We have enjoyed the view of Victoria Harbor from our room on the 115th floor at then ritz Carlton. We have also enjoyed Ferry rides in the Harbor as well as the Symphony of lights at 8pm each night! get viewed by the Avenue of Stars
Cool. Was cool relief on a hot night. . At night on a tour cruise the light show was fantastic Also went on sampans with locals. Enjoyable.

What's there to see? Buildings,lights & eating wind.. Wasted my time, walking up then down. The avenue of stars looks old and a disgrace for HK stars, no image at all. The lights displayed simply doesn't make any sense. Seats were limited, left the show after 5 minutes, total waste of time.

Must do in HK. Walking along the waterway is a nice way to spend a little time. Lots of people are doing the same thing, so it must be a normal touristy thing to do. You can take lots of scenic views of the island and you should grab a cheap ferry ride if you have time to enhance your experience.

World class views. It is a beautiful way to spend an evening, walking the harbor front, taking in the simple beauty of the Hong Kong skyline. It is a perfect example that showcases how old meets new. Definitely a must do activity when you are there.
I recommend enjoying the view in Tsim sha Tsui side, right by Harbour City.
nice walk after a meal. quite nice to walk along the long stretch of Avenue of Star, get to enjoy the breeze and overlook the brightly-lit office buildings of HK island.

Beautiful view of Hong Kong skyline. Saw the Victoria Harbour by taking a Star Ferry from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back. You can see the different faces of Hong Kong from Kowloon and Hong Kong.
Great place to hangout.... A beautiful view of Hongkong side. Those who loves night lifes, photography... Must recommended place to visit there
Great views. Take the tram up and get to see amazing views of the city from up top. Highly recommended during the night

city views, easy access and iconic statues. top tourist spot so if u can avoid tourist peak times as it can be hard to get a tourist free photo. here can be accessed by car, bus, metro, ferry all within easy distance. during festivals, this is the best spot to see boats or fireworks but beware it is of course exceptionally busy.

Enchanting view!!!!!. Oh my oh my...
The harbour I feel is the best attraction in hong kong after the Peak.You see the best skyline.The breeze over there is refreshing.It truly describes the name Hong kong has "Asia's world city".I would recommend a night visit to the harbour.One should nevet miss it

nice, chill place. it was really crowded, but it was also really fun. We actually made friends with other tourist there.
but the skyline is really great!

Tram Visit. A beautiful view while taking the tram all the way upto Victoria Harbour, from where you get a scenic view of the beautiful city. However there are layers as to how or at what height you want to go.
Best place to enjoy skyline view!. Went there by tram and returned by bus. It was quite cool at the Victoria peak, and the view was simply awesome! Highly recommended !
Good view of the skyline.. Get a good view of the skyline from the harbour. You'll find a lot of ships in this area. I believe it is among the busiest shipping routes in the world.
Great Views. This is a must if your in Hong Kong. Walk along the water front and enjoy the fantastic views at night.

A great show for free. This is one of the world's busiest harbours and you can watch the traffic for hours. Good to see both day and night. You must cross at least once on a Star ferry. If you go at night go Kowloon to Wan Chai rather than central - it is longer and gives better viewing angles.
A good view from the Ferry.. Even the star ferry at 2.50HK from the octopus card a ride gives an excellent view. Get off walk around and return. Plenty of things pop up to see.

So beautiful.... Beautiful place to walk around in the afternoon or stunning day and night views if admired from the roof top of Harbour Grand Kowloon. Nice to cross it on the famous and cheap ferry either.

Panorama perfection. This is what you come for - the signature view day and night and the varied architecture laid out for you in panorama. And you want to be close up and personal, especially for the nightly laser light show at 8PM. Hope you stay at the YMCA and get a harbor side room on the 15th or 16th floor, because rooms have huge picture windows. No other hotel is this close with mid-rise height. Just sit in your arm chair and enjoy the scene. Better even than going on the ferry, though that's an experience too. Suggest skip dinner cruises with typical mediocre food and amenities. We were lucky enough to have one rainy day, which gave a whole new atmosphere to the harbor - skyscrapers disappearing in the clouds. Photo possibilities are fantastic. Right across the street is the harbor walk, with fun crowds and vendors.

After the Peak the only place worth to see in Hong Kong!. After the Peak Victoria Harbour is the only place worth to see in Hong Kong! Specially at night it's a pleasure to walk through the Promenade, Star Alley..
Awesome. Great views at night make sure you see the lights display starting at 8 pm every night. You can also watch this from the lobby bar at the Intercontinental Hotel
Just a harbour really. There was a lot of excitement about the harbour but I wasn't blown away. Ferry is nice and cheap though
An experience. You've seen it in the movies and you have to cross it on the famous ferry. These are easy to use and very cheap at 2HKD one way.
too many people during xmas time.. Just don't go on xmas day, other wise nice people, free hugs given, firework on certain time. Lighting during xmas time its beautiful.
Fascinating harbor. Very diverse, from sampans and boat people, junks, modern sleek yachts, ferries, to cruise ships the harbor was busy all hours of day and night
Great to View Hong Kong from. It was easy to get to. There was lots to see and do. Nice places to eat. Some good shops thriving. Enjoyed seeing lots of different people around.
Cruise. Went on a cruise at sunset beautiful way to take in the views of the whole city and all the building

Harbour walk. We loved walking around the harbour which was lively and picturesque . We took the Star ferry over to Central district and the ride gave spectacular views of the harbour. The ferry costs 20pence! Then we walked around the shopping mall in Central .

Beautiful Harbour. There're many ways to watch the Harbour, you could see it from the sea. Take "Star Ferry" either from Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon or Central, Hong Kong Island. Just few dollars, you can see both side of the Harbour from the sea. You could take the bird eye view from the Peak or Sky100 (Observation Deck) at ICC. And my favorite place is watching it at TST East promenade. You can start walking from Star Ferry Kowloon/Cultural Center and walk over to TST East.

Cruise Victoria harbour & feel the soul of Hong Kong. Harbour cruises are always interesting. Hong Kong famed Victoria Harbour is more than just a harbour tour. The cruise operated by the Hong Kong tourism office using a motorised Chinese junk can be booked at the Hong Kong tourism office in Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon Star ferry terminal. You can board teh 1 hour long cruise either at Hong Kong Central or at the Tsim Sha Tsui side.The highlight is not just the views around the harbour and the breeze blowing at your face. It is the small junks and boats moored around the typhoon shelter at Causeway Bay which gives you a glimpse of the soul of hong Kong. These small boats are homes to a community that has existed since the colonial times and a way to beat the sky-rocketing cost of housing in Hong Kong. You cna see it is a community there with restaurants on some boats, temple on another with colourful banners decorating these boats. You see the fame Noon Gun along the way. AFter this stretch teh landscape changes to the usual high rise as well as the high-rise apartments and office block. The further you move away from Central the landscape changes to a less commercial scene. Passing the old KaiTak airport terminal and runway, you could still imagine the big jets roaring down the roof tops of apartment threatening the laundry left to dry. Alas the place now is being converted into a cruise terminal. the cruise will bring your sense from the paast to the present when the neon lights on top of building re-appear near Tsim Sha Tsui. All these time you would have passed barges carrying all sorts of materials to & from the harbour to ships anchored outside.The business of the harbour mirrors the pace of life on shore. you can see, sense and smell commerce, the lifeline of this place.Best time to visit this attraction is the cooler months towards the end of the year or early in the year.The cost, very affordable and well worth it. See for yourself.
Best night view in the world.. Excellent. Best night view. Though harbour is getting smaller and smaller. Laser show is also good. If you visit in Chinese New Year, fireworks is spectacular.
Loved watching the sheeps go by. Was lucky enough o have a hotel overlooking the harbor. Loved watching the ships go by, what a great was to decompress after a hectic day!
Victoria Harbour. The harbour with its large ocean and many ships are exciting to look at from the bus. Very enjoyable and memorable
Scenic. Best to go during the evenings when there is light and sound show and during summer months it gets a lit cooler. Very crowded during the light and sound show.
Scenic views from the Victoria Harbour ferry. The ferry is a cheap and fast way to get between Hong Kong island and Kowloon. Good views from the ferry. Prefer the upper level over the lower level.

The Harbour and its Prominade are not to be missed. You will see the harbor from many angles, with one being from the promenade in Tsim Sha Tsui. Others include your trips on the Star Ferry (and other cruises), plus from Central and Victoria Peak (which we visited on two different days).

Awesome as every seaside area in Hong Kong. Amazing scenery , definitely should be first place to walk through with your friends or alone.There are people singing nice songs and let's accept that it is Hong Kong view and it is just perfect !!!!!!
Breathtaking!. It's nice to walk the along the harbor and just take in all the scenery. The view is breathtaking! You can watch the laser light show at night for free!
Great views, cheap ferry. Great place to watch the skyline both day and night, preferrably on one of the ferries (that only cost 50 cent). Guided tours are avaliable as well.

Lights galore!. Beautiful....must be seen in daytime and at night. Take the. Star Ferry across to Central. Watch the dragon boats go by and the if you are down on the promenade at 8:00 pm see the laser light show.

A cruise to barely remember. I took a walk along the harbour and it was nice so i took a cruise along it.....Not so impressive. While the view of the buildings was nice the trash and smell in the water made for an unpleasent journey
Popular attraction. One of the popular attractions in Hong Kong which is must go if your first time visiting Hong Kong. Nothing too fantastic but it is popular enough to deserve for making a visit.
Star ferry cruise. If you have a spare hour take a harbour cruise, very cheap and well worth it for some great pictures of the skyline

Take a boat.. This place is so scenic it cannot be missed on a trip to Hong Kong. If you don't have time to take one of the many harbour cruises on offer then at least take the Star Ferry Ride across from the island to Kowloon.
Take the star ferry. Take the star ferry to take in the skyline of Hong Kong. A cheap ferry ride to see the harbour. A must do

Jump for Joy at Victoria Harbour. This was my 3rd time in Hong Kong and still, I never fail to visit Victoria Harbour. You always get a different vibe when you visit this place. At night time, with the skycrapers lighting the whole harbour, it's just magical and breathtaking. This time, I visited the Victoria Harbour on daylight, particularly on a sunny spring day. It was just beautiful to see all the different types of sea vessels, the city's towering structures just make an amazing backdrop. In fact, I was enjoying the place so much, I was jumping for joy. Haha- check out my pictures <3
Victoria Harbour. We used the local ferries and enjoyed them and found them easy to use, the staff were friendly and the sights made it an enjoyable visit.

I suggest the ferry. I suggest to use the ferry that connect Kowloon to Hong Kong. The boat is old and you get a beatiful experience of Hong kong skyline.Of course i suggest an experience in the daylight and in the night.

Fireworks!!. Everyone in Hong Kong should really see the fireworks they used to have for Chinese New Year, held here..at the Victoria Harbour..From this place as well, you may find many ferries going to Macau from Hong Kong.A very well organized place to visit.

Fantastic views - a must trips!. Visited last May. Staying at the Ritz Carlton we overlooked the harbour with fab views day and night but the harbour trip is worth every penny. We have done both day and night trips and the views you get are stunning of the skyline. Fab photo ops during the day - bit tricky at night. Lots of boats in the harbour like the famous white star ferries - traditional Junks etc - there wasn't a dull part of the trip. Back on land you have the harbour clock and cannon to see or hear! Very highly recommended.

Busy Harbour. Very busy waterway but the ferry ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong was quick and very enjoyable plus the ferry was very clean. The terminal is easy to find and the Octopus card makes public transport a pleasure to use.

Great Laser Show!. My friend in Hong Kong told me about this show that started at 8:00pm every night. She went there to wait for us and got a front line good spot for us to view it. It started very promptly at 8:00pm and it was a wonderful music/light show. It was fantastic and it was free. i recommend it.Our family love it!
Harbour. the 4th biggest harbour in the World, amazing to watch the number of ships being loaded each day. People going in and out on the piers to Kowloon, Macau, or other islands.
Nice view. It provided a nice view. Great to go a night when all the buildings a lit up. Managed to get some nice pictures with the city in the background.
A must do at least once. Came here in the evening to watch the light show. Very busy and the light show is pretty rubbish but the view of HK island at night was well worth it. Some good photos taken
Stunning View. Where else can you enjoy the views of the bay than from Victoria Harbour? Easy to travel to and the views are astounding.

Worth paying more than the Star Ferry tour.. We enjoyed the 1 hour tour on the Star Ferry Tour for HK$85 but the noise of conversation made it nearly impossible to hear the commentary. It is worth paying more for another tour company that also goes for 1.5 or 2 hours and see more of this magnificent harbour. Probably night time is the best time to see HK in all it's glory.

Take time to watch. This is a busy harbour with lots of happenings.The views from HK island or Kowloon are impressive due to the skyline and backdrop but other than that it is a harbour going about its daily life. Still interesting if you take time to kick back and just watch the world happen
Beautiful View. This is the most ideal location to take pictures as the sunsets and the building lights start to turn on.
great view. Night time is the best, specially if you can enjoy the sunset. The light show is quite interesting, but the vibe is phenomenal.

perfect spot to hangout. quaite a view. . its decribe Hongkong very well. take a leisure walk in the afternoon, or enjoy hongkong night view, Try crossing the harbour at night when symphonny of light started. amazing
So very beautiful. Take a Star Ferry, watch the Symphony of Light from the promenade and Avenue of Stars, watch the ships coming and going.

The view of the city skyline is beautiful.. Liked the view of the city skyline and the of course the Victoria Harbor itself. I actually visited Hong Kong in March 2012 but the review options didn't have it so.. Yea.

Seek a hotel with a harbor view!. You won't be disappointed. On two separate trips I arrived after dark and had a great harbor view room with the night time skyline. In the morning, you get a completely different experience as day breaks over the harbor. Amazing.

Wonderful views. The best way to see the harbor is by boat and the Star Ferry is a very cheap way to get out on the water, we took it over to Central and straight back again so we could take some photos and just enjoy the atmosphere on the water.

Amazing As Always. Hong Kong has one of the most iconic skylines and harbors in the world. With the skyscrapers lit up at night, particularly from the Kowloon side, or from the Aqua Luna, the harbor is a breathtaking experience. Luckily, we had an amazing view of the harbor from the 26th floor of the Icon Hotel so were were able to enjoy the splendor every single night. Sitting by the large windows, with all the lights in our hotel room shut, and wine glass in hand, it was magical.

Go on cool day .. Great skyline view but go on a cooling day or evening. A good place for some photos and for taking a relaxing stroll. Can be crowded but it's spacious enough to not feel all that disturbed.

Fantastic skyline. This skyline is stunning! Don't expect much from the much hyped light show though! The skyscrapers are lit up at night anyway and the reflections of them on the water at Hong Kong Harbour is fabulous.We stayed in Kowloon and walked down to the waterfront and got some great pictures.
Great Day on the Harbour.. I love going out on the Star ferry or another ferry and spending a few hours cruising around Victoria Harbour. The views of the city are priceless.
Lovely views. We took the ferry and walked along the harbor. The mountain views and the harbor views were lovely. the ferry with the exchange rate was only $3 for 2 people!
Star Ferry. Crossing the Harbour on the Star Ferry is great for sight seeing and gives the legs a chance to recover
Amazing. Views are amazing more so at night when the buildings are all lit up! Best to view from The views which over look Victoria Harbour!

Lovely. We went to the Harbour to see the light show and were disappointed. Perhaps it's because we had just seen the light show at ptroniuss towers in KL and were expecting fantastic, but it was quite a disappointment. If we had to do it over again, we would not fight the crowds to see it. However, to go during the day and enjoy a bit of tea while enjoying the view is well worth the time!

Great view and skyline of Central Hongkong. As the title says, it is great indeed. when visiting hong kong, be sure to visit this place around 5-7PM, coz the lights from the buildings starts to light up. Easy access from both MTR and buses roaming around HK. and fare is cheap by the way (except taxi fare). Visit this area and just enjoy the view while walking or eating with someone.
Amazing Views. A great way to see Hong Kong from aboveA fantastic tourist destinationMake sure to go early to miss the queues, by the time we came back down the tram queue was very long

Have changed a lot. This is one of hte famous harbour in Causeway Bay with a few hotels overlooking it. Excelsior and Parklane are some of them. There has been construction work going near the harbour but it has changed somewhat to the old day where you could sit on a sampan to have dinner with friends or for business.

Romantic Place. We loved the Victoria Harbour....the sight is simply romantic. We just sat there enjoying the memorable sight. There are nights where they have a wonderful musical light show. We missed that one because it started to rain, and we did not want get sick that weekend.

Awesome view of the HK Island Skyline!. A visit to Hong Kong is incomplete if you haven't set your foot on the Victoria Harbour. The place has a picturesque view of the HK skyline. One must visit this place in the evening so that one can also watch the symphony of lights show. Also a walk down the Avenue of Stars is a must for all Bruce Lee and Jackie Chand fans.

walk the harbour. again you can do this in the daytime or at night , pllenty to see , so go for a stroll, and see the waterways. 8pm the light show happens so maybe a good time to take a walk after dinner ,

Fantastic View of the HK Island Skyline. Very good place to view the skyscrapers especially during the night time. Too bad I left earlier I did not witness the light show but I was more than satisfied with what I saw. There's the Harbor City mall which offers a lot for shoppers and diners.

Good Night View for Couples. a good place for night visit after your dinner especially for couples. you may choose to have your dinner at this place. you can easily spend an hour or two at this place. highly recommended. it's near to Tsim Sha Tsui, just a walking distance.

Slightly disappointing and less than expected. A trip round Victoria Harbour and on the ferry is, supposedly, one of the highlights of a trip to Hong Kong, but we found both experiences slightly disappointing and less than we had expected.The ferry trip is noisy, relatively fast and soon over and whilst one tries to bring to mind nostalgic stories associated with the trip, its difficult to imagine!. The trip round the harbour is reasonably interesting and, in good weather enjoyable, but not something that we would strongly recommend unless you are very interested in boats.

Great views. Had a great time appreciating the view on both the Kowloon and the Island side of the harbor. The harbor is probably best-appreciated by riding the Star Ferry across. Inexpensive and impressive views.
The heart of the city.. One of the worlds busiest harbours, take a evening trip on the many ferries or a casual dinner and see this wonderful city from a different perspective.

You'll need to be on Tsim Sha Shui to view this harbour. You'll need to be on the side of Tsim Sha Shui to view across to Victoria Harbour. Lovely view at night and day. There is a Symphony of Light Show every night and that's amazing to see and take some stunning photos of the harbour.
my everyday view. i forget how lucky i am to have such a one of a kind view in my front yard everyday. And I still havn't gotten sick of it yet.

The harbour city with lights. To be at the center of both Kowloon and HK Island at 8pm is surely a good choice to watch the light show on the buildings. But I wish there will be more "active" building like the AIA building that contributes a lot in the show. Of course you can have a different feel at the Peak.

very cold. Do not let the taxi fleece you. Just take the tram but be prepared to queue, be it going up or down. Try not to go between 6-8pm as there will be a lot of people and you may be stuck in a human jam , it may 'jammed' you up for 1 hour just waiting for the tram.

Always bustling.. It's always lovely to have a room with a view and this is definitely true in Hong Kong. The Victoria Harbour has changed a lot in the last three decades but still retains its charm. I prefer the view from Kowloon onto the island but both views are differently special.

What a buzz!!. Wall to wall (sorry, shore to shore!) marine activity! Everything from small pleasure craft, ferries of all shapes and sizes,tug boats pulling barges and pile drivers, junks, cargo ships to huge cruise ships!! What a hoot!!

Ah-mazing. The night view is simply superb. No wonder Hong Kong named as one of cities with highest electricity consumption. The Star Ferry ride is a must in Victoria Harbour. Walk for a while and you'll find Tsim Tsam Sui, one of the busiest districts in HK.
Must See for first time visitors. We took a junk boat onto the Harbour to watch the light show. Cheesy perhaps...but also a real highlight of the trip!

What a nice view!. The night scenery was just jaw-dropping experience for me.
I'd come again with my girl-friend next time.
Smoggy and dirty. I am sure it was beautiful before it became smoggy, dirty and over developed. It lacks soul and is just another Asian city pretending to be American.

Surrounded by skyscrapers. Victoria Harbour is an overwhelming place not only because of the multitude of skyscrapers surrounding it, but also because of the boat traffic and crowds of people crossing from one side to the other for either business or pleasure. Tip 1: The best way to enjoy it is by taking the Star Ferry to the other side - either Central or Tsim Sha Tsui. The ticket is very cheap and you can pay by using the Octopus card.Tip 2: I recommend that you see it both during daytime and nighttime - maybe during the Symphony of Lights - because the experience is different.
Amazing . Take the star ferry and enjoy the view of the unbelievable skyline on Hong Kong Island.. An abundance of sky scrapers, simply a must see

Nature and Man Made Wonders Fused Together. I took a stroll along the Tsimshatsui East waterfront this evening after the air in the blue sky had been cleared by showers earlier in the afternoon. It was so peaceful, relaxing and beautiful there. As I walked towards the tip of the Kowloon Peninsula, there were many tourists from overseas - mostly from Mainland China - sharing the fun and enjoyment. I would recommend visitors to go there early in the morning, with the sunlight from the east shining on the tightly packed commercial buildings on the island. They should then return again the evening, and stay there till dark - observing all the buildings and houses being lighted up in different colours.

A must see whilst in Hong Kong. Victoria Harbour is beautiful in the daytime, but at night time it is even more impressive with all the bright lights and the stunning skyline. Our hotel was in Tsim Sha Sui and it was only a 5 minute walk from our hotel to the avenue of stars along the harbour front. It's a great place to go either day or night. The nightly symphony of lights show is also worth seeing. I enjoyed just sitting along the avenue of stars, people watching and appreciating the beautiful scenery.
fantabulous. it's better to go there at nights, cuz the view is astounding!!!

Man, Hong Kong. What a perfect place. I can't say enough about Hong Kong. This was the first trip my wife and I took together and have been back twice since. Hop on a cruise and watch the skyline come to life. You will love it.

Nice and Relaxing. We took the one hour Victoria Harbor cruise. It was OK. We were on board in the middle of the afternoon in July. Out on the deck the heat and humidity was horrible, but it was comfortably cool inside with a/c on. It was a relaxing respite from a day of sightseeing.
Good view. Love the cart snack i don't know what it called it's like a giant grilled squid and smell so good....love it

Water and Lights. We spent time watching the Aqua Luna sail up and down the harbor. It is more beautiful at night. Overall the harbor was quite a nice sight. The cluster of buildings lining the coast of HK island and the water reflecting all the lights is something that must be seen in person. Every time we go there its a good experience

pretty impresive. The view is really all there is, and its very nice at night.
Went to the evening laser show, however it was really disappointing - just go and see the lights and go for a really nice ride on the Star ferry. Not much on the actual harbour side
Plenty to do. There's endless options for things to do around the harbour. One of the best is catching the Star Ferry across from Hong Kong Island across to Kowloon or vice versa.
Spectacular views. Beautiful views at night very romantic. See the Bruce Lee statue, the boats on the harbor, the flashing lights on the buildings, and the walk of fame.

Lovely views. Went across the harbour on the ferry that the locals use and did a 1 hour harbour tour with Star Ferry. Both provided a lovely scenic trip and the harbour tour gave loads of information about Hong Kong and the harbour area. Just beautiful and peaceful cruising along and seeing the magnificent skyline on both sides of the harbour. Both of these were included in the price of our Big Bus tour tickets. Highly recommend.

Famous Hong Kong feature. Getting narrower every year with landfills. Hong Kongers say people will soon be able to shake hands across the harbour. Take the ferry to cross the harbour instead of taking the MTR or Bus.

Beautiful view of the city skyline. Instead of the Tourist Harbour packages, one should take the ferry that the locals use to get across. It is cheap and yet you are able to enjoy the short journey with spectacular views

good light show at night. There's lots of re-development in HK island ,so during the day time its not so great. But as the night fall , all the commercial buildings lights up and there's laser light show as well .The harbour is getting smaller all the time ,as they re-claiming more land -filling up the coastline .
Stunning. Spectacular views during the day and at night. Especially at 8pm whilst the night light show takes place, the views of the harbour from Kowloon are mesmerising.
Worth to kill time. It's just so ordinary that it is published over internet. Good for a free sightseeing, and the "Symphony of Light" every 8pm is not as marvelous I imagine.

this is Hong Kong. yep, this is it. i visited during the day, and i have to admit, if you have a chance to look at the harbour skyline at night, it is going to be absolutely stunning.also, try to jump in to the ferry, and just enjoy your day as a tourist in Hong Kong, one of the best experiences.

Tour Hong Kong Harbour at Night. Viewing the harbour skyline at night is an absolute "must do" when visiting Hong Kong. The tour that was recommended to us by our hotel was fairly basic but still enjoyable. Watching the lights of the tall buildings come on was a great sight. However beware. Our tour included dinner at the "world's largest floating Chinese restaurant" Jumbo. This is a real tourist trap. The food quality/quantity was very poor and drinks overpriced. The staff were very unfriendly and we could not wait to leave.
Nice to see. Good place to go for a walk. Clean and breezy. Convenient transportation. Try to visit it in different hours- daytime and evening - both are nice.

Great for a romantic evening. We cruised along the Victoria Harbour onboard a Junk on the night of Valentine's day. We found it very romantic. One could see the lights on HK island... enjoy the cool breeze of the evening while having drinks (unlimited drinks onboard, depending on the tour you booked).Though others may find this boring, I think it's a wonderful way to spend bonding time with your partner, family, or friends. One can interact with the other people aboard too :)
$$$$$. Huge mall. Make sure to keep your credit card ready. It is not cheep. There is a lot to see. Many brand names, but again IT IS NOT CHEEP.

Busy Busy. This area certainly gives you an insight into the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. Safe and lots of things to see and do but often just standing and taking it all in is enough, providing that is you can find a place to stand!

Sydney harbour it isn't, but equally wonderful.. The harbour is surprisingly clean given the thousands of vessels that ply the waters, and the millions of inhabitants around the harbour.The Western end of the harbour is the working end where the working vessels moor at night etc and the central portion is where most cross traffic occurs. Punctuated with bridges, and under water tunnel impressive it is.It feels as though the Harbour is the heart of Hong Kong.

AMAZING day or night. Loved the view from the local ferry, both day and night. The night view from SKY 100 was UNREAL!! A great romantic date would be just riding the ferry back and forth 3-4 times. The price makes this a very affordable date as well!!
nice place for a walk. Didn't visit the harbour in day time. But it was a nice choice for an evening walk, with summer breeze and the neon, music played by singers.

Stunning. My favourite experience was viewing the harbour as part of a boat cruise. We did a Aberdeen Night Tour organised through a group called Splendid. Ivan was the tour guide and he was great - good English, funny and very knowledgeable. The floating restaurant was a good experience but the food was pretty average.
the best view in the world. it was a place which was listed as the place in the world you must go to have a look in your life, you may be attract by the view immediately.

A great symphony of everything. Everything is awesome around Victoria Harbour, take the Star Ferry to take in everything around you and go to TST and look across to the Island at 8pm to take in the light show
Spectacular. Amazing, breath taking, all the buildings lit up at night is so impressive. Must see!! Cruise the Harbour at night for the best views
Symphony of lights. Expectations were high after reading all those reviews, but disappointed as we didn't feel that excitement on the cruise with the light and sound show.

Nice view of harbour and harmony of light at night.. The harbour was closed to Hongkong museum of art and Hongkong Avenue of stars. Try to get there at night, We can enjoy the exciting harmony of light.
a skyline view of hongkong from the top. its a must visit place for first time visitor to hongkong, and remember to come in good wheater so you can see the scenery very clearly
Victoria Harbour Hong Kong. Well worth taking a package which includes dinner followed by a harbour sail . It is spectacular to see all the buildings lit up at night.

Victoria Habour. We were disappointed, it maybe due to the hazy weather. The lights were not very impressive, we didn't even know that the light show had started. Perhaps we are pampered with the city lights we have in Singapore. If you have run out of activities, you can visit the habour for the light show and stroll. If you have plenty to do, you can give this a miss.

No time for sea sickness - too much to see. If your in Hong Kong then across the harbour you must go and the way to do so is by Star Ferry. Simply enjoy the ride and then enjoy again on the way back. Depending on your timing, you can pass by a barge or ocean liner. Its a working harbour so always a lot going on to take notice of.

Such Diversity. I could spend hours around this vibrant harbour. Junks, cruise ships, ferries, containerships (anchored a bit further away). It's surrounded by the most modern and appealing skylines. Still, you can take a ferry from here to one of the outlying islands to enjoy a break from the hectic of Hong Kong

Excellent view from Clean Harbour. We enjoyed riding the Star Ferry to view the Harbour. There is always something happening on it, from large cruise ships docking to smaller tugs and also the quaint Chunks. We were fortunate to view some Fireworks on a previous visit bit the light and laser show is also spectacular viewing

A must in HK. Take the ferry boat from HK island to Tim Sha Tsui. It is a must, no doubt, either night or day (although I like it more on the day when weather is good, I mean its not raining ...). Very cheap trip (price of a metro ride) and really worth it.

Hong Kong By Night. We enjoyed the city views at night.
Yes this is another Must See during your visit to Hong Kong.
The lights in the harbour and from the buildings in the distance made for fantastic and romantic viewing.
Nice place to visit. Nice place to visit while in hongkong and a must place to see with family and friends and worth visiting again

Always an Experience. I used the ferries 5 times when in HK in May 2014. To and from Macau, to and from Lamma Island and TST to Central pier.
Whatever time of day or night, always something new to see. A relaxed way to travel amidst the hustle and bustle of HK

Worth visiting. It doesn't cost you money, the view is wonderful, its exciting to search around your chinese movie star signature, especially when you grew up watching Louis Koo, know a lil bit Brigitte Lin, Maggie Cheung, Bruce Lee and the famous Jackie Chan.

Magical. You can stand at the Kowloon side looking over the Central at any evening, there are varies height of high rise buildings layering, standing along the river front with the mountain as a backdrop. It is breathtaking at day and magical at night. You have to be there to see it and feel it.
ok light show. Honestly the evening light show was nothing special. Cute, yes. But your time may be better spend exploring other tour and shopping spots.

Spectacular!. It's better than New York's Manhattan harbour. The lights at night are a sight to be seen; get on a ferry and see the light show. The laser light show from the buildings is not so great, but the view of the harbour is worth the trip.
Good View. The good view is night time. We can see the light from many buildings. Watch the light show every 8pm. Take starferry from kowloon to hk central through victoria harbour.

East meets West!. It's an interesting mix of cultures and traditions. From the star ferry ride to the big cruise lines and cargo vessels against the backdrop of the city's skyline and the mountains in the background make for a picture perfect view.

Relaxing on the ferry. The Star ferry is the only way to travel between Kowloon & Hong Kong Island. Great photos can be taken on board of all aspects of the harbour & surrounding scenery. 9 minutes from one side to the other. Always look forward to my ferry ride.

Beautiful from every vantage point. Victoria Harbor is definitely worth a visit when in Hong Kong. Take the Star Ferry across both during the day and evening for different views. Stop and enjoy the free nightly light show, then take a walk to enjoy the lights of Hong Kong. Can't wait to return!

best view anywhere in asia*. *potentially the world, save perhaps Rio de Janeiro.
this place is always teeming with life - night or day - boats small or large, star ferries, lights, and ever changing weather. simply beautiful.
My heavens what a hive of activity. Victoria Harbour is absolutely stunning at night. Our hotel offered a Sky Lounge that was worth a nightly visit.
The light Show. Very enjoyable and great to watch. if you can try to get to the top so you can get a panoramic view of the entire harbor.
Woow.... Lovely amazing harbour view and ferry ride terminals are available. A must visit place in Hong Kong..

Best view at night. Nothing to do but taking pictures, sitting or walking around. The view was great, at night was the best for me, since I went there in the afternoon & evening so I can compare it.
Enjoy your time here to feel the breeze of hong kong city.

Harbor cruise. We did the Big Bus tour while we were in Hong Kong and it included a free harbor cruise with the ticket price we paid. Just an enjoyable time on boat while cruising around the harbor. Well worth doing while in Hong Kong
Good visit, easy to find. It is very near from MTR Station, easy to find, good location and good view for take some photo there

Amazing view!. Victoria Harbour was absolutely amazing. The great amount of buildings and the peak in the back makes the scenery incredibly beautiful.It is best to visit it during the night and after the Symphony of Lights show (which is boring, by the way) because it is not so crowded.Visiting during day light can be interesting as well, to see the contrast and to have a better sense of the actual size of the harbor.Definitely a must see in Hong Kong!
Impressive. Best views of the harbour are from the peak (on a nice day - walk around the flat circuit track) and from the Star Ferry - cheapest harbour cruise you will ever get

Lovely at night time!. We went here in the day to get the ferry across to the mainland (so much cheaper than train & nice to experience what the locals us) lovely views however in the night it just transforms. It's so peaceful and lovely to just sit and watch the views.

Take it in the evening ... for the view.. We took the ferry in the night, and get to enjoy the beautiful sights of HK in the night. It was quite fast, and before we even know it, we had reached our destination. The walk towards our MTR, from the harbor, was quite a walk though. Try it, and you won't regret it.

Great views, lots of things to see. We came for the International Dragon boat festival so this was a hopping place with the San Miguel beer fest at the same time. Lots of things to see from here with the walk of stars, people watching and little restaurants just off the main drag. Great views of the skyline and can watch the symphony of lights if you are there around 8 pm. Maybe don't try to go swimming, the water tastes terrible:)

Victoria Harbour. This is where the whole hong kong revolves. Lot of attractions nearby. Promenade, Avenue of stars, Clock tower and the Symphony of lights show. The view is amazing. Go early and get to sit so you can enjoy the symphony of light show by 8pm. Colourfully lit buildings are a good welcome.

The great harbour experience. We tried this charming Star Ferry before for this harbour experience. This harbor as we all know was instrumental in this city's development as a trading and cultural center. Get this feeling again from a waterfront view in Tsim Sha Tsui. Truly admirable.

One of the best Harbours in the world. It was amazing . Just like the post cards you see. An amazing skyline. We travelled across via ferry for $2.50 Hong Kong dollars . The best money I have ever spent .

Light show. If you want to have a good view, go early as it can get very crowded with many tourists. Nothing really spectacular but was impressed with the co-ordination of the whole affair as there were many buildings involved.

First thing to do. If you haven't seen "Symphony of lights" show yet from Avenue of stars, then it's the best choice for your first time. The ferry is arranging exact time for the show as well as on board guide voice which will explain to you everything you want to know about HK buildings and districts.
