The best harbour in the world.. This is a must see when in Hong Kong. Take the Star Ferry across, it is a wonderful experience, take time to just stand and watch the different vessles negotiating this busy working harbour. The sky scrapers which dominate the skyline and the harbour are amazing. It is particularly spectacular at night and there is a laser light show at 8pm every evening which is well worth a view.
Lots of boats. It's a waterway, not much to say about it. Views along it are great, and it's pretty cool to see how the boats narrowly miss each other as they navigate it.

Great New Hong Kong City. To go to this area, you can cross the sea with ferry or you can take fast train. From this harbor you can admire the beauty of Hong Kong City surrounding you, and they have a light show from the building every evening as the sun goes down. You also can walk along the road to reach Avenue of the star. Every day this place if crowded with people. If you have time this place worth a visit, especially if you want to admire the beauty of Hong Kong City from a distance.
Amazing!. If you go to Hong Kong, you need to take a boat in the Victoria Harbour. Good view from the city in both side: Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.

fun area and go up to see the view...awesome. View was breath taking and decent priced shops. Our tour guide was funny as she named each building of how it looked (shaver). And she knew about how mot too get into long lines, like coming early.

Star Ferry Harbour Tour. One of the best ways of seeing the Hong Kong and Kowloon skyline is from Victoria Harbour. The famous Star Ferry Company offers a one hour tour (also bundled into the Big Red Bus Tour) which travels down the Hong Kong shoreline then across the harbour for a return trip down the Kowloon shore. You can sit out on deck for good photography or inside in cool airconditioned seating areas.There are also night trip options providing spectacular views of the light show on the Hong Kong shoreline.

Relaxing.. We had to wear thicker clothing and jacket since we went there during their coldest. We didn't expect it to be so cold so we had to purchase additional and thicker jackets but either way, we enjoyed it. My husband and daughter prefer cold weather anyway!

explore in a cruise during light and sound show. Light and sound symphony starts at 8 PM at victoria harbour. Explore the harbour in 1 hr harbour cruise. I suggest that you take the 7.55 pm cruise so that u can enjoy the symphony on board. It is an excellent experience. cruise will cost you 180 HKD / person and will include light refreshment. You can take the cruise from star ferry pier number 7.

Excellent modern and buzzing. We passed thro several times during our visit and visited the avenue of stars during the day and visited again and sat too view the harbour light show every night at 8pm, it's clean, and amazing views, plenty too see , worth a visit if you go too HK

Timing is Important to Enjoy Victoria Habour. Victoria Harbour, Hong Kong, is one of the most photographed and admired tourist scene in the world. On a clear day, or evening, the setting is unbeatably beautiful with the modern skyline of Hong Kong Island and the Kowloon Peninsula, dwelling Victoria Peak and the Lion Rock Hill on both side of the Harbour. We were on a boat ride to an out island for an evening of seafood dinner at the Rainbow Seafood Restaurant one April evening this year. The sky was relatively clear and we were afforded the chance to view the Harbour scene in its glory. However, if your visit to the Harbour is on a day when fog and mist rule, the timing may not be the best for your viewing. We were at the Peak a couple of days after our boat ride and the fog was so thick that we were not even able to see a glimpse of the Harbour from above. Therefore, time your visit to view the Harbor the best you can to avoid disappointment.

One of the World's Great Harbours. Take your time to savor the sights, sounds and smells of this great waterway. For sheer busyness it is difficult to pass up. I love lingering around its edges or jumping on a ferry, camera in hand, to document the frenetic traffic on this expanse of water. Its personality changes with weather, season and time of day, but it is always exciting to see the ships and small vessels navigating through the flotilla of ships. It is truly a not to be missed spectacle.
nice scenery. great place to do some shopping and the view is gorgeous! went up by bus and went down using the tram.

Nice waterway that reflects the skyline in a beautiful view. Likes: It is well serviced, and ferries constantly travel the harbor to connect the many islands to Hong Kong Island. A cruise ship is docked to one of the terminals, and it just adds to the beauty of the harbor. Day and night reflection of the skyline makes the harbor area breathtaking.
Dislikes: None.

Pure magic!. Victoria Harbour is perfect as a night experience. Go up the Peak, preferably to the balcony of the Cafe Deco Restaurant. Sit there with a loved one beside you and a cold beer or a chilled Chardonnay in your hand and be mesmerised by the beauty before you! Enjoy!!!
Beautiful. What a view, and o so serene, lovely jublly, got hoodwinked by photographers, but it is what it is still liked the place, and the ferry.
Victoria harbour. Fantastic views from both sides. Enjoy a ferry ride across the harbour for less than 3 HK dollars and watch the light show at night.

Constant activity on the busy harbour. Our room overlooked this busy harbour, and I spend many hours just watching the comings and goings below. There is a constant shuttle of ferries between Kowloon and Hong Kong; one every 5 minutes at peak hour (I timed them). As far as I could tell there was little pollution, although the constant construction work going on around the harbour causes some discoloration of the water at times.

Fond, fond memories.. It is truly one of the best harbours in the world. The ferry trip was highly enjoyable both ways. To go to Hong Kong and miss this would be akin to visiting NYC and never looking up. I could have lingered here much longer. It is an integral part of makes HK my favorite city.

Plenty of Ways to View it-ALL FREE. Victoria Harbour is really the centerpiece and likely the main reason Hong Kong exists. There is an extraordinary amount of commerce being moved from and to everywhere and as a visitor to Hong Kong, the main thing are the beautiful views you have whether you are on the promenade in Kowloon, on top of Victoria Peak or viewing it from Hong Kong Island-it is a very exciting place to see.
Good trip. Star Ferry a good trip went over to Kowloon to watch the night laser light show over HK.Junk trip around harbour good too.

Fantastic view of Hong Kong skyline. Last night in Hong Kong, and no trip in Hong Kong will be complete without a visit here. Take the ferry cross the river or stroll along the river, the choice is yours.
Great view. I missed this during my first visit and my friend told me what a miss it was. So on my 2nd visit, i purposely made a quick stop over just to come to this place. It worthed it!

Nothing quite like it. If you're going to Hong Kong you already know about Victoria Harbour. What you may not know is that this is a harbor unlike any other, both from a historical and scenic point of view. Don't worry about studying up, you'll understand as soon as you see it, or cross it on the Star Ferry. The only thing to concern you is how to view it. Here's my vote: Given just a brief time to behold its majesty, opt for a room on the Kowloon side facing Hong Kong, and pray for a clear night.

Hanging on the Harbour. The harbour is one view you won't tire of. Jump on board the Star Ferry (HKD$4 one way) to really experience it. Full review, photos, and other Hong Kong recommendations here http://feastplaylove.me/2014/04/26/things-to-do-in-hong-kong/

A great way to see Hong Kong. For just a few HK$, take the Star Ferry from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon (or the reverse) on a clear day for what must be one of the finest views in Asia. Mingling among the busy locals all heading to or from work, you get out onto the water for some stunning views of the high rise tower blocks set in front of the majestic Victoria Peak. It's a must do thing for the tourist and a great way to commute for the locals.

Low Level Panoramic Views of Spectacular HK. Victoria Harbor is a fantastic way of viewing the skyline from a different point of view. The Peak shows you the city from above while the harbor shows you fantastic views from across the water spanning as far as the eye can see. To access the viewing platform on the Tsim Sai Tsui (Kowloon) side of the Harbor the best way is to take the Star Ferry from Pier 7 in Central, easily accessed by Central MTR station for 2.5$HK once you leave the terminal the viewing platform is a short walk along the covered walkway and to the right, you cant miss it.This is the perfect opportunity for anyone who wishes to see the skyline but isn't too comfortable with the heights of The Peak.In conclusion....Victoria Harbor offers spectacular views for minimal cost. If heights aren't your thing this is the perfect opportunity. It provides a perfect backdrop for photos and is somewhere you can just pass the time away soaking it all in.

Nice place. Take a ferry there, it's faster and cheaper compared to the public transportation. Pleasant place to walk about. Pretty skyline especially during the light show at 8pm every night. If you're hot and tired, Harbour City mall is just around the corner.
Beautiful views at night. Beautiful views at night very romantic. See the Bruce Lee statue, the boats on the harbor, the flashing lights on the buildings, and the walk of fame.

Awesome view...!!!. Its literally an awesome view. Beautiful tall buildings surrounded by green misty mountains. We took a ferry from Tsim Tsa Tsui, Wanchai which didnt cost us much (I forgot the exact rate so i'm not writing it). It took us 10 minutes to reach Kowloon but that 10 minutes took my breath away. Cool breeze and gushing sound of water you cannot forget. National Geographic has put Victoria Harbour in one of the 50 places to be. The view is stunning and you would love to go their once again and then again.P.s: Night time or late evening are best times to be there.
Spectacular views. Watching the boats passing to and fro, day and night and the views of Hong Kong Island across the water.

Must-go for Hong Kong. The Canton Road shopping area leads beautifully up to the harbour itself. The area fits together very nicely, making the "journey" up towards the harbour a positive mixture of class, buzz and adventure. Try the Godiva soft cone at the top of Harbour City or the gelato at the end of the walk, on the ferry pier.

Best skyline ever. Take the Star Ferry to the Kowloon side, turn back, and be prepared to be amazed. The skyline is just amazing! Best photo opportunities are late afternoon and at night (bring your tri-pod)!

To Return to Agian & Again. Whether to walk the Kowloon side from Star Ferry to the end of Avenue of the Stars, or to stroll the HK Island from Central to the yacht club and Causeway Bay, or to take a harbour cruise, (do all three), is to take in the sights and experience one of the sights of modern world.. By day is good, then at night takes on another genre again. Then is the overview from Victoria Peak and the spectacular Symphony of Lights culminating the experience.
Great tour at sundown. Take the tour. Well worth it and get your tickets early. A different view of the city on both sides of the harbour.

Nice interlude. We took the one hour harbor tour run by the Star Ferry Co. And it was a great way to get a look at things from the water including people on traditional fishing boats trying to catch a few.Worth an hour or two.
Endless fascination. There's always something happening, so many different ships, boats and ferries sailing through. At night you can't see as much, but then the city lights are a dazzling spectacle

Breathtaking view of the harbour. Enjoyed the breathtaking view of the harbour while chewing on grilled squids! There is also a Starbucks and a pub where visitors can sip on their drinks while enjoying the view!

An essential for a tourist. Victoria Harbour gives a comprehensive flavour of Hong Kong. You have great views of the Hong Kong Skyline, the peak behind & the sea in entirety. There are multiple ways to experience this.1- Go on the Star Ferry from pier no 7 to TST on the upper deck to experience the beautiful skyline. I personally recommend doing it on both the day time & the evening time.. but if you need to choose - evening time is a Thumbs Up.2- Go to Tamar Park along the Victoria Park. It practically starts from Pier no 7 & goes until Admiralty.3- If you wanna go the $$$$ way, book yourself a table at the Ritz Carlton & get unparalleled views of the Victoria Harbour & 5 star experience4- For a slightly more upmarket experience on the waters of Victoria Harbour - book yourself a seat on the Aqua Luna for a 2 hour long experience of the Harbour & the skyline. You will enjoy whichever you pick up.
Nice stretch for a pleasant walk. Nice view of the skyline!! good option for a walk and dinner. Harbor mall is a good option right on the harbor with various avenues for shopping and dining.
Gorgeous. What a beautiful harbor! Book an evening cruise to see it properly. You can also get a good look from the ferries that cross the channel.

Take a cruise or ferry. Worth a cruise to get the best views of the skyline of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. If you don't have time or want to save money just take a ferry from HK Island to TST for a couple of HKD.

Well worthwhile. It poured with rain throughout my short visit. However the trip I took on the boat to see Victoria Harbour was well worthwhile. I got to see the harbour and kept dry. The was also plenty of opportunities to take Photos. The trip lasted an hour and I was pleased I had done it.

Great Harbour. I never get sick of travelling int he ferries. In fact, they are cheaper than travelling by buses. Of course, accidents do happen and a few years ago there was an accident that caused deaths. The harbour is very attractive with ferries that come in various colours, sizes and different kinds of ferries.

Business traveler enjoyed the harbor. This was one of the nicest part of my week long stay in Hong Kong. Love the big city feel in a small . Lots of activities along the harbor. Fairies and boats, moving around, many of the restaurants have harbor views. Beautiful at night.

Great Laser Show in Hong Kong!. The laser light show at night showcases all the skyscrapers by the harbor and is real cool!
It us easily accessible by the superb MTR network of Hong Kong

Great at night. One of the best looking harbours in the world.
Find somewhere nice and watch the lights at night....

Gorgeous view. Very nice view, nice to stroll along the harbour at night. Romantic.
Wide path, although there are many people and it was squeezy at certain central points, it gets less crowded as you walk.
Some small stalls that offer phototaking services along the way.
The Harbour. Go see the 8pm light show - every night. Or better still take a cruise around the harbour to coincide with lights - cheaper still take the Star Ferry, about 20p, to Central.

Beautiful night scenery. Panoramic night view with the colourful neon lights from the buildings across the harbor. Nothing much to do besides just relax and enjoy the view while strolling along the harbor.The scene will reminds you of those scenes in the most of the TVB's dramas. Its worth a visit if you are in HK for a holiday as it is a famous tourist attraction after all.
Nice place, Must visit. If you are at Hong Kong and if you miss to visit Victoria Harbour than you have missed a lot. Must go for ferry in eve to enjoy light show in night.

The bright view. The interaction between local traditions, seen in markets such as lady or flower market, and the gate to the world, revealed via passenger liners and some of the world biggest container ships is striking. A good place to get some air from the buisy city streets and to walk along the promenade admiring the stars statues and imprints or just having a cup of tea. In the evening an amazing laser show takes place enlightening all of victoria harbour and the surrounding skylines. Diverse islands with beautiful sandy beaches and restaurants which prepare delicious seafood can be accessed from the harbour.

Its a must do. It is a harbour city and the best way to really orientate yourself is to spend an hour or two going around the harbour. If you are lucky as we were it was a sunny day and we has some great photo opportunities.
HK city. The view of HK buildings from across the island in the morning and at night was great. You can stay there adn relax your mind staring at those lights and buildings adn the moonlight.

8PM. There are light show which organised on 8PM every night by 15 minutes,after we have take a bus to night market to try their sea food and do some shopping for souvenier for memory,after we have walk along the Nathan Road and get back to the guest house we have stayed in.

Beautiful View. Stroll along the harbor to take in the beautiful view. Best time to go is in the evening when the lights from the buildings across the harbor are light (approx: 7 pm-11 pm.). It is a nice experience for families and couples. Time spent can be as little as 20 mins to an hour or two, its up to you. ps the building light show, which is at 8:15, is nice if it fits into your schedule but a touch over-hyped, so if you miss it no biggie.
Hong harbour in the rain. Enjoyed the star ferry harbour crossings and the rain shrouded harbour views. Having an octopus card makes it all so easyTrip takes about 10 minutes

Don't miss it!. A must do when in HK. View from Red bar in IFC or take the charming star ferry over to Kowloon. Another great (but expensive) spot to view the harbour is at Sevva. Go for a drink and the light show (starts at 8pm)

Great atmosphere and sights.. Victoria Harbor is the waterway that separates Kowloon from the island side of Hong Kong. If you have time it is worth seeing both day and night. You can experience it by boat, ferry crossing, from Victoria peak or walking the promenade. It is the foundation of (in my opinion) the greatest skyline in the world. See my other reviews of Tsim Sha Tsui and Avenue of the Stars for more of Victoria harbor. No fee.

Stunning. We were there just before Symphony of lights then the music started playing and a series of spotlights shooting off the roofs of skyscrapers which was good. It is definitely worth spending a few minutes on the Avenue of the Stars to see the city lit up and looking gorgeous with lights reflecting of the harbour.
beautiful. beautiful by day night and even in the fog... seems very eerie to me to see the buildings cut in half by clouds.

Truly breathtaking. We went there during July and with beautiful sunshine and light winds, it was the ideal scenic view. It's truly a beautiful place, good for pictures and just strolls with your loved ones~
Nasir Mehmood.. Its a lovely place & leisure show was very nice. Overall Hong kong is a lovely & lively place. I was there fr Business but HK is also a family Liesure Place.

Part of the great view.... The harbor is definitely a great part of the Skyline attraction!
Like I said before, bring your tripod and camera to take some great images with you!

step away from peace guest house hong kong. the place are just walking distance from our staying place,the night scene is amazing and memorable and we to enjoy the photographer who snap one pictures for us and the burce lee statues,is a good place to walk around before sleep.
Not my expectation. The Bruce Lee statue is the attraction to all martial art fans. but the of Symphony of Lights was not nice at all consider after a long wait to see it at night.

Wonders on the Harbour. There are quite a number of activities that one can partake in along Victoria Harbour. Of course, there are many opportunities for shopping in the boutique shops or directly from street vendors. There are also many choices for dining. Perhaps the stroll along the Harbour walkway itself is more than enough as you take in the sea air and the view of the modern skyline or the many sea craft that pass through the harbour.

Not too special. I love the city lights but its similar to Singapore. They have dancing lights at night but apparently it was not that special. A bit boring in fact. Too crowded too so I couldn't take a better shot of picture.
Harbour Lights. Free laser light show every evening at 8pm well worth a visit (with thousands of others)--the harbour is just as you see in the brochures and a trip on the ferry is a must

Night crowed. The food there not really good, dont try fried squid, because its hard to chew. If you go there on december till late march dont forget to bring coat, sweater, to warm your body because the weather and wind is chill. But you can enjoy the light of the city from there. There were also street mucision that play nice music

Plenty to explore!. Pros: Pulse of the city, ride Star ferry inexpensively to see the harbor, eat egg custard tarts at bakery in terminal, decent bathroom facilities, connection to mazes of shopping malls & nice tourist info "store."Con: Worn & dirty. Unreliable kiosk personnel (closed when their clock in window says they should be open) for Star Ferry tour.
Cool weather. Fabulous views but the weather wasn't kind to us when we were there, it was cool and misty / rainy when we visited

Busy and misty. I enjoyed watching the comings and goings of the harbour from my hotel room.We took a Star Ferry ride but it was short - might have chosen the hour long harbour cruise if we had more time.It was also a foggy misty day so view was obscured - it was like that all week unfortunately.Had hoped to see more traditional boats but only saw two on the harbour over the 6 days we stayed at TST.

glow in the dark. You gotta have spend few hours here to see the stunning view of Hong Kong City in the night time. We were amazed by the lights, the busy harbour...ferries, ships, all passing by. the coldness and windy night not even affected us at all as we were really enjoy our time here...taking photographs and absorbing the beauty of it. This attraction is compulsory to visit...it is really worth!
amazing view. amazing view at night! the lights from the buildings across were very very nice! very recomended when you visit HK!

Best viewed in the night. It is one of the largest natural harbours, can be best viewed during the night form Tsim Sha sui promenade on the Kowloon side, or from HK convention center from Hong Kong Island side. Take Star Ferry harbor tour, the tours start from afternoon from Central/Wanchai/Tsim Sha Sui ferry

Stunning view of Hong Kong. Spend few hours there admiring the beautiful harbour and get a closer view about hong kong life.Really enjoyed watching the Junk Boat,ferries and luxury cruise passing by the famous harbour.
Don't ever missed it ^.^. No matter how busy but must plan a visit to Victoria Harbour, well worth visit in Hong Kong especially at night.
A different perspective. Victoria Harbour is a bit smelly but it's worth the assault on your nostrils just to see the skyline from the sea. The best time is at night when Hong Kong is all lit up.

Prof Jeff at Victoria Harbour Hong Kong. This is the central waterway through Hong Kong. There is development work on the Island side to open more space for recreation. On the Kowloon side of the Harbour there is plenty of pedestrian walking space beside the harbour and traffic free. Of course no visit is complete without crossing the harbour on the iconic Star Ferries. They are possibly the cheapest transport you will ever use. If you want to sit and watch the boat traffic there are plenty of seats and refreshments are close by.

Panoramic Views of Victoria Harbour. One of the main attractions for visiting Hong Kong, the evening time views of the Victoria Harbour from atop the Victoria Peak are the best. The Victoria harbor is located between the Kowloon peninsula & Hong Kong island. Panoramic views of the harbor from the Hong Kong island side can also be viewed from the IFC Mall & Bank of China building. While, Tsim Tsa Shui promenade, Sky100 of ICC tower offers great views of the harbor from Kowloon side. A ride in the iconic Star Ferry is a must to get a feel of the scenic harbor without which no visit to Hong Kong can be considered complete.
Fantastic. This is definitely my most favourite place in HK since I was a kid. I must come to this astonishing place every time I come to HK

You can't miss it if you are in HK!. It's a harbour, for heaven's sake! I can't get too enthusiastic about a stretch of water with a lot of tall buildings in the background. Though I do have to say that getting the ferries from the islands back into Victoria Harbour was always fun: that sea breeze in your face, and the locals jostling for position to be the first off, gave me a bit of a buzz!
Interesting place. We liked coming back down in the tram! Unfortunately, the weather was wet and cloudy, so we were not able to see much of the view from the top.

Wow. Great place to see the city, the laser show is worth having a look at! Go early to get a good place to see them. They show the laser show twice every night, so pretty with all the lights from the buildings too!

Spectacular. Like many of the world's most recognisable sights, the harbour view (at night in particular) is still amazing even if you've seen in pictures many times. You can't go to Hong Kong and not see it.

Beautiful sight of Hong Kong. This is one of the most beautiful sights with the ships and boats of all sizes and Kowloon in the background. There are mountains around Hong Kong as well. At night the lights are vibrant and awesome to see.

Well-decorated harbour. If you really enjoy the Victoria Harbour, first of all, I would recommend you to take a tram either from Central (near Hong Kong Bank headquarters) or from Causeway Bay (near Sogo Department Store) to Wanchai MTR station.Walking along the footbridge that leads to the Wanchai pier, then you can take a ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui. Within ten minutes, you can enjoy the scenery(the skyline) on both sides of the harbour, extremely beautiful at night. If you want to take pictures, you'd better to take your ride downstairs rather than upstairs.

Take a ferry trip across the harbour--your most romantic thing to do in Hong Kong.. Even though you are on a limited budget, you can still afford a ferry trip across the harbour. The trip is very romantic.

One of the best place I've ever visited. If you like modern buildings, visit this place and see one of the most wonderful place in the world! I will not forget all those lights shining and ahowing the modern city of HK.

Be prepared for the crowd on 8PM. If you want to occupy the best location for watching the light on 8PM, you should go there on 7.15PM. The fast foods or snack should be prepared. You will be hungry and it's hard to find the food on the harbour area. Mcdonald or fast food near the harbour are full of people. The lights are beautiful and worth to see. But there is very very crowd. You may have no good pictures if you don't have a great location to stand. So please go occupy the location early
How could you not do this. We recommend a quick trip on the Star Ferry to see this historic harbour and to view the skyline. We went to the Symphony of Lights--it was OK.
Free Event. At 8.00pm every night is a sky-show of laser light beams, from high rise buildings on Hong Kong Island. Worth being there.

Must go!. Go in the night to catch HK's beautiful skyline.
The symphony lights show is a complete letdown. If HK's Tourism Board is reading this - please revamp the light show, you have so many tourists waiting with anticipation but went away wondering what was it they have just seen.

Nice Place. Interesting and always packed with people.... Provides a fantastic view of Hong Kong at night and there are also street performances that helps to heighten the atmosphere. Recommend spot for night @ Hong Kong.
Spell-binding. A truly beautiful harbour ( and I was born in Sydney:-) ). Always changing according to the light both natural and electric. Amazing atmosphere, night or day it is spell-binding.

Nice. Victoria Harbour is a natural landform harbour situated between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon in Hong Kong. I like it so much because it is wonderful. I could enjoin spectacular views of HK skyline while i took a strong along the Victoria Harbour promenade.

what a view. spent a few days bothsides pleanty to do and even just chilling out people whatching or even taking a sanpan around ,the star ferry is something else but in a good way cheap to cross aswel the lazer display is fantastic from 8pm till 9pm nightly we were lucky the Hong Kong sevens were on so extra things on both sides of harbour pity it rained on final as it put of the firework display.
great views. beautiful views, we came in on the Queen Mary 2, we had awesome views of the harbour. best at night. we missed the light show as we,were off shopping every night.
nice in the evening. Nice ride on a historical ship. And is cheap. One trip costs only 2 HKD.Better ride at 20pm when laser show.

Bustling Harbour. Victoria Harbour is a forever changing bustling harbour. The activity is constant with the Star Ferry, Macau hydrofoil, junks galore, the prettiest of which is no doubt Aqualuna. There are container ships and ferries everywhere. The harbour is a hive of activity.

Heart of HK. A busy and ever present part of HK, Victoria Harbour is all about HK. From the train service that runs under it, to the multitude of transports on the water, this is an aspect of HK a visitor is very unlikely to miss.

Fantastic views. Fantastic views around and across victoria harbour. Skip the fancy and expensive tourboats, and just stick with the star ferries that criss-cross the harbour.
Must-see when visiting hong kong, hughly recommended.

Loved the dragon boats. While it's easier to take the subway back and forth between Kowloon and Hong Kong, if you've got time, do take the Star Ferry (only HK$2 or US$.30) to catch a glimpse of how life used to be like. The harbor is not as busy as it used to be since much of the port areas are being built up outside the harbor area but it's still pretty impressive. At night, lit dragon boats filled with tourists fill the harbor in order to take in the light show--I got some pretty good photos of the boats on display.
Great views. The views are spectacular! Crossing the harbour on the Star Ferry at least a couple of times is a must.

Great sight. Go on the Kowloon / Hong Kong Island ferry and see one of the best sights in the world for HK$ 2! Its amazing, even if you dont want to go anywhere just ride back and forth and take it in (and photos!)
Amazing!. The views were amazing! Definitely recommend it! My children loved it too! The weather was great - 28c!

A Neon lit harbour. During ones stay in Hong Kong, one must visit Victoria Harbour. The lights of the buildings on the sides of the harbour light reflect beautifully on the harbour, but what mesmerized me was the light show at 8pm. Lasers from the top of various buildings shot into the sky along with music that accompanied it. Apart from the light show at night, if one visits the harbour, one can admire the iconic buildings of Hong Kong such as the Bank of China, IFC and its taller sister IFC 2 among many others. Among the picture perfect harbour line is the Star Ferry pier which links Hong Kong Island to Kowloon with its frequent ferries crossing the harbour.Overall, a must visit while in Hong Kong.
We are sailing.... As the man says, a trip on the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour is one of the 50 things you have to do before you die. True.
Stunning skyline. Breathtaking skyline in a truly amazing city. Highly recommended. You must go to the top and use the tram to take you there. Unique experience

Hong Kong Highlight. This is why you come to the City. Breathtakingly beautiful. Tons of atmosphere. Light show, second to none. Great spotting, the skyscrapers, with the new Ritz Carlton Hotel very impressive.

Exciting bustle - effective travel. Well from here you can travel to Macao, the other islands or catch the venerable Star Ferries across to Kowloon for next to nothing. Most ferries are regular - Star ferries continuous - and you get good views as your ferry departs. Part of any trip to Hong Kong !

Stunning. The cityscape of HK is just stunning! The weather is just right, chilly and not that cold. The light show was nice but not really spectacular. Good place to sit by with a cup of coffee in hand!

Both sides. We took a boat ride at night in the harbor. The light show was nice, but not spectacular. The boat ride was a nice way to see the harbor. It was beautiful to see both sides of the harbor and all the boats on the water . It was chilly, bring a jacket.

It's a harbour. What makes the harbour special is its surroundings. The skyline of TST on Kowloon from Hong Kong island, and the skyline of Hong Kong from the Kowloon side. From the centre, you get a 360 degree view of both from the Strar Ferry. The harbour was the reason the British liked the place so much.
Beautiful. Beautiful scenery and nice walks along the promenade. The weather was sunny but can get a bit chilly with the windy. Nice break to rest your feet.
Not much of a view. Every day we were there, it was overcast and the fog, mist or smog made the light show impossible to enjoy.
Misty, Cold and Windy. It is "misty" and windy and extremely cold in Mid of March. Remember to bring your coat to stay warm.
Harbour. Yes, a harbour is a harbour but it was just relaxing walking along the promenade from city centre and walking through the gardens.
The skyline is gorgeous against the water. This is the center of the action in Hong Kong. It's particularly fun to take a rickety ferry across to The island.
Lovely place with good view. Great way to see the city skyline and lighting. The place is windy and cool when we were there. Crowded.

Make more of other locations. Yes you have to go here and along the promenade but after pushing past the rude locals and other Asian tourists on a smelly promenade where half of it is continually blocked off due to maintenance you are better off enjoying other areas of the island and heading to Hong Kong island or Lantau for a slightly better experience. The light show is absolute rubbish and not worth waiting for. Go to Disney and watch the fireworks at 8.00pm, that is truly magical.
Catch the ferry. A wonderful harbour, so easy to catch the local ferry, but is also a must do at night, very beautiful.
Beautiful by Day & Night. Try and wander during the day and night. Don't try and work a night time visit in with the light show - really not worth it, but a lovely city just the same.

BEST HARBOUR IN THE WORLD !!!. Victoria Harbour is one of the finest harbours in the world ! From small sampans, barges, sailboats, to luxury liners ,the harbour caters for all sea craft , day or night . A cruise on the Harbour is a must during your stay in HONG KONG .

Hong Kong must see, the Star Ferry from TST to Hong Kong Island and Stanley Market.. Beautiful ride at night, the lights of Hong Kong just for you. The ride is cheap, go 1st Class !
During the day before the evening ferry return to TSTgo to Stanley Market, good food sights along the way and just fun.

Interesting but not crazy on the weekend. We had heard about the Star Ferry boats being overloaded with passengers and non-stop sanpan and boat traffic, but out experience (on a weekend) was that there was enough to interest, but not enough to scare or intimidate. If in Kowloon, or on Hong Kong Island, you should cross the harbour to gain the other perspective.

Hong Kong harbour.. 2000 hours every evening there is a laser show to view from the harbour on the Cowloon side of Hong Kong.All the tall buildings have lasers fitted and they put on a spectacular shoe which lasts around 20 minutes.Cowloon also has a great shopping mall with 5 floors of shops.

Breathtaking. another must in HK, impossible to skip. it takes your breath away at any time in the day. the city enlight on the water it is a perfect combination of art and nature. you dhould take your time walking by the Harbour or just take the ferry to live it completely

cityscape at its best. Its a magcal place to admire one of the best harbors in the world. The spot on the outside terrace of IFC Mall and the avenue of the stars are the best spots to admire the view!

Lots going on in the Harbour. Victoria Harbour is a busy place and if you have a hotel room with a view of the harbor you'll be able to have a great view of the skyline and see the many boats in the Harbour. We weren't impressed by the light show, but did enjoy the lights of the many buildings surrounding the harbor as the reflected into the water. Quite beautiful.

good light show. This is a must-do if you are in Hong Kong as its basically free and also it won't take very long at all. The light show occurs almost every night and you can just sit and watch the show. Seeing this place day and night is very different.
Beautiful ~. If you are able to book accommodation anywhere near here, you will definitely have one of the best experiences. The location is filled with tourists and is lively all day or night.
A pretty pier but thats it. Good views of the HK skyline and good walking promenades. But not much else. The Avenue of stars is close so thats worth a visit
harbour sights. the Duk Ling boat trip on the harbour was worth it as we had sunny skies and no rain. book it at the tourist info centre o the foreshore, i think it only goes thursday and ssaturday

MUST GO. The harbour was one of the first spots in HK I went to. It was an amazing. I couldn't believe the view, it's definitely a staple area to visit in HK. There is a shopping area where you can explore the more expensive stores in HK and a scenic area where you can just chill and take in the view. During the day you can also get on the Star Ferry to enjoy a tour. At night, you can go to the harbour and watch the Symphony of Lights show at 8:00. The show goes on every night unless the weather is bad. It's cool, there's music and a lot the buildings participate in the show. The show is also narrated in English, Cantonese and Putonghua on different days. Even if you go on night where they are speaking a language you don't understand, it's still interesting to watch. The harbour is a great to bring family, friends, and loved ones. You can walk down to the Avenue of Stars and there are bars you can go to as well. Overall, amazing place for pictures and to take in what HK has to offer.

Spectacular view of Hong Kong both Day and Night!. This is the place I believe that everyone should not miss when you have a trip to Hong Kong. There are a lot of things to do around Victoria Harbour; for example, avenue of star, taking a photo with harbour view, water cruising, shopping at department store around like The habour city. Personally, I enjoyed being there a lot.

Simply amazing. The skyline is priceless its self, however the view of skyline from victoria harbour is the best. Although there are tons of tourist around, you'll always be able to spot a space and either sit down and enjoy the view or take some great photos. Since victoria harbour has some active spots for the tourist boats, it's a interesting atmosphere around.
One of the great Big City Harbors. Get on the Star Ferry or a harbor tour boat and enjoy the Hong Kong Harbor. It is a deep water harbor and one of the great Big City Harbors in the world.
enjoyed amidst the rain. its my first time in the place and im greeted by the rain but that doesnt stop me from enjoying the place.
great spot for a stroll. Liked the vibe and the avenue of stars. Would like to return some day. Pity it was foggy but still a great experience.
still nice after all these years. went down to watch night time laser show nice and the view is still nice after so many visit there nice to stand and watch the boats go past and all the people

City on the water. Always think cities on the water are so much better and Hong Kong & Victoria Harbour do not disapoint.
The views across the water are great and even more so if you take the ferry between the island and Kowloon.

Harbour with mountains.. Harbour with mountains and greenary all around and the Skyline are the best part to view from anywhere- Roads, Sea links, ferry, Hotel windows, a series of highrise buildings.

Beautiful View of the City!. Love visiting the harbour just to check out the lights. If you get a chance to stop by during the right evening, there's also an amazing light show. I personally love the view a from Star Avenue beside the Hong Kong Cultural Center! If you're stopping by HK, you definitely need to make a stop...Day or night!

Good place to visit. We stayed nearby and enjoyed our walks along the harbour side both during the day and at night.
We also took a boat trip around the harbour which gave a different view of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.
Well worth a visit.
Great skyline view. We took the star ferry back and forth just to see both sides of the Hong Kong Skyline. Great views both ways. A good tip: Go around 8pm and watch the light show from the ferry.

A nice harbour.. Victoria Harbour is beautiful each day of the year, but it is especially beautiful during the Chinese ID, when it is beautifully lit and fireworks light the skies.Try to get a clear day so that you can appreciate the surroundings of the harbour (no matter which side of the city you look at) and don't miss a cruise in the harbour.
Lovely. Go for a walk both during the day and at night to get a different perspective of this lovely harbour.
Day or Night. A great place to be, whether by day or by night. We took the bustling Star Ferry trips to explore during the day; and we just strolled in the evenings.Lots to catch on camera and video.

Spectacular and one of the world's best.. The harbour view, whether it is from Hong Kong or Kowloon side, is spectacular and can be considered one of the best harbour front views in the world be it in the day or night. Take a ride on Star Ferry and you can enjoy the view from the sea. Can never get tired of this view.
Stunning views. Lots to see and walk around. Light show is just so-so. Can be very busy. Worth taking the ferry back and forth

Excellent view. The view from the Kowloon side is breathtaking. Great views. Gets windy.
Take the Star Ferry across from the HK island side and walk to the promenade in front of the HK Cultural Center.

A great Nightout for Romantic photo scene. A place where Hongkong stars hands and feet embed street that Lovers comes to romance with; Nice Panorama habour Buidling view with golden sunset light and symphony laser showing at 08:00PM; .
Very Beautiful. One of the most famous harbors in the world. Not to be missed if you are in Hong Kong. Take the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong.
high point in hong kong. can see for miles, good for photos in mornings.can be a bit windy some days but the view makes up for that.

Better than even the guide books tell us. Travelling on the star ferry ( and seniors go free would you believe?!) as it plies across the harbour to/ from Kowloon is absolutely magical; day time is great for the views but at night it's another and different experience! You have to do it .....every time is exciting and the whole experience lingers in the memory. So much to do and see in the evening especially as you hop off the ferry on the Kowloon side and wander along the Avenue of Stars ; the nightly Light show at 8pm each evening...the Symphony of lights..... is quite magical and you just cannot stop taking "that next photo" Enjoy!
Great place to take in the view. Take the ferry across and soak up the view! Not to be missed on your visit to HK. Should be at the top of the list!

Always Entertaining!. Day and Night the action never stops. Beautiful harbor with amazing building on all sides. Take on of the many boat rides available, or just cross the harbor on the ferry, for a different view.

A view with love. I have been in the last 12 years into HK more then 500 days total. This is always one of my top spots for ANYTHING. If you want to relax or clear your mind or have fun or be amazed here is where you need to be. Even when it's raining this place has a great feeling about the views. Night time this place really comes alive. I never get tired of the view here. Now if you want to have a bit of adventure please do take the Star Ferry. Stay on the lower deck closer to the water. You will feel like the olden times going over from TST to HK Island it's the best short trip of your life. Enjoy!!!

A famous view. Victoria Harbour paired with the Hong Kong Skyline make up what is one of the most recognized tourist attractions in the world. You will always see this prominent view on the TV and Internet. Spend some time walking at the Avenue of Stars whether day or night to appreciate it. This harbour is very busy with ships, ferries and vessels travelling to and fro. Every night there’s a light and music show. Don’t go to Hong Kong without taking a look at this famous attraction.

Still love it although I have been here many times. I would say...this is a must come place in Hong Kong. It might not be the best view that I have ever seen but It gives you a great view of Hong Kong city, buildings...etc.
Take a ferry ride around the harbor. At night the lights are spectacular! I think the light show starts at 8 pm and is worth being on a boat to see.
Victoria Harbour Symphony of Lights Show. great atmosphere and views of the Hong Kong Light Show from Kowloon Avenue of the Stars near the Star Ferry Terminal.
fabulous views. Great value boat trip, around an hour. Good if you have limited time and don't want to pay high prices for the evening/dinner cruise.

Stunning view!!. Liked liked liked... this is the best place in HK to visit homies. I don't know the way around HK so I took the taxi up. It was a long wait from where I live in TST but well worth it. I recommend all mah homies to go man

A Great View!. Looking down on the harbor, busy with ferries and other ships, or at the brilliantly lighted buildings from a boat on the harbor is breathtaking. Simply one of the best in the world. A harbor ride in a tour boat, with or without dinner, is well worth the money. The view from the top of Victoria Peak is well worth the wait for the tramline or the cost of a taxi ride (HK$80).

Nightly light show is a must see. Starts at 7 or 8pm everyday. Complete with choreographed music the light show is amazing! Loved all the traditional and modern boats passing around the harbour. Makes you feel like you are part of something special.
Star Ferry. Defo get the Star Ferry to go across the harbour...top deck more "posh" and costs a bit more...loved more the lower deck...feels more authentic :)
LIGHT SHOW IS A MUST SEE. must see the light show, daily at 8:00pm. The dinner cruise looked like a great idea while the light show is on (do it without young kids though)

Only One Word. Only one word fits the Victoria Harbor- stunning! We enjoyed it immensely, even taking the Star Ferry several times to enjoy it better. It's especially nice at night- take your cameras!
Easy viewing. Harbour tours around Victoria Harbour run thjroughout the day. An easy way to get an orientation on the city and thesurrounding areas.

atleast ones in lifetime. Hong Kong is best destination for travel and shopping . duty free and live ,,
recommended to visit Hong Kong with Friends or family,
beaches , Bars , Dine and Life ,,,
All is here in hk
A must visit. You must visit and go on the ferry as well. Magnificent. One of the most beautiful skylines in the world. And the ferry is only a short-ride so you shouldn't get sick.

Worth the stroll. Come here not only for the avenue of star, but also see how the hong kong people lives... Every night 8pm, there is this laser light show, it is worth the wait. And if you wake up early, taken breakfast, waiting for time to pass, come here, enjoy the breeze and see how tourist and local people spend their time here. It is really relaxing, let alone the view is stunning.
Nice views. Just walk around the harbour and be suprised by all the lights you see! Buildings having beautifull lightshows. Just sit back relax and enjoy

Just love the Star Ferry. One of the "must do" things in Hong Kong. Only HK$2,8 pr trip is fantastic value - it's even less is you travel on the lower deck. Great views and a much better way to cross the harbour that the MTR. Use your Octopus card or buy a token at the machine and wait at the gate. If you get on a ferry just before 8pm the captain will stop in the middle of the harbour to enable you to take photos of the Symphony of Light.
Beautiful Views. The harbour allows you to see the beautiful views of Hong Kong skyline. You must take a ferry from one side to another at least ones.

fantastic. It is one of the best places to see in Hong Kong , the light show and view is just fabulous , If you landing in night at around 8.00 pm , you can get the chance to see from the flight Also , Was lucky one of them to see from the flight

Take the ferry over to the other side. Take the ferry over to the other side, to get a close up view of the water and all of the boats. Both in the day as well as in the night the views and activity are always buzing. Seems like the city and water never sleep
One of the world's great boat rides. So busy! Ferries weaving through the larger shipping. Great mix of people on the boats. Amazing vertical cityscapes on both the Hong Kong Island and Kowloon sides
Enjoy the light show and night view. This the best place to see how Hong Kong looks like at night, The city view and laser show are simply awesome. Just sit back and relax.

Very extensive harbour with an amazing skyline. Not quite sure what reviewers are raving about when viewed from ground level. There are amazing views of the harbour from the Peak and the size of the harbour is phenomenal but there are much prettier ones elsewhere, e.g. at Sydney. It's a must on a visit to Hong Kong, of course.

Great Harbour.... Took the Star Ferry ride across the Victoria Harbour to HK Island. There was so much smog on the Harbour when we visited it did spoil the view, but it is certainly worth a walk along the boardwalk to soak in the atmosphere of this busy environment. The laser light show off the skyscrapers on HK Island was fun and enjoyable. We did a night boat ride out on the water and the lights are nothing short of spectacular. Plenty to see and do close to the water.

CNY Fireworks. We took the Cataluna Cruise for the CNY fireworks and it was AMAZING! A small intimate boat, only holds about 64 guests. Butler passed hors d'oevures and two drinks included in price. It was so relaxing and beautiful.

great setting seeing the rich and the poor mix. suoperb area and seeing how the rich park alongside the poor when mooring their boats and how the boat people live is a treasure,the water is however very polluted but worth a visit and sight seeing tour thats not that expensive on your wallet

What a view. There are few cities that allow access for a view from TST across Victoria Harbor over to Hong Kong Island...the harbor is pretty narrow so you feel as through you are looking into a neighbor's yard when taking in the expanse of the HK view...great during the day but best at night...Smog can obscure so if its clear go do this then as the smog always comes back...it can be stinky if the wind and water are aligned the wring way.

Amazing views. The harbour provides one of the most amazing views of the skyline in Hong Kong. Take an evening leisure walk along the harbour to enjoy the fascinating Hong Kong skyline well lit up in the evening. You could probably witness the so called 'light pollution' in the haze; most of the time it is haze- courtesy the pollution in the air but that cant stop you to enjoy the views. Take lot of pictures. Photo enthusiast- carry a tripod; i didn't and later wondered why!
Evening walk. Love the cool weather and leisure walk with family, but not happy with the crowd. Took a lot of pictures.

Hazy but expected. It was hazy in the daytime at best so most of the city was not seen to its full potential. Although in saying that it was expected. Night time really makes the harbour seem more stunning,

Breathtaking View & The New Year Fireworks. The moment you enter Hongkong from Macau by ferry, you start enjoying the mesmerizing view of the harbour.Ofcourse, nothing matches the experience on the ferry and enjoying the view from the windows.No need to take any cruise, just book a hotel offering a direct view and you will just love it.

Nice place to hang out. Here you get the view of the entire modern city of Hong Kong.Here you feel the harmony between modern busy lifestyle with relaxing peaceful environment.Here you can enjoy a walk with your loved one to the Star Pier and Avenue of Star.Here you can enjoy a cup of hot drinks in the winter while chilling, watching the busy waterway.Here, you must visit if you are going to Hong Kong!

Fun and worth doing one evening!. Great views - fun walk along the stars! Take the ferry - cheap and fun ride from HKI to Kowloon. Honestly we got better pics of the view of the skyline here than we did from The Peak (to be fair the cloud cover was out when we were at The Peak.) But this was a fun thing to do, especially if you can see the building light show.
such a nice place. you can have such a nice view of hk here and you can have a walk for a couple of hours around the piers

Sound and light display every evening. 8 pm is showtime. Plenty of room to look out over the water and the laser and sound display. Walk on to the Avenue of the stars or start at the Museum of Contemporary Art. From the island side the show is almost invisible, so Kowloon is the best viewpoint.
Lights show at night. Take the Star ferry at night and watch the Light show from the Kowloon Side. Its very nice to see with the family
Beautiful. Take a harbor tour on one of the Astra Ferry's boats and get the best view of the skylines of both Hong Kong and Kowloon.

No trip to Hongkong is complete without.... No trip to Hongkong is complete without a trip to Victoria Harbour, everybody gets touristy as soon as you step out of the bus, taking pictures of Jet Lee's star. haha!

Nice!. Great view and atmosphere! Lovely to stroll around with the family at night. The only thing I would recommend is to waer comfortable walking shoes, as you may end up doing a great deal more walking thatn you anticipate.

Good for a evening stroll. One of the major tourist attractions of Hong Kong is the Victoria Harbour which seperates the Hong Kong Island from the Kowloon side. The place is very good for an evening stroll. Walk along the "Avenue of stars" during sunset time and end the stroll by watching the "Symphony of Lights" show. Take some time to know the skyline and it must be fun.
Gorgeous. Great views and at night they put on a light show which is awesome. You can take a harbour cruise or take the star ferry

Night walk. We went to Victoria Harbor around 6 p.m because we wanted to watch the symphony of lights show.We went for a walk while waiting for the show and took pictures at the Avenue of the stars.The Harbor is quite a view at night because of the lights but I wasn't that impressed with the "symphony of lights show".It was okey but not really majestic.I cannot say that it was a waste of time,after all we had fun taking pictures with the big time hollywood actors statues.So far,it was a good time for us,we were able watch the show,enjoy the night view of Victoria Harbor and took pictures at the Avenue of the stars.

Avenue of Stars. Having been in HK, Victoria Harbour walk is a must. We can see the entire view of tall buildings on both the sides of the water. We can also have a Cruise Ride in the river and enjoy the lightings on the buildings, it is really very good view. One can enjoy food and drinks on the cruise. "Avenue of Stars" is a good attraction on the harbour, where we can see hand marks of famous actors and actresses. The most sought after one is of Jackie Chan. Bruce Lee was not alive when this was made, but his fans don't miss him as his statue is erected at the harbour.

can you really review Victoria Harbour? if so - A+. this is a strange review, but what the heck. of course, you can't avoid Victoria Harbour on any trip to Hong Kong, nor should you. at any vantage point, it's fascinating. Always active with traffic from local boats to Macau ferries to cruise ships. of course, the best way to enjoy is via Star Ferry, back and forth from Central to TST. but man did they kill a piece of history when they relocated the classic Star Ferry terminal to this modern contraption in front of IFC. you can get a flavor of the old style, though, if you take a ferry from the Sui Sai Wan departure to Kowloon side, though - but it's inconvenient and only worth doing if you're in for a seafood dinner. the harbour is obviously much more choppy and less clean than ever before, but it's at the heart of Hong Kong. find a few ways to experience it if you're in Hong Kong for just a short while, even if it is just dinner with a harbour view.

Lovely walk, but lights weren't that impressive. We spent quite some time walking around before the light show. It was thoroughly enjoyable and lovely to see the city from that side. However, traveling as a couple, the light show didn't interest us that much more than the skyline at night. In hindsight it is not something we should have stayed out for. I would definitely recommend having a look around the harbour.
Average Harbour. Much vaunted but Star Ferry frequented by unfriendly people crouching over cell-phones texting god knows who
A world class view. This is one of the world's most amazing harbours. Great skyline views. Take the Star Ferry to HK Island. Olden days of colonial Hong Kong.
Fun Light Show. This light show is fun to watch especially if you have kids with you.Its a must watch. The lighting in Hong Kong is an attraction by itself.This light show makes it even more amusing.
Best viewed from Star Ferry. Take the Star Ferry back-and-forth and get a great view of the skyline and all that is happening in the harbor.
Ferry ride. Use the star ferry from central/Hong Kong station to get here. I wouldn't sticking around for the light show. It didn't wow us at-least. It's a great area for shopping and walking around.
Best to see from the ferry. Take the ferry & travel from KooLoon to Hong Kong island. Make one way during the day & way back in the evening.

10/10 A New Dawn. This site was amazing. The water is just nice to watch. Wish the Yellow Duck was back. Really close to the Ferry and with just City Super close by, I remember the day as a day of peace and comfort.

Worth seeing and its a gateway to other activities. Victoria Harbour has nice views of the water and allows you to see the unique buildings on the Central and Kowloon sides. You'll most likely end up only spending a few minutes walking around and taking in the sights but Victoria Harbour is right at the center of a few fun things you can do like sign up for a Big Bus Tour, take the 1 hour Star Ferry Tour, go across the Harbour to the other side, shop at many high end stores or eat / walk around the mall.It's a nice part of town and is worth visiting when you're in HK. Just try to plan additional activities nearby.
nice viewpoint. very atmospheric place, not so many people on NY eve, enjoyed a trip on the ferry across the bay, good connection to city centre and close to shopping areas and gardens

the peak and harbour. We went to the peak and the harbour. it was cool and enjoying. almost had the glance of the whole hong kong. the star ferry at the harbour was fun and we could see the symphony of lights a laser light show

Stunning skylines. We went to Victoria Harbour at night to avoid the crowds, boy was it worth it to see the nighttime skyline views of the city. Definitely a must-see for first-time tourists, we were amazed with the views. Luckily, we got a day without too much pollution, so we were able to get great pictures. On our next trip, we would like to take the Star Ferry :)
Nice!. View was excellent. I removed 1 star because even if you pay for the train up, you have to pay again if you want to go on top of a building to view it from a higher point.
Beautiful Harbour. The harbour is best enjoyed when you ride on the star ferry. Only negative is the thick pollution that makes your photos appear misty.
Just stunning. Do not miss at night time especially from the Peak. Catch the Star ferry at night for a very cheap look at the lights.
Lovely central Hong Kong site. This is the center of the action in Hong Kong. It's particularly fun to take a rickety ferry across to The island. The skyline is gorgeous against the water
an amazing place. great view. also the star ferry is great. also the disney stand there.it is also near one of the biggest mall there (harbour city)
Amazing in evening. Boating ,market around the Harbour area , amazing felling ................. Indian restaurant ..........................
Too Many People!. Well, this place is only a shopping mall and it is not suitable for young kids. Unless kids like to shop for clothings, there is nothing else, except for ToysRUs...

A Great View of the Modern Hong Kong. The skyline, the water, the boats, and the promenades all help to make this a great harbour to see and walk along. There is much to do for free in Hong Kong and this is one of the things that can not be missed. It certainly highlights the modern Hong Kong, although there are small reminders of the old as well that seem to suddenly appear.
Go by boat.. Very cheap and nice trip the views on both sides are really good. Much more interesting than going via tube.

Spectacular!. You must at least see Vic Harbour when visiting HK, I had a gorgeous view from my hotel room from the Kowloon side and it was a beauty to wake up to every morning. Small issue though is the smog.... Some things money can't buy.

View is PRICELESS !!. walking distance to AVENUE STAR.. like "walk of fame", but with many Chinese stars, such as Jacky Chan, Jet Lee, Stephen Cow, etc..you can take round round ferry, but quite costly, around 160 HKD per person..not much food corner / cafes around, but you can find starbucks inside one of the museums around the Harbour..

Perfect view of the city skyline. It's a nice walk with the view of the city skyline. You'll get to walk by the Avenue of the Stars, and also see the Clock Tower on the harbour side, see the red junk boat (popular in all Hong Kong pictures) while eating some gelato from a store nearby. There are spots to get your face draw into a caricature. We went to the harbour to see the symphony of lights. I wish the music would be from an actual symphony orchestra, and I was also expecting more laser beams. But it was a super great view of the city at night and got some awesome pictures. We took the Star Ferry on the way back to the island, which was a nice 5 min ride to continue appreciating the view (you can pay the Star Ferry with your octopus card).
Beautiful Harbour. I like every thing about the view, just too many people during Christmas night, but just simply excellent

Must see both daytime and night. Catch the Star ferry back and forth, don't use the underground train, the harbour is what HK is about and you can see it on the cheapest boat trip you can take, its a few dollars to cross. There are all sorts of boats on the harbour from junks to speed boats to navy boats to grand ocean liners. Catch it during the day then again at night. Well worth $2.50.
Great views and skyline. This was a fun trip and Hong Kong was beautiful. I'm not sure how this is a thing as seeing the Harbour is pretty much inevitable from so many locations in Hong Kong.
Extraordinary Views. The view at night from Kowloon side is exceptional and a challenge to get a good photo. During the day, make sure you cross on the Star Ferry for 40 pence each way.
beautiful. you will not miss is but it is simply fantastic. Unfortunately one day was a smoggy day but the skyline is breathtaking

A must when in Hong Kong. Simply breathtaking, especially the harbor cruise.
Every thing was great, no regrets making the trip.
Great day.... Most Beautiful skyline at night! Take a walk on the Promenade and a Boat trip at Victoria Harbour...
Star ferry across the harbour, don't use train. It's cheap ($2-2.50HK), staff are friendly, lovely ferry boats, much nicer way to cross the harbour than going underground.

See the day & night views. If you can, do arrange for 2 trips, one daytime and one night
time. In this way, you get to enjoy the best of what victoria harbour can offer. It's the most scenic harbour I have ever seen and is the most memorable of my trip to hongkong.

Victoria Harbour Cruise - Meet the Locals and See the Sights. My partner was born in Hong Kong as her father was in the British Royal Navy in the 1950s so a must do on her first visit to Hong Kong since babyhood was a tour of Victoria Harbour and the Noon Day Gun Firing Ceremony. The morning tour went with a bang. We were the only couple picked up at Star Ferry by the Chinese style tour boat booked via our hotel. The rest of the passengers were teenage Hong Kong school children with their teachers on a "tourist experience course" for their studies. While I sneaked off for a can of lager at the back of the boat, my blonde haired partner was suddenly surrounded bya semi circle of dark haired Hong Kong girls all wanting to have "selfies" with the blonde tourist while her partner was otherwise distracted. In the meantime - in a possible well planned ambush - I was cornered a the bar by three of the teenage boys who all had excellent English and drilled me with questions including the weather in London. As for the rest of the tour including the Noon Day Gun (a ceremony dating to colonial times) we spent more time with the school children and their teachers than seeing the sights!

Great view, especially during Christmas, with all the lights. With all the extra Christmas light decorations on the tall buildings, Victoria Harbour is really beautiful, by day and by night.Using the Star Ferry is really easy to use, and gives you great views of the harbour at a cheap price - under HK$3 per trip. Don't forget the lights show every night at 8pm (free). We have started visiting cities to see their New Year's Eve fireworks and this year we watched it in Hong Kong - Victoria Harbour. If nothing else in Hong Kong, our trip was worth it just for that, the fireworks were great and then with such a great backdrop as the Hong Kong skyline behind - should be on the Bucket List
Nice View. The breathtaking view and the neon lights gave you a very calm and relax mind while enjoying the breeze.

Nice view from here and also nice decoration at the mall. Been here for the cruise, nearby the harbour have lots of shops and also malls. Those mall are fill with nice decoration and it stir up the atmospshere of the place. From the harbour u can see the view of the hong Kong island.
Very nice view. Very nice view and the surrounded area was great. really recommend to see this place and take as many picture as you like.

Fantastic light show in the harbour every night at 8pm. This is a must do trip , you board the boat and it's slightly misleading as against the harbour pier the boat is bobbing up and down but as soon as the boat leaves harbour it's all calm.All the big buildings along the waterfront light one by one as my trip was before Christmas many had Christmas tree's or greetings on them. The trip is about one hour in total , it's a great good feel factor at around £10 a bargain .

Busy harbour. Do not taker the Symphony of Lights 1.5 hour Harbour Cruise. Feels like 10 hours and you gain nothing that you cant see from either Kowloon or Hong Island. These cruises are to be avoided at all costs.

One of many places to visit, Try in the evening!. A HArbour like many others, jut in Hongkong. Famous & most likely one to visit. Try evening Hours. The atmosphere is good. Try the Light show towards Hongkong Island!
We watched HK from the water alot.. There are many ways to see HK, the waterside is the best, either by harbour tour, junk, sampan, or various ferries, try them all.

Magical place to see in the new year!. Enjoyed a wonderful evening at no cost to see in the new year, the fireworks was the best i have ever seen. A truly magical evening with a beautiful back drop. I know this is early but would recommend to anyone looking for somewhere special to see in 2015 newyear!
Avenue of stars. I would have preferred a better representation...instead of hand prints being on the ground (which has been walked on) a prominent position could have been given.

Time Pass. Nothing too great to offer. Just an evening time pass on a cruise. The smell of the food inside the cruise was unbearable. Shelled out HKD 20 extra for a 1st floor deck to the tour operator attender. Only good thing is the light show. well it was good and worth watching

HongKong / Victoria Harbor. This small (and getting smaller) channel between the Kowloon peninsular & HongKong Island is busy with ferries crossing by day and the neon of the Skyscrapers at night.If you can the journey across the Harbor by Star Ferry is worth a try
One of the unofficial wonders of the world. Great atmosphere walking along. The lights show is something every visitor to Hong Kong should experience. Great for families or for couples.
Great walk esp in the night. Must do when in Hong Kong. Walks in the well managed promenade will really worth it & romantic. It turns magical at nights.
Great views!. Really enjoyed the ride. Super cheap and very efficiently run. We were able to hop right on and off on a night trip across without any waiting. Definitely recommend.

Day and Night - 2 very different views. So very pretty. Take the ferry for almost nothing. Make sure you do this in both day and night. Very different views - each is as if it has nothing to do with the other.
Lovely views. Did a night cruise with supper on the boat and watched the lights show which was extremely boring unfortunately. But pretty good as far as harbours go.

Great History. Had a chance to traverse the Harbor on a Sampan boat. Our tour guide offered many interesting details about the boat people that live there: How they live, get their food and their day to day activities. I didn't like the fumes from the boat however, I had a small headache after disembarking. Thankfully it didn't stay as we continued on. The fee was about 60 HKD so not bad for the 30 minute route around. Great photo ops as well.
Star Ferry Tours. Enjoy an hour of tour on a Star Ferry on the harbour, it has tours every one hour from harbour city.

Great views and lots of viewing space. Got there in time for the symphony of lights show, that occurs at 8pm every night. Wasn't too overwhelmed by that - it lasts 20 minutes, but was pleasantly surprised that there was lots of standing space to view and didn't feel at all crowded or left feeling I had got there earlier.

Old and the New Hong Kong. 2047 will be a year to remember. Let those who get the chance to experience it do it now because after the handover the Island of Hong Kong will never be the same. The harbor holds the key to the mainland and to the skyline of Hong Kong. What more can one ask?

Lovely views, but so, so crowded!. Night time is best for the night time scenery, but there are so, so, so many people on the Kowloon side that you soon want to leave the area. It's easy to get divided from a group, so watch your friends carefully. Pity!
Victoria Harbour sights. Great views from ferry going between Hong Kong and Kawloon. You can either pay for upstairs or bottom deck of ferry.
must visit. should be there from afternoon till evening ... then u can enjoy the evenings full of lights from high rise buildings, good views day and night ....
Harbour cruise. Must not be missed, the lights are just super at the end of our cruise we were taken to a local fresh market loads of different fish and shell fish some imported from Canada.
Lovely view of Hong Kong from Kowloon side .. Great promenade, the Avenue of Stars were all Chinese stars but that didn't spoil the walk .Well worth an hour of your time.
If you have seen a harbour, you have seen it all.. Ships. Some moving, some berthing. If you have seen a harbour, you have seen it all. Victoria Harbour check!
Star Ferry. Best way to experience the crossing between HK and Kowloon. Better than the Metro option, and at 25 cents per crossing a pretty good deal

Spectacular view at night. Although the weather was not the greatest and the sky was not clear, at night the lights across the harbour were awesome. We waited (with hundreds of others) for the lazer light display at 9pm but it never happened. Although that was very disappointing, we were still in awe at all the lights on the buildings and also those done in preparation for xmas.

The sky was clear and the view from the Peak was beautiful!. Beautiful view from the Peak. The sky was clear and the skyscrapers on the harbour projecting to the sky gave a feeling that you can touch those if you extend your hand! Loved it.
Spectacular view of HK!. From this harbour able to view accross which is Central HK island. Good place to unwind & relax. Will go again when I return to HK.
Enjoy the view. I like the amazing view of Hong Kong island and Kowloon area. Go there afternoon. So that you can see the view both in the morning and at night.

Amazing views of old and new. some of the best views are from the convention center where you can watch modern ships and Junks fishing close by. There are great places to eat in and around convention center.

great view. a great view which is worth going for. wait until night time for the light show and the lights on the building on the opposite side of the river. a pleasant walk with entertainment and a shopping mall at one side.
excellent views. it offers excellent views. one should go around 5pm to see the sunset. the tram ride is also fun. you can also do madam tussauds in the same building.
Nice for evening walk. it is very nice place for evening walk either before o rafter dinner. Great view on HongKong, at 8pm lights show

STUNNING STUNNING STUNNING. the best skyline ive ever seen, though its a bit cold in february but its worth the wait. we waited for the sunset until it was dark to enjoy both views and they were simply amazing. a great place to hang out too during the day, as you can also walk along the avenue of stars and they were museums around too.totally a must go!
Laser show. It's worth watching the laser show which is on every night. Something you don't see in other countries.

Amazing fireworks!. Went for Chinese New Year (Lunar New Year / Spring Festival) and had an amazing time. The firework show over the harbor is one of the best I've ever seen, especially with the Hong Kong skyline in the background. It get's crowded early, so show up a few hours before the start and hang out. Try to get as close to the rail as possible, because the trees and lights can block some of the lower fireworks. It was so amazing, that I would happily watch it over and over again.

A beautiful deep harbor, but .... Victoria Harbour lies between Hongkong Island and the Kowloon peninsula on the mainland. It is a very deep natural harbor pretty much right up to the shore, piers line both sides of the harbor for freight and passenger liners. Over the years the Hongkong Government keeps "reclaiming" land by filling the harbor, selling the land to developers at ever increasing prices. This is a major source of revenue for the government. The harbor of course keeps getting smaller. The recent 20 years also saw an increasing smog problem drifting from the industrial zones of Guangdong Province. November December used to be mostly beautiful clear days... now there are many smogged in ones especially if there is moisture in the air. Still it is nowhere as bad as Beijing or Shanghai where they have heavy industry.Two pictures are posted here, taken respectively in December 2012 and 2013. It has been 5 days of foggy smog so far this December. Don't bother booking the harbor view room ):

Very beautiful view. Very nice view, it's a must to go if you're in Hong Kong. Go around late evening time and walk along Avenue of Stars. At 8pm, there will be a 10 mins show of Symphony of Lights at Victoria Harbour. Must visit here :)
very crowded. laser show night we were there and it was so crowded we opted out of staying for it...really did not enjoy this part of the tour

A most enjoyable experience at night with the Xmas decoration on both asides of the harbour.. It is cheap and easy to travel on the Star Ferry and if you are an OAP it costs nothing!For all other travel obtain a travel card from the MTR which can be used for almost any travel and also for small purchases at, for instance 7Eleven.
Beautiful and such a great skyline. This city is so clean and it smells so great. Its indescribable!Can't imagine how even more perfect it is when there is no fog, yet the weather was perfect.

Take the ferry ride across the harbor. The ride is so cheap and convenient and the views are great. We would take the boat just to see the views at different times of the day. The view during the light show is nice too.

A must do. A trip over the habour costs almost nothing, the view after sun set is something that no trip to Hong Kong would be complete without. There is a lot of history just in the Star Ferry Boats, lots of fun

It is a must when in Hong Kong. Ferry terminal, shopping and restaurant's light show at 8 pm that's Hong Kong you can see two sides of the harbor architecture is amazing it's nice to compare day time and night life great to restaurants for all budgets

Fragrant Harbour. If visiting Hong Kong then you must go to the Star Ferry terminal and take the trip to and from Victoria Island. It's old worldy and lots of fun. On the way you will see sampans, maybe a Junk or two , and the delights of the Harbour and surrounding hills and high rise buildings.
Quick and Cheap Ferry to Kowloon. Very convenient and refreshing to see the different sides of Hong Kong. Good views to either side and only cost about 50c.

This is a must see!. If you are in Hong Kong you can´t miss going to Victoria Harbour! It is one of the trade marks of this amazing city!
The view is spectacular!
The tram to get there is very nice and different from what you normally are used to.
I highly recommend this!

Best place to see light show. This gives a fantastic view to see a sea (harbor), fabulous night view, light show which use to happen daily from 8:00 – 8:15 PM, though I didn’t liked the light show but it could be due to the high expectations. This is the best place to show your photography talent.Also from this point you could also go for avenue of stars, cover clock tower, and so you can take ferry ride.

Nice view of Hong Kong. This is a great place to go on your first day in hong kong. You'll have an exceptional view of the hong kong island skyline.
