You can watch the lights and sound show from here at night. they have a nice viewing deck for an elevated view of hong kong island. A must see when in Hong Kong

Incredible. The Victoria Harbour is a view you will never ever forget, absolutely beautiful, make sure you look at the harbour at 8.00opm every nite there is a lazer light show in which is totally free and worth seeing, beautiful, beautiful view.
Crossing the harbor. the Star Ferry systems carries over 100,000 people every day, clean and efficient, and very reasonable.

Victoria Harbour - All Hype. The lazer show was a real let down. The place was crowded and there were light beams here and there. Very over hyped .....You can give it a pass and see many other good things HK has to offer.

Spectacular sky line. A star ferry ride back and forth to the island is a must. Every night, at 8 PM, there is a 13 minute 'light' show in time with broadcast music that spans both sides of the harbor. A good viewing spot is the raised walk/promenade under the clock tower (Kowloon side)...but get there early, or they'll block off the stairways when the crowd fills the place.

Gorgeous and amazing views. very busy at peak times, but there are loads of places to see and visit whilst exploring.The terrain is all flat and very side.Stay after dark and check out the symphony of lights for free - amazing!

Amazing View. Stunning views from some amazing restaurants and bars. You can go along the the board walk in Kowloon Bay with loads of bars with live music or take a ride on the Star Ferry. There is a light show at 7:45 and again at 9. Well worth your time.

Do the cruise form Star terminal $18 HK?. An hour cruise with a few biscuits and coffee.Traveled either side of the harbour from the terminal with English broadcast commentary in a wood paneled old ferry and the wind in our hair. 3 stops en route to pick up and exit passengers.The smog that is enveloping Hong Kong and affects photos(and your lungs) is a turn off

Still a must in Hong Kong. The Harbor has undergone drastic changes in recent years due to large scale land reclamaton especially on the northern side of the Hong Kong Island. More new and modern skyscrapers have been built on the reclaimed land, adding weight to the density of buildings in the limited land on both sides of the harbor. At night time after dark with all the lights turned on it is a spectacular view though. The best view of the Harbor after dark is from the Peak. But compared to the past, the Harbor has become more like a narrow strait than a harbor, and thus has sadly lost some of its beauty when it was wide and open.
Interesting. We went on a small boat motoring around the harbor. Some of the ships anchored there are gigantic and beautiful. There are houseboats that people live on out there.
Must do. Take a day trip to Victoria Harbor, learn about Hong Kong history and enjoy the great view from the top of the mountain.
view it from land & sea. View from the Peak take double decker bus up and funicar rail car down. Take a ferry over to Macau you get a great of habour from China Ferry terminal & Ferries.

Avenue of Stars and the harbour is the only attraction. The main purpose of visiting Victoria harbour is the Avenue of Stars and the harbour that appears in most TVB & Hong Kong movies. Taking pictures with the status is must for all tourist. Standing at victoria harbour glazing at the skyscrapers across when the sky turns dark, feeling the breezes on your face is really romantic.We stayed till 8pm for the 'Symphony of Light' show was a great disappointment. The lighting effects was not very much and doesn't seems any huge difference from the lightings of the building itself.I suggest, you can give it a missed and save some time for shopping or other activities instead unless you have the time to spare.

Symphony of lights. Starts every night at eight, again just one of theses things that has to be done when in honk kong, if you don't do a boat cruise, stand on Kowloon side and watch from there, or even better get on the star ferry
Magnificent Harbour. We enjoyed two visits to the Harbour, one on a tour when we had a junk ride around the harbour and another free day spent leisurely enjoying the sights and sounds.

Nice place to enjoy your evening. The victoria harbour is a nice place to hang out, be it morning walk or an evening walk.You can se e the skyline of Hongkong , nice place to take some good pictures too.Nearby there is the avenue of stars, similar to hollywood walk of fame of the local chinese celebrities. There are some statues on the walkway , and of course a bruce lee statue as a tribute to him.Also you have some nice shops and restaurants on the harbour too

witnessed symphony of lights here. At 8pm daily the buildings light up in unison to music and you can witness the symphony of lights.get there at 7pm if you want a seat but in the end people just stand in front of you so your planning ends up not being worth it.Great experience to see once and can also see avenue of stars which is only 10 minutes walk away.

Wonderful Place. The Harbor is a grand place to stroll day or night. This is the feel of the Hong Kong we've read about and see in movies all these years. You must take the Ferry once or twice as it is dirt cheap and you feel like an adventurer as you traverse the Harbor. Do see the night time light show and make a point of mixing with the locals as they come and go.

Brilliant views of the city. Loved the ride up to the peak in the tram. Views from the peak were amazing and luckily it was a clear day so we were able to take some great photographs. The amenities were good with cafes/shops etc.

A must visit in Hong Kong. When u go to HK, u must visit this place. It's a great walk along the harbour and things becomes more interesting when the night comes. There's a laser shows called Symphony of Light which u can see from the harbour. U can also see the cruise along the river where actually the lights from the cruise is part of the show.

A good long walk. U can see the 'Avenue of Stars' here and if you a big fan of HK cinema, this is the place for u to see all their 'stars' on the walkways. There's even Starbucks. Free light show starts at 8.00pm everyday depending on the weather, get there early. Also shopping complex nearby such as Heritage 1881, Sogo, and HarbourCity Mall.

Very nice place to visit in hongkong.. Hong Kong being a harbour city, they have developed the skyline very well. During the day, you can view this skyline from Victoria Peak and if its dark, then may be lights as well. When you take a cruize ride, you get to see the real lights show and the real skyline, which is really very good and pleasant for the eyes.

Symphony of Lights Cruise. We did the Harbour Cruise and it was raining. Light show was still impressive though vantage points not so great and umbrellas not supplied which would have been good for those of us who weren't in a group (their guide supplied plastic rain hoods). The meal was really disappointing for the price of the cruise, we couldn't bring ourselves to eat much at all as the food looked unappealing, the place looked tired and rather dirty (which was surprising for Hong Kong), the coffee was lukewarm and the service was non-existent. The band was entertaining and non-stop as the singers took turns. All in all it felt like get them on, get them off, "next" type of cruise with little regard for guests.

What a Brilliant Place. Victoria Harbour is so brilliant, anytime of the night or day. View it from a Star Ferry, it costs about £0.20 to cross the harbour on one. View it from Victoria Peak on the HK Island side, it is magnificent, but do go up there on a clear day. The nightly laser show across Victoria Harbour with lasers lights situated on high buildings on both the Island Side and the Kowloon side, is a fantastic show.

Relax. Nice chill out place at night. I find the symphony of lights show only so-so. Nothing too spectacular but it's nice to just sit there and enjoy the breeze. Go if you are staying nearby or have the extra time. SOGO nearby has also nothing much interesting to look at. Take note of the weather before heading there... there aren't many sheltered area along the walkway.

Good neighborhood. We went out for a night there and we were amazed by how quiet and clean it was. We felt pretty safe riding the ferry and the view was truly beautiful! You can watch the lightning show at night there. It is beautiful!

Terrific Star Ferry Cruise. We took the one hour circle cruise and enjoyed it immensely. This is about the only way to easily see all the skyline for both Hong Kong and Kowloon. Good explanations of the various structures were broadcast throughout in English.

We are sailing!. Take a trip on a sanpan. Any Barbour cruise is fun. Special at dusk or dark. You can usually book these at your hotel. On land you can also experience the firing of the noonday gun (an old tradition from the 'trading days') across from the Excelsior Hotel on Honk Kong island.

Great view with a cheap price. Taking the Star Ferry is a must do when you go to Hongkong. I went there exactly on sunset so the view was extremly great. However, the wind blows pretty strongly, you should take a light jacket to warm up.

The light show is rather tired and messy. What was a great night time visual experience has become rather tired and messy it needs some work to make it worthy of its place in the Guinness Book of Records.That said its free and you HAVE to go.

Nice view for photo spot!. Victoria harbour is nice. Good spot to hang out, meet other traveler, or photo shot hunting! Day/night, the view is nice! You should go at dawn so you can see the sunset and you can see the lights at night ;)
Never crystal clear.. Star ferry TST to Central was a lovely old style expereience as this is one of the last older style forms of transport. Loved it !
What a backdrop!. The focal point of any trip to Hong Kong best appreciated from the Star Ferry or the Kowloon promenade especially at night.

The Star Ferry is a must do in Hong Kong. Victoria Harbour is just magic with everything from commercial shipping to the Star Ferry which is a must do when you are in Hong Kong. The view of Hong Kong with the harbour in the foreground is just beautiful day or night, make sure to see the Symphony of Light from the Avenue of Stars vantage point.
Visit at night for spectacular skyline. Nothing special during the day but after dark the harbour looks stunning, lit up with all the lights on the buildings. Definitely worth a visit.
Great view. great harbour view especially in the night. walking in avanue of star and see the harbour night view is good.
Sit Back and Relax and Enjoy the Ride. The laser show is beautiful. You could go on a cruise or just sit at the harbour and relax. Atmosphere is great.
It is a great location. There is so much to do around the Harbor here in Hong Kong. There are a ton of fancy high end restaurants and shops, plus ferries and other things.

Spectacular View But Not Much Else. The HK skyline is quite spectacular and the breeze of the water is quite refreshing. Still, other than a quick photo op of the HK skyline backdrop, that's about it. There are a few shops along the boardwalk but not much else. Take your pix and move on...

erm.... Number five attraction in HK! OK, may be but it is everything in and around it that goes to make this an attraction. Take the Star Ferries away and part of the appeal would disapear. Similarly, the skyline. So, it is the aggregate image that constitutes the attraction. My third visit over 32 years and each time there are new buildings...partly because of the URA renewal of buildings over 30 years old.

Breathtaking View of Hong Kong. Sit back, relax, take a walk and make sure to visit the free laser show at sharp 8 pm . Enjoy the beautiful building on the other side with varied range of lights. Many free musical shows also run which you can enjoy.

Always Amazing. First visited H.K. 42 years ago and just looking down at that harbour was something I have never forgotten. This time was no different, but the many sampans and junks that plied this harbour are no longer....a little of the "past" has been replaced with more modern vessels. The light show was very nice with all the buildings on the Hong Kong side lit up. Also we had the opportunity to go to the new Ritz Carleton hotel up on the 118th floor (?) where the view is phenonimal. Victoria will always be one of the greatest harbours in the world.

Amazing. We walked around parts of the harbour and did a Harbour Star Tour which was fantastic but sadly because it was very overcast/drizzly on the day we did it we didn't get to see the harbour or Hong Kong at its best, however I'm pleased we did it.

Great to view the Laser show. As you walk along the avenue of stars you will find a Starbucks. Below that is a Bar that has outdoor seating so you can sit and view the laser show. The show starts at 8pm every night so get there early eg 6.30 to secure a seat. Beers are about $6 AUD, not bad for a great view.
A sampan trip. The essence of HK is a trip in and out of the array of crafts old mainly and new. Full of atmosphere,you can imagine how things were.

Beautiful harbor. Despite being one of the busiest harbors in the world, Victoria Harbour manages to remain very picturesque, if not even charming in some ways. There are still a couple of junks that ply these waters, and the venerable Star ferries still criss cross the harbour for one of the shortest, yet most iconic Hong Kong experiences.

Beautiful busy harbour. The harbour is certainly busy but they seem to run the ferries etc very well and we always felt safe on them, just couldn't understand the language muchMy aim was to get a photo of the harbour with a junk sailing on it - I waited for hours and finally did get my shots around sunset, even though they were a bit hazy - don't miss a cruise on the harbour, the sampans are quite safe, as are the ferries and its good to soak up some of the atmosphere - just be a bit careful of photographers wanting to take your photo for a plate - we ended up with too many photo plates that you eventually will throw away
Night better than Day. Did a day tour on the junk, plus a night cruise with a dinner in a Fishing Village, which was fantastic. All the info from HK Tourist centres at the Pier.

Smphony of Lights. To see and experience the splendor of Hong Kong at night this tour is breath taking. You need eyes not only at the back of your head but at the sides as well. Take a video camera. :)

Beautiful Harbor. The Star Ferry tour is a must for admiring the harbor. It is a great tour with background information provided. It takes an hour to complete the tour and it is quite relaxing too. The harbour is beautiful.
Beautiful harbor... The harbor is impressive and the view outstanding from many vantage points.... We recommend the lobby lounge at the intercontinental hotel and the river front on that side.

Very good view specially at night. The easiest way to enjoy the harbor is using the famous Star ferry. At night you can enjoy the light show. The ferry is very cheap and takes about 10 minutes to go from Kowloon to HK.

The ferry. We were very tired when we stopped over in HK but a ride on the ferry was relaxing and enabled us to have a wander around the wharf area on HK Island. It is very cheap and worth doing just to see the harbour. Try to go over just before 8.00pm and then as you ride back you can watch the light show at 8.00pm. Do have a look in the Arts and Crafts shop at the bottom of Kowloon by the ferry wharf. You won't be able to afford to buy the things you like but it is an lovely shop to wander through.

A View of the Old Hong Kong. A trip around Hong Kong harbour in a Sampan is a great photographic experience with the high rise background of apartments acting as a contrast to the fishing boat homes that form a picture of how this modern city once operated. A beautiful Chinese style floating restaurant and amazing luxury cruise boats mix together and form a picture of what Hong Kong is really about - a city of many contrasts.

A trip on the famous Star Ferries. The best way to view the Harbour is via the Star Ferries you get to appreciate all that is going on on the great Harbour, there are a number of destinations from any of the Ferry ports, spend the extra and go First Class up stairs for the grand sum of about 2ocents extra!!!!!!, best on a calm day

boats boats I love the boats!. - I just love being on the star ferry from tsim sha shui to Hong Kong Island and back. - The colourful boats there are such a sight! I love them, taking pictures there with the boats at the background is lovely!

Take the Star Ferry. The Star Ferry costs about 35 cents and you get an awesome view of Hong Kong from the water. It takes only 9 minutes to cross from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. It is so beautiful that you will wish it took longer.

Splendid mix of colour, lights, boats, buildings, movement..... Victoria Harbour is quite long and extensive. I enjoy it the most on the return trip aboard a Macao ferry as the ferry veers more towards the Western tip of the island as you approach Shun Tak in Sheung Wan. You see older buildings, warehouses on the waterfront, some cargo working areas, the greenery of parks. The approach on the Star ferry to Central shows sleeker newer glass edifices such as IFC. Too bad the old ferry pier with the clock tower is no longer the marker for Victoria Harbour but it did have structural damage already, so I understand. Victoria Harbour at night is a whole different story and one that must be experienced at least once in everyone's lifetime!

Panoramic views, that are unforgettable. Panoramic views. If you truly want to see the beauty of Hong Kong you must go to Victoria Harbour. Drive or take trolley to the top. Make it a leisurely unjoyable trip to one of the highest points in Hong Kong Island. Seniors can easily can navigate the terrain. A camera is a must.

Went on the 1 hour boat ride. Perfect amount of time.. Went on a one hour boat ride. Perfect for the amount of time in the heat. I don't think I would have wanted to be on there longer unless I was with a larger party or a bunch of friends.

Pretty. Again I can't get over how clean Hong Kong is. We sat in a bar and watched the harbour change from day light to night. Very nice and clean. Smells like sea water not???? As we have smell in a lot of Asian country

The Star Ferry. The Star Ferry is a magical experience. It seems impossible for the Ferries to travel backwards and forwards from Kowloon to HK Island threading a way amongst the other waterway traffic, of dredgers, cruise liners, other ferries, and tiny sampans. I have been on the ferry hundreds of times and never tire of the experience. A Must for any visit to HK.

Absolutely beautiful. Never get tired of the harbour and the skyline. Absolutely beautiful at night. Could sit and watch the boats for hours. My son particularly loves the Star Ferries. Went for a night cruise to watch the Symphony of Lights - definitely worthwhile.

Amazing view. The harbour front offers amazing view of Hong Kong Island especially at night. It's one of the best skylines in the world. The clock tower, Avenue of the Stars, ferry terminals, shops etc are all there and it's a nice place to visit. Good place to view the Symphony of light show at 8 each night.

This Harbour is seething with floating traffic !! A joy to watch and be on. I can't get enough of Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong - Love watching the boat traffic of all shapes and sizes going about their business, Tugs, skips, dredges, ferries, fishing boats, cruise liners, container ships............ the list is endless, just a great spot to watch the world go by.
Fantastic View!. My parents really enjoy and love the place. We went there in the morning I believe it woul dhave been nice if we travel in the evening where you can see the beautiful city lights.

Bright Lights. We arrived at Victoria Harbour just prior to the dusk and the scene across the harbour was spectacular enough but when darkness fell, the sight of those buildings and lights was absolutely
awesome. A must see for anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Excellent Night View!. We enjoy the night view there and watch the harbor with so many lighting,there are one path called "Aveune of stars",so many famous Chinese movie stars like Jackie chan have put his hand print on the floor!

Lots to do and see. A walk along the banks of Victoria Harbour is a pleasant way to spend an hour or so. Visited a few times for various reasons looks great at night.You can catch the Star Ferry, view the clock tower, walk the avenue of stars and easy access to Nathan Road.All the time you get a great view of the Hong Kong skyline.
It rivals New York... >& I have lived there for 50yrs!<. VH is a world treasure, not to be missed- that's not news! It compltes the Hong Kong package to be sure...
The times they are a changing. Miss the old Star Ferries...well, time does march on and at least a few are still running...they had more character (in my humble opinion) than the newer ones........
Stunning. Stunning by day and even better by night. So many photo opportunities! Get there early to get the best view of the light show.

Beautiful skylines harbour. It is true the Victoria Harbour has become narrow over the years due to reclamation. The sea has become rougher with currents created by numerous vessels plying between Hong Kong side and Kowloon. Best viewing of the harbour and skyline is the promenade in Kowloon side. Wait till the neon signs are on and use a tripod to take a memorable shot of the harbour with the skyline and Victoria Peak as background and the multiple coloured stripes of neon light reflection In the sea to complete a nice photo. Ride on the Star ferry is only HK$2.80 for adults. And it is FREE for anyone aged 65 or above, including non-HK residents.

DO NOT MISS - The symphony of lights!. We were at this place for almost 2-3 hours as we waited for the symphony of lights which began at 8pm - sharp.The 'symphony of lights' is a laser light show wherein the building along the harbour get lit up as per the music thats played. A mesmerising sight! At the end, we took a ferry across the harbour.A lovely experience!
Worth a visit. Went on tourist harbour trip for 1 hour - saw the important bits, but could have done it a lot cheaper by just getting on Star Ferries.

Filled with History. Our tour guide gave so much information about Hong Kong and Victoria Harbour. I have learned so much about its history. The place itself is something to remember about Hong Kong. You haven't been to Hong Kong if you haven't been to Victoria Harbour.
WOW WOW WOW. A cruise company offers a sound and light show from the water and night, this is a must do when in Hong Kong. All the building light up and tell a story - I was just mesmerised
Amazing. We love this harbor. Wonderful place to view the laser show at 8pm. This was our favorite stop. Highly recommend to everyone.
great place to visit. totally enjoy the views and the activity happening here well worth kicking back and watching the world go by
Go see. A beautiful harbour and the nightly light shows are beautiful and a must to see. They go for about 20 mins

Aussie tripper. Love this harbour. Smaller than I was expecting but more exciting. Lots of options for experiencing it close up. If your an 'elder' i.e. over 65 as we are it costs nothing to ride the ferries.

Very cool light show. I love going to the light show every time I visit Hong Kong. I think it starts at 8:00 PM every night. Probably the best place to view the light show is at the Avenue of the Stars.

great cruise. inspire huge populations.. I find the waters great for cruise.. the family enjoyed.. and december sun was pleasant.. and easy.. and ferry moved not fast .. but slow enough to see all the sights..
Refresing. I love this place so much it is like flying without wings ,, you will see hong kong from above plus enjoying the lovely weather ,,

Excellent place. This has a cool place to spend your morning or afternoon walk or run. Probably not during summer daytime, it could be uncomfortably hot. It has good views. It was a good jogging track too. With 1.3km distance, there are a lot to see, from the bruce lee statues to hand signature of jackie chan. Cool artworks there too. If you get sea sick easy, just bear the smell a bit.Make sure you bring umbrella or wear a hat during the daytime. And sunglasses too.

Amazing Must See. Took a leisurely cruise around Victoria Harbour in August. It was a fantastic experience covering both sides of the harbour for in excess of one hours duration. Provided opportunity to view both sides of the bay in a leisurely format, and was comparable if not better than a lot of other harbours across the globe. This afforded many memorable moments which were supplemented by ongoing photography opportunities. Definitely a must see.

breathtaking. an amazing busy harbour - with 6 or 7 ferrys to different Island locations that travel back and forth all day - No & is the star ferry to Kowloon and costs 2HK$ - in addition you can see traditional junks - marine ships and two regular cruise liners - views from the harbour paths or from the bars in IFC are amazing,, the views back from Kowloon are equally spectacular.. - a must see

Nice harbour. The view was nice but the show was not that impressive as some had mentioned. Maybe we waited at the wrong part of the harbour and certain parts were blocked but my 2 children were not excited with what they were seeing as they were expecting something better.

Don't miss seeing the harbor. The Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong is beautiful. It's the view you see in all of those travel photos and post cards about Hong Kong. The best way to see the harbor is to take the Star Ferry across the water. It's very inexpensive and historic. You'll love the views!!
Smooth Ride c/o the Ferry. the ferry operates greatly and the fare is very cheap. You can cross the victoria harbor thru this boat unlike taking the mtr which has no view.

Best harbour in the world. Victoria Harbor is the best harbour in the world that I have seen. You can see the skyline on the island that is also best in the world. Take a nice ride on the Star Ferry and walk on the harbour walk called avenue of stars. This is one of best things to do in Hong Kong. It is good every day and night unless air pollution is very bad but usually it is not.

Great light show. The daytime weather had been rather wet and murky so we had not really seen the harbour properly apart from a brief panoramic view from the Peak. We went over to Kowloon on the ferry one evening and enjoyed the light show across the waters. It was still raining but without the mist so a very good view of the lights and lasers plus a lighting storm going on in the background to add to the spectacle.
Absolutely Beautiful. Its like no other place, the views of the skyline are breathtaking and relaxing. Definitely a sight to see at night!
A Modern Marvel.. Huge,colorful, tall breathtaking and amazing!! must be seen to be believed. Modern engineering at its finest. Bring a camera and soak in this awe inspiring experience.

Light Show!. This is the best place if you want to relax and see a light show at night will you can feel and see the calmness of the sea. This is also the place where you can find the avenue of the stars, where, statues of famous public figure and celebrities like the HK native Bruce Lee. Best place to walk around in HK

Simply marvelous. Victoria Harbour is definitely the place to be in Hong Kong. There are nearby restaurants, shopping and museums, plus lots of street vendors and artists here, so it is bustling with activity. Yet this is the perfect spot to stop, relax, and enjoy panoramic views of the Hong Kong skyline, which is breathtaking during the day and at night. Get your camera ready! Another fun and really cheap way to check out this view is by taking the Star Ferry to and from Kowloon. For less than a US dollar each way, this is a relaxing and memorable ride to enjoy the magnificent skyscraper skyline as a backdrop from the water.

Amaze-balls!. This is amazing. To have such a beautiful Harbour on the edge of an amazing city.Suggest going during the day for the views but also at night.....sunset is fantastic.A boat trip is a must to get the full impact. There are brilliant laser shows from the hotels.
nice.. its exampale of new achivement in techinology in short period. actually harbour is surrouned by modern buildings. cruse is nice.

A must see. this place has a wow factor, for the beauty of the harbour, this Is a very popular place for the locals to come as well as the tourists. At night the lights will fill your every expectation.
Everything you expect with this view's location. The view was breathtaking and high up from the city center. just stand there and take it all in. i recommend both day and night visits.
Pearl of the Orient. Amazing lights and beauty at night and romantic during the sunset, Try one of dinning cruise for cruise of a lifetime.
Silver wedding anniversary holiday. A magnificent place to take photos and truly spectacular at night! Take a boat trip at night and see the laser show put on by the hotels.

Beautiful view of the Bay. We visited the Victoria harbour ,on December ,freezing cold because its an open area and winds are strong.A lot of people flock here to witness the Symphony of Lights , came from the buildings opposite the harbour.Magnificent tall buildings, can be seen,with colorful lighting all over.Reflections of this lights , illuminates the water ,spectacular view.Some tourist boats , including the Traditional tourist Chinese Junk sailing on the bay.From this promenade, we can see some of the tallest buildings in HK city.The Symphony of Lights itself was not that spectacular,a performace of dancing green laser lights for some period of time. Too many people pushing and rushing towards the nicest spot on the promenade.The best thing about this attraction,its free.Worthed to visit at least once , to kill some of your time in HongKong

The best thing in Hong Kong is free. Hong Kong (literally "fragrant harbor") was founded as an entrepot because of its harbor. So it is not surprising that today the harbor and its magnificent buildings display the commerce, power and wealth that typify Hong Kong. The privileged can view Victoria Harbor from the privacy of their villas or hotel rooms from various aspects and angles, but common folks like us can enjoy the view for free from the best aspect of all at Kowloon's East Tsim Sha Tsui promenade. Safe, clean, and open, the promenade faces the Victoria side where bright advertising signs and skyscrapers make the water look like dark blue ink. The glowing cityscape is framed by the dark mass of Mount Victoria and the lights of houses and apartments extending all the way up to the peak (your view is others looking back at you). From left to right in the photo, the vertical sentinels of power and wealth are the Central Plaza (tallest building in HK for more than 10 years). the triangle shapes of architect I.M. Pei's "sprouting bamboo shoot" Bank of China Tower (the 4th tallest in HK), and finally the top of Two International Financial Centre showing above one of the promenade lamps at the right of the photo. It’s currently the second-tallest skyscraper in Hong Kong and 8th tallest in the world. The brightest ornaments of commerce to be found in the harbor are the green and white Star Ferries, the red-sailed tourist junk, Aqua Luna, and a Star Cruise ship that usually comes in to port in the mornings and leaves after sunset with its rigging festooned with lights. It would be worthwhile for visitors to linger for moment after nightfall just to take in the sweep of Victoria Harbor and to feel in it the history of Hong Kong as the darling of free market economists all over the world.
Same old same old. Yes same old same old, busy like other harbors, but a nice promenade. Ferries and busy harbor traffice, didn't seem eye catching or out of the ordinary to me.

All you expect it to be!. Victoria Harbour cannot disappoint, it really is all you expect it to be. There is a Tourist Information Office here, where the staff are very helpful. The views are totally amazing both day and night! Star Ferry is a must!
Stunning. The whole Hong Kong skyline unfurls in front of you as you travel around the harbour. Not sure what the cruise gives you but the Star Ferry is brilliant both day and night

Not a place you want to stay in.... ...but amazing just to drive through. We went through with the Red Bus and it is fascinating indeed. Not only the harbour but also the immense building projects around it.
Victoria Harbour at night. Watched the laser Light Show - only goes for 14 mins but well worth it. Very pretty light show. And it's free!
Disappointment. Undeniable the night view at Victoria Harbour was breath taking but the 'Symphony of Light and Music Show' was a big disappointment. It was beyond boring.

Great views from Star Ferry.. The main feature of visiting Hong Kong is the fact that the island is separated from the Kowloon and mainland by Victoria Harbour. Best way to see it is by taking the famed Star Ferry across the harbour or there are one hour boat tours available.

Absolutely Gorgeous. This is a must see on any visit. I think the place to be is on the Kowloon side so you can see all the skyscrapers on Hong Kong Island. Some nights there is also a laser show. Beautiful at day OR night

Lots of Activity here!. Lots of people, lots of boats (and Junk Boats), Avenue of the Stars, Star Ferry, Clock Tower...there are tons of things to do on or near Victoria Harbor. The views offered at sunrise and sunset of Hong Kong Island are spectacular.
Must see!. We had very little time in HK and so we hired a tour guide for our family and saw quite a bit of HK in a very short amount of time. This was our favorite stop.
Great views of one of the world's most amazing skylines. Take the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong... and from Hong Kong to Kowloon. The views are amazing, and each ride is only HK$2.50!
The best in the world. I have not see a better night harbor view than this one. You must go at night. Their is a light show every night at 8 Pm. The best spot to watch is near the ocean terminal

Spectacular. In my opinion, the best aspects were the skyline and Symphony of lights show. Otherwise, the avenue of stars isn't that memorable and the Star ferry ride was a bit of a letdown. I was expecting something more inspiring on the Star ferry but since its not an open vessel, you cannot really enjoy the approach to Hong Kong skyline. Even though I was sitting right in the front, I couldn't catch a good view as a poster was stuck right in front.

Good and bad. On the TST side, lots of undesirable touts wanting to sell you suits or watches. Avoid the visitors from mainland (all they do is push, shove, act rudely and spit everywhere).Take the ferry across (and back again, if desired).I prefer the Central side myself.There are restaurants in the IFC mall (old one, and new one) that have lovely views of the harbour. The expectation of something to do is misguided; go for the ambiance and to soak up the experience of all the activity and what can be observed around you.Best time to visit HK is spring months or autumn months.

Gorgeous views.. Wether you go on the ferry or stand and view from hong kong island or view from Kowloon, the harbour is spectacular.Night time is like a Christmas tree lit up every night.I was gobsmacked to even see a tall building with the word Facebook down the side in lights lol.Day time is picture postcard.Raining, blue sky, it's lovely.The promenade gets too crowded for the night show, I would suggest a ferry ride day and night the loveliest ,most easiest way of viewing this beautiful harbour.

Superb !!!. Preferably go in the night to see the electric skyline of the City. Take a Ferry ride or just sit and relax in one of the Cafe. You can visit Intercontinental where you can get a great view of the Symphony of light as well.,

love the harbour. great for the laser light show and agreat cup of coffee right on the harbour. It is a great place to sit and watch the sun go down and the lights come on and then wait for the light show. watching the Junks and sanpans running up and down the harbour.

visit. went and queued for the light show, heaps of people and very cramped viewing point. The light show was trumpeted as the best thing. if you have been to Disneyland and seen their fireworks then like me you will very disappointed.
Lotsa people. It was a 2 hour queue to go up with the tram. We took a cab which took us up there in 20mins for HKD60 and there was 4 of us.Breath taking view but too many people.

Simply the best in the world. Make it simple, the night view of Victoria Harbour is the best night view in the World. It is recommended to watch the night view of Victoria Harbour at the Tsim Sha Tsui side. You can also take a Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or Wan Chai to enjoy the sea view. Remember there is a laser show at the harbour every 8pm.

visiting HK is not complete without a ferry ride. That's what my HK friend told me, and I have to agree with him.There is not much thrill in it though. Just a short ferry ride that cost around HKD 2 per person on a very old ferry dated from 1960s with views of HK skylines.Sadly, cannot see any of the famous traditional HK boats anymore.

8pm Light show. Not to be missed...at 8pm the light show is a great way to see HK island from the Kowloon side. Go to the waterfront area of Kowloon and watch the laser light show and the buildings on HK island lighting up to music

Stunning views. Great panoramic views of hong kong over the harbour. I feel very fortunate to have been here over a Chinese New Year and witness the stunning fire work displays. I have never seen fire works like it anywhere else, nothing compares.

Star ferry still the way to go. Taking the Star Ferry across from Hong Kong to Kowloon still has some romance-the gentle throb of the engine,the ocean swell and a fantastic view of the ever changing skyline.Take that slow boat to China.....
First place to visit in HK. this is the first place to visit in hongkonglovely viewlovely buildingspicturesambienceeverything is just perfectHongkong skyline!Ferryshopping at central.just perfect!

Where are the ships?. Since my last visit years ago what a disappointment: most ships cleaned away to faraway harbours and Victoria looks like a swimmingpool. Took a Star Ferry cruise, romantic solo cruise but did not go far enough to reach the bustlong ports which only saw from airport bus. Disappointment compated to harbour cruises in Europe, for example
Fun trip. Great trip around the harbour, so interesting to see so much of life centres around it. Felt touristy in parts but well worth a visit.

Great Scenery. The view at Victoria Harbour is priceless and one of the most beautiful that I have ever seen. A good place to jog, or relax, have a cup of tea and soak in the atmosphere. A good place to take pictures as well, especially at night. Dont miss the "Symphony of Light" performance. Breath taking!Star Ferry is nearby if you want to catch a ferry to Central. Or if you are into shopping, there are loads of malls nearby, eg. Harbour City Shopping Mall (highly recommended), Silvercord, Sun Arcade, 1881 Heritage, Ocean Centre, The Gateway, etc. MTR - Tsim Sha Tsui or East Tsim Sha Tsui.
This in Hong Kong - You can Feel it!. Not to be missed on a visit to Hong Kong is the incredibly cheap ride across the harbour on the Star Ferry. Soak up the sights and imagine the history!
Of course the views !!. Very busy,you need to go trough a lot of souvenirs shop before you get to the top.Do plan the weather!! clouds means no views!!

Giant Duck in the Harbor. There was a giant inflatable rubber duck in the harbor. Quite something to see. We also took the harbor cruise at night and it was outstanding. Beautiful views of Hong Kong at night.

Relaxing way to spend the late afternoon/early evening. A predinner cocktail cruise was a lovely way to end a busy day of shopping! The lights were fantastic, the drinks readily available and it was surprisingly quiet, although not on the water, which has boats everywhere.

A spectacular view of the Dragon City.. It is at a great height and is well designed to hold the Great Viewing Gallery and The Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum. The tram ride is a great experience and the food joints inside add a great comfort to the visitors.

Well worth an afternoon stroll. I loved the harbour. The views across to Hong Kong island are fantasic, there are always liners and of course the ferries coming and going and there is a huge selection of bars and cafes along the walkways. Great photo opportunities and a lovely way to spend a couple of hours.

6 Day mini break. Amazing - all the buildings and how they all light up at night. Also the laser show is a must. Also enjoyed Avenue of the Stars and the Harbor shopping Centre - must have every shop in the world there!

One of the Famous Harbou must see!. Very good view of harbour especially night time, it shows the 2 sides of view differently (HK Island with a lot of famous commercial buildings while Kowloon Side with a lot of various buildings)A lot of pictures must be need to take and enjoy at night with your friends, couples and families. Daily at 8pm has light show from both sides, must take a look and enjoy it!

Harbour tour. We booked a cruise around the harbour from the ferry terminal itself. The price was 87$ each compared with 230$ each if booked through our hotel. It was only for one hour and raining really hard, so we had to sit inside the ferry and there were times we couldn't see the shore. It was a real pity because there are spectular views to be had. One hour is not enough because, as one of the largest natural harbours in the world, it is a facinating place and we would have liked to have seen the commercial docks, the container terminal, and more generally of the Harbour and it's waterfront. I love poking around harbours and boats, and seeing the working environment and the wide variety of craft from sanpans to ocean ships. The was so much to see, if we could have, that is. So we shall definitely go back but need to find a longer tour which I would guess needs 2 or 3 hours at least.

a bit misty. sadly it was a bit misty on the day we did our tour, so the views were not as good as they could have been, but it was interesting, we had lunch in a floating restaurant, a tour around the harbour the Stanley market was very good - the prices were very low indeed, difficult to haggle down. The tour guide was Joanna Law - and the driver was Kenny - both excellent with guiding and driving, informative, prompt and punctual.
Harbour cruise. enjoyed Star ferry one hour trip around Victoria Harbour and commentary included information re many of the landmarks

Outstanding Views. Victoria Harbour has shrunk a little over the years with reclamation and redevelopment, but is still one of the greatest views in the world. As a long time resident of Hong Kong every now and again I like to take a trip to TST and just gaze at the view across to Hong Kong side - it is fantastic daytime or night. I would recommend visitors spend some time down at the Avenue of Stars and take in the view of Hong Kong Island, it is something they won't forget in a hurry.

Take a trip on the Star Ferry. One great way to see Victoria Harbour and the skyline is to take the Star Ferry over to Kowloon or spend the extra and take the Harbour Cruise on the Shining Star ferry.Cross over to Kowloon during the afternoon to see the skyline during the daylight, walk around Avenue of Stars, take your pic with Bruce Lee then take a stroll through Kowloon Park before heading back to the Harbour to catch the light show. Then take the ferry back and see the skyline at night.

Don't tell people you have visited HK if you haven't seen the Victoria Harbour view. We are still proud of our Harbour despite it is getting narrower and wavy. During night time, when all the neon lights light up the whole harbour, you will find the answer why HK called The Pearl of Asia. The best place to view the scenery is from the Tsimshatsui Star Ferry Pier and also getting the experience to take Star Ferry back and forth the Tsimshatsui and Central. Again, weather is the crucial factor if you want to view a clear and beautiful Victoria Harbour. Raining and foggy days will totally spoil your mood, and not to mention we have a lot of air pollution from our mainland these days. Still the best months to view the harbour shall be during November till February.
There is a wonderful light show at 8pm with all the buildings lit up. Also the star walk. There is a wonderful light show at 8pm with all the buildings lit up. Also the star walk. Highly recommend.
One of the best night view. A good location for a night view and worth a short visit. There is also a short light show from the building around the area.

taking a walk down at the Peninsula. I took the MTR all the way to Victoria Harbor, then walked over to Ocean Terminal Mall. I went the the Cultural Centre, took pictures over to Wanchai Tower, I did it all except get to "The Peak" I discovered that on my way in I could have stopped on the other side of harbor and gotten a cable car to the top

very beautiful for night scene. I prefer its night scene to day; for boat trip, some will even get close to the Disneyland for the 9-9:20pm firework.Boat trip around Sai kung or outlaying islands is another excellent thing to do in HK

Excellence of harbour view at 20:00 free night harbour show. Take "star ferry" from either Wan Chai Pier or Central pier to Tsim Sha Tsui before 19:30. It takes 15 minutes for the ferry ride. You can enjoy night harbour show from 20:00 to 20:15 daily.

by ferry. I enjoy watching views by taking the ferry across the Victoria habour, it is great no matter rainy day, sunny day, nighttime or daytime . Highly recommend to buy an ice-cream in an ice-cream bus on Kowloon side,it's creamy. I like to do this since I was a kid. it costs around one US dollar only.

victoria harbour. A good location and worth a short visit. Try to be there at noon for the noon day gun ceremony. The yacht club is splendid. Visit the Excelsior Hotel for a buffet.Not much else to say really!

As Advertised. This is what you think of when daydreaming about trips to Hong Kong. And when you're floating in that ferry in the harbour, or standing on the banks of Kowloon, your dream becomes the day and it does not disappoint.

Picture Perfect. Victoria Harbour is amazing - like nothing I have ever seen before!! Sky scrapers crammed together along the waterfront and topped off with huge brand signs everywhere.Like some other reviews have said, I feel it is better viewed from the Kowloon side also. Just taking a stroll along the promenade is a great way to take in the views. The 'Avenue of Stars' is also a nice touch! Anyone visiting Hong Kong will no doubt already have this on their itinerary and is not to be missed!
fab light show. we visited the harbour to watch the free light show, was fab, loved the avenue of stars too, great vibrant place.

Victoria Harbor - Cocktail Cruise. You end up taking a lot of photos of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The views are amazing and of course unlimited cocktails. It is a low energy trip and very relaxing.

BEAUTIFUL. Not much to say but this is beautiful and in my opinion better at night. Use your octopus transport card to go on a ferry from one part to the other. A nice experience and if you go around 8pm you may even catch the impressive free lights show.
Brilliant!. A cruise in Victoria Harbour is a must do obviously in Honk Kong.All those modern buildings with all those lights!Just amazing!

Harbour Cruise. Twenty one of us booked an all inclusive harbout=r cruise with a local company called Jaspas.We booked in the UK at a cost of about £60 a head on an all you can eat and drink arrangement.When we got to the harbour we discovered we had the boat to ourselves for the four and a half hour trips.It was hugely enjoyable.The crew of four-the helmsman,the cook and two delightful friendly ladies -were excellent at their job and were a pleasure to be with.The food was top notch.Nibbles etc to start with but the main meal was tasty and plentiful.The best steak I had in our month away.The service we had was brilliant and I highly recommend this outing.The harbour and the light show weren't bad either!!

Best night view ever. There are so many ways to enjoy this iconice Night view of Victoria Harbour.If you are living in HK island:Expensive way: Have a nice dinner in hotel like RenaissanceCheap way: Take a start ferry Go up on the Peak for a walkIf you are living in Kowloon:Expensive Way: Have a nice dinner in Pensiular hotelCheap way: Buy a Starbucks and sit on the bench in Star AvenueYou will never be regret.

Victoria Harbour - fab. Go across Victoria Harbour on Star Ferry. Amazing and cheap and great for views of both Hong Kong and Kowloon side. Also watch the laser show from the boats on the Harbour. Trips can be booked at the offices on either Hong Kong Island or Kowloon side.
stunning. i recommend going at night, such beautiful night view and skyline. their is also a Hollywood walk of fame

Nice view surroundsnwith skyscrapers building. it is very clean and fascinating place...and here located the Ferry station to go to Kowloon.
The surrounding tall building contrast to the bay made it very special view to enjoy.

So many ways to experience this iconic view. I have lived in Hong Kong for four and half years and the Vicororia Harbour skyline always lifts my mood and makes me feel so happy to live here. My advice is to experience this at different times of the day. Past reviewers advise the cross harbour star ferry which is fantastic value and the views of the harbour from the Peak which are amazing day or night. The Symphony of Lights is a wonderful, if cheesy, way to see the harbour. I never tire of this and will always go when we have visitors, watching either from the viewing platform Kowloon side or from the Star Ferry harbour tour -again great value.I really recommend the views from the ordinary ferries to the outlying islands. These are simplly the best way to experience Hong Kong views. If you are going to Mui Wo (Pier 6) sit on the lower deck in the open area and enjoy the views and the breezes. If you are off to Cheung Chau (Pier 5) splurge and sit out on the open area of the delux deck. I usually take a plastic deck chair from the inside delux cabin and sit comfortably outside and relax. Both ferry trips are wonderful cheap and full of photo opportunities of harbour, boats, ships, tankers and the beautiful islands.
Take The Star Ferry. One of the best ways to see the city is from the Star Ferry. For as little as 25 cents (U.S.) you can cross Victoria Harbour and get some great photos.

Definitely Glad We Did This. Taking the tram up to the look out was wonderful. We enjoy seeing cities from the "top". This was a great 360 degree view. Go early and maybe on a weekday as the line gets long on the weekend.
Beautiful. It is beautiful, indeed. The Symphony of Lights is impressive, but seeing it once was enough for me. It is nice to take the ferry to go the island.

Harbour Views. Loved the Harbour, we wandered along the promenade every day when we were there...my only complaint is the complete absence of dining options on the waterfront! We found a bar called the Deck and Beer which sold overpriced drinks served with a cup of peanuts but no food here, the only other option for waterside dining on the TST side was the intercontinental but they didn't have any outdoor seating. Theres so much construction going on in HK I hope they put a restaurant and bar strip along the promenade with outdoor dining so people can sit and watch the sunset and the light show over dinner and drinks, such a fantastic part of town I'm amazed they haven't thought of this!

Star Ferry between Kowloon and Central is a must do. The ride on the Star Ferry crossing the harbor has got to be one of the world's cheapest and yet most memorable experiences. Sit along the window at the front of the Star Ferry (the seat backs tilt so if you're among the first to enter the front of the boat, move seat backs so that you can sit looking towards your destination).

Great views of the sound and light show. At 8pm each night, the Harbour lights up and the sound and light show begins. If you get a harbour view room, like we did at the Salisbury hotel, you can tune your clock radio into the music that goes with the lights. The show lasts for 13 minutes and is free. We did this on our first night then caught the train to the night market, so easy form that location. The next morning we walked down to the pier and caught the Star Ferry across the Harbour for HK$10 for 4 of us, that's AU$2.50 each. Great value for a fun ride with the locals across this busy waterway. There's a Subway and Starbucks on the other side if you need a quick snack on your way to the Peak tram. Just don't eat or drink on the ferry, they don't like it and there's a public announcement that lets you know not to do it!
Great Shopping at the Outlets. Excellent prices on ADIDAS shoes and clothing...less than half price compared to Aussie discount stores

Amazing views and tours. Visiting Victoria Harbour in HK was amazing. A ride on a tour boat made it even better. Watching the shoreline of HK at night was just breathtaking. With all the skyscrapers and lights, it really was a great experience.
beautiful harbour. We had a harbour cruise which showed many highlights of hong kong and Kowloon. Very pleasant. Could have been longer to show more of the harbour.

harbor in the evening is nice and in the morning is a good run spot.. Nice walk along the star walk and see the life sized bruce lee statue among others. a nice stroll to get a fresh breeze and get away from the congestion at least a little bit.

Beautiful. Go there to unwind, watch the cultural shows, admire the yachts and brilliantly lit buildings, or simply gaze at the beauty of hong kong while you listen to the sound of waves crashing on to the promenade of the harbour. Best time to go is at sunset.
Gorgeous. It's beautiful day or night. Enjoy the views, the water and the breeze. Great place to people watch as well.

nice sight. i love the sea and harbour
so this is definitely my kind of place
the sight is pleasing my eyes
will come visit again one day
Great views of the city. We went on the star ferry at night to watch the laser show. The laser show wasn't much but the view of the harbour was great.

The lifeblood of Hong Kong. Victoria Harbour is a never ending highway of water traffic - cruise ships, ferries, working barges, luxury yachts - they are all weaving their way to and fro. The biggest water police fleet in the world keeps everything under control. Fabulous one hour cruise is worthwhile.
Outstanding!. Catch the Star Ferry Harbour Tour from any of Star Ferry's three terminals for an approx 1 hr audio-guided tour around Victoria Harbour.
And must see!. Especially at night.. The lights.. The traditional junks going by.. The views of the skyline... ++++
Try taking the Ferry. It's well worth taking the Star Ferry across the harbour. Helps you get an idea of how busy the harbour is and how tall the buildings on both the Kowloon and Hong Kong are!

Wonderful Harbour Trip. Don't miss this unique experience. The 1/2 hour trip we took showed us the way of fishermen's life, the HK skyline, the famous
Jumbo Floating Restaurant and the busy waterway of HK..
Amazing sky line. Walking along the harbour is an amazing experience, the buildings are very impressive although the humidity makes it very uncomfortable!!

Victoria Harbour. The harbour is a place of wonder. from both shores the skyline and views are interesting and at times breathtaking. The harbour is always busy wuth scenes changing as boats move in and out and of course the constant flow of The Star ferry.
Busy harbour. Lots to see here, from the simple fishing boats to the huge cruise liners. We used the Star Ferry to go from one side to the other - great service.

Nice View. We traveled along the Harbour thrice and it was an interesting drive around. The best time to move along though is during late evening to see the Hong Kong Skyline on the way to the harbour. If you live near the sea, then you can perhaps miss this one location amongst many in Hong Kong.
Nice view. It is relaxing and interesting to just watch the harbour and the buildings across. The best time to view it is in the evenings and at night.

excellent dimsum and above average dinner. Dim Sum was great with great variety. Price was medium to expensive but environment is high class. Saw famous move stars there. Direct access from Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay which is a big plus.
Watch the world go by!. Just stand/lean on any wall and watch. Everything you ever dreamt of about Hong Kong is here. It is truly a world location and free to stand and stare - do it!!
very good service. nice peoples and also very good service and also very very cheap and thanks to the mr lung fuuk he is the best men ever

Breathtaking. Even though the wait for the tram was around 30 mins, it was worth looking at the view! I'd advise to ensure you prebook as it is very hot and queuing up can be bothersome. Would also advise to go at the evenings as the view is much more attractive!

Amazing Victoria Harbour View. If you take Star Ferry from Hong Kong Island side to Kowloon side, it will be a interesting and joyful experience at very cheap cost. You can see the beautiful and amazing Victoria Harbour with stunning skyline of both side. A wonderful experience!

Crazy Expensive Shopping but fun to people watch.. Get ready to shock yourself, the high high rents are reflected in the pricing at most of the stores, Citi Super is great for Americans or people who love to buy Mountain Dew, one of the only places to get it, a good offering of beers and other products, one of the only fair priced stores in the mall. Very Long Mall located on the water catering to those who want the best of the best and can afford it.

Nice crowded harbour!. For folks like me who don't have a busy harbour in our city, it is quite interesting to see the ferries, ships go back and forth. I used to be so mesmerized by it when I was a child. I still love the views of the skyline, but the harbour itself has become too crowded. Crossing via the ferry, it felt like we just floated from one side of the harbour to the other since it could no longer speedup with the traffic. For such a short ride across, we even had to delay and stop in the middle of the harbour waiting for the Star Cruise ship to park.Make sure you are not carrying heavy belongings while you are trolling around!with family, not at all on weekends!

There are a lot of things do there. There are a lot of things do there. You can take a stroll, watch the ships passing by, enjoy an early supper, watch Symphony of Lights show or take a harbour cruise, it's just fascinating.

Quack quack!. I was lucky when I went to HK this June. My first day on the island was the last day of Florentijn Hofman's giant rubber duck docked in Victoria Harbour. It sure did gave a smile on all the people that were there. Without the rubber duck the harbour is fine. you'll see the great view of the main HK island. You will have to walk all the time while in the harbour though. There are benches that you can take a sit on by the way so it's fine. I had fun.
Amazing Harbour. Very busy harbour with a trip on the star ferries a must. Also suggest a ride on the Ding Ding Trams

Another must.. A visit to Hong Kong is not complete without a trip to Victoria Harbour, regardless of which side you are staying, my recommendation is to take the traditional Star Ferry across from one side to the other. The views of the city are amazing and there is so much going on to watch both onshore and on the water. I went across to Kowloon side last Friday and was able to enjoy the International Dragon Boat Carnival that was taking place.

Nice place and free to see the HK skyline.. The nice place and free to see Hong Kong skyline. And don't miss out everyday 8pm Symphony of Lights. The amazing show and top 10 in ther world skyline all is free. But is raining then will cannot see it.

A must-see sight. Great for people and harbor-traffic watching, we really enjoyed Victoria Harbour both during the day and at night. The views are stunning, in my opinion ranking among the most picturesque cities in the world, and there is no shortage of activity. The harbor has been developed for a stroll; there is a lovely promenade to walk.
Magnificent view. Beautiful scenery, must see during visit to Hong Kong. View to a famous skyline and skyscrapers, especially during the night is unfogettable.
Colourful lights shines across the smooth waters. Relaxing and calming, great for pictures, lots or tourist, best time to go just after sunset, the city justs lights up right in front of your eyes.

Nice view,excellent place to visit.. Victoria harbour is one of the greatest place to visit and a great tourist attraction in Hong kong. Cruise along Hong Kong harbour to witness the famous skyline as well as a myriad of other waterfront attractions.Take a day time cruise that will take you as far as Shau Kei Wan Typhoon Shelter, home of local villagers and near by areas.......a must visit

Beautiful views. Always something going on in this beautiful harbor. Very busy - Take a tour on a Chinese Junk or sail to the markets on the other side. Don't miss the light show at night from Kowloon side. The buildings light up the skyline!
SEE IT. Beautiful scenery, must see when in HK! Take the boat ride and stay for evening fireworks. The skyline views are just wonderful!
Must do. Alot of tourists there especially during the lights how, so its worth getting down earlier in the day and an hour before the light show starts

Nice during the day and spectacular at night. Great view , whether you come to the harbour at night or during the day. From left to right- scyscrappers everywhere- power to see!Every evening you can enjoy for free a spectacular laser show. 40 buildings with installed lasers and running lights supported by the music perform the unforgettable spectacle providing the remarcable entertainment to the spectators from all over the word. Actually , the show is registered in the " Guiness Book of Records" Avenue of stars, Star Ferries etc - so, definitely recommended
Picturesque. The Harbour is breathtaking. Take a cruise, take a ferry or just stare out your hotel window. There is always something happening there: boats, cruise ships,light shows. Beautiful!!

Wonderful view before and after sunset. One of the most impressive views we've ever seen, a symphony of lights and water, should be even more imperious after renovation works in Victoria Harbor are completed

Considered Lucky to Get A Good View. This is probably one of the nicest places especially in the evening. You can see all the building signage across the harbor, illuminating the whole area. However, it all depends on your luck on whether you can get a good view. The smog can be so dense that you could hardly make out any buildings across the harbor.
Love it at night. the views of Victoria harbor at night are beautiful the colors of the light of the buildings and the panoramic pictures you can take are amazing really worth the visit at night

Always something going on in Victoria Harbour. Cruise along Hong Kong harbour to witness the famous skyline as well as a myriad of other waterfront attractions.Take a day time cruise that will take you as far as Shau Kei Wan Typhoon Shelter, home of local villagers, before returning to see the firing of the legendary Jardine Noon day Gun, a tradition dating back to the early days of Hong Kong. Majestic skylines, bustling harbor traffic and eye-catching waterfront attractions all feature on the ever changing Hong Kong waterfront scenery. Your day time cruise on Hong Kong harbour sails out to the Eastern harbor area of Hong Kong, along the waterfront of Central, Wanchai, Causeway Bay and North Point before viewing the Shau Kei Wan Typhoon Shelter - home of local fishing families and their trusty deep sea fishing junks. On Route, you will be introduced to a series of stunning skylines, harbour traffic and eye-catching waterfront attractions. Further sailing takes you to the North - Eastern Kowloon side where you will see more scenic contrasts including Lei Yue Mun Village waterfront. Last but not least, you will move on to Causeway Bay waterfront - known as East Point in the olden days - to witness the firing of the legendary Jardine Noon day Gun which is a tradition dating back to the early days of Hong Kong and immortalized by Noel Coward in "Mad Dogs and Englishmen".

light show. the harbour was excellent it is very clean and you can get the big red bus tours from here and the ferry also it has a light show at 8pm every night this I felt was a bit of a let down I was expecting fireworks but the laser light show was good. There are lots of shops and places to eat. Great place to visit

One of the best modern cityscape in the world. On a clear day, that is; but unfortunately, clear days are becoming rare. You can better chance if you go during the summer; on other seasons, the wind brings pollutants from the north and occasionally you can hardly see anything. It has everything a good modern cityscape need... skyscrapers, colorful lights, harbor front, a hill that not only provides a nice backdrop but also a slope so that buildings are presented in different layers. Not every city can offer a nice view from ground level.

Fabulous on the Sunny Day. Great skyline if there is no cloud which is quite rare. We used to stay at the InterContinental Hotel (Kowloon), one by the Avenue of the Star, We can watch the harbor from our room. It was a memorable experience.We did hop on and off the ferries but most of the time whether weren't synced with our timing

Aping Hollywood. Avenue of stars, statues of director, camera man, fake sets, mock pumpkin carts..... it was a paradise for movie buffs. On a sunny day, coastline pictures would have been great. For the entire 10 days that I was there, which includes a black storm signal, it was raining, drizzling, stormy. Still, ride on star ferry was wonderful. The free ride on May 29th was well received by the entire touring crowd. All of us clambered on to the upper deck, which is generally higher priced than the lower deck

Nice stretch of water. It is definitely the nicest stretch of water between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. There are some boats and ships on it and you can see birds floating on the water. The waves are also nice to look at.
Vibrant Harbour. Always busy and beautiful views of the Hong Kong skyline. At 8pm daily, a lovely light and laser show is shown on the island side skyscrapers. Lots of eating places.
Star Ferry is Neat. Taking the Star Ferry to Hong Kong is a neat experience. It travels accross the harbor with good views and saves a lot of time in comparison to the double decker bus.

The pulse of this metropolis...... This Harbour is its own entity with a vibrancy of life that is unlike any other body of water in the world - no wonder it’s a ‘must see’ while in Hong Kong. In fact, for us it's the pulse of this metropolis with a flotilla of vessels plying in every direction on water that has changing moods and colours day and night. The looming mountainous backdrop plus the skyline of buildings superimposed along HK Island, Kowloon and beyond are another distinctive aspsect.A lot has been discussed about the reclamation projects shrinking parts of Victoria Harbour and none more noticeable to us then the shortened journey on the Star Ferry between Central and Kowloon. What used to be quite a historically magical journey across the Harbour is more about the length of the walk on reclaimed land from the walkway at Central to the Ferry Pier itself.However, there will always be a stunning Victoria Harbour with walkways awash with people, superlative views from buildings, bridges and peaks, brilliant yearly fireworks and colourful laser shows that light up this sometimes dirty, calm or turbulent, natural waterway!We love it!Enjoy your experience!

Old lady... Guess.. the old lady has started to look her age..With Bangkok, Singapore and KL well ahead as a destination for an international traveller, guess the authorities need to pull up their garter.. socks might not be enough .. and reinvent themselves.. and the Victoria Harbour.. HK skyline.. the peak...May be at this rate cities like Jakarta, Shanghai, Beijing would also start moving ahead..Are the movers and shakers listening to the bell..let us not convert HK and Victoria Harbour in a hasbeen tourist spot. Already even the mainlanders have started yawning...With concern for this great city and its beautiful harbour.. the sights.. sounds..people!
great views. very famous waterway - the big duckling was visiting which was entertaining. take the ferry from HK island to Kowloon for HKD 2,5 for an enhanced experience.

Very Enjoyable place to walk and observe people. Recommended regardless of how long you are in Hong KongA very nice place to walk, day or night, but its especially nice in the evening after dinner. This is where the Avenue of Stars is, along with the Star Ferry Piers, Jackie Chan Shop, Bruce Lee shop, the Symphony of lights and the amazing Hong Kong Skyline - pictures dont do it justice; you need to be there!

Beautiful Harbour. You can see Victoria Harbour via walk or ferry. Both sides (Hong Kong and Kowloon) are lovely. If you're walking, stroll along the Avenue of Stars on the Kowloon side and take a photo with Bruce Lee's statue. It is the Hong Kong version of Hollywood's Walk of Fame. You can cross the Harbour on a ferry, or take the Harbour Cruise on the Star Ferry at 7:55 p.m. and watch the World's largest light and sound show from the middle of the Harbour.
Giant rubber duck is there !!. Went there on the weekend for a stroll and discover a crowd by harbour city taking photos of the rubber duck. Will be here till 9th. June. Nice view in the evening.

Busy Harbour. For folks like me who don't have a busy harbour in our city, it is quite interesting to see the ferries, ships go back and forth. I used to be so mesmerized by it when I was a child. I still love the views of the skyline, but the harbour itself has become too crowded. Crossing via the ferry, it felt like we just floated from one side of the harbour to the other since it could no longer speed up with the traffic. For such a short ride across, we even had to delay and stop in the middle of the harbour waiting for the Star Cruise ship to park.
nice view and sound. witness the harbour dancing light at 8pm. what a nice view and sound. love it. The buildings with their lights along the harbour are really amazing.

Must Do. On a stop over I was told I must do Victoria Harbour and the Star Ferry and how right they where. An experience I will not forget going to and from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back again, this is not a cruise liner it is an experience that will stay with you plus the fact you can see the Hong Kong sky line and all the towering buildings loved it.

Like nothing else you have ever seen!. Nothing can prepare you for the beauty and colors of the harbor. The ferries and floating adverts and restaurants. The towers and hotels shine their colorful displays all over the bay. Best viewed at night.

Get into one of the Harbour Cruises. Victoria Harbour is not bad Ordinary Probably id say. but while u there pop into one of the Chine junks that take u around the Harbour. look out for the Huge Floating Restaurant.Nothing exception but gives u a different viewe of the city.
NICE.... It was a beautiful sight especially at night! Must visit if you are in Hong Kong. We went in a family group. With my parents and for 4 kids. We enjoyed it pretty much

Bustling and colourful harbour. Victoria harbour is probably the most well known place in Hong Kong. When you imagine Hong Kong this is the view you will imagine.All the Star Ferries and harbour cruises leave from Victoria Harbour and is home to the excellent and famous Hong Kong Skyline.The harbour area is bustling with locals and tourists alike and is surrounded by eateries and shops including some of the most famous brands in the world, Tiffany's etc.

Victoria Harbour by ferry is a must do!. Visiting Hong Kong, top of the list should be travelling by ferry across the Harbour! It is just a must do in Hong Kong - iconic and cheap and enjoyable at the same time. There are lots of things anyone should put on their list of things that MUST be done in Hong Kong and a trip on the Star Ferries is right up there on top or near top of the list- it is something that everyone can do too whether young or old!
Victoria harbour. Fantastic restaurant right on the harbour at the ferry terminal called the watermark, views from Hongkong island across to the main land.

The iconic hong kong skyline- Live!. This is where you can see hong kong's iconic skyline. Its best to be on the kowloon side, looking towards hong kong island. From this side you can see many famous hong kong landmarks: HSBC, IFC, Peak Tower, Star Ferry Pier across the water. Both daytime and nightime have different ambience's so best to go at both times. If you go to the star-ferry pier (get a star ferry boat if u want later) at Tsim Sha Tsui (kowloon) and walk to left of it you can get really good views and there are elevation walkways for viewing. You will also see the remnants of the KCR railway when you see the old clocktower- a reminder of Hong Kong's colonial past. Theres also hk space museum and cultural center around the area. Also a place where many wedding photos are taken (you may see people in wedding clothes)

lovely, busy harbour. It was cloudy for most of the time I was in Hong Kong so I did not get to see it in sunny weather. I loved seeing the harbour from the star ferry, going from Kowloon Peninsula to Hong Kong Island. It was really nice looking at all the tall buildings, and making out the famous ones as we sailed in the ferry.
Star ferry only 2.5 HK dollars. Get on the star ferry across the harbour to Hong Kong island to get away from the hussle and bussle of kowloon
Scenic View. Excellent photo opportunity and you can wander down by the avenue of the stars. Take a star ferry across to Hong Kong for a few dollars which is quick and easy
worth a visit. worth a visit as you take the ferry from Hong Kong island to tsim sha stui, very cheap ferry, great view, tourism office at the harbor to get free maps & advices etc

Famous but Average. This is what most people think of when they picture Hong Kong, but there are so many better places to go.Everyone and their mother takes the Star Ferry, and everyone should do it once. Once is enough.Most people look at the harbour from Avenue of the Stars or the promenade from the Kowloon side, and that is why that is the most crowded area. For better views, go to the Peak (if it is an unusually clear day) or the IFC.Skip the helicopter tour. It is only above the harbour for a minute and spends most of the time on the south side of Hong Kong Island.

Great Harbour and City. I live here, I am very luck to see the harbor often and I commute to work by Ferry daily and am able to be part of the harbor experience twice a day. There are so many things to see, from the small family fishing boat headed out for the day or the giant container ships, the harbor is always busy..... A great place to be...

Spectacular view over to Hong Kong Island. The best view over Victoria Harbour is from Kowloon towards Hong Kong Island. The most spectacular cityscapes at night are from any point on Avenue of the Stars. Hong Kong can have lots of low cloud, so it can take a few nights to get really crisp photos, although when the cloud is very low obscuring the tops of the buildings, very dramatic views are to be had with the neon lights illuminating the clouds and Victoria Harbour. A must is the Star Ferry, it takes about 7 minutes and costs just a few pence. The raised walkways on Hong Kong Island make getting your bearings difficult to start with as the walkways and the streets don't match. Take the upper level on the ferry, access to the ferry is at the centre of the terminal, a different entrance to the lower deck. Automatic ticket, or plastic token, machines are along the walkway to the ferry, the last ferry is about 10 PM
Great view. Great view of the city. Should come around sun set and see the lights of the city. Its beautiful! be prepared for some good walking. The tram ride is great as well.

Its a harbour. Lots of ferries and shipping but definately a harbour like a lot of others in the world. The Star Ferries are a sight in their multi-coloured livery and the skylines are impressive but nothing really exotic or unique

Good site for a harbour view. Although the harbour is busy, but it is very safe.Have a look via Star Ferry, can enjoy a whole city view.The fee is not expensive, lower deck - Star Ferry USD 0.4 Tsim Sha Tsui to Central

Must visit. Definitely worth taking a long stroll along Victoria Harbour at night. You can see the HK skyline, as well as the red-lighted junks ferrying people across. Nice place for relaxing or taking spectacular photos.
Has to be done.... This is a must on a visit to Hong Kong. Take the Star ferry and see the skyline. Great mix of the old and new.

A ride on the Star ferry is a must. We were staying in Kowloon traveled on the star ferry like a bus. We also did the harbor tour which was very interesting because the commentary told us all about the buildings on the water front. A 'must' experience for a visit to Hong Kong.

Overall the view is good but I picked wrong time. Visiting this via walking through Avenue of the Stars (this method of visit is free, for sure), this area is a must visit in HK since it delivers beautiful city lights combined with urban seaside view and several boats pass by so often. For your consideration, you should pick the day with good or clear weather and wait until sunset, so you could enjoy the city lights with optimal pleasure. Unfortunately I visited this place when the fog is very bad so I couldn't take any good pictures of those lights.

The big duck has arrived in Victoria Harbour. As part of its world tour, the Big Yellow Duck has recently invaded Victoria Harbour and can be seen between the Star Ferry Pier in Tsim Sha Tsui and the entrance to the Harbour City / Ocean Terminus building nearby. The duck is big, its yellow and its certainly drawing massive crowds, pretty much like anything that happens in this area of TST. We recently visited first thing in the morning, around 7.45am and found the crowds tolerable. It was easy to take unobscured photos of the duck at that time of day. The Big Yellow duck will remain at this location until 9 June 2013 for those interested in seeing this temporary attraction before he swims away from Hong Kong for good!
Amazing view. The view of the city's skyline from Victoria Harbour is amazing. If you come at night be prepared to be amazed by the world most beautiful city nightview
