Well worth the visit. Getting there was an experience. Roads were full of traffic. No different than NYC on a busy morning. Plan on staying at least two hours to view everything. If you have a long lens on your camera this would be beneficial.

Does it get any better. Even though it has become more crowded over the years I think this is one of the worlds top cities and man made destinations. I have been coming to Hong Kong for 14 years and I am still amazed every time I visit.

The Star Ferry. You have to ride the Star ferries and do the harbour tour if only to queue for tickets and watch the man line fishing down the drain! These boats are in institution - the views are amazing.

awesome. just stroll on the avenue of stars or take a ferry ride across, its lovely. watching the free lights and sounds show from the avenue of stars was amazing. starts daily at 8 and ends in half an hour.
increadible water traffic!. Wow! Sometimes they have even real water traffic jams! The best transport is the famous Star Ferry for sure.

Truly Spectacular. The tropical emerald-green color of the water, the cool breeze, and a feast for the eyes.Take the historic Star Ferry across the harbor, and don't miss the Star Ferry harbor tour and the evening light show. One of the most stunning harbors in the world, you'll need to watch your camera battery and hope you have enough storage on your camera.

Pleasant for a stroll. There's some construction going on near the harbor, but once you get past it, Victoria Harbor is good for a stroll. It affords an excellent view of Hong Kong across the waterway and, when we visited, it was decorated with large pictures of British controlled Hong Kong in the early 20th century. The harbor is right next to the art museum and the space museum (both of which have free entry on Wednesdays).

The view and the breeze. Love to walk around here to enjoy the fresh sea breeze, even though a bit foggy on April, but still can't obstruct the view to the awesome scenery. The light show made a romantic atmosphere.
Light Show.. Excellent out at night with all the people across the Victoria Harbour to watch the light show then onto the night market.
Star Ferry, A must. Cheapest and best way to see the harbour, go back and fourth as much as you want. Star Ferry is part of Hong Kong.
Breathtaking view at late evening!. The view was breathtaking and the cool (strong) winds made it all better. A little foggy and slight rain, but it comes as a perks!

Nice place to relax and unwind. You must admit that going to Hongkong is really tiresome and no matter where you go there are so much tourist around that makes each place very crowded. But If your tired during your long day tour then you can just sit here and relax to ease your painful feet and admire the surroundings.

One of the great harbours of the world. Easily one of the world's great waterways by day or night. Spectacular views from which ever way you look. You can drive underground or catch the faster but more expensive MTR but one simply cannot beat the ferry service - cheap, very reliable, good views and only a travel time of 8 to 11 minutes. Well organised and a genuine piece of HK history. On the HK side you can disembark at Central Pier or Wan Chai. On the Kowloon side the areas surrouinding the pier near Nathan Road can get very, very crowded. Toilets are good and eating options are all near by. Great for people watching and photo opportunites. Twice I have been to Hong Kong and both times I have enjoyed the spectacular harbour by day and by night. Potentailly a free visit where you just walk along the promenade. Highly recommended.

First tome in Hong Kong. Took dinner tour which included evening boat ride around harbour. Wouderful lights.Tour took in night market in Temple St., Dinner at Bubba Gump Restaurant on Victoria Peak. Again, April is Foggy, and could not see anything,as was white outin a restaurant with a view.Meal was good, drinks expensive.Overall tour was wnjoyable experience.
Amazing views. You can't go to Hong Kong without seeing Victoria Harbour. Buzzing at nights with sound and light show
Take the Star ferry for the best show in town. The star ferries are dirt cheap and are an essential part of Hong Kong life,culture and history. The views you get as you cross are excellent.
nice place to relax. This is a nice place to relax...Go in evening.. n enjoy the breeze and the adorable skyline..have starbucks coffee n enjoy outside...
Vibrant and exciting. Loved walking along the harbour watching the boats and general buzz of the area and at night the light show is amazing a must to see if your staying in Hong Kong.
WHAT A VIEW!. I would travel around the world just to see this view. Magnificient by day and splendifiourous by night. Lazer light show every night 8pm.
What is not to love. After visiting over some 50 years, it never fails to amaze and entrance, with all the happy memories that that entails.

ground level viewing - worthwhile. A great way to spend an hour and get a completely different perspective of Hong Kong. The harbor tour was excellent, and relatively cheap. At the foot of Nathan Rd. where the Star Ferry signs direct you. There are several boats departing the same pier including the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island side. To avoid confusion, you must buy the tickets first at street level, on the left (facing the water) or east side and then proceed up the stairs to the boarding waiting area. The boats cycle every hour and depart approximately 10 minutes to the hour. They do not wait so, keep an eye for boarding. Its not overly crowded (when I went) and was excellent for some fresh sea breeze and has a narrative on loud speaker of the attractions and history. Great for a photo shoot. Bring a shawl or jacket in case the breeze picks up. There is indoor or outdoor seating. Worth the time and is a bit romantic too.

The views, the views. What can you say about the views of Victoria Harbour, your breathe is taken away by the magnitute of it all, it's so busy and visually beautiful there's nothing like it in the world.

Such a great place!. Although Hong Kong is a city animated in every neighborhood believe that the Victoria Harbour is in some way the heart of the city, the point where the influx of tourists, restaurants, economy, in short everything.Without a doubt my favorite side of the town, with its thousands of lights, and its towering skyscrapers.I think it is pointless to recommend to visit this place because you must go to a tourist, because after the visit and experience of Victoria Harbour can hardly forget this awesome and amazing place.
Nice Harbour. It's a nice Harbour must get on a ferry and travel between tsim tsa tsui as its a great place to visit both sides

The Great Harbours. I have tried to describe Victoria Harbour to others but everything I say make it sound awful. believe that this is because there is no way to describe the beauty.You need to experience the beauty of Victoria Harbour both by night and day. especially night. It is so different by day and night you will enjoy it as much no matter how many times you do this.
Wonderful. One of the most amazing attraction in Hong Kong, I would not want to miss to see the harbour, you can also have diner on nearby restaurant.

One of the most beautiful Harbours I have seen. Hong Kong has one of the most amazing Harbours in the world thanks to the amazing skyline. Since the harbour was discovered it has taken a drastic transformation form beautiful jungle and water to massive building and advertisement.There are some great bars on the Kowloon side that have amazing views and are a great way to send the sunsets. I have tried to describe Victoria Harbour to others but everything I say make it sound awful and I believe that this is because there is no way to describe try beauty. It may be a big harbour with nothing but big buildings and 100's of advertisement billboards but it is somehow more.Check out all the photos that people have posted and make sure to catch the ferry across instead of the MTR as it only costs $2HKD and gives you a full view of the Harbour.All in All: You cannot come to Hong Kong and not take time to view this spectacular view. Grab a drink a bar or catch the ferry across, either way you will remember it for the rest of your life.

Awesome. You need to experience the beauty of Victoria Harbour both by night and day. It is an amazing site. The Star Ferry ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island must be the most colourful trip you will make for about 20p. It is so different by day and night you will enjoy it as much no matter how many times you do this.The view from the Avenue of the Stars at night with the buildings all lit up on either side of the Harbour awesome!

Beautiful Harbour. You can't miss the Harbour in Hong Kong. Taking numerous ferries across from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, shows the skyline in all its majesty. We had cloudy drizzly skies but it was still beautiful. I will never forget it!

Amazing. We went with the star ferry from the central star ferry pier on Hong Kong Island to the Tsim Sha Tsui pier on Kowloon. We went during the night, and we only paid $2,50. It was a really great experience, and you get a nice view of the skyline.
Smoggy. The harbor is great but unfortunately at the time we were in Hong Kong there was a lot of smog. We could see across but only just, still worth a visit
Great harbour views. One of the best harbours in the world with a great laser show every night. Beautiful just to sit and watch the ferries and the old style chinese junk boats on the water

Very pretty at night,. We went on a cruise at night to see symphony of lights., the show goes fo about half an hour but the cruise was 2 hrs
Get a good idea of the harbour, very pretty ,
Wouldn't do it again !

Magificient Harbour. the views of this harbour are fantastic and at night it looks even better.
Many different boats travel across the harbour and add to its visual appeal.
Water tends to be alla round you in Hong Kong and it has been embraced by development everywhere. Spends some time down near the harbour to truly appreciate it.
A must cruise during your stay. It gives you the real feeling of Hong Kong as you see the skyline up close. Loved the trip on the boat and getting to the other side and back.

Amazing Skyline and Ocean All Within Reach!. Victoria Harbour is the most signature attraction of Hong Kong, where you can watch from both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon sides, on a ferry (by Star Ferry or more expensive replica old time boats.) It’s easily one of the most featured scenes for enthusiastic photographers, families, friends, locals and tourists to enjoy in the middle of such a compact city. You will be surprised how you feel how much you are in the Ocean but with the beautiful skyline withinin reach.There are multiple points of entries to enjoy the harbour, but Tsim Sha Tsui will be your best bet in terms of getting the best views and most convenient to everything from shops, restaurants and other attractions

Laser Show. Make sure you visit the Laser show (currently at 8pm). We got there early (about 7.30) got a good viewing spot (near the Ferry). Excellent combination of building lights and lasers. Highly recommened
Night View awesome!. A Symphony of Lights is impressive. But if you want to take photos, be there earlier and staying at front :)

Still one of the best harbors in the world !. We have visited here before and always look forward to the views and the ferry rides. It didn't disappoint. There's now a nice walk and viewing are on the Kowloon side. It's a good place to watch the laser show. The show doesn't hold a candle to Disney so don't expect too much but the view of Hong Kong Island is always worth it. Definitely view it from The Peak at night.

great harbour. Everytime we visit Hong Kong, we always visit the harbour, my wife and i just love the harbour, overlooking HK island with the skyscrappers and we were fortunate that the night we walked passed, the sky was clear, the lighting on the buildings was magnificant!!
excellent views. No matter which side you are on there are always great views. Don't forget the light show at 8pm from the Kowloon side

Back in time.. The Victoria Harbour ferries have been going for years and have changed little. The harbour has decreased in size due to some land reclamation. The trip from Hong Kong to Kowloon costs a few pence and is a great experience.

great view from Kowloon side. great view but very disappointed with laser light and music show
on at 2000. but go any time after dark. forget the show
A busy harbour perfect for photographers. The harbour is busy and best viewed from the water. Go to the Star Ferry Terminal to book any water or land based tours

Watching the boats go by. Spend a little time from either Central side or Kowloon side watching the ferries and other craft make their way across the busy harbour. It is easy to get to the edge of the harbour from the Kowloon side and the promenade has an elevated viewing area, too.They are reclaiming land on the Central side but around the Star Ferry terminal you can see part of the harbour.An alternative is to actually take a ride on either a ferry across the harbour or a short cruise.

It's awesome at night!. It would be better to visit during holiday, for beautiful firework. What's more, it's a great place to shop. I prefer to dine by vander or at the so-called Hong Kong style tea shops in the lanes rather in a fancy five-stars restaurant. Foods there are cheaper but are as great as what are served in a high class hotel.

Interesting thing to do. There are a few ways that you can cross the harbour but this one is just remarkable. Suggest trying this during sunset or night time when you will be able to see the skyline with the lovely city facing you when you are on the ferry.
fantastic light show. at 8pm there was a light show loved it great view of all the ships and boats and if you look round you may find Bruce lee

A trip on the Star Ferry is a must. The harbour has been cleaned up a lot since recent years and it is very much a joy to travel from Central of TST by the Star Ferry. You can also take trips around the harbour on another of the Star Ferries.

Dancing Lights. Its nice to see the dancing of lights from buildings at night. Its nice to bring your kids to see it. The only downfall was that we visited the place during winter season so it was too cold...

Generally good seaview but avoid visiting this place on a cloudy day. It's best to visit the Victoria Harbour on the Kowloon side (i.e. in Tsim Sha Tsui), rather than on the Hong Kong island side, as most of the tall buildings and illuminations are on Hong Kong island, it's best to view it from the opposite side of the harbour. During the day you get to see the different massing, scale, heights, textures and colours of all the amazing architecture on HK island, my favourites are the Bank of China building by I.M. Pei, the HSBC building by Norman Foster, as well as the shorter buildings all justapositioned against the taller ones at the back of the island. But one must choose a bright day as the pollutants from mainland China meant that if you visit this place on a cloudy day your vistas will be severly limited. By night you get to see the magnificient illuminations from the external facades, at around 8pm there is a light/music show, all the buildings will be lit and some music will be played in the background explaining the architectural history of HK. The best place to view this free light show is by the Star Ferry terminal in Tsim Sha Tsui.
Beautiful Views. Beautiful Views. Check out the harbor at night! Recommend avenue of stars and taking the ferry across the harbor.

World's Best Skyline. Not too long ago a team of architects from New York travelled to Hong Kong to take a look at the skyline of Victoria Harbour in an effort to understand why it has taken over New York's to become world's best. The harbour weilds a particularly breathtaking view during nighttime when all the "trees" of the urban jungle come ablaze with sparkling lights. Unparallel - world's best indeed. Best viewed at 8 PM from Avenue of Stars in Tsim Sha Tsui or from a boat.

The view of the Hong Kong skyline is fantastic!. If you cross the harbour on a nice clear sunny day, the view if fantastic and a sight to behold. Tall skyscapers as far as the eye can see. Truly magnificant!

The best ride on the planet. Using the star ferry affords u arguably the best views on the planet on a clear day? Price has hardly changed in decades and is amazing value. Pity they moved the pier at central. Ferry also operates service kowloon to wanchai.

Central Hong Kong, Great Views. This is one of the prominent places in Hong Kong and a must-see during your visit. We went during the night and it was an unforgettable visit. The harbour is quite busy and crowded at times. There are lots of photo opportunities, especially during the night when the buildings in Hong Kong wake up with all the lights on them.You can opt to take the star ferry cruise for better views on both sides of the harbour. This is Hong Kong on the plate for you... You'll enjoy the experience!
Take the boat. Take the boat to go from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, it's a nice experience with a great view to the Skyline.

Just Beautiful. I have been to the harbour every time I visited Hong Kong and I love this place. You can sit by the harbour and admire the view. You can also log in the free wi-fi. Both the day and night views are just beautiful.
LOVELY CRUISE. We spent a bit of time down by the Avenue Of The Stars and took the ferry back from Lantau Island. The harbour was busy and very interesting.

night time photography. almost every night at 8pm they have the light shows. It was a bit crowded, but then again, this is HK. Be sure to bring your tripod for your camera. I'm not much of a photographer so my DSLR pics didn't turn out too great. surprisingly, my Samsung phone did a pretty good job.
Busy busy. Busy harbour and the ferries are just great. The star walk is ok but we enjoyed it best during the symphony of lights although this is vastly overrated in my opinion.

Just Beautiful. We'd read all of the TAdvisor reviews prior to our first visit to HK, but nothing prepared us for the majestic views of Victoria Harbour. What surprised us is what a romantic vibe HK has to it, as this was not what we would have guessed prior to discovering HK.Our favorite thing about the harbour was our cruise on the Aqualuna! For about $14 American dollars, you can sail for several hours around the harbor, getting off & on at three different stops: Tsim Sha Tsui, Wan Chai, Causeway Bay (I think!). Order bellinis, and...perfection! Crew is very helpful and service was fabulous.

Smaller than when I first saw it but still great. I loved the activity in this bustling harbor when I first came to Asia in the mid 1970's - junks everywhere, ships anchored, constant activity. The Peninsula and YMCA on the Kowloon side used to have an unobstructed view, but now the harbor on both sides has had huge landfills such that the Star Ferry seems a shorter ride, though still the best way to see it close up. At night it's all lit up like Shanghai which I guess is okay if you like lots of tall buildings; the nightly laser light show is mildly interesting but not spectacular. The harbor is still the center of the city and you could watch it for hours, either from the Peak or one of the skyscrapers. Just like the freedoms of the population are being slowly shrunk by the Communist government, the harbor seems somehow diminished. See it before they pave over the whole thing.

Takes my breath away every time. We visited in a group (two adults, one teen, one child) at least three times to see the Harbour at night-- a few times on the Star Ferry, once walked the Promenade on the Kowloon side-- and will never forget it. Must be seen.
A must see in Hong Kong. Definitely worth a quick detour during a visit to see. It is particularly nice to see at night. Would not plan a day around it.

What a Clean Harbour. This harbour used to be a mess. The junks used it as their sewerage. The junkians have been relocated to high rise apartments and the harbour is very clean these days. There is not much yachting but mainly commercial shipping. The only junks are Disneyland types with sightseers.

Gateway to Asia. This has got to be one of the most spectacular harbors in the world. You could just sit for hours watching the water traffic flow. At night, the light show is fantastic and adds to the charm of the city. Love this place!

Best view on Skyline HK. Take the Star Ferry from Central to TST. You wont get a better view of HK and it only takes you 5 - 10 minutes to get to the Kowloon side (Victoria Harbour) to see the skyline. And it's sooo cheap

The Heart of Hong Kong. I am continually amazed by Victoria Harbour and insist on taking the Star Ferry every day while in Hong Kong. It offers great views and it so cheap. Good tip is to get an Octopus card at the airport when you arrive in Hong Kong even if you are only there for a few days as it can be used on all the public transit including buses, Star Ferry and subway as well as in most small shops for routine purchases. You can add money to it as you see fit and it avoids issues with needing exact change on the pubic transit.

Highly recommended to take Star Ferry at night. Great view of both sides of the harbour. If you time it right, around 8pm every night, you will be able to see the laser show as well. By the way, picking a clear and non smoggy night would be a bonus as well.
gorgeous. Clean, beautiful on both sides. Very scenic. A night ferry ride is a must do!!!! The ferry rides are very reasonable.

what a show. During the day the harbour provides a pleasant place to stroll and relax,but every night at 8 there is a spectacular light show on both sides of the harbour. The skyskrapers are lit up and there is a laser show.We went on a star ferry to the middle of the harbour to get the best view.
Colorful Victoria Harbour. Buildings are so alive because of it's different colors at night and shapes are really incredible.. You can watch here the Symphony of Lights that starts everyday at 8pm..

Wonderful view. Breathtaking views and well worth doing. Travelling on the across the harbour from Kowloon looking at the fantastic buildings. We bought tickets for the crossing and took a trip with the Red Bus Company around Hong Kong Island......a must
Legendary Harbour. Victoria Harbour is like no other in the world, full of activity at anytime of the day. It is always part of Hong Kong life and it remains a silent spectator of the city´s changes.

Great. Victoria Harbour is central to Hong Kong and great place to walk around and take in the amazing sights of the city. Then for a different perspective jump on board a vessel and sail around the harbour definitely a must do on a visit to this amazing city.
Stunning. amazing views in a futuristic setting. Definitely worth to visit in the evening when all lights are on
I really love Victoria Harbour..... Victoria Harbour.....It's such a nice place to walk around and take a photo... nice view here....And good for the night time also...

Harbour Walk, Photos, Picnic and Lightshow. You can do all that and more. Why not grab a sandwich in the basement of the iSquare mall nearby, or the McDonald's ice cream just by the buses and spent a few hours just enjoying the view. It is the most amazing sight that man has made, there is just something about it. Take a junk cruise at night for about 20USD or ride the star ferry back and forward all day long. The harbour and skyline are simple must do. You can not come back from HK without seeing them, at all costs!

Awesome. I would definitely recommend taking a ride around the harbour in a sampan tour! The scale of some ships there are amazing, and what is also quite interesting is seeing Hong Kong from a different way,

Beautiful busy harbour. We were fortunate enough to have a hotel room overlooking the harbour - fascinating watching the day to day harbour activities - including watching the large cruise liners being escorted by busy little tugs.
Always a pleasure. The excitement of the Harbour still lingers when taking a tour or simply crossing the harbour` on a Star Ferry. Definitely a must do in Hong Kong.

Best view of hongkong skyscraper. Ordinary harbour,cheap fery trip ($3,4)but you must try it when in HK. From avenue of star, you can see sky scraper of HK, good spot for take photo.it's even better at night,the light is very beautiful,very relax atmosphere and free.good choice to take a rest after shopping in Tsim sha tsui
Go back in time with the Star Ferry. It's amazing that this still exists. Took the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai for only HK3.50. Great views of the harbor.

Beautiful views of the skyline. We experienced the beauty of Victoria Harbour both by night and day. The view from the Avenue of the Stars at night with the buildings all lit up on either side of the Harbour was great! So much energy, and along with the various watercraft in the harbor, it truly was an exciting sight. The next morning, we took the Star Ferry from TST to sightsee Hong Kong island, in the company of many commuters heading in for work. It was a pretty and practical 5 minute rid.
Must visit .. to experience hk. Walk. Seat. Eat. Picture taking. Unwind. Relax. Have the Symphony of light show... Walk walk and walk. A busy harbour with nice view.

A Pearl indeed. The view from the Peak is what I think to be the BEST VIEW OF A HARBOR IN THE WORLD!!Plus the Chinese restaurant at the top of the peak has the best view of the harbor. It also has Great food,that enhance the view.If you find the line for the Tram to be too long take the bus it is a very scenic ride. The HKG buses are new and fun to ride.

A super walk along the Kowloon side of the harbour. Well worth a day walk, there you can walk along the Walk of Fame and also a night walk for the lights. A must to do to see this panoramic City and Harbour.

Wonderful busy harbour. Great views of the Harbour which is always busy ferrying people, goods from one end of the city to the other. Try to get a hotel with a harbour view and marvel in the sights you will see.

A must-do when in HK. You've got to visit Victoria Harbour when in HK and take a boat ride - the views are incredible. We got a free boat ride with our hop-on hop-off bus tour ticket and it was a great experience.
Feature of HK. There are many ways to see and cross Victoria Harbour. Practically, MTR is great and the Star Ferry is excellent. The views are great and the evening light show is a feature to watch.
Nice walk!!. They are improving the harbor walk as I write. What is there right now is very nice to see Hong Kong from both sides of Victoria Harbor. Easy walking and great views.
nice view- got lucky and there was no rain. Very nice - we took ferry from HK to Kowloon...only took a few minutes - $1.50 and provided a nice view of the city.

Amazing!. The view during the day is amazing but the view at night is Eben more incredible. Do not miss the light show every night at 8pm. Best viewing place for the light show is at the clock tower Pier... Get there at least an hour before the show to get a good spot. Also, best have a tripod for pictures.After the light show people tend to clear the area quickly, this is the ideal time to get your "perfect" Kodak moment
take the evening cruise and see the light show. Not only was the skyline fantastic, but a number of the buildings put on a coordinated light show that was terrific.
Amazing!. The most gorgeous view ever!Go at night the lights from the city lighten this place up like nothing I have ever seen

Hong Kong: Harmony of Opposites!. Wear your urban chic wandering wear to enjoy some of the following highlights. Our guide, Shirley, of Splendid Tours did an amazing job informing us on Hong Kong history and answering questions.Victoria Peak: Awesome view! as long as it's clear, but guide will have more than one vantage point to take you too if overcast.Aberdeen Fishing Village was an interesting window to an old way of life. Take advantage of the opportunity to ride a Sampan for 50HK$. Well worth it! Great vantage point to ruminate on Hong Kong from the view of this historic floating community. The final destination "Stanley Market" is a great place to pick up affordable trinkets to take back home.
Enchanting and nostalgic. Given the luxury of time, I always prefer to take the Ferry to cross over between HK and Kowloon. It is so relaxing, each and every time.
Do it!. Don't miss this inexpensive ferry trip with amazing city skyline... Go again at night and enjoy the lights

Best value in HK. There is no better value and spectacular way to see Hong Kong than to take the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour any time of day or night. Whats more it is not crowded with mainland tourists.

An always interesting Harbour Crossing.. The ferrier from Kowloon to Central are not just convenient, they provide the visitor with a fantastic view of Hong Kong for a very small price. I think it is the Number 1 attraction in Hong Kong.
Once it was great. It was one of the best harbor in the world but with all the new landfill & buildings, the harbor is now narrower and became just average.
Very nice place to relax.. We went here late in the afternoon. Took a long walk along the harbor. A lot of people are coming here. The air is good. A lot of benches available.
Lively. There is so much to do around the Harbor here in Hong Kong. There are a ton of fancy high end restaurants and shops, plus ferries and other things. It is a great location.

go on the star ferry. One of the best ways to see the harbour is the star ferry.far better.than the crowded Mar.you can also take a one hour tour of the harbour drink$85 unfortunately when I did it there was a lot of low cloud so not a great deal to see.it has a recorded commentary.still an enjoyable way to spend an hour
Beautiful!. Very nice harbour. Great to travel across in the ferry as the views are great (and it is quite cheap!)

A nice viewing of Hong Kong island. Victoria Harbor is where the most popular pictures come from. It's here that you can see the entire skyline of buildings over the water on Hong Kong island, the harbor with all the boats going across including the Aqua Luna (the old fashioned boat with the traditional red sails that used to be found on ships years ago in Chinese history).  This place is perfect for just relaxing, sitting in one of many benches overlooking the waterfront, and enjoying the setting. Nice for either day or night time enjoyment. In the evening don't forget that there is the routine 10 minute 'Symphony of Lights' running from 8:00 to 8:10 each night. this location, whether during the day or night was heavily visited by many people enjoying the setting along the waterfront.

Got proposed to here. This attraction will always have a sentimental memory. My fiance proposed to me here! So this review is pretty biased. Despite it being a gloomy day and even sprinkling, the Harbour overlooked the amazing buildings and lights that the view was still perfect. I don't think there is a bad time to visit this place. There were a lot of vendors (about 50 feet of each other) equipped with their SLR cameras and printers ready to snap a photo of you with the grand background. It cost about 20 (Hong Kong dollars) for 2 5x7 prints (different poses) and 4 wallet sizes. Even if you happen to have just a few hours in Hong Kong (if you are just waiting for your connecting flight), leave the airport, take the tram for a few Hong Kong bucks and explore Kowloon and visit the Harbour. Takes about 3-4 hours tops. You'll have enough time to catch your next flight. Do it!

Crossing. Crossing over from HK Island to Kowloon noticed how clean the harbour was, much cleaner than last visit 2004. Still very beautiful at night time, and seeing junk(Boat) on harbour so Hong Kong style makes for great photo. All the new additions along kowloon wharf are great seeing families, friends and tourists alike enjoying themselves. Cant wait to go back and see all new additions on HK island side.

Watch the world pass you by, from your room. You no longer see sampans/junks, however, lots of cruise liners and other boats, each day. The liners leave at night, under the city lights on Victoria Island. Bit smoggy in MAR, but you can still see the Peak

Harbour cruise. Lovely by day or by night. A boat trip around the harbour is worthwhile. It is a great way to view the Hong Kong skyline & learn a little bit about the story of the city & some of it's buildings. The day we did this the water was a little rough but it did not spoil our experience.

Star Ferry Ride. Just to know we did it, my wife and I took the Star ferry from Centrl to Kowloon. We got to Central station with the MTR train from Causeway Bay. Then a rather long underground walk and some confusion on where to go, then a walk outside - but we finally made it to the ferry terminal piers, and the one that sers the Star Ferry. The ride was nothing special. Just needed to do it. Arrival in the Tsim Sha Tsui area of Kowloon puts you within easy walking distance of the main commercial deveopmentrs around Nathan Road. Of course you can take the MTR train to Kowloon form Hong Kong Island.
Best in the world. Just stunning. Do not miss at night time especially from the Peak.Catch the Star ferry at night for a very cheap look at the lights.

Must see. Everybody must be here at 8p.m. to see symphony of lights. It is worth to see the harbour at night with light and laser show.Just to sit here to feel the sea breeze and enjoy the view of Hong Kong is grateful.

Interesting place Victoria Habor. I was here in the morning around 8 am, the situation was still no more travelers to come. While enjoying atmosphere around the harbor side, the air above it smogs visible so a bit interrupted interesting view. Along side many travelers spent their leisure time by walking at harbor side, travelers can found ' palm hand trace' at walk side or statue of HK film stars famous. It's so interesting place at walking side Victoria Harbor.

Symphony of Lights. Every evening there is a laser show on the sides of the buildings along the Harbour. Well worth a look and the best way to appreciate it is on the Star Ferry. It would be so much better without the smog from mainland China !

Wonderful views. Our hotel room looked straight across the harbour. It is forever changing with cruise ships, ferries, barges and small tankers constantly going by. It is also great to get out on the harbour on a ferry to look at all the skyscrapers on both sides. It is truly great waterway worth going to Hong Kong to see by itself
Busy Harbor. Crossing in a Star ferry is the only way to go! Much better than taking the MTR under the bay. Its great at night also.

Jewels in the night. Both sides of the harbor dress up in jewels that sparkle at night. At times one might be overwhelmed by how concrete and time has devoured the open space piece by piece and how the other side of the harbor is getting more and more within reach (that the harbor is getting narrower...), but regardless it's a must-visit when you go to Hong Kong.Travel across the harbor on the Star Ferry before the 2 sides of the harbor become walking distance...
Great riverside view. Fantastic on both sides to see the Hong Kong skyline, and was safe and easy to walk along the promenade. Go!
Great view of HK skyline from ferry. Took the Star Ferry from HK Island to Kowloon at sunset without planning it and had some incredible photos of the skyline. Great way to see HK.
Always something to look at..... We spent a lot of time on the harbour on two cruises and on the Star ferry and saw lots of fascinating sights. The lights at night were amazing

Amazing!. The best place to enjoy the view is from Kowloon side. Get a boat from the Central and get of on Tsim Sha Tsui, take a stroll along the bank towards avenue of stars and Bruce Lee statue. There is Starbucks cafe straight onthe avenue of stars with the great view over the harbour. The light show starts at 8 pm. From my experience, its better to watch light show from the boat somewhere in the middle of the harbour. Though, don't expect anything special from the show.

Pretty place. It's a lovely place to wander day or night. The skyline looks nice at night and the Avenue of Stars is a good place to stroll and see it. The Star Ferry is quick and cheap to get out and see it from the water.
a must. this is another touristy must do, so you can say been there done that, and enjoyed the experience, as you may never get the chance to do it again

Wow. Best harbor view anywhere. Victoria harbor, with it's great skyline and frenetic ship traffic is just lovely. I could stare here all day. For the best views, check out Victoria Peak at night or from TST during the day.

High exceptions!. I was mildly disappointed, I expected more as this was discribed as one of the main tourist attractions and I thought it had an excellent view, but the Avenue of Stars was rather fabricated.

Beautiful spot that I never get tired of. ThIs is just a magical spot where the lights of the city seem to dance on the water.. I love the crazy,busy city and the tranquility being on the water brings.
Light show. It make sense if you have a time to watch light show from both sides: Conventional center and Kowloon:every night at 8 p.m

City lights. Daytime it's the colorful junks, ships and ferries. We saw the light show at night from Avenue of Stars then went up the Peak Tram. I'd watch the light show from the Peak Tram next time. Either way, absolutely dazzling.
Nice skyline!. Very nice view, Symphony of light presented every night could be better, Star ferry cruise (available with MTR Octopus card) highly recommended.

Take the star ferry for a beautiful view.. We took the MTR (subway) from HK island to TST stop and followed the directions with a little help to the star ferry area. Here there is an excellent tourist information center where the man gave us a perfect 4 day itinerary for Hong Kong . Starting with the light show on Victoria harbor. This is also HK at its best.

New Years Fireworks. Plan to arrive early by 6 PM for the 8 PM show. Very crowded but orderly. There is no transportation to the area that evening so plan your walking attire accordingly. Once in a lifetime expericence.

Hong Kong Harbor the Future Meets the Past. Take the Star Ferry if you can find it and then walk along the promenade in Kowloon to see evidence of China's arrival as a world economic powerhouse. The harbor is alive with water traffic from sunrise until hours after dark and the buildings on Victoria island are all lit up every night just like Christmas. It is really spectacular!! Don't worry sampans and a few junks remain on the scene and they are really local color.

B E A U T I F U L!! :). Victoria Harbour is best viewed from 'The Peak'. It is beautiful. A walk along the harbour is sure to destress you. I was lucky to have a lovely harbour view from where I sat in office. While in HK, it is impossible to miss it!
A Dream Fulfilled!. The ever-changing activity on the Harbour always provide a photo opportunity and something to see. At 8pm at night it's the only place to be, to see the light and laser show.

Walk of fame. We enjoyed a promenade on beautiful walk of fame having taken a ferry from Victoria Harbour. The weather was excellent and we could watch the famous Hong Kong skyline from another point of view. Such an amazing city!

great way to see the city at a distance. we took a boat tour, it lasted a couple of hours. it took us along both sides of the harbour and right by the floating village. it's a good way of understanding the city layout. the skylines are unbelievable. it's worth the trip just to see the layout and population of Hong Kong

I'm on a boat!. It's telling when a city's skyline is the number one attraction, that just the view of the city itself is enough to make people want to come and see it. Hong Kong has a well deserved reputation as having one of the best skylines in the world and one of the best places to enjoy it is the Harbour.There are many ways to get onto the water and enjoy this view. The cheapest and most practical may be to take the Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or Wan Chai. It costs about 2.5 HKD per person and only takes about 10-15 minutes at most but the view is spectacular, not to mention the fun of riding on one of the oldest still operating ferry services.If you want to spend more time out on the water, consider an evening dinner cruise or even charter a boat for yourself. It's certainly expensive, being Hong Kong and all, but the memories will probably last a lifetime.

Not many views like this. Fantastic, loved the atmosphere of hong kong. Full of life, but felt very safe. Went to Soho (expat area). Had belgium beers and pasta. Strange for hong kong but were with friends from chinga (expats) who were dying for some western food.

Unwind relax. My family took a boat ride ar the Harbour and it was amazing. Coming from Durban you'd think we would be used to such but Victoria Harbour is on another level the mix of old and new makes it even more stunning!!

Victoria Harbor. Stayed 10 days in HK and rode the ferry several times. The harbor areas is well maintained to walk along the water and view the spectacular skyline of both Kowloom and across the water on HK Island. Nice stroll and picture taking opportunities. They have a walk of stars where there are hand prints of all the Chinese movie stars and there are kiosks for something to drink. Also museums are in this area. then catch Star Ferry for the quick but fun ride across to HK Island.

What's not to love!!. Exactly what the title says, it's HK, what's not to love about it!!! So many things to see and do along either side of Victoria Harbour. If you must know get out and explore it, the ferry is cheap but takes time, but allows for a great view, the MTR goes like every 1 minute, good speed, gets you fast to the other side, but no view. The Light show is on at 8pm every night for about 15 mins. Doesn't matter how many times you watch it, there is always something you didn't see the previous time.

Must take the ferry at night. Just take the ferry which costs about HK$2.50 and you must do that at night time. The view of the harbour at night is amazing. I took the ferry ride like 4 times back and forth on 2 separate evenings just to enjoy the ferry ride and get away from the overly crowded MTR (mass transit railway). If you are staying in a hotel in Kowloon, just take the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central then go to Victoria Peak to look at Hong Kong skyline at night.

The Views of Hong Kong Harbor by night are Spectacular!. One of the very best skylines in the World has to be the Victoria Harbor view of Hong Kong island! Impressive in the day and even more spectacular by night.You can take the famous 'Star Ferry' boats across the harbor which is recommended for different views.The only downside could be the pollution where the visibility is poor and therefore there is a chance of disappointment!

very cold day...getting ready for the festival. It was a beaytuful setting with the nice walkway along the water, but the wind made it so cold and the clouds took from what I am sre is a perfect setting in a different day.
Glowing. I travelling to this place is amazing esspecially when chinese new year. The sky filling with fireworks and laser light.

Will Take Your Breath Away. I have visited Hong Kong approximately 10 times and every, single time I see Victoria Harbour, I get the same thrill. What an incredible view. Breathtaking. Should be one of the wonders of the world. During the day time or night time, it is breathtaking. A mix of old and new. Try and get to see the light show at the promenade (Avenue of the Stars) in Tsim Sha Tsui.
A must do!. We loved the ferry ride that gives you a different aspect of the city. Very comfortable, great value & the views were amazing.

Beautiful Views. The most beautiful harbour with great views day and night. Star ferries, old junks, container ships and cruisers compete for passage and offer great interest. The light show at night is great too.

Gorgeous neon jungle obscured by smog.. If China does not get its act together on pollution control, the magnificent views of Victoria Harbourview- mountain peaks, skyscrapers and neon nights will continue to be obscured far too often. Pity.

A magical experience. The reflection of neon lights flashing from the numerous tall buildings on both side of the harbour... the colourful boats...the hustle and bustle... the occasional live concert... The whole atmosphere is a magical experience at night. The cherry on the cake is the 10 minute light and sound show named "Symphony of lights" which takes place every night at 8:00pm with neon and laser lights from more than 40 tall buildings dancing in perfect harmony with some soothing music. Many would suggest Victoria Peak as the best place to enjoy the harbour view... But, if you really want to be in thick of things then Avenue of Stars located on the Tsim Sha Tsui side of the waterfront is the best place. Grab some delicious street food, take a front row seat of the elevated observation deck and emerge immerse yourself in the magical atmosphere. Taking boat ride across the harbour at night is also highly recommended.

A must-take-photo. Other than the view, and the fact that this is one of the landmarks of HK, I don't see any real attraction of being here. Didn't got the chance to see the night show, though, because I hear the light shows are pretty great.

Impressive Skyline. Victoria Harbour is impressive especially as you see the city unfolding as you drive in from the airport. The 8 pm light show is definitely worth a look but you will need to stake your place early as the crowds start forming an hour or so before the show.

Hong Kong Victoria View. This night harbour view has been the best I have ever seen. Take an old tram to the Honh Kong Victoria Peak at night. You will be shocked by this stunning Victoria Harbour view.If you visit there during the day time, there is a trail which you can walk for an hour.It is a must to see "view" if you ever go to Hong Kong.
Endlessly interesting. There is so much to see on the harbour! There is always something happening. We were able to cruise the harbour for an hour, on the Duk Ling junk- bliss!!

The night view should not be missed. There is a 8pm light show but not awesome. The night view is more intereesting especially if you are there during the festives seasoon as the buildings are decorated and lighted up.

It is not a harbour, it has become a narrow river. if you say victoria harbour is beautiful, I would say, the spot lights of the on-shore buildings make it look like a sophicated place. It is in fact, polluted with rubbish, plastics bags, and it is becoming narrower due to reclamation for the crazily dense population
pretty. the harbour is pretty, and a nice place to watch the world go round. the ferry is so cheap, and great when you want to get to Kowloon.
nice to see at night. this place was nice to see at night very very beautiful. you can everything on there. but not too fun i think.
Victoria. a nice place to walk specially at night and stay there between 8 to 8:15 to see the light show, you will see many people around you, as well many boats on the sea...
Victoria Harbour. Nice to walk leisurely here. Very calm and relaxing too. I like the food around. We always go here everytime we are in HK.
Smoggy. Loved the tours organised for our group and led by Linus from Grey's Coachlines. Lots of people around but manageable.

Reminded me of Sydney Harbour. This place reminded me of sydney harbour when I visted australia its nice and has a similar ferry transport. Lovely to catch a ferry to Hingkong Island and visit the great shopping centres there

Victoria Harbour Ferry Tour 1 hour. At the Star Ferry terminal catch a 1 hour Victoria Harbour tour which only starts at 11.55am. The office in only open for 15 mins each hour from 30 mins past to 45 mins past each hour to buy tickets - they are not open all the time. If you want to book for a particular time you can only book on the same day - not the day before. Prices for this tour will go up in cost for the night trips. Informative and giving a bit of history. We did the first tour of the day at 11.55am and thoroughly enjoyed the sunshine on deck. Complimentary drink and snack is included in the cost.

Very nice!. If you like some urban view, you should see it, especially at night! In my opinion, the harbour is much attractive, than in Singapore and more convinient to watch, than in Shanghai. There`re many lights, neons and beutiful buildings.. and like a part of show, some ships with illuminations, of course. Very nice.

symbol of hk. looking over HK side from kowloon side gets a better view, you may have afternoon tea in intercontinental to watch the sunset then neon lights on, or go to aqua for drinks in the evening, the victoria harbor stunning night view will be on your face.
Victoria. This is the center of Hong Kong and a must see. Worth taking the star ferry to Kowloon and back. Ferry travel is very inexpensive. Buy the octopus card for all travel needs.

Very interesting - how the boats all miss each other is amazing. This has to be the busiest stretch of water in the world - I have never seen so many boats all going in different directions and some at great speed - and they miss each other. At night - 8pm - stand on teh Kowloon side and see all the buildings light up - the colours and patterns are amazing and great photo opportunity. I wasn't overly impressed with the laser show - but it might appeal to others. Take the Star Ferry across - which ever way you like - the best 18p ever spent.
Wonderful. See it at night also.... lights and laser show in evening brighten the harbour. Great photo opp for all

I expected more. I took at Star Line ferry from HK Island to Kowloon and had expected the harbour to be bustling and colourful. It was surprisingly devoid of boats. One brave soul was bobbing up and down in a dinghy, attempting to fish and a tug was pulling what looked like an small oil rig, but otherwise there was little on the water. The skyline is interesting on the HK Island side. The ferry spills out into a massive shopping mall and it's a long way to the exits. All in all, rather unexciting.
Amazing as ever harbour HK. I hope you are just loving ideas of yr weeks away - can we help - uch excellent food andD food ........ Thank you.DXx

Beautiful Experience. The best time to visit is January. In my many trips, I have yet to see the Harbor skyline so clear and pleasant as in January. All or most other months one will experience nothing but haze and fog.
I think that the scene here is wonderful.. I think that the scene here is wonderful. Please visit, when you visit Hong Kong.
Bustling. Always something going on - even saw Morris Dancers one afternoon. Good place to just sit and people watch

Busy waterway. Great to watch the lights at night, and to travel on it during the dayAlways busy and fascinating - big container boats, star ferries, little boats whizzing along. find a spot to sit and watch

Lights, Skyscrapers, mountain backdrop. A must-see amazing mesmorising sight! Day or night! Make sure you take your camera. It really is breath taking. During the day and take the star ferry from Hong Kong Island and pose like Bruce Lee next to his statue on the Avenue of Stars. Later in the evening at about 8pm (ish) watch the light show.

A site to behold in every trip!. Seeing the buildings of the islands from Nathan Road is like being teased of what to see in the Harbour. Upon reaching the boardwalk , you get the full view and brings back fond memories of trips with family and friends ! One of the best view of the World !

Unescapable. While in Hong Kong, you must get onboard a Star Ferry to feel the pulse of the city and admire its harbor and skyline. So Victoria Harbor will necessarily be a place to go. Hong Kong skyline is truly spectacular both in daytime or at night.
Bit chilly to enjoy. A must to visit but rug up if chilly as it was very windy the day we went walking around the harbour.

Great escape from busy City Life. Both the Kowloon and Hong Kong side provide good view of habor and escape. Try outdoor Bar at IFC or hotels at Kowloon side. There is a Habor view Dim Sum restaurant at Kowloon side--reserrvation suggested.
Great Views. Star Ferry is a good price and the views are super. Good restaurants in the area and lots to see on both sides of the harbour.
spectacular views. be smart go midday that way you can see the amazing views in the day time and night. this is a must see. long lines long wait time but worth it.

Awesome view. We stay in one of the hostel near Victoria Harbour and can be reached by walking. One of the most awesome view ever especially at night. Our visit in winter 2013 make it an awesome moments as we can see all the beautiful lights from all the sky-rise buildings. A must go place with millions dollar night view. Don't forget to watch symphony of light at 8 pm from here.

View of Hong Kong Skyline is amazing from there. Not much to see in Harbour but Hong Kong Skyline view is superb from here. There is a usual Clock Tower nearby which is like a usual building one can find in many places. But if you go around, one can sight of amazing skyline of Hong Kong across the harbor. Star ferry terminal and the several restaurants are also in the vicinity. It is one of the best place to sit and enjoy the famous symphony of lights show of Hong Kong.
Fabulous. Amazing NightviewDon't miss the night show at 2000The lighting and laser goes with the musicMake sure u find yourself a good place along the harbour

Breathtaking at night. Victoria Harbour at Christmas is a light show in and of itself. Not content with just beautiful lights the builds are animated with lights featuring scenes like Santa and his reindeer circling the building. It was truly special and memorable.
A place with nice scenery. Nice scenery for you to take photos with your loved ones. A must visit place if you go Hong Kong. Peaceful and fresh air expected
Victoria Harbour. If the view of HK from the top is nothing short of breathtaking, the skyscrapers of Shanghai beat those in HK from a lower perspective. Pudong beats Central.

What a busy place!. Our hotel overlooked the harbour and I was amazed at how busy it was with ferries and various types of ships, yet it was still picturesque! We walked all along the harbour side ... there's a nice walkway with gardens for most of the way ... lovely place to spend the afternoon.

Magnificent skyline at night. Being down by the harbour by night is a treat. The skyline with all the lights are spectacular. Just missing a few more bars, open air restaurants by the shores so its possible to enjoy the view while eating.
Must do!. If you're in HK you must visit Victoria Harbour. Such a great way to view both sides of the city and admire the skyline!

Photo opportunities galore. Victoria Harbour separates HK island and Kowloon. On both sides there are excellent views. If you love taking photos then the harbour is for you. The views are amazing during the day and especially in the evening. The city comes to life in the evening and all the skyscrapers are lit up and there is a light show with music at 8pm every evening. You can take a nice stroll along the harbour in Kowloon which is very nice.

Night time is awesome!. Night time is very cool and you must go down there to check out the skyline views of the city!! Make sure you take the star ferry at night also because this is a great way to take pictures.
Great place for couples. a great place to stay esp for couples to enjoy sunset and at the same the the cool breeze and christmas lights
Must do. Breathtaking. A harbour cruise is a must do. It goes for about 1 hour and the commentary is exvellent

Great fireworks at night. Definitely worth a look if you are in HK. Great photo opportunity. I suggest dinner overlooking the Harbour at night and you can watch the fireworks display while having your meal.

Taking the ferry was interesting; other than it's good if you like skyscrapers.. Definitely do take the ferry either from Kowloon to HK island or the other way round. It's cheap and gives you good photo opportunities. I guess it's an important experience if you want to say that you have been to HK, but don't expect anything impressive about this place. Nice skyscrapers, but I guess you can see those in any large cities. HK island has nicer buildings so i guess it would be better to take the ferry from Kowloon instead. Yup and buy an octopus card. It would be simpler.

Free light show. Get there early.. Every night they have a free light show to music. It's ok (not amazing) so don't forego dinner or other plans. If you have nothing else to do, then it's a good time filler.
Amazing trip on a harbour cruise. I took an evening tour which included a harbour cruise and a meal at the famous Jumbo seafood restaurant. Highly recommended!

beautiful place. the perfect place for walking and enjoying the sea breese and taking beautiful pictures wiht HK skyscrapers. difficult to choose where to enjoy a relax afternoon eating the freachest seafood.also the place of Avenue of Stars and the statue of Bruce Lee.

Amazing View. Victoria Harbour is the icon of Hong Kong. This is the view that we always see from postcard, movie and travel book. It is a must- visit place. I would recommend people to come during night time. It is pretty amazing to see all the lightings and buildings of Hong Kong Island from the Kowloon side. I don't know if it would be that amazing if you come during the day- time. I also recommend you to take the star ferry that operates between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. It departs right at the Harbour and arrives at Central. It is not only reasonable price. You can also enjoy the view of Victoria Habour from different perspectives. It is pretty different and amazing. Also Star Ferry is the symbol of Hong Kong, it has been operating for over 100 years. It witnesses to the many changes that have taken place in Hong Kong over the years

Brilliant day out. Fantastic day out, beautiful views and great shopping. had a nice ferry trip which was calm and got lots of pictures, would recommend and must visit if you go to Honng Kong. Away from hustle and bustle of Tsim Tsai Tsui- Kowloon!!!

What a View - Stunning. How could you think of anything not to like about the view. Best looking from Tsim Sha Tsui towards the island at night. Brings back so many memories and it's romantic setting is a must for all you loveers.
Great place. A harbour in its true sense, not Victorian but very modern. One can view the different activities related to a harbor going on as well as the majestic HK skyline.

Perfect place for that perfect evening. Just three words - Best Skyline Ever. Period. Nothing can compete with the world's most beautiful skyline which can be viewed from the Victoria Harbour. To get the most out of it, board the local ferry (http://www.starferry.com.hk/services.html) that goes from Wanchai (reasonable prices of 2-3 HKD per trip) to Victoria Harbour (Tsim Sha Tsui) during twilight. The serene waves and the picturesque location is sure to sooth you after a tiring day. It is simply magnificent. If possible, hang around for the light show - Symphony of Lights - which is shown every single day at 8:00 PM HKT. It's the largest permanent light show in the world.. And, it's free!!

Stunning. What a fantastic harbour! So bustling and interesting, and a wonderful way of viewing the skyline, especially for photographers. Star Ferry across the harbour is a must.........on as many occasions as possible............but go on the Harbour Ferry Tour. It's really worth it!

What a view!. A definite must do when in Hong Kong. Whether you take the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong or vice versa or just take in the views and action on this harbor you can't go wrong. The best time is in the evening when the skyline comes alive with colour and the many boats that are lit up sail by. It is a feast for the eyes. I was there just before Christmas and the lighting displayed on the various skyscrapers and accompanying music/laser show was out of this world. Victoria Harbour has to rate with the top in the world.

love it at night. night view was awesomearrived there around 5pm to secure the best spotto watch the symphony of lightsthe show started at 8pm if im not mistakenvery near to a shopping mall...where we had our coffeeavenue of stars is at this area
Beautiful. Wat a lovely harbour and you coud ride the star ferry around all day.So busy on the harbour with so many bats and so much see.Nice trip from Kowloon across to hong kong island.
Firework lookout. It is very close to the venue for a good view at the firework launched in the midnight of December 2012 and January 2013.

Spectacular night view!. Just stroll along the waterfront and "sip" the beautiful night view. One can get great photos if you have a good camera.The waterfront area near Harbour city area is great. There are many shops as well as restaurants in the vicinity. There is even a bus terminal, a star ferry station, a lane crawford store. There is a 1881 historical arena. Great architecture. There are many boutiques here. We love the Anna Sui store. Nearby there is also a SOGO departmental store.The nearest MTR is Tsim Sai Chui (check spelling) station. Hotels nearby is the Peninsula. A very busy area altogether. Just be careful of pickpockets.

Something for everyone. In a city of epic and legendary proportions, Victoria Harbour is a stunning showcase. It was easy to access on the MTR from the airport. I went directly to Central (on Hong Kong Island) then took the Star Ferry to Kowloon. The panoramas offered on both sides of the harbour are stunning. The harbour front has something for everyone....shopping, eating, culture, and people watching. For a tourist on a limited time budget, positioning the amenities (museums, etc.) so close together showcases great planning. I also enjoyed the wide and expansive walkways to enjoy the views, the water, a leisurely walk and get some much needed exercise. During my visit, the weather was uncooperative. While it was grey or overcast - you could definitely enjoy the buildings lit up for the night, however, it did disrupt the light show. I can only imagine the stunning beauty with a clear blue sky or star lit night. Can't wait to come back and update my review!
A world wonder. It is amazing to see all of the water traffic in the Harbor. It is a great way to waste some time watching everything go by
Endless.. Great place to go for a coffee. Beautiful views and ambient.You can find there the Avenue Of Stars also, and the statue of Bruce Lee. Don't forget the bottle of water.

Nothing like it anywhere. It is superb, could catch the star ferry back and forth all day, I never get tired of the views both in the day and in the night and of course being Christmas time and cold it was more magical.

Beautiful view!. Took a stroll here in the evening after the hustle and bustle of TST. Very relaxing and had a quick look through the Avenue of Stars. Worth it just for the amazing views of Hong Kong island.

absolutely gorgeous, plenty to do. get a hotel nearby. go to victoria peak to see it from above, go to the waterfront on the Kowloon peninsula to see it up close and personal. enjoy the symphony of lights where they synchronize the lights on the buildings to music at night. take a ferry across it. possibly the most beautiful seaport area/maybe cityscape in the world. people are extremely nice and friendly.
A must see. We loved Hong Kong harbour but the weather was gloomy so we couldnt really see too much. the sheer number of sky scrapers is a must see

Beautiful Harbour. Hong Kong did this right - there are no bridges across this beautiful harbour to mess up the views! And great to view from both sides! Take a trip across on Star Ferry to see it up close and personal.
Nice cool view but having trouble breathing. I love the view there. Which is facing HK island. The only thing I don't enjoy is smell and they should have more things there.

Entertaining. There is always something happening in this harbour, ferries, cargo barges, private boats etc., and I find it entertaining to sit and watch all the activity. It's glorious at night with all the neon lights.

Blade Runner meets the Last Emperor. Tradition and futuristic neons make this harbour the most spectacuular at night. Better than NY, Shanghai, etc Unbelievable. Get in the Acqua Luna at 7:30 pm, you'll be amazed with the light and sound experience
Fireworks viewing places at HK. One of the best places to be on 12/31. We can view awesome fireworks! Make sure you reach that place early, around 10 PM, as there will be too many people

Worth it. I normally avoid the tourist spots when I travel but this is one place that every time I go to Hong Kong I go to, once in the evening for the light show and once during a clear day so I can get some photographs.I always try to make the Symphony of Lights at 8pm, and normally is a fantastic show, especially if you have kids. Went again last night and there was an issue with the sound system on the viewing platform and we couldn't hear the music. it made the whole show seem alot less special
Fireworks for New Year's Celebration. Beautiful for the night view, there are fire works show for the 2013 new year's celebration. A lot of people were there and people enjoyed the view and parties.

Breezy harbour cruise. Bought the "See Hong Kong Attractions Pass" and decided to select the Victoria Morning harbour cruise with Watertours. You amy refer to the link pasted here for more details of this pass: http://seehongkongpass.iventurecard.com/attraction/watertours-victoria-harbour-cruise/Though it is a pity that we do not have a good view of the noon day gun firing but I would encourage this cruise which is about an hour cruise that will give you spectacular view of the skyscrappers along the Victoria coast line.
\the light show is a famous and fun tourist attraction. great to watch the light show over Victoria harbour, who cares if it is a tourist trap, its still cool!!!

Par Excellence. We were lucky to have the view of the harbour 24 x 7 from our Harbour room at Mandarin Oriental Hotel. The harbour itself is an iconic symbol of Hong Kong. The New year fireworks over the Harbour were simply out of this world.
Fabulous views!. You'll always find fantastic views in Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry and constant stream of boats make for a lively scene at any time of year.
Amazing!. Allows user to experience the view of the entire city.Would recommend to go at night as it's breezy and fantastic night view
Iconic view of Homg Kong. Although it might seem a cliche, this is the one thing you should do if visiting HK for a short time. Gives a great appreciation of the city's position and landmarks.
Must see. take the star ferry, everyone does. its great and you'll get your camera a workout. Start with star ferry pier or other star terminals in wan chai, etc.

Best viewing at night. Best night viewing from the Kowloon side and take the Star ferry ride.
Do not miss the laser light show if you are in Hong Kong during the X'mas season.

Excellent Place to See the HK Skyline. Visited here in January 2010 for the new year and it was quite a nice place to view the HK skyline. Visit in the night. The fireworks show was not that special though. Lots of shopping nearby.

Great to Vierw. Great to view the boats and ships entering tand leaving the harbor. Also great to view the other side of the harbor and to see the lazer light show from Hong Kong island in the evening.

The best place to see the Victoria Harbour. In my opinion, the best place to see the Victoria Harbor is the Promenade in East Tsim Sha Tsui, either during the day or at night. The second best place would be from Victoria Peak.
It's Sexy. The best harbour with the best views i ever seen. Going Hong Kong without visiting this place would be worthless

Amazing Place. Walk or sit on the Kowloon side of the Harbour and enjoy the amazing views of the Hong Kong skyline. Night time is something special and its hard to tear yourself away from it. It was also December and some of the skyscrapers were seasonally decorated too.
Excellent and free to enjoy.

Connecting the islands. Crossing the harbour (at only HK$.28) from the Star Ferry to Central you inhale widescreen views of Hong Kong (and Island) coastline. Time your crossing to before 20h00 just in time to witness the nightly Symphony of Lights show from a unique angle.

One of the world's most beautiful harbors. Victoria Harbor is fairly large, but not too large to be nestld between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, the other major part of the city. Both sides have loads of tall (I mean rally tall, one at 118 floors) skycrapers, many with unique architectural features, so they don't look alike at all). The harbor itself is filled with boats, big and small. The view oif the Harbor is awesome day and night. At sunset, you see the skylines change and the lights gently come on. At night it is simply amazing. At 8PM nightly, they put on an amazing show (it's free) called "Festival of Lights", where many of the buildings light up and change colors, and then a fantastic laser show begins, where laser beams shoot between buildings and across the harbor! This is all accompanied by a musical score, and everyone should love it. It is of course great for kids, whose fascinated looks were very cute, but also very romantic for couples. I know my wife and I felt that way!All views of the Harbor are great, from the shores, or from your hotel room (if you get a view) or the many hotels on the waterfront that have bars and restaurants with full views. But do NOT miss taking the famous Star Ferry across the Harbor. We took it first during the daytime, and then again at night. The ferries run constantly, and are absurdly cheap (regular far is about 10 cents USA, and if you want "first class" on the upper level, it is hardly budget-busting at maybe 25 cents!)You can go back and forth on the ferry and it is a delight in itself!! This, together with Victoria Peak, are the top attractions in Hong Kong, a city of many, many attractions. Do not pass this up!!!

Colorful historic location. Watching Victoria Harbour is lots of fun....so many vessels going past us. Tug boats pulling barges; cruise boats; construction along the shore. Even helicopters fly by. Buildings along the bank have neon messages on displayed at night which is very colorful. This is a cheerful place.
Truely the Pearl of the Orient. Beautiful as you can't describe through the use of words, better to see it in person! Bling Bling city!
Great view. I love the view! Try to choose a hotel near Victoria Harbour and you can enjoy the view at your convenience.
Very nice view. View is excellent especially at night because of the light displays. Very popular tourist attraction.
nice fireworks. There is fireworks show in night time. It was nice. Well, nothing special about Victoria harbour. The buildings along the river are quite modern.

good but not what i imagined. The harbour itself is an iconic symbol of hong kong but to be honest i had high expectations and i was a little underwhelmed by the experience. The light show was boring and cheesy and the view at night was mostly covered by smog or cloud, also the trip over to tst on the star ferry was an experience i can only describe similar to cattle in a farm waiting to be released in a frenzied scramble. I returned later in my trip during the early morning hours and the promenade was relatively empty allowing time to appreciate the views in peace and freedom, this is until reaching the avenue of stars to find people queuing to take a picture with bruce lee most notably the tourist bus crowd which ruined the whole ambience and i just wanted to leave the promenade and find the nearest place to escape the crowds again. The best time was definitely early morning to visit, the night view is overhyped but everybody does it so it's an experience within itself to just go and see.
Just like you imagine. It's one of those iconic images that you see on tv and in the media and it's great to see it for real.
its night view is still the best. hardly able to get another cosmopolitan city having such fabulous night view and beautiful harbor together

Great views from Kowloonisland. It is very nice harbour, and if there isn't foggy weather it rocks at night, but you should be on the Kowloon island to enjoy all of this, because all these beautiful skyscrapers are concentrated on the Hong Kong island, and Kowloon's skyline looks pretty poor.

I love going to Victoria Harbour!. The Harbour has always been a great place to visit, watch fireworks, see the 8pm light show (not just for tourists!) or take the Star Ferry from one side to the other! The Promenade often has live music on a small stage, my daughter's high school being one of the groups invited to perform there! It's free! It's iconic and fun.

An unforgettable experience. Beautiful view especially when looking from the Kowloon side.We took so many pictures and we even returned to the same place at a different time on another day, just to grasp a different portrait with a different brightness!
Lovely! Great place to stroll around.. Great by day or night. Really beautiful, especially at night time. Worth a look. Some nice bars and eateries in the area too.

Fabulous panoramic Bay View. Superb location with magnificent panoramic.One of the best avenue you will remember for a lifetime.I really really love this place and I'll be back.It's well worth a visit.!!

Beautiful Place. Victoria Harbour is really great place to spend your evening. There are a lot of things do there. You can take a stroll, watch the ships passing by, enjoy an early supper, watch Symphony of Lights show or take a harbour cruise, it's just fascinating.

Victoria Harbour is beautiful !. The beautiful sights of Victoria Harbour during the day and night are different !At Night, the Harbour is so beautiful, it is amazingly bright and multi-colored !!make sure you go and see it and watch the skyline light up start at 8pm daily.For a great viewing location, go Ocean Terminal Carpark , Kowloon !

Beautiful, walk around and watch the light show. Get to the light show early, seats fill! It's a beautiful walk around the promenade, and the views are breathtaking. This was one of my favorite parts of visiting the city, just walking around after dark.
fab lights!. Go over to Kowloon and watch the show on HK island.worth watching at least once during a stay...all to music, amazing!

Absolutely beautiful!. Victoria Harbour was the first harbour on our cruise from Hong Kong to Sydney. It was on par with the other great harbour on this cruise, Sydney, but that's another review. We spent quite a few hours visiting the harbour during our three days in Hong Kong prior to the cruise, as we took the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong every day. It's a very busy place with many shopping opportunities as well as ferries to Hong Kong and Macau. We were eager to see the light show, but decided to wait until we boarded the cruise ship. Watching it from Deck 9 of ms Amsterdam (Holland America Line) was quite a spectacle!

Great walk. Victoria Harbour is a very nice place for a walk and sight seeing. Took lots of picture here. The nightly light show (around 8pm) is worth sticking around for. Get there early, get comfortable (it can get windy being close to the water) and enjoy.

Take some time and enjoy this world class site.. Don't just come here, take a few photos, and leave!Some suggestions:On the Kowloon side, start at the Star Ferry and proceed along the promenade and stroll as long as you like! Pass the Intercontinental Hotel, round the bend nearly to the old airport. depend on how far you go, this can take 10 minutes or 2 hours!Stop at the Intercontinental Hotel and have a drink in the lobby bar.Stop at the Starbucks near the Intercontinental, grab a beverage and take a seat upstairs. I have not been to a Starbucks with a better view.Ride the Star Ferry, just because....
Bustling harbour. What a beautiful place and it still is used for commercial shipping. 24/7 loading of ship cargo units makes for a busy looking harbour.

Invigorating!. A walk along the Avenue of Stars, taking in the view of this amazing harbour is an absolute treat. Having travelled throughout South East Asia quite extensively, the main thing that strikes m about Victoria Harbour is how fresh and clean it is. Its immensely busy and surrounded by one of the world's great metropolis', but there isn't rubbish in the water and the breezes are heavy with unpleasant odours so prevalent in other SE Asian harbours. I could spend hours just wandering and watching by the waters of Victoria Harbour... Definitely another of Hong Kong's treasures.

Beautiful Harbor, Great Light Show. I loved HK. & Victoria Harbor is it's center. The ferries are convenient and offer a great view of the city in addition to being practical. And a must see is the nightly light / sound show that is world famous. Take your camera as the views are amazing.
Don't miss the light show!. Victoria Harbour is beautiful, make sure you go back and see it at night and watch the skyline light up.

It's my favorite place in HK. The view of the harbour is nice, and also the tourist and school kids make a very colorful scene. You can enjoy the skyline across the bay, and the junk boats in the harbour...Don't miss the statue of Bruce Lee...must see. My friend, Kurt Chen(a great photographer took most of these photos.)

Good. There was not good weather. The sky was covered blanket of fog. It was hard to see something. But, I want to visit such place again, especially when the weather will be good. There are very nice.

Must see views of Hong Kong and Kowloon. Great both day and night. Spectacular when lit up after dark. We took the amazing value Star Ferry which runs very frequently and at 2hkd must be the best value transport anywhere in the world. We also did their boat tour after dark nod watched the light show from the water
good. great building and lot of color light around the harbour, you, better try the ferry which travel back and forth the harbor, very cheap ,but very good

Seen it at last..... Didn't disappoint - caught it during the day and at night (best time to see it). Was pleasantly surprised at the colour of the water - for some reason expected muddy brown, but it was actually green/blue.
Great Views. See Victoria Harbor by Ferry, Tram to the top of Victoria Peak, and especially on the esplanade in Kowloon for the 8:00PM Laser Light Show.

Beautiful!!. Absolutely stunning at night. Come sit by the benches surrounding the area during sunset and just enjoy the view. Around 8pm, there will be a lights show where most of the buildings will be lighted up with various colours.Truly spectacular, there's nowhere else like this in Asia.I also took the one hour ferry cruise around the island. Great photo oppotunities and reasonably priced. Cruise starts at 7pm and tickets are available at the counter.
