I understand theres also a 2 hour option available with a dinner buffet which is slightly pricier.whatever way you choose, it is guranteed that you will enjoy the HK skyline at night.

Love it. This is the harbour which ended Macau's prominence as the major port on the southern coast of China. Always busy and fascinating. The Star ferry is still my preferred transport to and from Kowloon. Only take the train if you are in a real hurry.

hong kong's harbour is the most stunning view in the world. hong kong's victoria harbour is one of the most stunning view in the world! it's really really beautiful both in day time and at night!! superb!
A night time must spot.. Its great to visit this spot as it has a lot of place to walk around and take pictures. We watched the fireworks but if you stay in the harbor hotels you are in luck!
Great Day Out. Nothing better or cheaper than catching the ferry to Kowloon side . Take the ferry and avoid the traffic

Nice to walk around. The harbour is very clean and when you walk around the avenue of the stars on the kowloon side they have Asian Movies stars names and hand prints . there is also lots of places to stop along the way for photos with Hong Kong island behind you.
It's a harbor. Have you ever seen a harbor before? Ok, then this is another one. Sriously, a harbor is a harbor. Nothing extra special here, but nothing bad either.
Always something to look at. It always has things coming and going, ferries barges boats etc. Fun to cross in the ferry. Was covered in smog most days
Not to be missed. One of HK signature views, especially by night. Rather windy, do bring along a light jacket. Be prepared for an invasion of very rude mainland China tourist.
laser show was brilliant. when in Hong Kong make sure you visit Victoria Harbour during the Laser show held nightly the show is dazzling and shows off the lights of the harbour

A main attraction in the area. Given some travelers consider Hong Kong's skyline the best in the world, some difficulty exists in not considering the best place to view that skyline also a great attraction. While the view is superior, The Peak's vista essentially sees the skyline from the back as many of the buildings "point" toward the harbor. In short, add seeing the light show and skyline from the harbor to your itinerary.
Its ferry harbour. The view from here its very beautiful....its look like in calender. U have 2 come here n make some pictures. Especially when the cruise passed...its very nice view......
A Must!. One of my favourite places on the planet, just can't get enough of it. Magical place and a must for all visitors and locals alike.
Harbour lights show is always a delight. Walk down to the harbour any night at 8 pm to see the light show , it is quite spectacular and a few buildings have Christmas themed building lights already

Starr Ferry great way to see the city- especially at night. Took the Starr Ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon to see the city and night. Very inexpensive and delightful opportunity. Also took the Ricksaw Bus tour of the city, worth the price and the time.
Splendid views. Take the harbour tour from one of the ferry departure terminals and marvel at the skyline on both sides. This will give you some great photographs of Hong Kong and Kowloon.

My Favorite Harbor. Visions of Bruce Lee hopping from one junk to another, putting the beatdown on evil doers!!Who can forget the many pictures of 747 Jumbo Jets taking off from Kai Tak zipping over the harbor?The smell of the salty spray as the air circulates. There is just no harbor on Earth that can compete with Victoria Harbor, with its city views, boat trips, and many food options nearby. There's no need in visiting Hong Kong if you won't stop and check out Victoria Harbor
FROM JUNKS TO NAVAL FRIGATES. Victoria Harbour always amazes me! Each of my visits to this great city includes a Star Ferry ride across the harbour. Inexpensive and the best way to see the skyline.
nothing special. as most of HK attractions I found it quite average. perhaps i should take a brake from traveling to begin appreciate things again :))
WOW!!!. It reminds me of the marine drive in Mumbai but more cleaner more vibrant and the laser show rocks!!!!

Beautiful. Very beautiful views on the harbour. Best way to see them is from the water. Night time is the most beautiful, but even during the day the sights are lovely. Just catch the star ferry from Kowloon side to Hong Kong side to enjoy the views.

do not miss the show. a really unique experience, when you gather around the harbour with hundreds of others to enjoy the light show. The music is great, very intense and the enlightment of the buildings on the opposite side of the harbor changes according to the rhythm. Be an early bird to reserve the best places!
Victoria Harbour Hong Kong. Lovely lovely lovely!!! The views are amazing.Visiting at night is a must too,its just an amazing site.
Great. Must see from the Star Ferry! An amazing view as well as seeing how busy the working harbour is. Keep an eye out for the many black kites hunting above the harbour!

The backbone of this great city. You can sit, walk, ride or sail. From any angle it is a fast paced gorgeous harbour. Pick up some shredded squid. A few more ice cream places might make a nice addition to the Avenue of the Stars. No complaints here.

Amazing. A fanstastic view of so many sky scrapers as far as the eye can see. Beautiful at night with so many lights illuminating the sea and sky although the light show was a little disappointing but still worth seeing.
Beautiful!. The view is absolutely beautiful with all the lights and neon from the buildings accross the harbour. Although it can be very crowede, I went there several times. Loved this place!
Impressive. The view is stunning. If you happen to be on the Kowloon shoreline, be sure to check out the incredible light show of an evening!
Another face of HK. You will find this small resort area very quiet and comfortable away from crowd of center of HK. Many good and not good restaurants.

Still love this harbour, even in the pouring rain. An ferry ride on the harbour is part of the experience and a must do when visiting HK. The beauty of the buildings surrounding buildings is amazing, architecture at its most modern but with a oriental style. Day or night, worth a trip.

Busy nice harbour. Victoria Harbour is probably one of the busiest on the world with lots of boats crossing it every day and night. It makes me wonder how it is possible that they don’t crash.It is a nice place to appreciate the skyline of Hong Kong and admire its beauty.You can take the star ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui and then take a stroll on the promenade to admire the activity on the harbour, either during the day or at night and take lots of pictures.It is so busy that sometimes, when you cross the harbour in the star ferry it needs to wait until some other boats pass.There are tourist junks and sampans that you can take to appreciate more the harbour but I haven’t tried it.I love the feeling of calm the water gives me even in such a busy harbour.The visibility is better on a nice day but if it is cloudy it looks mysterious and I love it too.Guess I like it, either it is sunny or foggy!
scenic view. liked the beautiful view even if this is my second time, still I find this place excellent, very different from what the Philippines have.
nice. nice to walk along here in the morning, lots of chinese ladies doing there excercises!!!nice to see a working harbour, very clean and safe down here, good facilties too
Harbor Trip. This was great - we saw Hong Kong via sea - the cruise boat took us up and down on both sides of the harbor - this gives another view of Hong Kong and Kowloon.

A world class skyline. You have to be there and see it for yourself! This harbour with the neon lights and a skyline of high rises to give a stunning backdrop for the junk boats, sampans, ferries and cruiseliners that frequent its waters. It encapsulates both old and new in one breath.
The Harbour and the Night Light Show.. Both during the day when the Harbour is very busy and in the Evening before and during the Light Show it is spectacular.
Magical. I have been to Hong Kong many times, the waterfront is pure magic, take the star ferry - just for fun, walk the boards it's all very cheap and always something to see
Aqua Luna Harbor Lights Tour. Great vessel, nice tour but would suggest that you board on TST side of harbor for a better choice of seat.

Fantastic night view. was there a few nights before Halloween, the place was buzzing with activity, quite a number of people were dressed up for Halloween and a huge display of motorbikes and there was even a stage where people were singing. view to central was fantastic and there is the equivalent of the Hollywood walk of fame, look out for Bruce Lee's star.
Take the Star Ferry. A trip across the harbor on the Star Ferry is a must and great photo opportunities. Also if you have time ride the junk the Duk Ling for a nice experience.
Great skyline. One can see the nice tall buildings of Hong Kong as skyline. The harbour lights were great to watch change colours at dusk and night time.

Place to Chill-out. Can take can easy walk in the night & if its weekend, nothing like tht !!! You can also find lots of lounges on the opp side of harbour. Its also good for morning jog, though i dont think many will go during Holidays !! ;)
What can you say. like the skyline which the harbour is part of is a must see. If you go up The Peak around 4.30pm and see the lights come on as it gets dark you see the harbour at its best.
Amazing. Everything you expect and more. Very clean and toilets easily available. So many colours. The scarlet sailed junk was beautiful.

Symphony of Lights!. I would hate to fall in- the harbour waters are grey and murky in daylight however take a boat ride into the middle of the harbour after dark. Watch the Symphony of Lights. Many of the tall buildings on both the HK and Kowloon sides of the harbour light up and send beams of light soaring across the sky, all accompanied by atmospheric music.. A great evening out.
nice. very nice but a little busy. Hongkong like most big cities. It's busy and commercial. You can have many choice for the food and a little expensive. Many good place for shopping like outlet .
Busy busy busy. There are always boats, ships, barges moving around Victoria Harbor and it flanked on either side by massive skyscrapers - am impressive view.

Excellent for a stroll in the evening. The area is very bustling and busy but at the same time the calmness of the water and the reflection of those magnificent feats of architecture render this soothing and calming effect.There are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby to enjoy the view with a drink or a meal. We preferred to go late in the evening.

pintoresque. I liked the contrast between water, mountains and skyline. For the navigation make sure it is a clear day ( the same if you go to Victoria Peak) otherwise you will only see some shadows through the fog...
Hong Kong October 2012. This was great as the anticipation to see the nightly laser show. just get there early. Fantastic pictures to be had.

One of the best skylines in the world. Take the star ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui, there's a promenade there where you can sit and watch the skyline. Go at night for a truly spectacular view. At 8pm there's a light show from the buildings in Central. Definitely one of the best views in the world.

harbour with a view. no doubt, this must be one of the most stunning skylines around. the best part is when day turns to night, and the whole skyline slowly lights up till there is just a blaze of neon. the best views are from kowloon as you look out to hk island.

Lights, camera, PHOTO!. Head on down to the Star Ferry Pier and walk along the Avenue of Stars at about 8pm to take in the Symphony of Lights show. Stunning! Great photo spots all the way along as well of Hong Kong's iconic skyline.

View from Victoria Harbour. You can have amazing view of Hong Kong from Victoria Harbour. Its really famous for its stunning panoramic view and skyline. Its so beautiful and romantic out there specially during night time. Must see for honeymooners.
Great View. Great place to visit at Night as well as by Day. Take a walk as the breeze takes your breathe away. Watch the Symphony of Lights and Sounds everyday at 8pm.
Required and worth it. It would be hard to say you had visited Hong Kong without going to Victoria Harbour. The river traffic is amazing and the area is interesting.

Harbouring good thoughts. Hong Kong is my favorite city. Victoria Harbour is an enchanting place day and night. I have welcomed the New Year here. The fireworks are spectacular. Be sure to take the ferry from Kowloon to Central. Ride upstairs and down. Walk the harbor on both sides; the views are very different. One can stroll, sit, take pictures and spend hours alone or with friends.
Scenic Harbour. We loved watching the ships in the harbour day and night. It's very beautiful against the Hong Kong skyline.

As busy as 100 busy things. The harbour is like a city on water. The amount of water craft getting around (without crashing into each other) is amazing. The pollution was pretty bad the day we went out and the fumes from our sampan's engine were a little disconcerting. It was interesting to observe all of the different businesses happening in the Harbour - all from boats. I would have liked to have gone to the floating restaurant but unfortunately it wasn't part of our arranged trip.
Not the postcard shot, but still fascinating.. No junk boats and very little visibility might make this disappointing for some, but we loved the iconic, working waterway.
alot of people there... make sure u when there... i been to doraemon exhabition here..wonderful spot... can see the whole hong kong island from here...near to shopping place..love shopping

Fascinating!. Even though the Star Ferry traffic has been reduced since the new road tunnels have been built, this is still one of the world's greatest harbours and no visit to Hong Kong would be complete without spending some time here.
a sampan round the harbour. well, couldn't visit Hong Kong and not do this. It was fun, would have liked it to have been longer.

Always changing. Nothing stays still for long in Victoria harbour. Watch the Star Ferries going back and forth and the junk with its red sails taking tourists round the harbour as well as other pleasure boats. You can also watch kites (the bird type!) skimming the water for fish. You can happily spend time doing nothing just watching the world go by.

Amazing. Dear Lord, how do the boats, ships, ferries, junks, and sampans manage to not crash into each other? Ancient sail-powered boats engage in a complex dance with cargo ships, jet-engine-powered ferries, cruise ships... all playing out in front of a spectacular urban skyline.Not to be missed. Can be enjoyed from shore, but more fun to experience from a tour boat or a ferry.

Nice view of the harbour.. Victoria's peak is often visited by tourists. Maybe it's just not my cuppa tea, but it does offer nice views of the harbour with a few stops along the way for photograph opportunities and also a famous temple in the area.
Make Sure to take the Ferry. To take in all that Victoria Harbour can offer, the Ferry should be taken at least one time, to experience the view of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island from the water.
Star Ferry. Take the 1 hour star ferry trip around Victoria harbour, well worth it, good views of Kowloon and HK island and good informative trip

stunning. Absolutely beautiful. Do take the star ferry across at just $2.50 but don't waste your money on the symphony of lights tour in the evening. Waste of time and money. Nothing to write home about.
Impressive but in a constant haze. It is probably cliched now, but the skyline was permanently partially obscured by the haze. Still it is impressive.
Great for people watching. pull up a chair and watch the world go by such a busy place full of life and a great place to visit. Lots of places to eat and jump on a ferry for a trip around the harbour

the skylike surrounding makes it unique. its got an amazing skyline all around..so the nights are spectacular..but really there are way too many people and its too crowded all around..u don't even get space for a good pic..on top then there are commercial touts and agents (photographers) that block the best spots because of thier own business

The most beautiful harbour and skyline. Go to see the laser and sound show - one of the best, and free, hightlights of HK. The crowd builds quickly so get there earlier and view from the skywalk area at the pier.

Best Bird's Eye View. the best view is from the peak, best to take a bus from Admiralty. Go up to upper decker, you can experience the whole winding hill trip all the way up to the peak with high rise apartment building on the hillside. Best time to go is in the late afternoon around 6pm during summer time. Take an hour stroll walk around the peak path. You can see the islands and Central districts, harbour view and Aberdeen at the back of the mountain where there is fishing village. Wait until 8pm to watch the laser lights dancing in the dark. It's the most economical and excellent way to view Hong Kong.

Great Star Ferry Tours. The day tour offered by Star Ferries is very informative andgives good views of the harbor, but the night tour that incorporates the light show at 8:00pm is superb. The fare includes a soft drink and a piece of cake. I highly recommend the night tour.
Star ferry. Our children loved their first ride on a star ferry. The harbour is beautiful day and night. Stared at it from our hotel window.
must visit. this spot is a must visit place, as you see so many time in hongkong movie, take a walk and enjoy the day, better come on summer

It is worth to give it a look. The view is quite pretty at night. But according to HK tourism website, there's 45 min light show every night at 8 but we only saw like 10 min and it was over. Very dissapointed.

A grand view especially from the Kowloon side.. The harbor comes to life every evening with light, laser and music show where the major buildings come to life with their light shows. I call them "the dancing buildings" and my favorite is the Bank of China building. Best viewed from the Avenue of Stars on the northern seashore or from our hotel room window at the Harbor Plaza Metropolis.
Don't miss. Another fab way to see the nightly light show, or just to take in the wonderful views. It is very cheap to use the star ferry and take a journey across Victoria Harbour.
Good Value. enjoyed a ferry trip around the harbour and the lovely scenery, also how some locals still live on the river, very colourful and interesting, commentary on trip educational.

8pm show. Beautiful any time of the day, but especially at night. Check out the 8pm light show from the seating near the Clock Tower on Kowloon side. Then you can walk the Avenue of the Stars and people watch. Lots of fun!
great views. Take the star ferry to get a cheap but authentic take on Hong Kong with amazing views. If you go in the evening you are very close to watch the Hong Kong Skyline night show.
Victoria harbour. A good place to relax and unwind, yet it was very very hot may be because of the smog?? However, the public toilet rooms are not that well-maintained.
must do. Great short trip up the hill for an excellent view of Hong Kong. This is an affordable must do activity when visiting Hong Kong.
Harbour. You must take a trip on the Star Fery across the harbour. Go on the upper deck which a relief from the heat. Great views and it is cheap, as is all public transport.

amazing time!. spent almost a full day at the harbour just sitting by the river... the weather was very nice. good place to just sit and relax! if you fee hungry Tsim Tsa Tsui offers hundreds of good eateries!
A sight to see.. I have never seen so many tall sky srapers in my life. Very neat to tavel across on the Star Ferry. I was very surprised by the haze (smog?????).
Great and breath taking. One ot the best place in hongkong...hope to go back there someday!I really enjoy the scenery in Victoria Harbour.Most people took photograph of this amazing view.

Very Hazy - no good for photos. One of my missions while in HK was to get some of those great harbour-skyline photos - both day and night.
Problem was, it was so hazy the photos I did get were not what I hoped for.

One of the best cityscapes in the world. The cityscape of Victoria Harbour is a must. It's especially amazing at night. The view is best from the Kowloon side next to the Tsimshatsui Star Ferry Pier. There are lightshows on the weekends.

One of the most picturesque harbours in the world. You can just sit there day and night and soak in the colour and beauty of the harbour. The light show at night is worth looking at and as the lights come on at night the atmosphere changes. It is a pity that there are no or virtually no Chinese junks seen in the harbour but there is enough to see time pass by.

Glad to return. Love the atmosphere, the Star Ferry crossings, watching life go by on the water and just generally the whole harbour scene: this is, to me, the focal point of Hong Kong and the imagery always stays with me until I return.

A must for any traveller. This is unique. Take the ferry or any vessels to be on Hong Kong harbour for 1-2 hours anytime of the day; and this will complete 50% of what a mInimal requirement for anyone who visits. A guide is not required. Just sitting back and soaking in the sky line and buildings is sufficient and without having someone to tell you the names of each and every buildings or it's history. I am a local person who lives here and once I went on a 2 hour harbour cruise with dinner on a summer evening which turned out to be one of the best treat. For those who are pressed for time, take the Star Ferry across the harbour is also a quick introduction to the magnificent city

Beautiful Views disappointing Symphony of Lights. Victoria Harbour is indeed beautiful and I would recommend going both during the day and in the evening to see both sides of Hong Kong's harbour. I was however disappointed with the light show- not the spectacular I had hoped for. Check out my blog for more Hong Kong details and photoshttp://www.globejetter.co.uk/2012/09/final-hours-in-hong-kong.html
Very busy little hub. Quite a busy little hub in Hong Kong but flows very well. Quite often at night there is some kind of entertaining going on and can wander around for hours

Pretty at night.. We didnt find that there was much to do here, but we did find a nice place to eat. We got a few nice photos. We asked a lot of people how to get to avenue of the stars and no one seemed to know where it was or what it was. When we found it, we found out why. It was boring!

A boat trip is a must. An amazing harbour. Boat trips with Star Ferrys are a great way to take it all in. The views at night are breath taking but in the day it's fabulous to see the architecture in detail.

Look from Kowloon to HK Island. At this moment, due to historic establishment, the night view of the harbour is still the best to look from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island - post card like. However, as times go by, due to the relaxation of building height in Kowloon (after moving of the Kai Tak Airport), more high rises were built and so the view may change in the future years.
Spectacular. The view either side of the Harbour was mind boggling only rivalled by Sydney Harbour. My impression was it's more a working Harbour than for pleasure.

time spent in Victoria is a magic. Victoria Harbour is the heart of Hong Kong from my perspective. Alaway beautiful, vibrant, exciting and during the evening hours the light show is great. We went on the star fairy, so cheap, and worth the ride anyway. The harbour is very busy, tall skyscapers all about, it looks fabulous. Cant rave about it enough, just magic.

Postcard scenario. Night scene at Victoria harbour was awesome. One can walkabout by the star studded harbour front and take lots of pictures. There are many push cart artists along the harbour front ready to draw portraits for you.

good background especially from tst. a fantastic buildings view from your behind when u stood in the tst victoria park, i.e hong kong island...a relaxable places to walk around...highly recommend...can been there to rest and relax day or night

How busy is this place???. Standing on the quayside watching all the water traffic going about its business is a great way to watch the sunset followed by the magnificent laser sho that takes place at 8pm each night.
Spectacular day and night. I like because it is clean, no smokers although the place is crowded. After a light shower the air is breathtaking.

You have to go the Vic. Harbour. It's seriously a wonderful site to see. You really feel the city: standing at the harbor with the water crashing around you, the tall sky scrapers towering above you, boat and yachts passing by and all the different languages you hear of all the foreigners around you.
Bucket List #50. This is one of those things you must do especially at night. Star ferry across the harbor only 2.50HKD but the view is worth a million.
Amazing for photo shooting. Always visit when i'm in HK, good for walking and chit chat with friends, impressed with Light show everynite at 8:00
The Harbour. The harbour is a hive of activity and easy to access the star ferry. night views so different from the daytime

All shapes and sizes. The land is compact with skyscrapers which dazzle with their mirror frontages; very impressive buildings. It was lovely to see the Star Ferry is still in operation but disappointing not to see Chinese Junks and san pans in the harbour as this has always been part of the image of Hong Kong in the past.
symphony of lights. Its ok, crowded with mainland tourist. You have to get there 30 mins early to get a good spot. After the show, its recommended you take a walk along the habour

Best free ferry ride on earth. Even better than the New York one from Downtown Manhattan. The view is amazing (day and night), the harbor crossing is quick and calm. Once should defenitely take one hour to cross both ways and admire the skyline.
take a nice long walk. Great place for taking nice long walks, just try to avoid the crowd stucked in the middle of the road. take lots of pictures.... stroll after dinner..
Past and Present. It was interesting for us to see the mix of vessels plying Victoria Harbour, from the old junks to the modern sea liners.
A BIT OF NEW CHINA IN OLD CHINA. Used to see lots more of quaint Chinese junks plying the harbour than it is now.Now its more highly motorised boats. Looses its soothing effect from the past times.
Stroll, take pictures. Great to walk around and people watch. The light show is at 8pm every night, set to music which you can view from TST

Beautiful. Day and night views are amazing! Every night or sat night, there are some laser show which is pretty interesting. If you really must, book a room at W or Ritz with a harbour view. Fantastic!

Victoria Harbour. Is somewhere you are almost guaranteed to visit during a trip to Hong Kong, either to take a stroll, catch a ferry, admire the skyline, or to watch the nightly laser light display. so make sure you do at least one of these during your visit.
Amazing day or night. Crossing the harbour by star ferry is both cheap and fabulous by day or night. I never tire of doing it.

Great during the day, spectacular at night... Victoria Harbour is a must do at night. From 8.00pm there is a laser light show that really sets it off, just in general without the light show it is quite a buzz. Go down there one evening. You won't be disappointed.During the day you can get a boat tour around the Harbour which is great value for money. $55HK per person for about 25 mins on the water on what could be described as a small wooden junk. Well worth it.
Best harbour view !. Very very beautiful and pretty ! Take many photos ! Love the light show ! So romantic ! Better to go in the night .
Great setting. Taking a trip on the Star Ferry or, even better, a boat around the Harbour or out to Lammas Island gives you a really great perspective of Hong Kong.

Seeing is Believing. The view coupled with the cheap ferry rides make Victoria Harbor a delight for every traveler. Areas around the harbor are great for people watching or for just watching the pretty skyline. Overall a must see and do during your trip to Hong Kong.

Spend free time at night. Victoria Harbour is a natural landform harbour situated between Hong Kong Island and the Kowloon Peninsula in Hong Kong.In this place, you can take your free time at night. Long famous for its spectacular views, the harbour is a major tourist attraction of Hong Kong. This harbour is the site of annual fireworks displays and its promenades are popular gathering places for tourists and residents.
victoria habour. nice scenery especially at night. however it could be crowded and noisy particularly during weekends
best scene. the best night view in the world, I visited lots of city in the world Hong Kong night view is the prettiest.

Bustling & vibrant at night with beautiful lights on display. It was bustling with people at night. Very vibrant atmosphere, and they even had a grilled squid stand - freshly grilled squid for 30hk dollars, so cheap and delicious.

One of the best sights in the Orient. What superlatives can one use about one of the best harbour sights in the Orient and possibly the world. The best start to any business day I have is the trip across the harbour from the China Terminal to Shun De up the Pearl River....a very realxing way to start any business day. Pay the extra and go VIP class.

See hong Kong from Kowloon !. First, cross with the Ferry ... just because it's a must to do ! Then, spend your time to have a look at the view on Hong Kong from the Promenade. At night, you'll be able to see a lightning show.Avenue of the stars is about the a nice walk, but don't expect to recognize the names of the stars. Of course one will remember you something at least !!!Clock tower is nice, but I was disappointed not see more historical information about it on the spot.

What More Can Be Said. If you read just a few of the reviews, you will see that Victoria Harbour is a not to be missed. I can only add that you should try to see it from as many different locations as possible and at different times of the day.
Amazing!. Awesome views of Hong Kong from all around the harbour. Definitely see the harbour in both the day and the night time.

MUst - seen scene of Hong Kong. The panoromic view and comfortable feeling!! It is a fantastic natural view of Hong Kong!! Nearby there has great restaurants, museums, shopping centers and entertainment facilities and cultural centers,
See it till you die. Yes, this is an amazing tour (you better even take it twice - during daytime, to see the city, and at night - to see the light show). Yet another "must see" thing in HK.

Spectacular celebration of the 15th anniversary of Chinese takeover. The Victoria Harbour is the most famous point of interest in Hong Kong, Its offers ferrys to various places, there's a space museum, then the Hong Kong Cultural centre and the Hong Kong Museum of art

"Hong Kong Signature". You can never say you've been to Hong Kong if you do not have a picture at the Victoria Harbour.Plus, the Avenue of Stars, Clock Tower and Hong Kong Cultural Center is located here as well so its a 3-in-1 tourist destination.Try visiting from late afternoon til night so you can enjoy both the morning and night view, and watch the Symphony of Lights at night. :)

This place is stunning!!. There is really no way to descibe how incredibly stunning Vic. harbour is!! At night there is nowhere more amazing- the light shows/ the skyline and the people-- you really have to see for yourself.

The Pearl of Orient. Hardly can describe the beauty of the harbour with its fascination throughout the day. In particular during the process of laser performance from various high-rise buildings, it's really marvelous and definitely an extravaganza!

Victoria Peak. Right after our 5 hour visit to the Ocean Park, we proceeded to Victoria Peak to view the Harbour! Though it was drizzling, the view was breathtaking! Even at around 10pm, there were lots of people milling around the Peak to take some pictures of the area and of course for posterity. It was also an experience for us family to take the tram going up! Though the taxi we took going to the tram station charged us quite high considering our ride was only from the bus station of Ocean Park to the Tram station. It just took us 5 minutes and cost us $60.00. Nevertheless, this didn't spoil our trip going to this area..Unfortunately, restaurants were closing down when we arrived since we were all hungry!

Prettiest Harbour. Been to Hong Kong several times and I still can't get over the magnificant Victoria Harbour, day or night, just spectacular. Walk on the Promenade, its free, ride the Star Ferry to anywhere, just get out on the Harbour.

beautiful view of working harbor from room.. Busy water traffic, No noise penetrated room. Loved the Star Ferry - why don't we all keep our facilitIes in good repair - this ferry was old and charming and clean
Stunning at night. Get the star ferry from Kowloon at night for lovely views. Home kong sky line is amazing at night. Light show is great!

Get on a Chinese Junk and sail around the harbor Beautiful. A trip to HKG is not complete without several trips on the Beautiful Victoria Harbour, Don't forget the veining LIGHT Show Spectacular off many Famous hotels on both the island and Kowloon side, Also a must is a Day trip to Macau or overnight and wake up in Macau Breakfast and travel back to HKG Island Perfect.

View to die for!!!. This is one for the "bucket List" you must visit here before you kick the bucket! Just to sit at the top in The Peak Restaurant with only my wife for company,served personally by the head waiter was just unbelievable. At precisely 8 o'clock each evening or maybe it was at the week-end,I didn't ask,a fantastic firework display was given.And it seemed it was for the sole purpose of us two love birds (35 years married by the way) That in itself was worth the meal price,which was not cheap by the way! That night will long live in my memory and so it should,the harbour view is iconic and not to be missed so please be making your way there very soon. 10/10 !!!

Night view. The night view is nice, can see lots of beautiful lights from all the buildings. And can feel that wind blow across you, felt relax. But it crowded at night. If you want to find a good spot must go early.
One of the world's best skylines. Star ferry ride - a must do, the light show - view from Woolomoloo Prime cocktal barat the One in TST
Beautiful views. Loved the hustle and bustle of this place - the place never sleeps, one ferry after another - and everything is so organised.

Night Cruise. As we had seen Victoria Harbour from Sky 100 and the Peak it was time to take a closer look. There are many tour companies offering cruises both during the day and at night. We choose the night cruise and were not disappointed. We were able to view the 'Symphony of Lights' (spectacular light show around the harbour). We then cruised a fair way up the harbour and observed all the night activity.

A must see in HK. Victoria harbour is without equal in it's stunning views. Grab a spot along the TST waterfront to look at the buildings. Jsut grad a coffee and watch the sunset. Them catch teh Star Ferry to Wan Chai, walk around the convention center to the west side for a great photo opportunity of Central.
Best harbor in the world. Its vibrant, busy and charming with the skyscrapers in the background. It makes for a charming place to see.

taking the sights at the harbour. it's great to go and just sit down, and take in the view,there's always something new to see,the harbour is always busy,at night it's a wonder how some boats navigate with no lights and so much traffic
Short ferry trip. Nice slow way to get across to the other side when you are not n a rush
Beautiful no matter the weather. Take the Star Ferry, book a hotel room with a view of the Harbour and enjoy every minute in this wonderful city. The water tours give you a great view.

Very good sights - Could have been better!. There isn't really anyone to blame for the smog that covered the light show at 8pm, it would have been excellent if it was clearer! Through the smog it looked pretty good - there were laser lights and the buildings would change colors, it was quite a spectacular show. The views from the harbor were beautiful, and the ferry ride was memorable. We'd go again.
one of the best in the world. you must come here to experience east meets westgreat placewow wow wow - when there is fireworksgreat at nightromantic at night

Nice Attraction. We went back in 2009 (2009 is no longer in the drop down so I had to choose 2011), and it was very nice. It was incredibly windy which added to the experience, and my Dad being a Bruce Lee fan enjoyed posing with the statue (I cannot post pictures of my Dad here though - he'd get so angry!).
"Just Beautiful". Victoria Park gives you nice taste of Hong kong. Amazing view of Hong Kong harbor.
amazng view. went there in the late evening , luckily it was not foggy and cud get a good view !
amazing sight. sitting out side watch the world go by the cruise liners coming in the hustle and bustle of the harbour.amazing
Ride on Victoria Harbour. Very nice ferry ride across the bay from Kowloon to Hong Kong City
Spectacular day or night. We were there for the Dragon Boat Festival (daytime) and for the evening 13 minute light show! Great waterfront. we'd go again in a minute!
good. Nothing I can say I dislike.Huge passenger liners are docked.With such beautiful environment its worth watching night life.

Romantic place. For me, this place is one of my fave and i will make sure that i will visit this place when i visit hongkong again. This place is nice for you who interest to take photo or maybe nice place to bring your kids who likes to run and keep running. Its safe place anyway.
Fantastic view. Family of mine came for the first time in Asia, there where amaze from the view of the Harbour! Really great walk, 4pm to 6pm is a perfect time!

Ferry trip. The best way to see the harbor is to take a ferry. I took a ferry from Hong Kong Island to Lantau, where the giant Bronze Buddha is located. The slower ferry allows you to appreciate it more, but either one (the slow or fast) allows for a wonderful scenic route.

awesome laser music show. It was awesome to see the laser music show at night, all these lasers bouncing off from these sky buildings. It was pretty. for about 10-15 min. would see it every time when visiting HK.

beautiful and relaxing. Very nice, awesome view and relaxing. We did the cruise 7:30 in the evening, so we have enjoyed the sunset, the view during the night and the laser show. Our cruise included just drinks which was good since the weather was windy and we couldn't have eaten.The cruise name is AquaLuna, the boat looks like ''Pirate of the Carrebians''I recommend it to everyone, it'sa nice trip after a long walking day.
Stunning view. There are so many things to do here plus it's an amazing view at night. The Symphony of Lights was also quite entertaining.
Atmospheric. This is a must to do to soak up the atmosphere of the world famous harbour.
Awsome view on both sides of the harbour. Good experience in taking the ferry to/from Hong Kong Island/kowloon. The fare very affordable and you get a good view while traveling on board.

Wonderful Views of Hong Kong. If visiting HK, you must see Victoria Harbour! The 'symphony of lights' was spectacular, and the view of the entire city was beautiful. Just make sure to go when the pollution isn't blocking anything out, and don't miss the light show!

Amazing view in the Morning. Amazing view in the Morning
Amazing view in the Morning

Night out. Excellent weather in the city. Amazing light show at 8 pm with great view of the entire city and superb Avenue of Stars walk that one can remember for life. You truly feel international in this city. Conveniently located from anywhere in HKG

SCENIC HARBOUR. Victoria Harbour is a must see place . Very scenic at day time and very dazzling at night. You see lots of crowd there. You can go and relax there and can spend your time there. Some eatery shops are also there and you can pick and choose of your choice.

Every bit as lovely as in pictures and movies . . .. Breathtakingly enchanting view; best seen while on a Star ferry, which, incidentally, is one of the cheapest attractions of HK at HKD3.20. A must-do!
beautiful!. Go here for amazing views of the harbour and catch a star ferry across to kowloon
Symphony of Lights. Every night at 8pm...don't miss it! And get there by 7:45...
Impressive. Water a bit choppy on the Ferry.....a bit queasy After landing. The shopping hall not to be missed! Restraunts a plenty!

Unique. A kaleidoscope of people, activity, maritime maneuvers, skyscrapers lit by color and lasers every night, dredging of the bay in the march into the future and sampans carrying freight and passengers...
Beautiful. Even as a local. I find the scenary of Victoria Harbour is special.
Great shopping. Huge variety of shops for clothes shopping. Did my clothes shopping there.

Fun to take tour. We took a tourist tour of Victoria Harbor in what was portrayed as an old junk boat. Our driver, an old China woman, drove us around the harbor and showed up the boat she lives on. It was fun and I would recommend doing this.
Great scenic view. Pay the extra to see the scenic view from the top of the plaza.
Hong Kong by night. Go to the Peak in the evening is most suitable . The night view is well known to the world

The most beautiful habour!. Stunning habour! So picturesque & so busy. Wonderful during the day & fantastic at night. Catch the Star Ferry during the day & watch the Light & Sound show over the habour at night. Every alternate night the commentary isin English

Get your camera out!. No matter the time of day or night you'll see the coolest things on the Harbour. Whether its the people or the vessels that go by, you'll be thoroughly entertained.
