A clean, busy stipr of water that separates Kowloon from Hong Kong. I loved the diversity of harbour traffic; the ferries, sampans, cruise boats, power boats, etc. The water looked incredibly clean and smooth and there was no worries about sea sickness on the ferry because, a) it's not that wide to get to the other side in a short time and 'b) it's so calm. I come from Melbourne and we also have a body of water that splits the city, only ours is a little narrower and a lot dirtier! Beautiful city is Hong Kong and the harbour is an integral part of it.
Words just don't do it justice.. Indulge yourself in the unbeatable night view of Hong Kong, yes, even if you come from manhattan!
Nice to spot it. Great view from the sky 100 and sky 102 restaurants...no baby acilitis at the restaurants thou..

Take the Star Ferry!. My children and I took the Star Ferry both directions across the Harbour and experience was fabulous. We had a good time talking with both locals and other tourists, and my children were thrilled to see all the boats seeming to pass safely in chaos. The breeze on the harbour was a welcome respite from the summer heat, and finding our connecting bus was easy-peasy. A fun was to get around Hong Kong.
Must do for Hong Kong first timers. Nice place to spend some time, try and book a boat ride at night around the harbor so you can enjoy the sites of the city all lit up in lights.
Wow - on a nice sunny day -thing to do!. Great views, great relaxing way to see Hong Kong. Got on a cruise ship and sailed around the harbour.
The best night view. I never miss to visit Victoria Harbour at night every visit to Hong Kong. It is so easy to see the whole Victoria Harbor from Star Ferry.

can’t miss it. You can’t miss Victoria Harbour staying in Hong Kong. This is the first thing you see from the Peak Tower and you gasp at the view. All the 3 routes of the Big Bus Tour have a stop at the Star Ferry and Apple store (a real tourist attraction!) is a few steps away. It’s beautiful in the daytime and stunning at night during the Symphony of Lights, both from Kowloon and Hong Kong side.

Truly Iconic. The views of Victoria Harbour define Hong Kong - just like the skyline of New York. It is best seen from the Kowloon side. Head towards Harbour City or the ferry terminals to get a really good view of the harbour. At night, the views are truly spectacular. If you are lucky to be in HK for new year, the fireworks to be enjoyed from anywhere near the harbour should not be missed.
Supper Lookout!. See all the Hong Kong panorama!Take bus No. 15 from the Star Ferry Terminal, Hong Kong side for the cheapest way up. EnJoY!!

Pretty as a picture. The harbour is pretty at day or night. Consider taking a Star Ferry Cruise across the harbour, take the tram up Victoria Peak and take a stroll along the Avenue of the Stars...all give beautiful vistas. Also, do not forget to spend at least one night on Kowloon side watching the night 8pm light show.
Bustling port offering a great night view. We took the boat ride across from HK island to TST and the night view was simply breath-taking
The evening light show and Star Ferry. Star Ferry so cheap and such a great way to cross the harbour. The lightshow worth a look, but doesn't add a lot to the already gorgeous harbour.
Great Nightview. Although it is crowd in night, but that is the most attractive point of Hong Kong, beautiful night view. I think visit here after 21:00 or 22:00 is better.
Nice evening stroll :-). It's great to enjoy the vieuw in the evening when it's dark and the lightning on the buildings shine :-) Don't miss the light show at 20.00 hrs

See it at night!. The lights and water of Victoria Harbour always bring pleasure no matter how long you live in Hong Kong. Seeing it at night is a must! The days give one a better sense of the amount of traffic in the harbour. The nighhtly light show is not as special as it once was.

Beautiful way to view the city!. This walk along the harbour was absolutely the beautiful. This really showed visitors how beautiful Hong Kong really is. The avenue of stars was very interesting and we loved all the statues along the way.
Excellent. It is a wonderful place to visit. The view of Hong Kong and the harbour are excellent, especially the night view. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
Brilliant harbour. The great harbour coupled with the famous Hong Kong skyline. Marvellous
go for the light show. Light show was very entertaining. get there early for a good spot. Anywhere along Tsim Sha Tsui is fine.
Amazing. Tram was good.. View was good.. But the sky tower was crowded
Light Show. Great light show every night of the week. Find a good location in TST for the best view
Best view of hong kong. Loventhe city on day and night. Too k loads of photos

The jewel in Hong Kong's crown. Victoria Harbour must certainly qualify as the centre piece of Hong Kong. Apart from the day views of the harbour that are quite spectacular, world-famous are the panoramic night views. Hint 1: among the best places to view the Harbour at night is the Peak Tower on Victoria Peak. The day view is perhaps best from Sky100 International Commerce Centre (ICC). Hint 2: National Geographic Traveler quite justifiably named the Victoria Harbour Star Ferry crossing as one of the 'Top 50 travel experiences of a lifetime'. For HK$ 2.50, take the upper deck on the Central / Tsim Sha Tsui ferry or vice versa - a ten minute ride where you can relax and feel the harbour breeze on your face as the ferry thrums its way across - and before you know it there you are on the other side!Hint 3: Yet another popular if more expensive way of taking in Victoria Harbour during the day, evening or night is on the various harbour cruises on offer - please see the Hong Kong Tourism Board website for specific details.Hint 4: if you are okay to some big spending, one of the best options to do the harbour at night is the Symphony of Lights Dinner Cruise conducted by Harbour Cruise - Bauhinia, which throws in dinner and a live band on board. Departing at 7.30pm, It lasts for about 2 hours and costs about HK$ 440 per head including a 10% service charge. There are lower cost versions, all listed on the HKG Tourism Board's website.Hint 5: Don't miss the Symphony of Lights multimedia display, which takes place at 8pm every night. Listed as the world's largest Light and Sound show by Guinness World Records it uses a combination of colourful lighting, laser beams and searchlights synchronised to music - quite a stunning spectacle. Admission is free. You can see this display from any of the harbour cruises or from the waterfront promenades on either side of Victoria Harbour.Hint 6: Star Ferry's double-decker "Shining Star" ferry is a really good recreation of the ferries that sailed across Victoria Harbour in the early 1900s. On board the Shining Star, you can relax in an air conditioned lounge which has a cafe to serve you, or you can choose to take in the breeze on the open deck - or both! At HK$80 per head for the "Single Ride Day Round Trip Ticket", the one hour long Star Ferry Harbour Tour is good value for money, an unforgettable experience and offers some great harbour views - hard to beat.Hint 7: I recommend the Star Ferry Harbour Tour that leaves Central Pier at 5.15pm - this departure time gives you a great combination of seeing the harbour transform from daylight through evening to dusk - certainly a novel experience.No exaggeration this - Victoria Harbour is definitely the jewel in Hong Kong's crown.

Central to the city. This part of Hong Kong is central to the downtown area and therefore a gravitational force for locals and visitors alike. We took the harbor cruise on the Star Ferry and highly recommend that as a way to learn about and see the harbor. The promenade is lovely, too (along the water front), and we came back there for Tai Chi lessons outside the Museum of Art the morning of our departure.
Pretty Night View. It is very beautiful in a clear evening. The lights are pretty. I don't think much of the dancing lights at 8 pm but when they had the firework, it is fantastic.

world's largest permanent light and sounds show. Victoria Harbour is the destination to visit if1) You want to see the famous skyline on both the Kowloon and the Hong Kong Island. 2) See the record setting light show at 8pm every night.You will get to see the famous skyline of Hong Kong from both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, and it is low cost to see if you take the Star Ferry. It is worth the trip to go from Hong Kong Island and get off at Tst on the Kowloon side and visit the 1881 heritage area if you scenery and photo ops. If you enjoy fireworks then check out the evening daily show known as the "Symphony of Lights" that is set against the skyline. The show holds a Guinness World record for the world's largest permanent light and sounds show. It is also located on the Kowloon side. A good vantage point is the avenue of stars. For more first hand information as of Jan 2012, maps, pictures, and videos you can find it at this linkhttp://chicvoyagetravel.com/featured-experience/hong-kong/hong-kong-guangzhou-experience/
Astonishing. What a view, the hub of the city of Hong Kong. Victoria Harbour shines in all her glory at night. We went to TST side. There is heaps to do, dinner, drinks and photos.

An Excellent Display of Lights in the Evenings!. The Light Show at Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong is a must-see for every visitor to Hong Kong. A spectecular display of lights takes place every evening. It is a marvel to watch. You are sure to enjoy the sight.

A "must experience" part of Hong Kong. This is one of the most famous places on earth. Anyone who takes a trip to Hong Kong must spend some time at Victoria Harbour and take a ride on the ferry which crosses it.

A Refreshing view. If your lucky and the weather is great, you'll experience a stunning view of honk Kong from the harbor, id recommend taking a ferry to the other side of the island to enjoy it completely
amazing. Wow the lights at night are amazing book a boat trip at night great fun
Amazing spectacle. The Star Ferry is the best way to experience this amazing mixture of east meets west!
not a patch on shanghai harbour. Personally, Harbour lights show was a little dissapointing, go to Shanghai if you want to see better architecture and spectacle.

The heart of Hong Kong. Sooner or later you will definitely see Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry is shuttling the harbor from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon via different landing places. A trip takes around 10 minutes and costs around 4 HKD. You can use the Octopus Card as well. The best place to spot the harbour is Tsim Sha Tsui promenade, especially at night it's simply amazing. At 8 pm there the "Symphony of Lights", a lightshow illuminating the skyscrapers on Hong Kong Island.
Stand and look. Great views, just looks unreal!! Make sure you see the light show, great free entertainment
Boat Tour. lets you see the city without having any stressbest to do at night time

harbour nights. the Hong Kong skyline is so iconic I thought I knew it even before I'd got there but nothing fully prepares you for seeing it for real. It is an astonishing spectacle, especially seen at night from the deck of a "Star" ferry on the way to Kowloon. Buildings that appear to be stealing the sky compete with each other to offer a light show of startling audacity, with the Bank of China building eclipsing all others. It is mesmerising and night photography becomes possible because of the intensity of reflected light off the surface of the ink-black harbour waters. Kowloon harbourside is thronged with sight-seers until very late in the evening creating thew impression you are part of one of the biggest and best FREE shows in the world. Unmissable and unforgettable
BUSY HARBOUR. There is a fantastic buzz with all the traffic in this very busy harbour with Cruise Ships, the famous Star Ferries, all the barges , tugs, etc. Never a dull moment.
Impressive View. Impressive view, specially in the night. Don't miss the Symphony of Lights (Daily @ 8:00 pm)

Breathtaking view of the city. This is a really nice place to go and see the city lights. There are a couple of restaurants with a beautiful view. Its buzzing with tourist all the time. its a must see if your in hong kong.

Take all of HK in...from the water. The HK sky line is overwhelming and almost surreal. I found myself looking up all the time, as the buildings go on for ever and there's no trees or breaks in the sight-line. We took a 4 hour boat ride around the harbor, coasted along Kowloon and HK Isle sides. We saw the sun set and the lights come on, seeing both day/night views. The light show is @ 8pm daily and was neat, but best to view on a cloudy day, so the clouds are the backdrop to the bright lights. The actual viewing platform is on the TST Kowloon side, but you can see the show from anywhere, especially up high.
busy little harbour. This harbour is jam packed full of little boats and some are even restaurants! So busy, cute and full of life. A must see.
Worth a visit. Great views over the harbour, and really interesting to watch!

Symphony of Lights. Beautiful presentation at night (starts at 8 pm daily) except that the audio system gives way after raining session. Certain nights, it is presented in Cantonese version which will be pretty difficult for western tourist to understand.
Enjoyable Light Show. Go down to the Harbor for the 8PM light show and bring your camera. Great shots and very colorful. Show is short but well worth going.

Can't beat this view.. Go early. Worth the time and we spent hours here. Walked around the trail the whole way. So glad we did. Beautiful with waterfall and more views. Quiet, gorgeous, don't miss it.
get impressed. watching the lightshow (9pm) and skyline of hong kong just can't go wrong try and catch the views from any of the skyscrapers at kowloon side
Beautiful Harbour. Loved the awesome skyline and the buzz of the city, especially after dark

Love the skyline!. The famous skyline! It was quite special seeing these well-known landmarks for the 1st time. Be there at 8pm to see the amazing light show. We viewed it from a boat in the middle of the harbour - super special moment!
Amazing. You have to see it for yourself, and take a good camera. See it at night.

New year countdown. Best place to be for the new year countdown! The fireworks display is amazing as it is set against the hong kong kong skyline. There are available cruises that one can ride for a good view of the firewalks display although staying on the promenade works as well too.
Breathtaking. It is! And the best way to enjoy it is via Star Ferry.

Vibrant heart of the city. Victoria Harbour is the heart of Hong Kong. By day a bustling harbour that you MUST see from the iconic Star Ferry (around 25p for a seat on the top deck it's one of the best bargains around).By night head for the Avenue of Stars on Kowloon and watch the nightly Symphony of Lights. It's a great light show but don;t expect to hear the story of Hong Kong and DEFINITELY don't pay to see it from a boat as it's a complete waste of money when you can see it free from dry land!
Busy ,busy. Great lightshow. Photographers delight. The background music adds to the experience
Interseting place.. Nicely set, the harbour si a byzy place. Various type of crowds are there hanging around. A place to go and see.

Light show at the Avenue of Stars is spectacular!. Perfect for a night time stroll down after dinner at the night markets. Make sure you check what time the light show starts and arrive on time. It gets quite busy so would be good to get there early. Great atmosphere.
The best thing in Hong Kong. of all the things in Hong Kong to do. Just go down to TST at night and watch the skyline. The light show at 8 is ok, but the skyline is the best.
Awesome scenery. The harbour is beautiful in the night because of the light from many skyscrapper. If you go to HK isn't complete if you don't go to this harbour!
A way to relax. The ferry ride across the harbour was relaxing and a good way to find some space in what is otherwise an extremely dense place. The views of the skyline were, as always, spectacular.
Stunning by day and night. There is always something to watch in this harbour. The area really comes into its own at night, with an amazing light show.Spectacular!
Victoria Harbour .... Great vistas of a wonderful city. Enjoy the Star Ferry cruise and make sure you walk the sea front ... Harbour City mall is a great area to see.
Great Harbour. Love the walkway from the star ferry around the harbour
Perfect view. It's a perfect place to see and enjoy Hong Kong view. One can sit and watch the sunset, each night at 8pm there are music and light show. Not wowed by it, but still nice.
Must See. Do not miss the light show over Victoria Harbour, when in Hong Kong.
Nice view to end your day. Everynight at 8PM symphony of lights is scheduled here. A great way to end your day. Stay at the avenue of stars are where there are also starbuck and other eatery.

Enjoying. Vitoria Harbour must be on the hot spot list of everyone visiting HK. The lights from these mage structures provide a very picturesque background for photography. The Symphony of Light takes place in this place at 8:00PM daily. It is located in the south end of Nathan road a accessible to surrounded streets which are bustling with fife and activities.
Beautiful experience. Loved the view and the boats with buildings in the background
A fantastic sight night and day. A truly unique place by day or night. Take the Star Ferry round trip for a great view of the city and Kowloon....

Quintessential Hong Kong. If you do not visit the harbor you cannot say you've been to Hong Kong. It is beautiful from either Hong Kong or Kowloon and should not be missed during the day and again at night. At 8:00 pm each night there is a lovely light show that outlines the major skyscrapers in Hong Kong central.

Great view. Great place to see hong kong skyline. U can either see from tsim tsa tsui area or central to wanchai area. Similar but slightly different. Best to see on clear night together with symphony of light or fireworks on certain day.

Prefect night view. Very famous nightview ! it was great to take the traditional ferry to enjoy the environment. At 8:00 pm there is a light show everydays ! It should last for 20mins highly recommend to go.
Take a photo with Bruce Lee. You can take a photo with many actor & artist of Hong Kong here. Good view, fresh air, convenience to go just few minute walk from subway station

great view and ferry ride. I love this place it reminds me of Hong Kong dramas so much. The ferry ride is a nice experience, it gives the traditional feel of HK again. Great view!
Another way to feel the "old hong kong" is to ride the trolley bus at Central
Iconic trip. You must do the Star ferry trip across Victoria Harbour. Great views and great value.
A Peaceful Setting Overlooking the Harbour. We loved the view as we sat in the Club Room with a coffee and cognac
Great view. We went here in the morning before heading off to the star ferry. It was chilly due to the slight rain but had a great breakfast at Starbucks with the harbour as our view.

Enjoyed the Star Ferry. Taking the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbor was a nice way to get on the water and enjoy the harbor views for next to nothing. It is such a short quick ride, I wish that it took longer.
foggy. It would have been even more spectacular with clear weather, but going in April can be iffy
promenade victoria harbour. good promenade, fantastic view especially in the night
Stunning!. Get up to the Peak and take a view over the entire expanse of the harbour area it is quite stunning
Great views. Interesting little ride up the trolley car. Fantastic panorama views. Great pics to be had. A good way to spend a few hours in Hong Kong.

Spectacular.. Personally, I was amazed by the view, Hong Kong is just so huge and it was beautiful to see behind the numerous skyscrapers the outline of the mountains on the island. Such an impressive city to visit.
Amazing views. Its great to see the contrast of old and new boats sharing the harbour....wonderful to look out over.
it's the center of hong kong. the harbour is the center of hong kong, it divides the two areas of town, hong kong island and Kawloon
Wait for a clear sky. Because of the pollution in China, it is best to wait until nightfall or after rain to take a scenic photo

Star ferry. To view the Victoria Harbour at night would captivating onlookers and tourists, no doubt the best view of any skyline anywhere in the world. The colorful lights reflecting from the high-rise buildings onto the pitch-dark water especially around Christmas time creating a breathtaking view for anyone who sees it by changing the disign of the colors to the theme of Christmas. You have to be there to truly understand how spectular it is. Very romatic and very relaxing. Light shows are often done at arround 8´clock in the evening.
Brilliant Light Show. Free light and lazer show every night at 8 pm, reccomended

Hard to believe. With the lights at night it is hard to put into words how many people live here! Coming from Australia I have never encountered so many people in such a small place. Fantastic harbour cruises available and be sure to try the local cuisine.

Nice place to visit and walk to see Hong Kong Harbour views.. The Victoria Harbour is central to Tsim Sha Tsui in Hong Kong. You'll be able to see many ferry's departing & arriving taking passengers to & fro from Hong Kong Island. Plus, you can walk along the harbour front to see all the stars embedded in to the ground of past and present movie / film actors and actresses, for example Bruce Lee and Jet Li. Really lovely spot for a romantic walk with your partner / lover.

Spectacular. Spectacular view of the Hong Kong high rise buildings. The walk along the victoria harbour is worth an evening stroll. Just for few HK dollars, the Star Ferry can shunt you back and forth the piers. Also, don't miss the Symphony of Lights show at 8 PM. Though the narration happened to be in Cantonese on the day we visited, it is worth a visit.

A special place. Yes, this famous place is a little commercial, but it has got to be one of the most special city harbours in the world. While there are lots of fancy tours, it is possible to simply take a ferry between Kowloon and Central. The light show is simply spectacular.
Great views. Victoria Harbour has improved SSoooo much, new buildings great shopping centres in side, if you get there and the fog overs the Harbour, go shopping there's still lots to see.
On a good day. Some days the smog is so thick you can't see across it.
Iconic Harbour, can't visit HK and not see it.. Fantastic views of HK, take the starline ferry over to Kowloon. Great to walk along and see all the boats on the water.
Polluted and overrated.. There is a smell. It's crowded and the light show isn't exactly fantastic. Dont bother spending your money on any harbour cruise!

Pretty. The Harbour is very very very pretty no matter when you visit. It is cooler than other places during the day time. And the night hours, you could see pretty neon shows. However, it is always somehow crowded since it is so popular and sort of like the must see attractions. Strongly recommended!!!
Ferry and surrounding Areas. The hustle and bustle of the harbour is great viewing.

Excelent views at night!. Great to walk around on the harbour front at night. Avenue of the stars is interesting. Have your picture taken on the harbour front. One of the best pictures we own! The skyline is amazing! Generally safe. The Metro got us there easily!

Must see if visiting Hong Kong. The Victoria Harbour is a must see if visiting Hong Kong.The Symphony of Lights is absolutely spectacular.This show displays lights and lasers with background music. The lasers beam from the HSBC building, Bank of China, etc....The show begins at 8 pm and is always quite busy.Theres many ways to access the TST Victoria Harbour. If you are on the Hong Kong side you can take the ferry or you can always take the MTR.
a must visit. This was a dream realised visiting herefantastic place and a must at night for the evening light showcan't wait to return
fantastic. fantastic, the train is excellent a beautiful view of hong kong, a good mall and great prices would recommend to visit
must do. We go into Hong Kong often, we love Victora Harbor, crossing it is great fun, and the sky line is amazing.
Amazing. A trip (or two) on the Star Ferry for about HKD$2 is a must

One of the most beautiful harbour in the world. Never get tired for watching the boat, the building, It is spectacular in both day time and night time. Though there are more tourists now, you can still feel very comfortable and relaxing.
Very busy and interesting harbour... best on clear sunny days.. A good spot for a stroll - moreson on the Kowloon side. Take the ferry and enjoy the locals.

Excellent Harbour View. The place is spectacular and offers many photo op ideas with the famous Bruce Lee statue among others along the harbour. There are also restaurants and coffes shops that are just in the harbourline so you could relax and enjoy watching the attractive boats sailing in the river and the bright lights of Hong Kong's skyscrapers at night.
Beautiful. Hong Kong is such a spectacular city and this harbour is beautiful.

Getting totally destroyed. Victoria is naturally one of the most breath-taking harbours in the world, lined with eye-catching skyscrapers and mountains, this has to be on your To-Do list. BUT the HK government are destroying what little charm there was. They keep filling-in the Harbour with ugly roads and buildings, with ZERO consideration for the beauty and enjoyment of the people of Hong Kong or tourists. If you visit any city from Singapore to Sydney, the governments are beautifying the riverfronts and harbours with boardwalks, greenery, parks and restaurants. The HK government have just busied themselves making Victoria Harbour the worlds busiest construction site. Shame on them
never tire of seeing it. No matter how many times you cross it there is always something interesting to see either on the water or on shore.
Beautiful harbour view of Hong Kong. Picturesque view of Hong Kong's harbour view.Had coffee at a cafe along the harbourfront, while enjoying the whole atmosphere and vibe of Hong Kong.

Perfect Place to See Hong Kong's Skyline. Victoria Harbour must be on the list of everyone visiting HK. Better visited at night, the harbor is also the best vantage point to see HK's stunning skyscrapers. The lights from these megastructures provide a very picturesque foreground or background for photography. It is located in the south end of Nathan road, which only means it is accessible and places nearby are bustling with life. Located near the harbor are Avenue of Stars and Hong Kong Museum of Art. The Symphony of Lights also takes place in this place at 8:00PM daily.

All my experiences on the water were great!. I took several boat cruises during my stay, starting from both Kowloon and HKI sides, and enjoyed them all. Several nice promenade areas to enjoy even if you're not getting on a boat.
Victoria Harbor. Want to see the Hongkong skyline . . . ? perfect place, just few steps away in Nathan Road... a way to relax specially at night + dont miss the light display at 8 pm .. .
Interesting history.. Nice to take a trip around the harbor front, and to learn the history of HOng kong.

One of the most beautiful harbours. A very nice view at night. I went there around 8 in the evening, and the shopping malls near Virtoria Harbour where still open. At night there are quite a lot of people still walking there. This really is one of the top spots to see Hong Kong at night.
river cruise. did the river cruise in the evening. Good place to see the light show
cross the harbour in the ferry. uau! spend same time, just looking the view durant the day and special with the night lights, and of course cross in the old ferry
Just visit there. If you visit Kowloon you need to walk there just to see old part of city.

Night cruise. Weather was dull during the days, but we took the night harbour cruise and watched the Symphony of Light show at night, which was very impressive. Food was also very good and plentiful. Better to board at North Point, where our hotel happened to be and we were first group to board.
Lovely view. Lovely day or night. Perhaps not when it is misty.
Stunning!!!!!!!!!. Breathtaking to see such a beautiful city from the Harbour!
Busy harbour. Very colourful and the waterfront on the Kowloon side was very interesting and at night there was a spectacular laser light show
Beautiful Views. The nice views coupled with the warm drinks at Starbucks make the experience a memorable one. Do check the timing for Symphony of Lights.

Must see. Evenings are magical, avenue of the stars is a must see for anyone visiting Hong kong. They call in the million dollor view, apparently iy costs a million dollors to keep the lights on every night. :)
dash liverpool. unfortunately it was a little misty when we were there nonthe less a great view.
Most romantic and finest panoramic view in the world and not to be missed at night time. Most romantic and finest panoramic view in the world and not to be missed at night time
spectacular view. The view always fascinates me every time I visit HK. The harbor remains to be very clean and most of all, it represents what HK is all about

A changing view. Every time we visit Hong Kong, the view of the Harbour is changing. The reclamation of Wanchai is every changing the views. The Harbour is much cleaner, and as more ships and containerisation are being undertaken further up towards the NT, there is not so much activity near Kennedy Town and Kowloon - Only the Cruise Liners coming in and out. Not many sanpans around these days. Many changes in Aberdeen and the area by the Excelcior Hotel where you used to see the sanpans in the Typhoon shelter
Take the Star Ferry. The best way to get a true feel for Victoria harbor is to take the Star ferry across the harbor.

Magnificent Sight. From a tourist perspective, Victoria Harbour must be one of the finest harbours in the world. There was always something to see, from the Star Ferry, zig zagging across to HK island, the magnificent sky line, particularly at night, the cruise liners coming and going and the local transport going about their daily routine.
A must see.... The lights show at 8pm was an amazing experience... Hearing the music and seeing the lights on the buildings change in tune and reflect against the river is a one of a kind experience.
Take the Star Ferry for a great view. This is definitely one of the most scenic harbours in the world. Take a Junk ride or the star ferry for the best view.

Orderly and accomodating. There was an art exhibit at the harbor when we arrived and things were quite accommodating. Things were quite orderly and neat and toilets OK but not so clean compared to Star Ferry port.
Easy access to the rest of the island. I liked the way it was easy and fast to cruise and access another part of the Island. Quite cheap, too. Makes it an exotic transport.

Lovely area. Great to stroll around and to watch live go by.
Nice area, lots to do and see. Take the boat to the other side and enjoy the sky line.
The evening harbour cruise - well worth it. Good way of spending an evening - the bright lights and the laser show: brilliant! Sinatra got it right in his song "Downtown"...
Great views.. Excellent views especially from the Kowloon side. Be sure to catch the light show, although the music is a little 80's, and a very cheap boat tour HK$3 on the Star Ferry.
Aqua Harbor Lights Tour. We took the night Aqua Harbor lights tour. Amazing!

One of my favorite things in HK. One thing a lot of people don't know about HK: All the buildings in "Central" are connected through covered walkways. Use these to get around. You also get better pictures from these walkways.

Lively views. Its a long and busy place and jampacked with all shapes of ships the odd chinese junk boat and pleasure boats not to mention more passenger ferries than you can count,all cruising along and criss crossing each other on the harbour with a brilliant city boundary on both sides. The harbour is not to be missed.
Best thing about HK. The sights, sounds and the sheer experience is rivalled by only the greatest such as the Sydney harbour, the Venice grand river etc. Must see!

buzzing harbour with great views from most hotels. We loved watching the hustle and bustle of the city...there are islands all over the place ....the only disappointment is the smog it never seems to lift and we were there a week
What's not to like?. It's all good - looking at it - riding a boat in it. Nothing bad to say about this.
Excellent city life by the harbour. Lots of thing to do, eating, shopping all major malls and brands, sight seeing and symphony of lights at night.

Great skyline with laser light display. My girlfriend & I booked a night tour with Able Tours. It started with a cruise to Lamma Island with seafood dinner which was fantastic. After that we took a night cruise from the island back to the harbour. At about 8pm, the laser lights came on. It was a great experience as we stood at the front of the boat to enjoy unblocked view of the skyline. Do make it a point to take a night cruise if you visit Hong Kong. Tip: the water can be choppy and if you are prone to motion sickness, take precaution before you start the ride.

How can you not go to the Harbour?. Although the cloud cover was there for 3 days, my understanding is that the weather is always like that.....so, we couldn't see a beautiful sunset on the water, but it was still a busy, fun place to go.

Well laid out. I got to see it at night on the ferry ride around the harbour. Very beautiful and with a lot of history around it. The skyline surrounding the harbour front is very impressive. Go armed with a good camera if possible as there are very many photographic opportunities.
wonderful view. about as good as it gets. talking the harbor cruise is an excellent way to see hong kong. and the star ferries are a good way to get around. nothing like it in the world.
Star ferry. No trip to Hong kong can miss out the star ferry it is only 2.5HK dollars and sadly the harbour is getting smaller with the amount of building work going on.
Walk and Enjoy. This one is like walking endlessly but you'll not even going to notice it as the weather is so fine so with the scenery.
Excellent View. You definitely seen this view from many movie but when you seen it before you. You can't stop from taking out the camera to snap one..

beautiful hong kong. Beautiful and busy--took sampan ride and watched the light show at night. The buildings on both sides were beautiful at night and also the daytime-just great! star ferry ride was great and free since I am 65---noody told me in all of those brochures. would hope the rest of my family gets a chance to go there. singapore airlines was great!

Iconic skyline, enhanced by the light show. Really, the Victoria Harbour speaks for itself. Best enjoyed with a bottle of wine on top of the IFC, or looking out from the viewing platforms on TST side.

Bustling. I love Victoria Harbour because of the many ships that are seen anchored.. The Star Ferry is fun and the hustle and bustle is
exciting.

What a great view. Always something happening.. The harbour is fantastic and a key point in Hong Kong. The light show was great. What an amazing view across to Central it is at night. Took the Star Ferry across and the night tour they offer. Make sure you get out onto the harbour in Hong Kong.

Beautiful in daytime but amazing at night. Every evening at 8pm there is a beautiful light show...all the high rise buildings around the harbor are lit up with different color lights that flash across the sky to music.
Overcrowded and incredibly boring. Come here if you love crowds. Other than the well coordinated lightshow there really isn't that much here
Light Show. We took a cruise on the harbour to view the light show, this is well worth doing, an amazing sight.
just a place to sit down and rest your legs. What's cool about this place is only the Symphony of Light attraction at night and view of some old boats crossing over the river.
Harbour cruise! Fun!. Dinner cruise with laser show. Fun, cool and great opportunity to meet people.
Romantic Hong Kong. Romantic and excellent view to see HK - both day and night!
Impressive big city skyline. Monday mornings are generally best for photos due to reduced pollution haze.

Best seen at night. It is the best at night, especially if you watch the light show that runs everyday at 8pm. Watching it from the Avenue of Stars (TST station and follow the signs) is best from Kowloon side. Also great is Star Ferry or a boat cruise of some sort.
Amazing. Even better then all the pictures. Althugh I am biased being from Sydney, this is easily the second most beautiful harbour in the world.
Fabulous. Awesome,what,s not to like about this iconic skyline!
Unforgettable!. Unforgettable day and night. This is the signature of Hong Kong. Try on the Star ferry, use the lower cabin for some old days fun!
The Christmas lights are amazing. So beautiful to walk along the harbor in Kowloon at night looking back at Hong Kong. Lifetime memory.
Great to see. Great to cross this off the list of things to see. Enjoyed the sights of a great city.
Awesome.... Cool but very crowded. The view at day and night is awesome! It would be a great place if it's less crowded and non-smoking.

Must See if in HK. You have to make the effort to see Victoria Harbour. It is breathtaking. Make sure it dosen't rain the same day! Take the bus going up for scenery and the tram going down. A beautiful view of HK!

Busy waterway. Like a busy freeway in my home state of California, Victoria Harbour one of most traffic congested waterways you'll see. Enjoy the wonderful views of Hong Kong from your hotel room or on the Star Ferry.

Most beautiful skyline in the world, at night. nothing compares to it when night falls. beats new york, sydney, or any other large city on the sea. during the day, though, venice is better (and yes, venice HAS a skyline...).

Symphony of Music, simply stunning for sure. An hour-long anticipation of what I'd heard was a 'must see'' in Hong Kong was worth the wait - gobsmacking attraction. A highlight on Victoria Harbour .... For Sure.Where in the world can you get such a stunning experience for free? There is obviously somewhere else but I ‘m still to find it!I missed this extravaganza on my first visit to Hong Kong in January so I’d made up my mind that on my return stopover, in February, I’d make it a ‘’must see’’. I strolled along Victoria Harbour as the light was fading, saw a modern-day reconstruction of an old Chinese Junk ship taking a huge party of business people out for a sail on this stunning harbour which is surrounded by massive, interesting shaped sky-scrapers.This is a good time to visit the harbour because you get daylight, then twilight leading into darkness so you see the harbour in many different roles, activities and photo opportunities.Eating was high on my agenda, there was not as many eateries/pub/cafes along here as I expected but I did find a light snack place so sat and watched the pedestrians and the shipping/tourist boats go by. This was really satisfying after a long day roaming around and touring the interesting/vibrant things Hong Kong has to offer.Victoria Harbour is huge but to get the best out of it, go to the waterfront, near the bus depot, there is a board-walk type of access-way, it’s long and holds lots of your interest as you walk along: there’s a movie theme in statues for you to take your photo by, a well set out garden, unusual craft and lots of ferries moving between both sides of the sea.A bonus for me was a cruise ship coming up the harbour, fully lit up in all its glory. Wow, was it a real treat; one of those travel moments when you realise you just cannot plan every detail which pleases you. Unexpected moments can be so memorable. What a thrill this was.Victoria Harbour is stunning no matter which side of the water you view it – especially at night.I’d heard lots about the Symphony of Lights, organised and presented by the Hong Kong Tourism Board but nothing could prepare me for the wonder I experienced for 20 mins, from 8 o’clock that February night.On our side, many thousands had gathered and above the music their shrieks of delight just added to the magic.Choreographed to the music, massive buildings had light shows emblazoned on them, lazer beams struck out across the harbour and special lighting sequences were shot onto massive buildings, all along the harbour-side.Victoria harbour is a picture, whether you see it in daytime or night, from the waterfront or high above on Victoria Peak, get the most out of this amazing point on our globe – go soon and experience the huge harbour for yourself. It is free, it is amazing, it is well worth your time when staying in Hong Kong.
Wonderful. A beautiful harbour, especially when not misty. Lots going on and a good focus for activities
My great memory. We like it here but where we were here it's so smoky we could not get any good shots but everthing was good.
Busy but cool. Not much to say about Vic-har, but the water was dirty and an awesome skyline! You definatley have to ride the ferry across.

one glimpse of the harbour makes the whole world kin. There is ne'er known to a be a harbour more magical, serene, retrograde, beautiful nor romantic than Victoria Harbour.It makes Sydney Harbour seem like Boston Harbour. Swillish.
Laser Show boat trip. Great show wonderful way to see Honk Kong skyline at night
Part of a 1/2 day tour. Sangpan tour and saw how the locals live, from the traditional to the modern
(star farry)Victoria horbour. the view from the peak is amazing, one can view hong kong from there and the view at nite is great
real hong kong. lights make the harbour a real hong kong. Clouded with tourist.strong wind will make one feel relax there.

Take a tour. The harbour is central to life in Kowloon and Hong Kong Island and as a tourist, it is well worth taking a harbour boat tour to get a view from the water. The Star Ferry is a must, not only to get from one side of the harbour to the other, but also for the experience. It is a good idea to buy an Octopus card which you can use on buses, MTR trains and the ferry.

Worth taking time to walk here and see light show. Check out the stars for all your favorite Hong Kong actors (think Jackie Chan, Bruce Lee and others). Enjoy great views of Hong Kong proper. And stick around for the evening light show with accompanying music.
Fantastic. The laser show is great. You dont wanna miss that in Hong Kong
Great light show. One of the places to visit, whilst staying in HK. The light show at the peir is great. There are plenty of museum and sights.

See the Sunset or Night Viewof Hong Kong from the Harbour. To see the sunset in the late afternoon from the harbour you will catch up another romantic view of between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, and the feeling.
The light show is too far to be enjoyed. It is actually a good light show but unfortunately located too far from victoria harbour. Hence cannot really enjoy the show

Didn't have the best day. Victoria Harbour was worth the trip. Unfortunately the day I went up it was foggy. This tends to be the case in March so I knew this could be the case. It was still worth it!
nice views a lot going on. busy area, lots of boats and ferries, nice to weatch all thats going on there, multi cultural area

Iconic - A Must See. No other harbour like it in the world save for maybe Sydney's although I think Hong Kong's shades it for the unique mix of mountain, sea and buildings. Great place for a stroll in the morning or evening but especially when the weather is cool. Can get rather hazy once the sun's up and also very crowded at night when the laser light show.
Light Display on the Harbour. 2 hour ferry tour with drinks included good views and value
Too many tourists. But beautiful harbor, loved urge ferries, avenue of stars was annoying, tourists in packs standing in the middle of the promenade, pain in the....
It's what Hong Kong is!. It should not be missed at least for a quick stroll!!! A few snapshots are worth the time.
Take a boat ride. After the boat ride...take a stroll...U will love it
Good view, on a nice day. Not much more than the view. Best seen from the Star Ferry. Too bad about the smog.

Relaxing and short ferry cruise across the Victoria Harbour. Even as a local resident, I enjoy taking the Star Ferry across the Victoria Harbour regularly. The speed is not fast so the breeze is gentle and you can enjoy the view on both sides of the harbour at a relaxing pace. It is relaxing, just a short 10-min ride, and very affordable (HK$ 2.5 on weekday, about US$0.3).
nice scenenic. a good place for chilling out all night. the weather is so clear so we can see the high sky building in other side.

You are going to go there, for sure. While there, take your time, walk around, cruise the harbour and watch the laser show (which is nice but doesn't worth waiting too long for). There is a starbucks facing the harbor if you can get a seat for the show.

Great View - Pathetic Light Show. Booked the Harbour cruise through our hotel. Boat was prompt in picking up passengers from the pier. The Hong Kong skyline is pretty spectacular from both sides, the light show is non-existent. Sure, the buildings light up in what looks like it should be a sequence to music playing on the boat, but all in all, very average laser show. Go in the evening with a good camera for great pics.

You can't miss it!. Victoria harbour is a place you can't miss when you are in Hong Kong. The view is breathtaking, especially at night, when the lights are on, it looks magical. If the day is not clear however, it might not look so appealing, but on a clear day, a walk on the avenue of stars, a ferry cruise, of a visit at the Peak is the best way to enjoy the magnificent views it offers!
Breathless view of the island. Beautiful view that helps you appreciate the depth and magnificence of the city.

Incredible place to visit. Victoria Harbour is one of the cooler places on earth. The Star Ferry is the best way to fully experience it. A one way trip on the ferry is about 40 cents USD, so it should be in any one's budget. I love being able to see Hong Kong Island and Kowloon from the middle, and also seeing the activity on all sides.
Great laser show !. Love the Star Ferry - cheap as chips and the 8pm laser show is a must.

Shopping fantasia. It's almost like your in New York , full of high end shopping and restaurants, but walk a little further in, and you hit the real Hong Kong with all it's culture. And you still feel safe being there.

Amazing view of Hk's skyline. Go at night to catch the light show. The view of the skyline is so picturesque. Take tons of pictures then walk down the avenue of the stars. Yes- totally touristy, but it's one of those places you have to go to when you're in HK.
Captures Hong Kong. Although not what I expected Victoria Harbour still has great views. The ferry service was VERY cheap and a great experience

A Hong Kong Icon. You must not miss Victoria Harbour when in HK. By day or night it is a true icon - a busy harbour (getting smaller each year with land reclamations) that is best appreciated on a Star Ferry trip, the promenade at Tsim Sha Tsui or from the new Sky 100 lookout. It is a magnificent photo opportunity (especially at night) and best of all it is free.
harbour boat ride. lots to see only down side Hongkong has more smog than 8 years ago when we were last there

Possibly the world's greatest harbour. I fell in love with Victoria Harbour when I was in Hong Kong, spending many hours walking on either side of it, along the Avenue of the Stars etc.This is arguably the world's greatest sea harbour and when you are there in person to experience the buzz of the fishermen, the Star Ferry, the TurboJet boats to Macau etc. you'll know why.There is nothing like seeing the Hong Kong skyline from a boat while cruising around Victoria Harbour.One of my all time favourite travel memories!Very highly recommended.
Truly a postcard. Being in HK you can't miss the Victoria Harbour and it is hands down is just stunning place either during the day or night.
Water is hard to walk on. Its got some great history and if you are up for an early morning stroll its the place to start
Great place to hang out. Lots of shops around the harbour and lots of activity with the ferries heading back and forth to Kowloon.

Best place to view Symphony of Lights. The harbour area near the clock tower and the Star Ferry Terminal is one of the best places to view the lights/lazer show. Music is piped for the show which adds to the effect. Unfortunately, for us the fog was very heavy, but that sort of added something to the show. The Ocean Terminal shopping mall is also quite good for wandering the shops and getting something to eat. It's an easy walk down from the Nathan Rd exits of the MTR at Tsim Shar Tsui.
Fantastic views!. I'd recommend Aqua Luna cruise at dusk... on a clear night!
GREAT. I liked everything about it ... the views from it are not to be believed. You have to be there to get it!
Best viewed from Kowloon Side. Take a trip on the star ferry at 7pm and then go for a drink at One Canton Rd, to see the best of the Harbour

Crab in wine sauce at its best. Victoria City at Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay. Better than average Cantonese. Steamed fish and Crab in wine sauce are of good standard. Manager Martin recommends good dishes.
One hour Star Ferry harbour tour. Great way to get a waterfront aspect of both Hong Kong and Kowloon.
Ok but not up to the hype. It was ok. Overrun with people and not that much to do

Great views - a must-see if you're in Hong Kong. Go see Victoria Harbour up from the Peak. There are several viewing stations that you can go to if you take the tram up (it is automatically included in your ticket). However, I would recommend walking down the Peak instead of taking the tram down.

loved the river cruise. the harbour is a great point to just watch the cruiseships going in and out and lots of junks to watch cruising down the river go early or late to sit along the river front and watch the boats in the harbour
One of the most beautiful harbours in the world!. Take the Star Ferry across anytime (day or night) and just enjoy the breathtaking skyline of Hong Kong!

One of the great cityscapes of the world. Not much more to be said really - it is one of the great cityscapes... changing its mood with the weather. I find it can be quite haunting in a deep mist, while sparkling in the sunshine.
spectacular views in well-planned public space. Art Museum and concert halls make the most of their waterfront setting. Two level pedestrian park allows for fabulous strolling.
Pollution!. There seems to be a layer of yellow-brown mist hanging over the harbour - a shame because it marred what would probably have been a stunning view.
The raison d'être for Hong Kong's existence.. The Harbour is why Hong Kong exists. Take the Star Ferry across the Harbour, not one of the high speed ferries.

Not to be missed, fantastic view of HK island. The view from Kowloon over the island might be a cliche, but it is wonderful. Some traditional sampas against a backdrop of high buildings. You watch the boats and ferries sail, as you contemplate all the ecclectic structures. Old buildings next to tall new ones, It is worth waiting for all the lights from the different building to lit, and take photos of the same scenery as the lights start lighting the bay with different colours. Awesome.

Top site to see in Hong Kong. If you limit yourself to one place in Hong Kong, this would be it. Star ferry ride, Avenue of the Stars, TST's shopping, museums and Hong Kong island's view and light show must be seen from the Kowloon side, while IFC, Central's shopping and Hong Kong Park can be experienced from the Hong Kong island side. With a cool breeze always running and lots to see and eat, you can easily spend half to a full day here.

One of the best cityscapes in the world. One of the best things about HK, especially on the Kowloon side. The promenade between the Star Ferry Pier and Avenue of the Stars gives the best views of Central HK numerous high rises. At night the free light show at 8pm is spectacular and it's free. Hope that the weather is clear and you can see all the way up to the Peak during the day.Take a few hours out to tune out and just enjoy the panoramic view.
Lots of energy. Star ferry, pro invade and ship traffic are a great relax in busy busy city

A Must for All. Star Ferry, a ride over Victoria Harbour is scenic. It is touristy but well worth it. And the cost is very reasonable. If you begin your trip on the Hong Kong Island side, beware of hawkers who want to sell you electronics, tailored clothing, etc. I do not advise purchasing cameras and watches on the Kowloon side - it's just a scam. Buy cameras in your home country where they can be serviced! I've lived in Hong Kong 18 years and you can get much better prices at the large wholesale shops in the U.S. if that's where're you from.

This is HK. From Kowloon, just along from the ferry terminal, views of the harbour & HK island are great. There's a sound and light show in the evenings - go for this once, but not twice as it's crowded. Ride the ferries often!
A lovely evening walk to the Harbour. If you have done with your shopping and need something to relax you can try this walking around Victoria Harbour.
misty. it was ver misty and foggy...couldnt appreciate the harbour that much...
Excellent Location. Being able to see the buildings on the Business side when it wasn't misty

Must-see in Hong Kong. The most famous harbour in Hong Kong. Views from either Kowloon side or Hong Kong side are great. Or maybe go to the Peak first, and then get the view from Hong Kong side to see the whole Victoria Harbour. Another cheapest way to view the Victoria Harbour is by ferry. A few minutes from Central/ Wanchai of Hong Kong to Tsim Sha Tsui is great. I must say both day or night view at Victoria Harbour are excellent.
Beautiful Place. Its a beautiful place to walk at night. Since I am here around the beginning of March, the weather is great for evening walks.
Pollution. You can smelling something along the seashore.....

Scenic View of Hong Kong Island... There is a light show (Symphony of Lights) which happens at 8 pm daily, with English narration occurring on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays (the rest of the days narrations are done in Cantonese). The narration mainly describes which companies (buildings) are taking part in the light show, so it's not a big deal if one does not understand Cantonese. You can disembark at the Tsim Tsa Shui MTR Station and head to the Avenue of Stars to watch the light show.When we were there it's quite foggy. Hence some parts of the light show are not that visible. Would imagine that the light show and view will be much nicer with all the fog cleared up.

Awesome. Everything is good about it. The sights of skyscrapers in the backdrop, the crystal green water, the occassional horn from the passing ships, its beautiful. In the evening, she transforms herself into a bride. Decked with lights, music, the breeze, its romantic!

good spot for photos. this is a nice spot for having your picture taken with the famous skyline of hongkong in the background. this is also where the avenue of stars is located so if you are a fan of chinese movies, this is the place to go. the symphony of lights, a light and sound show, starts at 8 p.m. so make sure you come early so you can get a good spot.

Ok. Wasn't as great as I'd imagined it to be - very crowded and pretty confusing as well. But then again, that may have been because we went around Chinese New Year - but we didn't like it too much, either way.
Light Show at 9pm. Make sure to be on the Kowloon side for a great light show with music and narration.

loved it!. every night at 8pm (better check again, when u are there) victoria habour has a lasershow. its really nice! check it out.
they have laser light and use addistional lightning.
the sound or music could be better ajusted to the lasers but its a cool event anyhow. at best go there around 7pm so you get a better seat!

Still the best sight in HongKong!!!. As always, Victoria Harbour never ceases to amaze me everytime i go there. The HK government always exerts effort to mAke this place inviting and nice to stay and spend time. When we went there the lights and sound show pushed through despite of the thick fog, there were plenty of tourist but everybody had a place to sit on, the place was clean and well kept, water at the harbour was clean, air was chilly but fresh always giving us a wonderful time to just relax and admire the beautiful scenery of the hongkong side. Still, this is my favorite place to hang out in Hongkong!!!
Enjoyed our walk there!. Love strolling at Victoria Harbour at night. I love love love the Symphony of Lights. Will make it a point to drop by at Victoria Harbour everytime I visit Hong Kong.

Amazing. It was such an amazing thing to see - the harbour and the ferries that go by. There's a viewing deck beside Avenue of the Stars and where Acqua Luna docks where you can sit and watch the Symphony of Lights show. If you need to go to a comfort room, they have one right behind the statue of a female holding a torch at Avenue of the Stars or to the far end which is at Star Ferry docking area. Not sure if there are other comfort rooms in between, but these are only two that I have noticed.
Great. View is great, things to do are plenty. Ferries and buildings good but symphony of lights disappointing

One of the world's most beautiful harbor and scenery. The Victoria harbor, seen from Kowloon side, must be one of those sceneries that evoke a thousand words, and make lovely memories for any tourists. Do make a point to see it in day time and night time (with an 8pm symphony by night free show) Your cameras will be put to test to see how well it captures the spectacular scenery. Welcome to the city of lights, welcome to HK!
Wonderful. Probably one of the world's most amazing harbours. Visit "The Symphony of Lights" in the evening. Truly spectacular!
Great place to walk around. Great during the evening to see the lazer light show which is free.
Hoarbour. I love the water and seeing it from high up in a hotel as well as at the waters edge is great as it is a working harbour
A must !. Only the first step you have arrived the harbour, you will love it!
Most spectaular urban view in the world. The Star Ferry ride costs practically nothing - it's even free if you're over 65 and the view is stunning.
The place Hong Kong was born. This is Hong Kong! You could sail, take star ferry, watch the view! a must visit
Iconic. The view across the harbour is great, especially at night when everything is lit up. Worth taking a trip on the Star Ferry to enjoy it
NIGHT TIME LIGHTS. go round the harbour at night, it should be one of the 8 wonders of the world

Great day or night. Although the weather wasn't always cooperating, I've been the harbour a few times in only a few days - even taking breakfast up to the viewing deck one morning. One can easily sit there for hours.
Best place to be at night. amazing night view and lazer show makes it breath taking.
Absolutely Fantastic view. It is a wonderful view of the whole area and would recommend the trip to view

Must see. One of the worlds great cities, and arguably the worlds greatest harbour. Only two cities have the ability to take my breath away - this, and New York. Awesome. Don't forget to wait for the nightly light show...
Excellent and magnificient. Victoria Harbour is one of the busiest harbours in the world. Perfect view in the night!

so cool, nice place for picture taking!. Must visit the place at night for greater view and feel the beauty of Hongkong.It is home to most of the ports of Hong Kong, making Hong Kong one of the world's busiest ports. The harbour bustles day and night with all manner of watercraft – from the historic Star Ferries to cruise liners, cargo ships, and wooden fishing vessels.
Avenue of Stars is a Must See. The laser light show across the harbour should be viewed from both sides if you have the time.

This is Hong Kong's major tourist attraction!. Long famous for its spectacular views, the harbour is a major tourist attraction of Hong Kong. and its promenades are popular gathering places for tourists and residents.
Did the night tour and then dinner at the Jumbo Floating restaurant. The most awesome view of the Hong Kong skyline at night !
Still one of the best attractions in Hong Kong. Even though HK keeps filling in their harbour, the vistas here, especially at night, are amazing. Go!
A nice stroll. Relaxed, get a picture from the stall sellers, a few picture opportunities, walked here easily from The Park Hotel, tsim tsa tsui.
Go on the free Star Ferries for the best photo shoots. Stay in the evening for the amazing Laser Light Show at 20.00 every night

If in Hong Kong for short visit...this is must see. Impressive views of Hong Kong...although a bit touristy. Try to take a walk in the park behind the Peak observatory to get away from the crowds at sunset.
What a setting to build a city around. Photo opportunities everywhere. What an amazing location
superb setting. one of the best views in the world must be crossing the harbour on a ferry

Gorgeous Harbor. Coming from the US, I kept trying to get up waaaayy to early in the morning. What better way to greet the morning than with a stroll down the harbor? The great misty morning full of salt air and chugging ferries will stay with me forever.
Just spectacular. A fascinating place and a must for any visitor. Take the Star Ferry to go across. At HK$ 3 (weekends) still the cheapest tour to be taken.
harbour night show. light show at night is good attraction and it cost nothing
Victoria Harbour. This was a nice day out, we walked along the Avenue of Stars and took lots of nice photos, was a beautiful day also. Lots of things to see.

A must in Hong Kong. The iconic harbour in Hong Kong is an absolute must see. World famous it has to be one of the worlds must stunning views with its glittering, souring sky's rappers contrasting with the ancient Chinese junks and the famous star ferry. Don't miss the spectacular 8.00pm music and light show!

Don't miss the light show at night. Watching the ferries and boats in the harbor is an experience in itself. Snatch a seat at a harbor restaurant and enjoy. Don't miss the nightly light show from the Avenue of the Stars at 8 pm.
Great views. Especially from the kowloon side. You get a good view of the city skyline

Whatever time of day, Victoria Harbour is beautiful. Whether you are riding on a star ferry, walking along the Promenade, sitting with a coffee at Starbucks or gazing upon it from The Peak, Victoria Harbour is always beautiful to watch night or day. Victoria Harbour is truly the lifeblood of Hong Kong.
Outstanding views of the city. Star Ferry inexpensive and convenient. Harbour tour okay.
Just around the corner!. An easy five to ten minute walk from the hotel through beautiful flower-decked promenades with an amazing laser show at around 8pm.
A beautiful harbour. We always enjoy taking the Star ferry across the harbour.
Million dollar view. Go up the Peak or Sky 100 or take a ferry to Central to enjoy the spectacular view of Victoria Harbour!

Great night view. I like this place for its fantastic night view, but I must say it is always crowded. When there is an event, it is impossible to get around in this area.
Tips: if you come from the Hong Kong island, take the ferry to get to the harbor. Subway is faster, but it is much easier with the ferry.
The best thing to do in Hong Kong. Great experience going up with the train and the views are spectacular
Great view. It is good to just spend some time along the harbour. The view is spectular, esp at night. The light show at 8pm was just average, it is okay if your couldnt make it.

The SOL show was OK (not great). Maybe I was just expecting too much since I only managed to catch the show on my 3rd Hong Kong trip.
However, the row of lighted buildings even without the lights show is a good backdrop for photos!

Terrific Skyline. Just to enjoy looking across the harbour from Kowloon during the evening was a bit like watching a fireworks display.
Also ,seeing the many and various kinds of ship ,from liners to a Chinese junk helped to emphasise this is where east meets west!
Must See.. Always a great view although with recent developments the harbour is getting smaller! Make sure you view the harbour and Central at night from the Kowloon side.

The skyline by night. The HK and Kowloon skylines by night are pretty impressive. Add to that the nightly 'Symphony of Lights' show at 8pm and it's worth seeing. I did it by taking a Star Ferry harbor tour for HK$126. Takes an hour.

Great show dependant on weather and good souvenirs. We used the Star ferry to cross to Hong Kong Island and watched the Symphony of Lights show at 8pm on a Tuesday night. The weather was foggy and the show and music was a little cheesy but overall we enjoyed it, especially towards the end as it go more dramatic. It's worth it to visit the little souvenir store and just buy something. A lot of the stuff was quite cute and decently priced. I still regret I did not buy anything, there was too much to choose from. Also there is a Philharmonic Orchestra Hall nearby, this is also worth visiting, even if for the souvenirs of miniature musical instruments.

Catch it before it disappears. I don't want the Harbour to think I am insulting it. My low rating is aimed at the bureaucrats and others who would like nothing more than to fill it in altogether. Given that land reclamation started almost as soon as the British colonised Hong Kong in the 1840s--and with good reason, there was no flat land--it startles visitors to see where the original waterfront was, under the Court of Final Appeal Building, compared to where it is now. For some years we have been able to stand on the bridge linking Central to the Star ferry and watch various stages of reclamation, dredging, filling-in, building, and so on. What's evident is that the common person has very little place in this scenario. Ocean Terminal can still handle some cruise ships, but not the biggest ones. At an average depth of only 40', the days of Queen this-and-that sailing through are over, and the red-sailed junks are also gone. The view of the harbour from Victoria Peak remains one of the world's greatest harbour views, assuming it can be seen through (variously) clouds, fog, or air pollution. A Cross-Harbour swimming race was just re-introduced after being suspended in 1979 due to pollution, and we did not hear of anyone getting sick after the recent event. That is very good news indeed, if it's true. So my rating does not reflect the harbour itself, which has always been one of Hong Kong's strongest visual selling points, as it does the stresses and changes it is being subjected to.

Ideal way to see both Hong Kong and Kowloon. Took the Star ferry tour and found it very interesting. You can purchase a half day ticket which allows you to travel on any of the ferries between 1100 and 1700.

Perhaps the World’s Finest. We live in Hong Kong and naturally have bias towards Victoria Harbor. However, having visited most of the world’s famous harbors, we have come to believe that the Victoria Harbor in Hong Kong is the worlds finest. This is due to a number of reasons. First, Victoria Harbor boosts the Hong Kong skyline which is one of the world's truly remarkable skylines, only rivaled by that of the NYC. Second, there are several famous locations by which you can view and enjoy your time on Victoria Harbor and to top this off, each year, Victoria hosts one of the world’s greatest, 23-minute fireworks displays each Chinese New Year. This is why we feel that Victoria Harbor can arguably stake claim to be the world’s best. So where should you go to see Victoria Harbour? Taking a harbour cruise or just making a single crossing is a favourite way to visit Victoria Harbour and there is no better way to do this then by taking a ride on the historic and iconic Star Ferry which ferries passengers between TST (Kowloon) and Central (HK Island) and Wan Chai (HK Island) for the pocket change price of HK$2.50 (US$0.32) per adult, HK$1.50 (US$0.19) per child. We often say, that for a family of four, this may be the best US$1.00 value for money attraction you will ever find. In addition to cruising the harbour with the Star Ferry, there is another popular junk boat, called the Aqua Luna, which plies the waters of Victoria Harbour. This is a more atmospheric (and pricey) means for taking to the water. Our second favorite place to view the harbor is from the world famous Victoria Peak on HK Island. This is the first of our two Classic Hong Kong postcard locations. From this vantage point, visitors can appreciate the vast size of the harbor while admiring its formation, water traffic and beauty. Best pictures are made on clear sky days with the sun at your back or pretty much every night when the skyline is lit up against the darkness of night. Traditionally, the favorite means for visiting Victoria Peak is by taking the equally famous and historically important Peak Tram found at the Peak Tram Terminus in the Central District of Hong Kong Island. A relatively new and promising attraction that offers cloud level views of Victoria Harbor is the Sky 100 Observation platform on the 100th floor of the ICC building in Tsim Sha Tsui. Like the Empire State Building and Rockefeller Centre in NYC, Hong Kong now has a place to view Victoria Harbour and the Hong Kong Skyline from way up in the skies. Our third favorite location for viewing Victoria Harbor is ground level on the Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) Promenade on the Kowloon side. This is another classic postcard location for your picture taking interests, especially at night time with the Hong Kong Skyline is let up and reflecting off the surface of the harbor. This is also the best place, along with the Avenue of Stars, which is a popular area on the TST Promenade, to be when it’s the Chinese New Year fireworks display is taking place. Another popular activity is to watch the Symphony of Lights laser show that takes place at 8pm each night on Victoria Harbor. From the Ave. of Stars, you can hear a program that accompanies the laser show. Bars, Food and ‘High Tea’ with Views of Victoria Harbor?From Kowloon, you can also enjoy excellent views of the Victoria Harbor from several bars on high floors; such as the popular Aqua Bar (30/fl of Peking One Road) Sky bar (118th/fl) at the International Commerce Center (ICC). Other popular Kowloon based viewing areas include Felix Bar at the famous Peninsula Hotel as well as the lobby and restaurants at the Intercontinental Hotel and the Peking Garden Restaurant in the Star House, across from the Star Ferry Pier. As a helpful hint, if dining at Peking Garden, if you are a large (5+ party) and ask for a window view table when you make reservations, they usually oblige.Another popular activity that can be done near Victoria Harbor is taking traditional ‘Afternoon High Tea’. First this can be done at the iconic Peninsula Hotel Lobby, just across the street from the TST Promenade on Victoria Harbor. This is a very popular attraction for visitors and HK residents alike however it doesn’t come cheap. An alternative is the Lobby Lounge at the Intercontinental Hotel with direct views of the harbour, an outstanding location for High Tea if the weather is nice and many feel the ‘High Tea’ experience here is even better. For coffee drinkers, there is an Starbucks with two levels of outdoor seating on the TST promenade offering views of the harbor. This location is surprisingly quite in the morning but can be quite busy in the afternoon and evening when the harbor laser show, symphony of lights is about to start. What can I do near Victoria Harbor? Along the TST Promenade and Avenue of Stars there are quite a few additional attractions you might be interested in seeing. These include the Bruce Lee Statue and the historic Clock Tower. On the museum and cultural front you can visit the Hong Kong Space Museum as well as the Hong Kong Cultural Centre for performancesAlso, there is quality shopping all around the Victoria Harbor. On the Kowloon side, the high end 1881 Heritage shopping mall is directly across Salisbury Rd. near the Peninsula. At the end of the TST promenade near the Star Ferry Pier, you will Hong Kong's largest shopping mall in Hong Kong called Harbor City. Also, on the Hong Kong side, the IFC Shopping Mall is located five minutes walk from the Star Ferry (Central) pier. Lastly, perhaps the best place to get tourist information about Hong Kong can be found at the Star Ferry Pier on the TST side of Victoria Harbour. Here you can load up on maps, brochures and information or talk to tourism board representatives, fluent in English, Cantonese and Mandarin about anything you want related to visiting Hong Kong.

Hands down, the best HK view!. This should top your list of a must-see in HK. The 360 views at the top are amazing! We lucked out and it was clear when we visited but I hear that the fog can really ruin the experience if you choose a bad time. Check the weather before you go up!
Nice view. NIce view, especially from Sky100. Was also able to ride the ferry going to Hong Kong Island and Macau.
One of the best. We were very impressed with the views at night and the Chinese New Year firework display was a spectacular 25 minutes long.

great nighttime boat tour. the boat tour at night is spectacular - definitely worthwhile!

Just a harbour. It's ok, bit boring though overall I thought. Not really much to do down there, but great place to see the sun rise.

Well worth it whatever the weather.. It will not fail to please and soothe you.Because it is at night it is not dependant upon Sun (H K was cloudy when we were there in Jan 2012).Even if it is raining lightly and it was, we sat in a sheltered part of the boat and the light Show "Called Symphony of Lights Tour" takes place between 8 - 8.30 pm we were still OK because the symphony of lights is timed to represent the music playing on the boat. It is a light sabre show off various buildings on hong kong island. The 1.5 cruise runs an open bar and most travel agents can book it. If you are running out of money go to the harbour walk running north east from The Kowloon terminal star ferry but you will not get the syncopated music, the drink and the swaying action of the boat. You can also see this from the Peak but not sure if the tram runs that late. However at the Peak you are behind the buildings and the effect is not as good. When you come back at 9.30 you can go from Pier 9 to the adjoining Star Ferry cruise just to cross there and back for fun by night. However the pick up for the cruise proper is 7.30pm at Hong Kong Island Pier 9 (be prompt) and 7.45 on the Kowloon side not near the star ferry so check details of pick up on the internet. Return to Kowloon side for disembarkation at 8.45pm and Pier 9 Honk Kong side at 9pm. This trip makes you responsible to get to the embarkation point under your own means. We took a taxi on the H K side and by 7pm the chronic traffic congestion is dying down making the taxi journey inexpensive. Ensure he turns on the meter though and if he does not insist he does.Such Fun for all ages and you will not get drunk in 1.5 hours of an open bar onboard as you spend you time sitting around the edge of the boat marvelling at the beauty of the night lights. I noticed toddlers could get over and through hand rails so best to arrange a baby sitter for this trip.Chris, Anna & Jordan.

Boats, cruises and ferries... Beautiful. Very nice view. Rooms facing the harbour charge more. you can relax watching the boats on the harbour. Take a walk on the promenade at Kennedy Town for a pleasant evening stroll.... Makes for a good place to spend time with wife and friends....

Make sure you cross at least once at night, the lights are really spectacular.You can see junks, sampans,little boats and liners in the harbour - it is always busy and always something different to see.

Great place to laze around...... Stroll around in bright sun.. Lots of different faces to see... Good food nearby..What else for a lazy holiday?

Great views. watching the sunset looking over to the island is a photographers dream
New Atmospheric Shopping Location in Hongkong. Alternative shopping area with different atmosphere from the famous Tsim Sha Tsui shopping area.

Avoid the lights symphony cruise it's a waste of money. Hong Kong Harbour is beautiful but the evening Lights Symphony Cruise was our worst experience in Hong Kong. There is no gangway to the boat so you have to jump from the pier to the boat. A disaster if you have a disability. My son has a mobility disability so this was a tour we should have avoided. He got on to the boat but couln't get off. THIS IS NOT A TOUR FOR A SPEACIAL NEEDS VISITOR TO HONG KONG. GO ON THE REGULAR FERRY.The brochure advertaised refreshments and free drinks. Don't be fooled. Refreshments was a bag of potatoe chips. My grandson askes for a lemonade and was given a half can, poured into a glass. I asked for a coffee and was given a coffee with milk from a can! Hong Kong is so much better than this tour. My advice is don't waste your money. Get a ferry across to Kowloon and see this beautiful hrbour from the sure.
Mindblowingly impressive. Best way to see HK..especially in the evening. All for free

One of the great views of the world. A trip on the harbour at night is required. Even if it is just a short trip across on the Star Ferry, this view will always be amazing to me.
very nice!!!. it was nice .having seen a lot of ports and harbours ..nothing very special.

Breathtaking!. What can one probably say about Victoria Harbour??
