A slowly shrinking body of water. Victoria Harbour is a harbour - for now. The gradual land reclamation that's going on seemingly threatens to unite Hong Kong island and Kowloon, although the two don't touch quite yet. The water was so full of pollutants at one point that maybe you could have just walked across, and although it's reportedly a bit cleaner now, if you watch some of the anglers down by the ferry piers, the most healthy things they seem to catch are either dead fish or old shoes. Oh well.The harbour isn't much of an attraction in itself, unless you like watching ferries ply their daily trade / junks bobbing up and down / the occasional passing cruise liner. However, it's fun to float around on in the evenings and watch the light show - but that's the light show you're watching, not a body of rather dirty water.
Beautiful view. Scenic view from both Hongkong & Kowloon and also while travelling on the Star Ferry.

Beautiful view, day or night.. Find a spot and watch the buildings light up and see the light show. It is a wonderful experience. Take some time to talk to the people near you for the show. You will find yourself a citizen of the world.
Beautiful. definitely a must-go for all tourists. make sure you stop by the Avenue of the Stars and get a picture at Jackie Chan's star! :)

Not bad at all..

(too crowded at weekend)

Urban dreamy.. From any vantage point along the Avenue of Stars on Tsim ShaTsui, this dreamy urbanscape takes you to a whole new level. There's light as far as your eye can see. You can sleepwalk from your HK Pen digs and promised near-daylight cruise control as you see each building's silhouette bathe in bright light and neon. Plan to view this late late at night and meet a lot eccentric expats watching in awe as they ponder why they are in HK in the first place.
very nice. Beautiful view of HK skyline on both sides, the island and kowloon in daytime. Very special at night with all the lights!
just standing on the kowloon wharf. watching the boats the people the hong kong island is the best buy in the world, with the harbor breeze in your face!
Strolling Victoria Harbour. A nice promenade to stroll especially in the evening!!!
Beautiful!. Bring your tripod for the night camera shots. Absolutely beautiful and "hong kong"

One of the world's most striking, beautiful harbours!!!. My favourite thing whenever I'm in HK is to catch the classic Star Ferry (so cheap it's almost free!!). Watch the boats pottering around on this working harbour; watch the other passengers; enjoy the lovely views. It's only a short trip, but it always makes me happy :-)The light display in the evenings is also excellent -- stand by the shore on the Kowloon side (down at Tsim Sha Tsui, near the Star Ferry terminals) and watch the coloured lights brighten up the harbour and the HK side buildings. Day or night, Victoria Hbr is atmospheric and very photogenic :-)
Hongkong hongkong!!. There is a side walk close to the Intercontinental hotel at Koolong Side. Enjoy coffee, looking at the harbor, Very refreshing.
Beautiful city scape. I loved the view of the river in Hong Kong. There are lighted buildings on both Kowloon and Hong Kong island making the view of Victoria Harbour beautiful from either side.
Fantastic Views. The views of the Harbour are spectacular especially from the Kowloon side looking to Hong Kong Island around the avenue of stars.
Stunning.. Make sure you pay the few pence extra to go upstairs on the Star Ferry.
Beautiful by night. Try to get on one of the night cruises if you can...
Dont waste your time waiting for the light show. Not worth it. It was very disappointing after the big wrap it got .

I cam to see the harbour and was not disappointed.. Better than the photos I had seen, the harbour was so full of life, and beauty, what a cool setting. Saw one junk ship, touristy I know but it made the history of the harbour that much more real. Great views, striking buildings, a great view across the harbour, no matter which side you are on; and different views at night for sure. Note that the Bank of China building on the 41st floor has a free viewing area of the harbour. I loved that perspective for sure.
Nothing much has changed even after all these years since post 2000. A nice place for a drive thru' just to have a feel of the sights here in HK

A dream that comes true. Hongkong harbour is famous for the neon ligting sourrounding the place. a person can catch this better view from the peak tower in Hongkong, . Have snacks at Cafe Deco also located in the peak tower, the peak tower hides a lot of things including a ride down by taxi to the nearest subway station

symphony of lights. symphony of lights start at 8pm
near East Tsim Sha Tsui station
Love the light show.. Go to the walk by the HK Cultural Centre at 7:45 to claim a spot. At 8, the music sounds and the lights start flashing on buildings on both sides of the harbor.

Very crowded and touristy. The laser show is so so, not as grand as we imagined could be. Maybe the timing and the music can be enhanced to make it better.Be sure to go way before 8 o clock, if you arrive just before 8 o clock, you will not be able to find an empty spot facing the harbour.Note: I was in TST side.
simply beautiful. the views are spectacular and the symphony of lights show at night was one of a kind

AUSSIE TOURISTS. If you want to meet fellow aussie tourists while in Hong Kong go to Happy Vally races,nothing changes if a horse is runing the aussies will be there and in numbers.I must say the locals are as fanatic as us,the great comon denominator "a day at the races".

Laser light show was so-so.. The famous laser light show is boring and unimpressive in terms of the effects. What is impressive is the magnitude of lit-up buildings in the harbor area. The amount of time and money that most go into lighting those things is beyond comprehension.The harbor area is nice to walk around and seems safe and clean. You will be approached when you come off the ferry for fake Rolexes and other shady pitches, but just keep walking and they leave you alone.The harbor is nice and should be visited. The light show may even be worth seeing, just don't get too excited or you'll be disappointed.

Pretty, must do, but underwhelming.. It's one of the must do things in Hong Kong and definitely the ferry ride is quite cheap. I guess compared to other Harbours such as Sydney it is a little underwhelming. Although at night, the lights and fireworks if you catch them are quite pretty.

a tad disappointing. stayed in Causeway Bay and walked all the way to the Bauhinia Flower to catch the Symphony of Lights. it was a tad disappointing as the lights weren't as spectacular as I thought it would be. Maybe it was the fog, but I doubt the fog less night would make much of a difference.

See the harbour three-ways. Most tourists only view the Hong Kong waterfront from Avenue of the Stars on Kowloon side, and miss out on the buildings on Kowloon, and this includes those watching the Symphony of Lights. Therefore I have three suggestions: 1) see Hong Kong waterfront from Avenue of the Stars, 2) see Kowloon waterfront from from the Convention and Exhibition Centre in Wanchai or from the top floor of Star Ferry Pier building in Central, and 3) take a ferry, especially that between Tsim Sha Tsui and Wanchai (NOT Central) which takes on both waterfronts in one route, or one of the harbour cruises. For the Symphony of Lights, the narration can be heard on FM 103.4 , so just set your mobile phone (you don't even need a smartphone or i-phone), or at the Avenue of the Stars (English, every night) or the Convention and Exhibition Centre (English Mon/Wed/Fri).
The lights are great. We crossed the haber 4 times and we loved it the view is great and you get to see the shy line of the city. You should see it both the the day and at night.

Very nice harbour!. Victoria Harbour is a very nice Harbour that stretches between the north of Hong Kong Island & the south of the mainland area & it boasts some wonderful views & is really great to take a boat trip around the harbour either day or night.
Stayed right on the harbour and the ferries were great to cross over to other side of town. Very affordable form of transit and so beautiful and right in schedule

An Ever-Changing View. Victoria Harbour is an ever-changing view nd one that no longer has the old fishing village markets that we think of from the old movies. It is a man-made natural sculpture, with construction to fill in the sea to create more land for building all the time. Small fishing boats are still to be seen, as well as commercial freighters and cruise ships. One should not miss the sculpture that documents the change from British colonialism back to China. It is a subdued sculpture, but a point in history that many of us remember the long lead up to its formal transfer.
Sound and light show. This happens every evening at 20:00 hours. Best view is from TST get there early to get a good view

Dont miss.... see it from Kwalloon. Great view of the harbor comes from the Kwaloon side where you can see the magnificent skyline. At night the light show is really wonderful. Head to the Star Ferry pier and wander along the promenade to see the great site. May also wish to head up the other side to the Peak and view from there..... do both, well worth the experience.
View. Cross the river on a local boat for about 25cents, on the below deck for a great view.

Breathtaking, one of the wonders of the world. The view from Kowloon across the hardbour is just breaktaking. especially as the sun goes down the city comes to life with light. Also the syphony of lights show is quite fun. It happens at 8pm every night but only lasts about 10 mins. It gets very busy during the weekend so try and go during the week if you can.
very beautiful. beautiful and magnicifant place to visit dont lose itbeautiful and magnicifant place to visit dont lose it

The Best Skyline in the World. Victoria Harbour is a breath-taking view. It doesn't matter how many times I've been to Hong Kong, I never tire of seeing that view. Best place to see it is from the Avenue of the Stars in Kowloon. There are also lots of rooftop bars in Kowloon with a great view, but for a close-up, go to the buffet restaurant at the InterContinental just behind the Avenue of the Stars. It has floor to ceiling windows so you can enjoy that view during dinner.

Nice View. The view is good from the Tsim Sha Tsui side of the harbour from the Avenue of Stars. But try to go on a weekday. We missed the Symphony of Lights (english on Mon Wed and Fri I think) but still enjoyed the view.
A Must Visit for Tourists. The view at night was spectacular while the view via a ferry ride is a must!
Love Victoria Harbour. I could have spent all my time at the harbor. We rode the Star Ferry back and forth because we loved the views of the harbor. Especially at night.

Visit Victoria Harbor, the Peak and Dim Sum later. You take the Star Ferry across the harbor and proceed to the tram up to the top of Victoria Peak where you can see the whole harbor and all the skyscrapers which surround it. On the way back, stop at City Hall (upstairs) for the best Dim Sum anywhere; it is walking distance from the ferry.

At night, the fireworks/laser show is excellant!. If you're in town for a laser show at night, this is not to be missed. I've spoken to couples over the years, none have had a bad word to say abut it. Very well done. Water too is clean in the Harbour, no visible polution. Star Ferry is a great mode of transportation on the Harbour. Under harbour train if you are time sensitive.
A Must Do. This is where you'll find the Symphony of Lights every night at 8pm.
Stunning Night View of hongkong. i like the night view of victoria harbour and star ferry.

Fascinating.. I could spend days watching the traffic on the Harbour. There is so much variety. We were there in early December, so there is the extra bonus of the magnificent Christmas lights on the buildings both on the Island and on Kowloon side.
Stunning Skyline. The nightly light show is amazing, head over to the Kowloon side for the best views over HK island

Good place to rest and relax. I love to stop and relax in this area. Perfect for watching different ships go by. Looking at the skyscrapers of both Kowloon and Hong Kong side is also a nice way to pass the time.

Eagle's view of Hong Kong. The trip up the mountain, with beautiful foliage and great houses. We saw Jackie Chan's house, quite a castle, and a huge housewith four floors, where some Eastern bigwig lives with his four wives, one to each floor
Fun!. Lots of activity, hustle bustle, Junks and sampans lined up. Lovely views.

Go at Christmas for the lights !. This is just a wonderful view - We first walked along the Kowloon " Avenue of Stars " on the evening We arrived, then took the tram up to the Peak to view it from above . Then had 2 wonderful meals on Kowloon side,( Aqua and Hutong) with amazing views over the harbour lit with lights , and the Christmas displays on the buildings just added to the splendour .THere is always something to watch - from the " aqua " sponsored Junk , with it's red sails in the evening, to barges and tugs, and the very cute , and so handy , Star ferries .Great photograph opportunities at every turn!

Pride and joy of Hong Kong, marred by endless construction work. This remains the pride and joy of Hong Kong. Regrettably, the Hong Kong Island side of the harbour was marred by the presence of floating cranes which were scattered from the Exhibition Centre all the way to the ferry terminal. There is a lot of construction work going at the side of the island, so that beautiful promenade which used to allow you to walk along Wan Chai to Central is no more. Some things are meant to kept in a certain way. I hope the authorities will do something about it.

Nice view but too crowded. It is romantic at night and boasts a great view of the HK skyline. However, there are hordes of China tourists and it is not so enjoyable to squeeze with so many people. Maybe it is a Friday night, thus the huge tourist crowds. Tip - not to go on weekends

Just skip the laser show. The habour was soooooooo beautiful at night but my advice is that you should skip the laser show: too crowded that you could hardly feel anything, and the show itself was not interesting either. However, do visit this place at night and NOT during peak hours. You will be amazed.
Must see the laser light show. The laser light show is just spectacular. Star ferries and ferries to outlying areas are a treat.

so romantic. esp. at night time i liked the lights and the crowd they're very behaved as if like me they're trying to capture the magic that the place is creating what I disliked I guess the time its moving fast.
What a buzz!. Beautiful and bustling! The most famous vantage point is of course from the Peak at dusk going onto the evening.
Not much to see. Just walked down from the hotel and took a few pics.
Nothing special. Just a nice view of the lake and boat, best time to get there is on sunset.

one and only view in the world Victoria harbour. Best view in Asia
The view of Victoria harbor sould be on everyones to do list
Make sure you at least go on a ferry. It is great watching all the traffic on the harbour and I recommend you to go on a ferry at least from one side to the other.

Nice lightning show at night. Been to here few times, very nice lightning show with music, start at 8pm every night. Located just opposite Penisula Hotel in TST, connectir Avenue of Stars. Couldnt consider visited HK if didnt been here
stunning view. The view was stunning in from 6pm on wards from the star ferry pier.

Water, boats and some lights. I read a lot of reviews praising the evening "light show" at Victoria Harbour. It's no big deal. They play some nice music and flash some laser lights for about 15 minutes, then it's over.

One of the top views in the world. I love HK. I live here and I will Victoria Harbour will always be one of my favorite spots. Both HK side and Kowloon side. On Kowloon side start at Star Ferry and walk for several kilometers to the east. Right now (Dec 2011) HK side isn't great, there's lots of construction. Go to Sun Hung Kei and Great Eagle Centre and look out from the outdoors mezannine level. Or go to IFC and lunch outside at one of the restaurants upstairs (my favorite is Isola). Go to Convention Centre, up the escalators and towards the Harbour for spectacular views.Take Star Ferry across the Harbour whenever you can.

When is Junket not a Junket !. We bought some tickets and got on those old ferries and travelled around, we saw those old traditional boats and some looked like they would sink if you even said you were going to bump into it. Great way to see everyday people going about normal commuting. Cheap not an actual attraction but a go way to see the shorelines and people on the boats.

pretty at night. definitely worth a visit, but the laser show is SO overrated. I would actually highly recommend NOT going to see this, as its too crowded and the show is definitely not spectacular. we were just waiting for it to end (the 10 minutes drag) so that people would leave and we could actually get photos without everyone being there.
So amazing!. It's very amazing and interesting place. I like it a lot.
Pretty. Busy harbour, lots to see, beautiful at night. Laser show happens each night at 8pm.
tremendous views day and night. Enjoyed hustle and bussle. toutes selling fake watches/handbags were a nuisance.

so interesting!. This is a very busy harbour and we felt we could sit all day watching the activity on the water. There's also lots of activity on the Avenue of Stars on the Kowloon side. We sat there one night to watch the Symphony of Lights, which was decidedly underwhelming!
Must Do. $2.50HKD ( About $0.40USD) to cross the harbour is insane value however you look at it

One of the best harbours in the world. I never get tired of watching the traffic on the harbour - Star ferries, Junks, Cruise ships, cargo adn rubbish boats. A busy menagarie of industry that never stops.

You have to see it. We went to Victoria Harbour for a light show at 20:00. It was a bit foggy and A LOT OF PEOPLE. After all light show was not so impressive (fog got most of it) and due to crowds bad photo opportunities....Go at off peak hour - avoid the lightshow if you are OK with it....
Fantastic view. We took the ferry from HK Island to Kowloon. Loved the view and the ride was quick. Our toddler loved the whole experience.
such a good place you can't miss. wow, it's excellent, beautiful seaside view beyond description
Excellent View. we had a lovely time at night light show at Victoria harbour
Fantastic view. Really enjoy the Symphony of Lights display but try and be there about 15 to 30 minutes before it starts to get a good view!

Great views and an amazing spectacle. The harbour is the lifeblood of the city and worth a seat on the edge to watch the city in motion. Traditional fishing boats dwarfed by massive cargo ships. Take the ferries everywhere and pay the extra for first class to get up high and see the view. It is worth the extra cents.

Really beautiful view at night. It has the most amazing view at night with all the lighting! You can walk by the stars of avenue and enjoy the lighting together. Or you can choose to ride on ferry to look at the night view too.

Magical. It doesn't matter how many times you stand there looking at the view, it still manages to just amaze you. In theory its just a load of buildings and advertising boards but its just captivating. Watching the 8pm Symphony of Lights just adds to the experience.

Nice night view. Nice place to visit for a skyscrapers view beside the harbour. Especially the laser show at 8pm that you shouldn't miss.
A highly recommended place for taking photos in day and night.
Just enjoy the view. It's really nice to travel to places where spectacular sights are free!

Full of activity. This harbor is full of hustle and bustle day and night. Look at the freighters, ferries, junks during the day. At night, the panorama with the sky scrapers lit and laser shows (looking from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island) is spectacular

Nice CBD view. the view of the night lights that light up HK island is still as mesmerizing. However, the symphony of lights show's standard has really dropped tremendously. I remember the first time i visited HK 4 years ago, I was really amazed by the Symphony of lights (the laser beams with the music and it used to be really crowded). Now, most of the laser beam lights seemed defective/no longer working and the light show didn't seem to go with the music. It was a poor choice of music as well. Shopping at SOGO was perhaps more worth the time.

Where Do you Look First. We entered the harbor on a cruise ship and got a feel of the activity of the harbor through the variety of ferries, tourist boats and commercial shipping boats plying the waters. It was alive!After docking we approached the harbor from the Kowloon side and strolled down Artists Walk. The sight is classic, the architecture inspired and the people watching great.We then took the Star Ferry across and couldn't decide if we wanted to watch the harbor itself, the Hong Kong side of the Kowloon side. The view is worth a couple of trips back and forth to experience the magnificence.

Being on the water is great, wherever you are. Our party had booked a boat for a two hour cruise from the Star Ferry jetty, up the waterfront a way and finally over to the International Conference centre on HK Island. We got there about half an hour before dusk, piled aboard as the boat pushed off into quite a big swell - made worse by the wake of some pretty big vessels passing. I'm a sailor anyway so am fine with the motion of the boat but unless you are a sailor, consider accepting a couple of sea-sickness pills from the crew just to be on the safe side. We pitched and rocked out into the harbour as I marvelled at how low the guard rails on this boat were. The perfect height, in fact, to pitch an adult European over the side with ease. If you're on a similar boat, be careful.Our boat chugged up the harbour front and I just sat back and took in the sights as the light faded and all the city's lights blazed brighter and brighter. Our tour provided drinks and food and moored up for a while further up the harbour to allow people to eat and socialise in calm water while taking in the warm, humid air and the views.After a while, we motored back towards the Conference Centre tower in darkness getting a really spectacular look at the lights as we went. Well worth doing, and surprisingly relaxing too.

Great Sight. The sight is worth seeing... The high rise on the opposite side is a sight that fills ups your eyes. You feel like you are watching the King kong film with your miniature size in the midst of sky scrapers...

"Spectacular". The view of Victoria Harbour from the Avenue of the Stars actually took my breath away. I was not prepared for the peaceful feeling which swept over me as I gazed out over the expanse of water.Was one of the most pleasant couple of hours spent during my time in Hong Kong.

many moods, always stunning. Victoria harbour is stunningly beautiful with it's skyscrapers and busy boats and ships - such a variety - whether looking out over it at night or crossing it on a ferry by day. Try to catch it in all its moods, have a cocktail overlooking the harbour in the evening for the light show (try the Lobby Lounge at the Intercontinental), and appreciate the atmosphere when travelling between Hong Kong island and Kowloon on a crowded ferry. Though the MTR system is excellent for getting around Hong Kong don't be tempted to use it for all your travel needs - even on a hazy day the harbour still has a magical atmosphere and is not to be missed. You can use your Octopus card on the ferry, and it's very inexpensive.
Good to Visit. Transportation is very good, People are friendly and busy..
Harbour review. Walked along the Harbour and sat their by the pier
music/light in symptony. at the habour must visit at night cause with music and light combine..impress///

Truly Classic Waterfront. Parts are modern, parts are old. There are lots of ferries running to see the sights. Some great shopping districts on both sides, including a huge very modern shopping center. Most nights, the buildings and boats put on a light show.
amazing and busy!. Love this harbour! Great views! Lots of movement of cargo 24/7! Plus buildings are lit up nightly!
Great. This harbour is very interesting we did go on the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island also did a harbour cruise which was very good to see all the lights on the buildings.
Very beautiful. Check out the Avenue of Stars, amazing view from there

WOW Harbour. The amount and variety of shipping and ferries in this harbor is astounding. At night, buildings are all lit up on both the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island sides of the harbour. Nothing to dislike...a surprisingly quiet harbour (no whistles / horns from shipping).
Wonderful habour. love the Light- show every-night, awesome view, there are many cafe, restaurant among, near ferry station to get to other side !

Victoria Harbour. The view across Victoria Harbour is a must during the day and evening. Easy access from the underground to the sea front and can be combined with the star ferry trip which is just next door.
Better in the evening?. Have only visited in the evening when it looks lovely all lit up. Good choice of eating establishments along the front.
busy and interesting. lots of ferrys going to different islands, good value for money
Very beautiful at night. At night, the Victoria Harbour lights up and the view is spetacular. Don't miss the the Simphony of Lights.
Big construction. Nothing special, just a big construction, not even good for walking. Just the view is good.

Love the views. No matter what time of day the harbour is always different. I love just sitting and watching everything happening in the harbour, the sound the sights is all nice. Weather at this time of the year is good too pleasantly warm.

Under a blue sky sunny day......take in the fresh sea air and harbour vistas.. Come down to the waterline and take in the everchanging views, Victoria Harbour has on offer. There are plenty of places to sit and eat (IFC Mall on Hong Kong Island or the many eateries around the Star Ferry Pier in Kowloon), here you can enjoy the weather and atmosphere that only Hong Kong can give. I and my fiance' was on the observation deck of the IFC Mall, there we enjoyed the warm breeze and the constant flow of water craft (many different types). If sitting on land doesn't excite you, take a trip on the Star Ferry, this will rock your socks off. I enjoy Hong Kong for its' multiplicity, and its' harbour is a must do. Mmmmm....what a place.
star ferry. light show excellent; star ferry trip short and cheap go for top deck

Wow!. The view of the harbour from Kowloon waterfront is sight that anyone who visited HK must see. It's breathtaking and amazing that can keep you lingering at the waterfront for hours whether to come during the day or night The badside, too packed with tourist throngs from tourbuses it get so suffocating not to mention loads that disobeyed the non smoking signs by smoking next to the water. If you come to see the symphony of lights at 8.30pm be prepared for the huge amount of tourists..if you come after 9.30 pm, the place is less crowded.
Nice view - thrilling. You can spend hours watching ships, ferries and people in this area. And the light shows in the night - terrific. Don't miss it.

Harbor of Aroma. Harbor of Aroma is what “Hong Kong” means in Cantonese and Victoria Harbor has done an excellent job to make the city significantly proud of its own moniker. Vast and dazzling in day and night, the harbor represents heartbeat of a dynamic Hong Kong in light of commerce, transportation and entertainment. On 2 banks along the harbor stand myriad skyscrapers wherein daily financial activities and shopping spree take place. From the very place, ferries and boats depart almost every minute towards neighborhood islands including Macao, Lantau Island and even islands of China Mainland. However, tourists may most love the harbor for panoramic view when strolling on Tsim Sha Tsui or Central site to enjoy the show of light by night. Even with one day in Hong Kong, do manage a visit to Victoria Harbor for pictures.
Great Scenery. it is cheap to take the ferry cross the sea (hkd 2.50 for upper deck) and have the sea breeze and the nice view !
Take a walk. It's a must see when in Hong Kong. Take a nice, long walk along it and admire the stunning views of Hong Kong Island towers!
great. Very easy to use the ferrys between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The Harbour area was really nice.

A must do. I am sure no visitor to HK would miss a trip to the Peak. Stunning views of this random city. You wont believe the gradient of the tram. While in the area make sure you go to the Zoo and botanical gardens, Man Mo temple, and have a ride on the Mid Levels Escalators. If you are there in the evening/afternoon, stop off at one of the cool bars.
Beautiful Place. It is a beautiful harbor especially at night. Be there for the 8 PM light show.

Definitely worth having a view of it.. The harbour is pretty from both sides - don't bother with the cruises to see the "Symphony of lights", though, much better to just stand on one side or the other - then you can get some photos of it that are neither moving, nor through windows.
Bustling Harbor.... Get on Kowloon side at dusk for HK side light show...
Nothing like viewing the sights and the lights from the water!. Great, cheap alternative to a touristy harbour cruise.
A beautiful View!. i took the ferry across the harbour and make sure you go and see the symphony of lights-

Best view. Yes, I think I did like the view from Victoria Harbour more than a view from IFC.
Big crowds in the evening, but it worth it.

Still very busy but nice to stay at during sunset. Nice to stay and look at the harbor.
Hated the smell of smoke.

so refreshing to stroll here. Victoria Harbour is one magnificent view to visit in HK especially during night time. It's refreshing to just walk and talk with your friends here, while looking at the lights of the buildings.

Looks amazing at night - perfect postcard photo opportunity!. You cannot visit Hong Kong and not see the view across the harbour. During the day it is a bit hit or miss with the sky often being cloudy but in the evening it looks incredible.

Best sightseeing. very nice views of hongkong... Clear Weather is very important to enjoy the views of the city.. its on a height & reaching by roadways takes a bit long time but the best way to go up & come down is by tram ride.. Tram ride is worth the money & is real quick & easy

Special Skyline. Took the Aqua Luna Junk with red sails....wow what an experience.
Simply awesome way to see the night skyline. Extremely romantic if you are looking for that, or just a great sight seeing trip for those wanting the best view in town.

Just like the photos I had seen. Victoria Harbour is beautiful and worth exploring both day and night. A walk beside the water in the cooling breezes of early evening watching the lights begin to glow is like a fairy tale. The harbour comes alive as more lights come on and is one of the most beautiful I have seen. Photographers will take your photo if you want. In the day, watch the many boats go by, some with local fishermen, others giving tourists a close-up view of the harbour itself. For a great visit both day or night, take the Star Ferry across, very reasonable and frequent. There are many benches located around the area where you can sit and watch. A must for any visitor to HK.
Very Beautiful. Nice place to sit and watch @ night. The light show was average

Just another skyline. We have seen enough big cities, so normally, we don't get very excited by huge skyline and so Hong Kong wasn't any different. In fact, we found the 8pm light show of skyline rather lame. Still it was pleasure taking ferries in Victoria Harbor and thinking about old Jackie Chan movies shot in Hong Kong

A Architectural Marvel. The Victoria Harbour is a must go place to get a great view of Hong Kong. The best part is the mode of travel to the Harbour. The Tram is a marvel in itself and gives the whole journey a vintage touch.

"it is THE Hong Kong". being in Hong Kong and do not walk on Tsim Sha Tsui side of Victoria Harbour - you haven't been in HK :-)
Panoramic view of Hong Kong across Victoria Harbour is one of the most breathtaking views...
Postcard Tour. Just like the post cards. Really gives you a good perspective of the city rising from the sea.

One of the best sights in the world. Get across to Kowloon on the Star Ferry, avoid the incessant designer shops and turn right along the harbourside boulevard by the Space Museum. Spectacular views back across to the Island, especially at night.
laser show. There is a light show around 8pm that lasts about 20 minutes. Check it out if its your first time in hong kong.

"Victoria Harbour, splendid as ever before...". Victoria Harbour is splendid as ever before. I am fascinated by the beautiful and sparking lights surrounding the building when the right time comes in the evening. The nearby seawall is a perfect place to relax and feel the fresh air. There are plenty of sceneries from point to point where we stand. I am indeed awed and haunted by the beauty of Victoria Harbour.It is a must for every visitor in Hong Kong not to miss this place. If given the chance to visit the place i will go back and stay longer to savor the whole area. Infact you could just sit back and observe the boat and ferries passing along the coastline. Wow is the uttered word one could say before leaving the place. I love it and hooked!
An excellent view. An excellent place to visit. Great view of the harbour and the skyscrapers of Hongkong.
Beautiful. Simply breathtaking especially amidst the Symphony of Lights.
Cheap tour with the Ferries. Tale the star ferries fom TS and Wan Chai and North point. Almost the same as official tours and much cheaper
crowded Victoria Harbour. Good view. Place was too crowded and so, hard to walk through and difficult to find a good angle for photography.

Great central location. Loved the hustle and bustle, displays, gardens, seats in sun or shade, always a lovely breeze to sit and recover from sight seeing. Great place to meet up if you have gone separate ways for a while. The light display at night - 8pm is fantastic.

Beware!!!!! Breath Taking View..... The most used post card photo and there's a reason for that. Best location to view the harbor, Avenue of Stars in Tsim Sha Tsui and during the ferry ride between the Star Ferry Pier. A good visibility day is very important.

Amazing night view!. I visited the harbor in the evening, and as night fell, the view was just breath-taking. It's just a totally different experience of the view of Hong Kong's coast-line of buildings lighted up during the night. You can choose to have photographers situated along the harbor take a photo of you for a fee depending on the size of the photo.
Views. Would have been better if it wasn't rainy but still spectacular
Star Ferry. Best way to experience harbor. Inexpensive, convenient blast from the past.
very busy. To view the nightly light show it would be best to be on the Kaloon side faceing HK or on the star ferry
Light Show. the light show itself was not something special (may be because of music theme they chose for the background), but the view of HK Island was just awesome!

Amazing harbor. The harbor was beautiful at night. Was nice during the day, but the haze of the pollution took away some of the beauty. The difference between night and day reminded me somewhat of Las Vegas.
Night Cruiseis the best!. Night cruise is the best. Book the 7:20pm trip from Central Pier so you get to see the light show as well.

World Class Harbour. The amount and variety of shipping and ferries in this harbor is astounding. At night, buildings are all lit up on both the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island sides of the harbour. Nothing to dislike...a surprisingly quiet harbour (no whistles / horns from shipping).
Very nice atmosphere. The view is excellent BUT very very overcrowded.Worth to see though :)
Victoria Harbour. We did this as part of a city tour. Day tour and very, very nice

Breathtaking...Makes NYC Look Like a Small Town. The skyline of Hong Kong is the best in the world. Makes any so-called large city in the US look like a small farm town. Yep, it dwarfs NYC, Chicago and LA...combined. There are many ferry boats making regular trips across the harbor from downtown to Kow Loon.
Cheap entertainment. You should ride the ferry during the day and at night, is the cheapest and funnies way to see the harbor
" THE PEARL OF THE ORIENT ". The city now has a huge light show every night at 8pm.
Wow. amazing skyline! try to see it during the day and at night
Very nice trip .... A very nice experience and enjoyed the beach and sunset..
The best priced cruise ever!. Do take the boat to cross from Hong Kong island to Kowloon just for the sake of it: the skyline is impressive and the ticket is ridiculously cheap.
It's a view. Nice to look at , but there is much more to see and do.

One the most beautiful city views on this planet. Victoria Harbour is the heart of Hong Kong from my perspective. Alaway beautiful, vibrant, exciting and during the evening hours the light show is great.
Brilliant. So easy to use, and a fabulous view for very little cost.

Stunning. We were taken by junk leaving the harbour at 6pm and cruising until 8pm. The skylines of both coasts were stunning and became so magical after dark. We saw old fashioned boats and modern casino liners. We also took a Star Ferry to soak up the local atmosphere.

Great Night Views. Near to our hotel at Tsim Sha Tsui. Great harbour to view at night, took a long stroll down the harbour enjoying the sea breeze and great view of HK skyscrapers. Did not manage to go for the light show as we were there pretty late that night. Nevertheless, we really really enjoyed the view.
best bargain. A must when in Hong Kong great views day or night and very cheap on ferry

Fantastic light show. You must visit Victoria Harbour at 8pm any night to see the 15 minute free light show that highlights the lovely harbour and buildings on Hong Kong island. It is a wonderful spectacle and a true memory of Hong Kong. And it's free!
Great views at night. Views were great and Star Ferry is a must at least once, to get the local experience.
rain. view from hotel.star ferry journey.would have been more fun if it hadn't rained constantly
light show??. Great harbour to view at night but not worth waiting for a seat for the light show. The 'show' is about 10 mins and not worth it.
Great views!. Dont miss the ferry ride; do the light show and finish it off with a luxury dinner at Nanhai.1 (michellin restaurant)

Just stare and take photos. There’s nothing like it. Utilitarian, exotic, enjoyable, beautiful. Boats of every kind and soaring architecture both modern and ancient melded together on both the Hong Kong and Kowloon sides. Be sure to take the Star Ferry just to experience life on the water.
Fantastic View. An amazing view of the city. High buildings and lights make it a spectular view. Even more impressive at night.

One of the most beautiful spots in Hongkong for free. Victoria harbour lies in Victoria bay in Tsim Sha Tsui between HK Central and Kowloon area. Remarkably tranquil at daytime and most stunningly romantic at night when the state-of-the-art multimedia lights and sound show starts around 8PM. We've been to HK few times but we can't get enough of this place. Oh by the way, nearby, you would also see other attractions like Hong Kong's famous Clock Tower, Avenue of Stars and Star Ferry Station for crossing each side of the island vice versa and experience a unique ride of a lifetime for only HK$2.20. One can take a lot of gorgeous photos here as the scenic view is incredibly beautiful!!!
awesome place to visit sharp at 8 pm. the laser lights and sound show of buildings on both side of the harbor was mesmerizing.its free for all. a must go.

Its like a Chinese New York. Whilst in HK you must visit both HK Island and the Kowloon side. Travel by Star Ferry it is very cheap and an enjoyable journey. We also travelled on MTR which is very easy to navigate. Hong Kong Island looks like a business district from the Kowloon side but well worth a visit. When you get into the heart of the island there is a lot to see and do. The tram is a novelty must and a great way to see the sights. The Peak is also another must. We also enjoyed a bus tour to Aberdeen, Repulse Bay and Stanley which had great views along the way.
Breathtaking. One of the best views in the world a city like bladerunner a feast for the eyes

Fascinating Harbour. You can't get sick of looking at, or travelling on, Victoria harbour. It's the Highway of Hong Kong, full of every type of ocean going vessel from sampan and junks, to tugs, barges and ocean liners! The best way to see this harbour is on the Promenade at Tsim Sha Tsui / Kowloon, from one of the waterfront hotels or from the iconic Star Ferry. However many times you cross the harbour by the star ferry you won't get sick of it. With a bit of preplanning you can get yourself an Octopus Card (from the customer service at the Metro stations) for a small amount, and this saves having to pay coins for your public transport, includig the ferries. they're great. Take a cruise, a night time one, on the Star Ferry, for one hour. They're cheap and fun, and you'll get a drink and a piece of cake while you cruise around looking at the wonderful city lights. if you choose the 8.00 cruise, you'll see the Symphony of Lights which is a laser light show from the tops of some of the main HK buildings. Not a spectacular show, but the Hong Kong buildings and harbour make it really special and worth doing for the peanuts the cruise costs.Make sure you look around both the Star Ferry wharves, in Central and in Kowloon, they're interesting. The best view of the harbour is probably from Victoria Peak, don't miss it.
Watch the light show. The harbour is amazing.It is worthwhile going down in the evening to see the light show.

Great shopping. Central is the financial district in HK, it is also where great shopping can be had in HK, name brand stores are within walking distance of each other. But each time we visit HK, there are two restaurants we will go in central, TSIM CHAI KEE Noodle located at 98 Wellington St, and another location at 153 Queens Road Central, serves only Won Ton Noodle soup, each bowl have three big won tons filled with whole shrimps and minced pork in a very tasty broth with thin noodles, all for just $18HKD per bowl, it must be the cheapest eat in Central. The restaurant is not big, the chairs are benches without backs, people come here just to eat the won ton noodle and leave, this is not a place to sit , chat or relax. Just to grab a quick bite. Avoid lunch time during the work week you can find a table without waiting too long.Another restaurant in central is JIMMY'S KITCHEN, located left of the Coach handbag store in Central. There are a number of signature items on the menu, but the best is the roast pork knuckle. It is the best, with crispy skin on the outside and moist juicy meat inside. This restaurant's decor is like an English pub with dark wood panels and red color seats. It has been around since 1925. Three course meal averages $35-50 USD with drink.For souvenir shopping in Central, go to Li Yuen East and Li Yuen West Street, it's two streets next to each other filled with shops and stalls of souvenirs. Do bargain with the street vendors, it can be fun.

much neaded holiday. just got back from hongkong and had a great trip.Its is one of the most alive cities that i have been too.There are many things to do from the Peak to Ocean park and getting around is so easy.Bus ,trams and especially the trains are great.Get an octopus card as soon as you arrive they are so easy to use.Prices are starting to rise but there still are great bargins to be had at the markets.

Great views to be had, good walking to see the sights. Go at around 8.00pm to see the light & lazor show from all the skyscrapers. You can get on the star ferry just after 8.00pm and have a waterside viewing. It is one of the best sights in Hong Kong and FREE!
Amazing sight to behold. Truly amazing sight from the Star ferry boat going to and from Kowloon. Harbor city is also great shopping.

A 'must see' attraction. The waterfront of Hong Kong is a bustling and vibrant part of the city. There are several boat trips available, but to see it at night is special. There is a laser and light show every evening when the large buildings in Hong Kong and Kowloon are lit and the light show is co-ordinated across the Harbour. A dinner cruise which included this would be a great experience

One of the Best Harbour Views especially at night. we went to the Peak in the morning aboard the Peak Tram,,the line was long but if you choose to buy a combo ticket which includes the Wax Museum,the line was short. We didn't include the Sky Terrace since what you can see up there is the same view you'll see when you get at the Peak anyway... We took some pics, had lunch at Burger King since we were on a budget...went to Madame Tussaud's and had photo ops with the wax celebrities..We rode a bus on the way down and i must say that taking a bus is much much cheaper and more convenient for us..i wished we took it going up by riding Bus 15 at Exchange Square Bus Terminal...We waited for the light symphony at 8 pm at the viewing deck in Kowloon side ..it was not that good but the Harbour View at night was AMAZING...if you want to take a photo of it, you need to bring a tripod and a dslr for a fantastic pic...the clock tower is also very good ...

hong kong harbour. if you have never been befor, what a sight there is so much going on we went on a river trip and shown the people living and working on the river,if you catch a ferry across to hong kong islnnd you can catch a ferry to any of the other islands or sight see around hong kong island (CITY) and that is something else

World famous skyline. The skyline of Hong Kong is something very unique. It's beautiful and unforgettable. We've been to Hong Kong twice and everytime coming here we always spend some time to stroll around.
What a view !!!. You must go in the day time to appreciate the beauty of HK ... and again at 8:00pm at night to see the city lighing show.

Spectacular, a must see!. Absolutely beautiful, a must see on any trip to Hong Kong. Each night there is a light show across the harbour. We saw it from the Hong Kong side, the Kowloon Side, and if you manage to get on the Star Ferry cruise at the time of the light show the ferry stops in the middle of the harbour and you can watch it from the middle. It is different from each side so well worth a look. On the Kowloon side they also have an audio commentary, it is in English every third night, so make sure you time your visit with it.The harbour is also lovely by day, the star ferry is the best and a cheap way to get across, you can use your octopus card. We found it much cheaper than a taxi and more pleasurable than the train. Some excellent photographic opportunities.The star ferry run a one hour cruise, well worth a look. We did it during the day and at night, and you get a piece of cake and a can of soft drink.

Plan before your view of the 8pm light show. You might consider having drinks at the intercontinental and watch the show. The harbor is spectacular and ine of the best. Follow the crowds for the best vantage point...they know it better than we would.

Best View of Hong Kong is Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade. Take the Star ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui and walk over to the promenade, along side the harbour, it's the best spot to see Hong Kong skyline, bring your camera, then you have the best shot to take home with, whenever there's a firework event, half million people pack this place, afterward you can walk over to the Peninsula or Inter- Continental for a afternoon tea, if you can spare the time, please do it, probably will give you some happy memories of the Hong Kong trip.

A trip to HK is never complete without visiting Victoria Harbour.. Very nice view. My family went for a walk around the city - to Mongkok and the Museum of History during the day and capped it off with a visit to Avenue of Stars at Victoria Harbour. The view was wonderful and the air was clean and refreshing. Perfect location to see the nightly light show.There was a large crowd of tourists but not so crowded that you can't move around freely. The light show was not that spectacular - I expected many buildings to participate but that wasn't the case. Nonetheless, the HK skyline is amazing. The MTR station is close by, transportation is not a problem.I recommend to stay an hour here at night.

See the Light and Sound show. Had visited the harbour on a Sunday. The voice guide was in Chinese, however the show was good.Got a chance to click some really awesome pics. Overall, it was a great experience. You can get down at TST station and follow the directions to this place.

Great way to spend an hour. Tram up to Victoria Peak was much shorter than I thought it would be and the views from the tram itself aren't altogether that clear because of the vegetation around the track. But once up to peak, the views are pretty spectacular and offer fantastic photo opportunities. The queuing time was minimal. Remember to buy a ticket for the 'peak' experience if you want the best views. Bus is signposted from the ferry, so it's very easy to find the entrance to the tram.

Victoria Harbour, grab a cheap ferry to the islands. Great location and views, Plus found a awesome arcade and eatery on site, plus 7-11..Victoria Harbour is home to most of the port facilities of Hong Kong, making Hong Kong amongst the world's busiest.On a nice day, attractions include local arcades and museums and nice views of the Island, with plenty of tourists buzzing round.Plenty of places to eat and stay for a while,Whilst I was here, they had a display and interesting walk for the Beijing Olympics, just along the pier is Hong Kongs version of the Hollywood Stars walk with handprints from people like bruce lee, chow yun fat, and Jet Li and a good history of film in HK.

Gexcellent place to see the Hong Kong skyline. Victoria harbor is a great place to see the hong kong skyline. The best place to go is near the star ferry terminal on the Kowloon side. You get an excellent view from there and it is a really great place to see the light show at night. Also there is a tourist center there where they have a lot of information and where you can book tours. It is easily accessible by walking, subway or cab.

this is an exciting place. One of the most exciting places in Hong Kong I would say. What a great location they have got! Things appear to be carved minutely. The excitement began at night when lights were lit up. Surroundings changed dramatically and were adorned with varied and colorful lights all around. Having a walk towards the Kowloon side quite adjacent to Tsim Sha Tsui station, we got to see a spectacular view of the city. Fortunately, you do not have to part with much money to watch this amazing view. It’s a matter of a few dollar only and yes.. the ticket cost that you pay also includes a drink and normally a cake. The synchronization of lights with the music being played sometimes seemed missing, but it still went in sync most of the time. There came out a happy me from the show. Recommended, cheers!
A Wonderful View. It is a really good place for Hong Kong, especially at the Festival days. Have a great sea view.

The Top Attraction of Hong Kong. The spectacle of Victoria Harbour is the best and clearly definies what Hong Kong is. Either seeing the harbour from our hotel window, on the Star Ferry crossing to TST or watching the light show from either TST or up at the Peak. It is magical watching the sun set, The area comes alive again at 2000 hrs for the light show.

Beautiful night light spectacle. At night, the entire skyline on Hong Kong Island light up in amazing computerized colourful light animations. All the skyscrapers and other buildings come alive with light, some with their normal billboards, others with specialized light shows or specially installed laser lightshows. Thex are all syncronized to the music you can hear at the harbour promenade. To witness this, stroll to the Kowloon side, near Tsim Sha Tsui station and near the ferry terminal, to the promenade where people will already be gathering. Find a spot to sit and enjoy the show!

Beautiful view. It's really beautiful scenery at nite when we came. Sit at the Avenue of Stars and just relax and enjoy it. The Symphony of Light is disappointing, it's only a couple of laser from the building with a very small music sound from the speaker. It's a must when you're at Hongkong.
Amazing. Visually stunning city. There is no other place like this, so full surprises!

Fantastic views but disappointing "symphony of lights" show.. Just did the symphony of lights boat cruise last night and although the views were spectacular, the show itself was quite unremarkable. I honestly didn't even know the show started until a few minutes into it. And it was nothing more than a few synchronized building lights, some green lasers and white lights shining into the harbour. The ticket cost $110 HKD ($15 USD) including a drink and a piece if yummy cake and lasted an hour. Well worth it in my opinion, simply for the views and relaxing boat ride! Enjoy it!.

Top attraction in Hong Kong - breathtakingly beautiful !!. We chose a hotel with a harbour view , views were amazing esp in the morning light and at sunset , and in the evening with all the twinkling lights on Honk Kong Island. Views from the ferry are fantastic , and cheap , but last only minutes. We did a 1 hour boat trip at sunset on the Aqua Luna (old junk boat with red sails) . We were served a complimentary glass of wine (beer available too). This was well worth doing !Views from the Peak are breathtaking , esp if it's clear and smog free !

Fantastic view!. Definitely a must go place in HK. Went there at night and really mesmerized by the harbour view. The concrete jungle of hong kong are all lighted up at night. A great place to take night shots.Avenue of stars is so-so .. if you have 15min to spare, why not drop by to take a look.The Symphony Of Lights is a disappointment in my opinion as it is just merely shooting lasers and white lights.Try taking the Star ferry for a tour round the harbour!

Relax and take in the view!. Victoria Harbour is an amazing sight, but we found the people-watching to be just as fascinating as what was happening in the harbour!The Symphony Of Lights is a must-see, but only to tick it off your list as it wasn't as impressive as I'd expected.The Avenue of Stars is interesting, but we were disappointed by the Jackie Chan shop we'd read about online. It was much smaller than we expected, and the range of items for sale was limited.We did stop and have a drink at the Starbucks at the end of the Avenue of Stars, which has an upper deck which was a lovely place to sit and rest and appreciate the view.The clocktower near the Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry Pier is also a lovely place for photos.I would suggest one visit to the Harbour during the day and one at night, just to see the scenery. In my opinion, the absolute best way to see the Harbour is via a trip on the Star Ferry. Again, take a daytime trip and a nighttime trip to fully appreciate the views.
superb view. great for early morning runs or tai chi. if you walk along the promenade, you get a great view of the harbour and city. Best scenery for early morning runs or free Tai Chi classes.

One of the best harbor views in the world. Ok, I'm biased as I live here in Hong Kong. However, having scene many of the world's best harbors and having been to over 70 countries I do feel like this is one of the very best on offer, especially at night time. I recommend walking the Avenue of Stars at nighttime when the Hong Kong island side is fully lit with bright lights. Also, you can take boat ride, Aqua Luna is a good way to go and ride down Victoria harbor at night time. During the day, the harbor view is a hit or miss. If the air pollution is bad, its not very good. If there is clear sky, its fantastic. There are many good restaurants, Starbucks type shops and photo stops along the harbor on the Tsim Sha Tsui (TST - MTR stop) side. I also recommend walking the harbor on the TST side early in the morning prior to the tourist group arrivals. Its is pleasantly quite and almost empty of people before 7.30am. Once the tourists arrive, it fills up, quickly and is pretty much busy for the rest of the day. From the Hong Kong island side, Victoria harbor is best viewed from the PEAK where you get the world famous view of TST side of the harbor. Again, this is best done at night time when you get the real perspective of the size, scale and glamour of Hong Kong. The view is much different than from the TST side viewing of Hong Kong island so I recommend doing both. Again, lots of dining options at the PEAK or down below closer to the water so make a nice evening of the harbor when visiting Hong Kong.

Best place to be in HK. I can't fathom why the Victoria Harbour was not on the top of the list. It is an absolutely fantastic place and a must-see in Hong Kong. 'A symphony of lights' is a light & laser show using the LED lights of many office towers and skyscrapers, played in the rhythm of Chinese orchestra. With light sea breeze and astounding light & sound show, it is truly a feast for eyes! I'd recommend to see the show from the Tsing Sha Tsui side of the harbour, as you can see most of the famous building in HK, such as the Bank of China Tower, International Finance tower etc. I went to the see this show twice during my three nights of stay! yeah, it's that GOOD!
